title: Nice Location
text: Nice Location between Central Park and Time Square. Subway just around the corner . Close to must visit places Ellen’s Stardust Dines and Carnegie Diner for a bit of breakfast. Great family rooms and unexpectedly spacious. Ideal for a short break .

title: GREAT Location and Property!
text: It's easy to walk to any theatre or 2 blocks to Central Park!  Carnegie Hall is adjacent across the street.  But in addition to the location, the unit is spacious by New York standards and clean.  The little Sweet Greens restaurant nearby was easy to duck into and grab a healthy, cheaper meal.  But there are plenty of great restaurants.

title: Great service, good location
text: We loved this hotel. Wanted a Manhattan hotel , good location and with affordable room for a family of three, with a separate bedroom and good sofa bed. We got that and more - loved our penthouse floor room even with just courtyard view. Huge bedroom and bathroom spaces for Manhattan. Maid service was really attentive- concierge great and a smart bar on the 26th.

title: As always a great place to stay in NYC
text: This is our preferred place to stay when visiting NYC for the past 20+ years. Great location, friendly helpful staff & the rooms whether studio or 1bd are generous in size. This trip we got a 1bd which is perfect for a group of 3, as there are two bathrooms.

title: Enjoy visiting Manhattan with The Manhattan Club
text: The Manhattan Club is at the best location of Manhattan: Is near the Broadway shows, Central Park, Upper Westside, Lincoln Center, etc.  I so enjoy this hotel spacious rooms that's unlike most NYC hotels where I can invite friends to stay with me.

title: Not an Hotel
text:
I have planned a four day vacation in NYC with my wife and booked this hotel next to my son's  apartment . Upon arrival I have been charged all the amount of my staying in advance and realized that what I have reserved was not actually been taken in consideration such having a king size bed , more over the so much advertised breakfast ( 22$ each) was nothing else that some muffins and bagels on a table with no other possibilities to have any kind of food 
The lobby do  not exist so all day long you find people in a limited area checking in and out and all the bellmen seems hardly tolerate your presence and if you ask the fon un umbrella in a heavy rain day the answer is " absolutely not  available " 
The feeling is that this is not an hotel but rather a condominium which changed its status  without having any service of hotel 
Considering the offer of hotels  in a city like NY services are the basics if you do not have these you loose and the Manhattan Club ( not hotel ) looses

title: Great stay and excellent location
text: We spent 5 nights in a penthouse suite and loved it. Beautiful spacious suite with 2 full bathrooms and small kitchenette (no cooking except microwave). King bed was excellent and the living room furniture very comfortable. A big bonus is the owners lounge on the 26th floor. The continental breakfast is very pricy but you can just enjoy the room and views for no charge. The location is perfect too. We have stayed here many times and some of the rooms are dated but this suite was not.

title: Yes
text: Exceptionally well located residence. But decoration of the studio is out of fashion and not in very good condition. The kitchen equipment is very basic. However, given the location we will come back with pleasure.

title: The Manhattan Disaster
text:
We traveled to NYC to take my son to Nike Nationals and visit West Point. Reservations were booked a year in advance. we had to arrive two nights earlier than our original reservation.  The reservation dates were inflexible and we found a Hilton on 48th and 5th to fill the void.  When I checked in I informed the desk that we would checkout early and the attendant informed me I would be responsible for the resort fee for all 7-nights. Not sure what the $56 resort fee covers. No amenities in this hotel other than overpriced breakfast, and "Free" coffee after.  Even the Fuji water in the room was price marked at $8. 
The room was dated. Couldn't help to notice the musty smell as soon as we walked in the room. The room was wornout, wall paper peeling, cracks in the ceiling trim/moulding, mold in the bathroom, mix-matched plumbing fixtures, old style table lamps, and pull chain curtains.  The highlight of the room was the kitchenette and the plug in alarm clock with USB-A and C adapters (the only modern thing in the room).

The staff was friendly, attentive, and responsive, however, I would not recommend staying here. Just off broadway and close to carnige and central park.

title: Great location and setup for families
text: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite for 3 nights. Two adults and our daughter. The two bathroom and separate bedroom setup is great for families. The MC location is fantastic for Central Park, Times Square and theatres, and midtown shopping. Joel the bellman was excellent and answered questions and arranged our transport back to LGA. Would stay in the MC again and highly recommend for families traveling with kids.

title: Very comfortable family stay.
text:
Very comfortable stay.  Clean facilities and spacious hotel rooms.  Walking distance to key attractions restaurants, metro, and grocery store.  Would recommend and return. 

Faisal, one of the bellman, stood out as being very helpful and attentive.  A+ service from him.

title: Revisiting N.Y.C.
text: Fabulous location for traveling in N.Y.C. The staff at The Manhattan Club were tremendously attentive and professional. The room was spotless. We had a maintenance issue and it was handled efficiently and immediately. The 26th floor lounge was great.

title: Great Hotel
text: Great location near Central Park and easy walk to theater district. Suite was spacious and updated. Very comfortable with two baths with a king size bed and pull out couch. Fast elevators and a helpful staff at the check in desk and lobby area. Helpful getting taxis too.

title: The Manhattan Club
text: Very convenient location. Room size is decent but poor water pressure.  Great that there are 2 bathrooms with showers for the one bedroom unit!  The sleeper sofa was very uncomfortable. There is a microwave and small refrigerator which is a plus.  There is a $56 service fee per night and parking is additional fee.

title: Almost perfect
text: I adore NYC. The Manhattan Club is ideally located near Central Park and not far from Times Square. My only complaints are minor. The snickering of the young woman who helped me with checking in with another female employee during that process made me uncomfortable. I have no idea if it was directed at me but I didn’t like it. But the bellman was very friendly and helpful. And the response time of housekeeping to our requests for first a working iron and on another occasion toilet paper and facial tissue was unacceptable. However, these were minor inconveniences and overall we enjoyed our stay!

title: Great comfortable stay
text: We will be back. Great space in the heart of NYC. Friendly and accommodating staff. The club room was fun and breakfast available. State of the art fitness room and business center. More than a room with just enough of home

title: Ideal Location and Great Staff
text:
I can recommend this hotel and staff  
Excellent location for walking to the main tourist sites such as Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, and MOMA
Big thanks to Katie (for cleaning our room) and Anthony (on the door)
Great Breakfast with Boyan, Michael, and Jermeel. Thanks for being friendly, doing a good job and the tourist tips   
The managers offered free drinks and chocolates on Valentines Day ! You didn't need to do it but you made a great effort to make it a very enjoyable. VERY kind gesture by you. Much appreciated

title: Perfectly Pleasant Stay
text:
Perfectly pleasant stay.   Reception was nice (they generally are) but lifts & decor were a bit tired + our room was 'fur coat & no knickers'.   A broken roman blind which wouldn't raise or drop & was at a skew whiff angle half way up the window (reported but not fixed) - it meant we couldn't have complete privacy.   The hairdryer didn't work (reported and not replaced - borrowed one from my daughter's room).   Handles missing from one of the bedside drawers and a light switch not working.    Both of our rooms had single glazing & bad draughts.   My daughters suite at least had curtains so we could clip the curtains together to keep the draughts out.    On the plus side, all the staff were welcoming, our shower cubicle was HUGE (water pressure not great but did the job) & the bed was really comfy.  
We didn't visit the bar or fitness suite (we did enough walking during our stay to warrant not needing to exercise any more 🤣) so can't comment on that.

title: Custo benefício bom. Ficaria novamente
text: A localização do hotel é excelente, 5 minutos a pé do central park e Columbus circle e 10 minutos a pé da times square, muitos restaurantes, lanchonetes, locadoras de carro, propiciando sair pela cidade a pé. Tamanho do quarto bom, além cozinha “compacta”. A simpatia dos funcionários também é algo a destacar, e menciono o colaborador Jerry, que tentou ao máximo ajudar, de maneira sempre educada e cortês. Hotel bem inflexível quanto a horário. Para entrar mais cedo, me dispus a pagar uma diária a mais mesmo chegando apenas na manhã seguinte a data de início da reserva e não tiveram a delicadeza de nos conceder late check out, isso porque estávamos com nossa filha pequena. É passível de atualização do quarto assim como banheiro.

title: Excelente estadía en Manhattan!!
text:
Excelente estadía, servicios de calidad, amplias habitaciones, cálida atención del personal. 
Excelente ubicación, cerca de subway si vienes del JFK(a sólo 3 cuadras). A una cuadra de las líneas más importantes de subway(para recorrer todo NY). A 3 cuadras de Central Park y muy cerca de Times Square, el Moma, La catedral de San Patricio, etc.
Sin lugar a dudas, muy recomendable

title: Great location, excessive price and very loud rooms
text: Great place if you are there to see shows, however you have an additional charge of $50 a night plus parking charges and the $50 a night is charged even if you are not there. So I don't know what that was for. The room was nice but the windows seemed old and unsealed since it was cold and we could hear everything all night.  probably wouldn't go back in the future but it would be great if they could find a way to seal the windors.

title: Seamless check in, great customer service, and comfy beds!
text:
We had such an easy time at The Manhattan Club! We planned two nights in January to celebrate our son's 21st bday and I decided we should drive right in to NYC from PA door-to-door--not knowing what to expect. It was seamless! We zipped out of the Lincoln Tunnel and were there in a few minutes. 

We arrived early at noon with the plan to store our luggage and walk the city before check in. We pulled right up, valet came out, and within a few short minutes we had our luggage stored, car taken stored, and checked in to wait for our room. The entire staff was super friendly and quick to service us. It was delightful! 

We stayed in a 1 bedroom 2 bath suite and glad we did as the space was great--considering so many NYC hotel are like matchboxes. The main bed was comfy and we were very pleasantly surprised to see the pull out couch bed was memory foam and NOT some awful flat piece of cardboard. However, apparently the pull out sofa bed wasn't checked as there were crumbs in it and some toy cars. But within 3 minutes housekeeping was there, cleaned it up and made the bed. Then when we needed more blankets--they were there in a jiffy. The showers were hot and with good pressure. The floor was super quiet. We even brought an extra blow up single bed that fit in the suite too - for when my husband snored. LOL. We brought a small water pitcher and filled that up to keep cold in the mini fridge. Only thing is that the mini coffee maker only takes their pods. However, you're in NYC and there are cafes everywhere! I brought my tea and used the microwave for it.

We enjoyed heading to the 29th floor for the lounge each night for a drink and view. The bartender was jovial and quick to service (although not the best spot for a dirty martini--so stick with beer or wine). Our son enjoyed the fitness center.

And even before our stay, I was nervous about driving into NYC with all the details and emailed several times with customer service from the hotel website. They responded each time within minutes answering my multitude of questions. We will TOTALLY come back to The Manhattan Club again for our stay. Highly recommend! We got a great deal on Black Friday and between the seamless check in and cheery staff--it was great. We will be back!!

title: The Manhattan Club
text:
My husband and stayed here for a week in January. We were very happy with our stay!  Every staff that we talked to were very friendly and helpful. The room was very nice (room 1202).  There was no view as it was an interior room.  But it was nicely decorated and laid out. 
The location was unbelievable!!!!  10 minute walk to Times Square, 2 minute walk to the subway, grocery store, restaurants and everything you could want was right there!!  The subway system was so easy to use if you don’t want to walk everywhere.  We would definitely stay here again!!

title: Great location But...
text: The hotel is in the great location. The unit where we stayed needs a good remodel and update. Everything is worn out. The shower didn't drain, and there are mold outside the shower wall. The kitchen cabinet door won't close. The chairs in the dining room had tears on the seats. The bedding were comfortable. I appreciate the house keepers for trying very hard to keep the unit clean and comfortable.

title: Great location with mini kitchen
text:
Great location,  a few blocks from Central Park and a Whole Foods for groceries. Subway stops a block away and can walk to Times Square and the Theater District. 
This was RCI exchange for the smallest suite.  However, it has a sleeper sofa,  dishwasher,  microwave,  small fridge and dishes.  Daily hospitality fee is over $50 now, which covers daily refresh and empty of trash.  There is a concierge and doormen.  No access to owner's lounge.  We did not get robes. 
The rented units are worn. Our chairs were both torn.  Note it's very hot in winter, no need to turn on heat.  Can crack open windows,  but no screens.  The car service they recommended was more expensive than quoted. They treat you well,  but I wish I could empty trash myself and save some money.  I  have stayed several times and will return.

title: Manhattan Club In New York City
text: The Manhattan Club is in an excellent location, close to subways and everything needed to make your stay fun.  The staff are very friendly and helpful, and the building is very clean.   This is one of the best resorts we have ever stayed at.

title: Seriously mixed feelings - and disappointed!
text:
A friend and I had two reservations at TMC through RCI during November and December 2023.  The first week we were unfortunately in a small unit.  There was a window, but you could barely open it, and the view was of massive pipes etc. so all we really had, was some light coming through the window (which was sandblasted I think).  I've stayed at TMC twice before, both times thinking it was lovely, but this was an eye opener.  It was not the same anymore.  I had quite a shock when I opened the kitchen cupboard, to only find a few plastic plates, cups, glasses, and the little throw away sets of knives and forks!!  What!!  I phoned and asked what was going on, and finally got some decent crockery and cutlery brought to the room.  Then heard that these rooms, I think it was second floor, were called 'Metropolitan Suites', and it was standard!  Getting wifi was impossible, so we were finally given a gadget to carry with us for wifi.  We found the staff not very helpful, and even battled with our own luggage on the day we left!  
For our second stay, we had a one bedroom unit with a lovely view on the 16th floor.  What a difference.  We were just back in NY from a cruise, and even though we were paying for a week, we only spent 2 days and 1 night there.  This time there was decent items in the cupboard.  We did have some help from the bell hop with luggage.  Front desk staff again not bursting with enthusiasm, and friendly and happy as with all the other places we stayed at during this overseas holiday.  
I was really disappointed in TMC.  They have also had two hefty security deposits on hold on my credit card, and even though I've asked them to instruct their bank to remove the holds (after my bank said it was their responsibility to do do, even though they were telling me my bank should be doing it!), I still have one large hold.  They just don't seem to want to do anything themselves to remove these.
I have always thought that this was a really lovely establishment, but this holiday has changed my mind.  The hotel is in an excellent area, has a good business centre, etc.  The one bedroomed unit was very good.  We often saw specials at the hotel, but always it was stated 'for owners', so we did not bother, seeing that we were not owners.  Is this because we had our reservations as exchanges through RCI??  
By the way, the 'kitchen' in the small room was impossible!  You had to bend under the cabinet to open the tap.  In both rooms, the so-called kitchen is really nothing more than a fridge, microwave, sink, few odds and ends.  
Getting lifts can also be a daunting task, you can wait forever.  Make sure you get your luggage to the foyer very early on the day of departure, as you could stand waiting at the lift for a very long time!
Finally, STAY AWAY FROM THE 'METROPOLITAN SUITES'!

title: My new Favorite place to Stay in NYC!
text: This place is perfectly situated to move around Manhattan both on foot and by train!  The rooms are spacious and perfect for a respite after roaming the city and resting up for the nightlife. The rooms have separate living area with a fridge, dishes and microwave for those leftovers!  Great hot water nd pressure.  Richard has great suggestions for nearby spots. Tanner Smiths is great for late night and Names and Faces is the perfect place to watch the game.  Jerry at the front desk was friendly and attentive.  The elevators could be an issue but if you go left of the front desk there are 2 other elevators! Carnegie Deli is right there! Easy walk to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, 57th and 59th subway stations!  My new fav place to stay in NYC!

title: Birthday Celebration
text: 70th Birthday celebration for my spouse and the choice was NYC. Best aspect of the MC is location! Restaurants and yellow cab access, excellent. The facility is showing its age. Furniture in the rooms are dated as are the blinds. The bed was comfortable. There’s a bar on the 26th floor which is decent. Small lobby. If we were to return, we’d look at the neighbor, Park Central. Nice, large lobby with cab hailer and next to Starbucks., much nicer in ambience.

title: Good but elevators are always full
text: All good but allow yourself and good 25 mins to exit the building every morning. The elevators are always full ! Either wait (about 25 mins for us) or wallk down the stairwell. At least I came back a lot fitter !

title: Estupenda estancia
text: Excelente relación precio calidad. Es un departamento y ofrece desayuno. Estuvimos muy cómodos. Esta muy bien ubicado. Tiene todo lo necesario para tu estancia. El personal es muy atento. Totalmente recomendable.

title: Wonderful Boutique Stay
text: The hotel is small enough that the front staff and door men know who you are- and they welcome you.  You're two blocks from Central Park and 7-8 blocks from Times Square.  The room is well appointed, comfortable and away from everything, so you get a great night's sleep.

title: Okay Visit - Overpriced
text:
We booked and stayed in one of the penthouse suites - The room was not what I expected from the advertisement we found when we booked and was well overpriced for what we got - there were dirty towels left from previous guests I had to have picked up and given new ones & the pull out bed we had to make ourselves when we arrived, along with dirty towels and rubbish being left in the entry way after we did get cleaning done.

 the gentleman who checked us in was very robotic and not very polite, however one of the concierge were outstanding along with the nighttime security guard (every night) 

Overall an okay stay, but won't choose this hotel on our next Manhattan visit

title: Vergogna!!!
text: Siamo andati in questo albergo a settembre ...viaggio a New York..insieme a mio marito e i miei bimbi...nella quale ...uno possibilitàto a camminare...dopo aver pagato l hotel...online.. e dopo 12 ore di volo...arrivati all hotel ...a causa di una cauzione non depositabile...in carta... Non nominativa...siamo stati ...invitati a lasciare l  hotel .. senza nessun rimborso e pietà nei confronti di mio figlio che non poteva camminare...invitandoci di andare a cercare in pieno manatthan di sera tardi un altro hotel.....mi dispiace per questa recensione...ma dovreste avere più cuore... Che fiscalità distinti saluti

title: Esperienza da dimenticare
text: Una vergogna totale, capisco le politiche adottate ma non così...hotel pagato arrivati stanchissimi con due bimbi dopo 10 ore di volo e non ci accolgono per una cauzione di 300 dollari... perché non avevamo carta di credito ma di debito, offro in contanti ma niente...cacciati via e niente rimborso!!

title: Love the Manhattan Club!
text:
We were very pleased with our stay.  We stayed here several years ago, and Adam graciously booked us our exact same room upon our request.  He was extremely professional, very warm, and greeted us upon arrival with a "home-away -from-home" welcoming attitude.  We enjoyed the lounge on the 26th floor, the exercise room was refreshing, and our room was spotlessly clean.  Both the regular bed and the fold-out bed was extremely comfortable with a few of the pillows a very soft down. The heater kept us cozy warm in our October stay. The location was outstanding: 5th Avenue, Central Park and Columbus Circle all within a short walking distance.  
Adam, thank you for going the extra mile!  We cannot wait till we return!

title: Can’t wait to return
text:
I didn’t get around to writing a review the last time we visited which was Dec 2019. However, we had such a fantastic experience when deciding to return to NYC this year we didn’t question where we would stay. The Manhattan Club hotel all the way!
We found all the staff to be extremely welcoming, helpful and courteous. 
I believe we had the standard suite with the mini kitchen, this was perfect to store snacks, milk and drinks in the fridge. Complimentary popcorn for the microwave was the perfect snack. 
The bed was the most comfortable we’ve ever enjoyed and the bedding was luxurious. We loved having an area to sit and plan our day. 
I used the gym several times and it was fab. Everything you need to workout. 
We went to the bar on a couple of occasions and the bar staff were so friendly and gave us lots of good advice about sightseeing. Concierge. I’m counting down the days until we return at the end of this month.

title: A charming hotel in the best neighborhood
text:
Wir waren zu zweit, als Freunde in dem Hotel, deshalb haben wir eien Suite mit Schlafzimmer und seperatem Raum mit Schlafcouch gebucht. Die Suite war altmodisch, aber das macht den Charme aus. Die Bettcouch ließ sich leicht ausziehen, sie war sehr bequem, auf unsere Anfrage hin kam sofort ein Zimermädchen und bezog das Couchbett. Wir waren mit den beiden Badezimmern und der Küchenzeile sehr zufrieden, es war alles sehr sauber und gepflegt. Besonders hervorheben möchte ich das Personal. Jeder einzige Mensch, den wir gesprochen haben, war sehr freundlich und kompetent, wir hatten immer das Gefühl, dass unser Wohlergehen den Mitarbeitenden am Herzen lag, dass sie uns gerne helfen möchten. Das Fitneßstudio war modern und sehr sauber, der Getränkeautomat in der 26sten Etage hatte die besten Preise in NYC.  Wir empfehlen das Hotel uneingeschränkt, wir hatten einen schönen Aufenthalt.

We stayed at the hotel as friends, so we booked a suite with a seperate bedroom and a couch bed in the other room. The suite was old fashioned, but that's what makes it charming. The sofa bed was easy to pull out and very comfortable, at our request a maid came immediately and covered the couch bed with fresh linens. We were very satisfied with the two bathrooms and the kitchenette, it was all very clean and well maintained. I would especially like to emphasize the staff. Every single person we spoke to was very friendly and competent, we always had the feeling that our well-being was important to the staff, that they wanted to help us. The gym was modern and very clean, the vending machine had the best prices for soft drinks. We fully recommend the hotel, it was great to stay there.

title: Excessive Resort fee by Manhattan Club
text: We are very upset with the Manhattan Club's "Hospitality Fee" of $47.50US per day plus tax.  We got nothing for that except "free internet".  It's a money grab by the hotel.  $381.57US including taxes for 7 nights.

title: Soluzione top
text: Abbiamo soggiornato per 6 notti presso questo hotel e ci siamo trovati davvero bene. La stanza era molto ampia e pulita e in più il letto era davvero molto comodo. Avevamo poi la soluzione della colazione da asporto, sceglievamo quindi 3 pezzi da mangiare (a scelta tra cornetti, bagle, yogurt, frutta, pancake) e una bevanda (caffè, latte o succo di frutta). I camerieri ci preparavano poi tutto in una bustina e potevamo scegliere di mangiare in stanza o in qualsiasi altro posto come ad esempio Central Park. Ci tengo a nominare Bojan e il suo collega, addetti alle colazioni, che sono stati sempre super gentili e disponibili con noi. Anche la posizione è ottima, a pochi metri da Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center e MoMa. Inoltre, sempre a pochi metri e in varie direzioni ci sono diverse fermate della metro.

title: We loved The Manhattan Club!
text: We loved the Manhattan Club. Older building but nicely kept. The staff was incredibly nice and helpful. Really made us feel welcomed and at ease. Fantastic location near great food and walking distance to Central Park and many other attractions.

title: BE VERY CAREFUL WHEN BOOKING THIS HOTEL
text: We booked a room for the end of August early in July. We booked through Expedia, and 2 hours later we called as we had booked the wrong dates. The dates were 3 days off. So within 2 hours we called Expedia and they changed the dates for us. At no time they, or the hotel notify us that our FULLY REFUNDABLE reservation was then going to become NON REFUNDABLE. A few days later, so over 45 days from our stay, we learned we had to travel to Seattle instead of going to NYC, so we cancelled this hotel. They refused to give us a dime of $2285.00 back. In fact, they then booked the hotel FULL so resold our room, and did not provide a dime of refund. We are now pursuing legal action, but I would be VERY careful about the policies at this hotel. Expedia has tried to help us saying it should be refunded, but of course the hotel refuses. So they got paid twice for our room. I would stay elsewhere where the hotel has integrity as this one lacks that and more.

title: Saved from the flood
text: I am soo happy with this place, they were sweet helpful and soooo understanding, we got stuck in the flood that Friday and they let us stay in they lunge after check out our train finely came at 7pm. They were so sweet and helpful

title: Strategico
text: Posizione strategica si è a 5 min a piedi da Central park e 10 da Time Square . Ci sono nelle adiacenze più linee della subway . Le stanze sono datate ma pulite . Piccole secondo me x un 4 stelle . La colazione è cara x il servizio  . Il personale è  molto carino e disponibile  .

title: Fabulous location and comfortable stay
text: The Manhatten Club location cannot be beat. A few blocks from Central Park and close to the subway and many great NYC attractions. The resort is clean and the staff and service are excellent. It does charge a $55 a day cleaning fee, which makes it an expensive stay. Without that, it would be great value. The age of the last renovation is starting to show in the furnishings, carpet and wallpaper, but everything is comfortable and in working order.

title: It was ok
text: It was just ok. Location is great - close to times square. Rooms a little outdated. There were no sheets for the pull out couch - I only had blanket and pillow in the bag in the closet. Had to wait forever to get and kids were tired.

title: Great place in New York!
text: We had a great trip to New York and a wonderful day at the Manhattan club. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were very clean. There was not much of a view from our room so that was a little bit of a bummer. But overall I highly recommend.

title: Great overall stay at The Manhattan Club in an Exec Jnr Studio Suite
text: Our stay in late Sept-2023 at The Manhattan Club in an Exec Jnr studio suite was awesome.  Everything as informed and expected.  The frontdesk and concierge (Daniel)  staff were very helpful and friendly.  The daily cleaning included with the $52+/day resort fee is worth it.  Location at W56th and 7 Ave was also very central and convenient.  Overall A+ all around.

title: Excellent location in Manhattan for access to Broadway action.
text:
Just walk out of the Club, go a block and a half and walk down Broadway to a fun vibrant experience.
Also go to Hershey store - great chocolate. Suggest do not get a hot dog from one of the many portable  wagons.

title: Love, love, love the Manhattan Club!
text: Location doesn’t get better than this.  Service is excellent.  Rooms are clean and comfortable and well appointed.  There are a variety of room types to choose from.  This time we have a one bedroom with a separate living area and two full bathrooms.  The extra bathroom makes for such a comfortable stay.  It’s the only place we stay in NYC.

title: Poor customer service! Do not stay in room 2223! Right next to elevators—we did not sleep and we will not return.
text:
Very upset by our stay and the poor customer service on behalf of the Manhattan Club staff. From the moment we checked in, we were unhappy. Our car pulled up with several bags and large luggage—although there is a bell hop outside, he stood there and watched as we unloaded our own bags and brought them inside ourselves; he didn’t even so much as offer a luggage cart. There was no one in line at the front desk, yet we stood there and waited for someone to greet, or even acknowledge us as we looked at 5 staff members behind the front desk all talking to each other and messing with one single computer. I can understand if they were experiencing computer issues, but did it require all 5 staff members and not one of them could even look up to at least say, “we’ll be with you in just a minute.” 

Finally, Vana gestured us forward. My husband handed her his ID to check in and she claimed she couldn’t find our reservation asking us, “well, when did you book the reservation?” When did we book the reservation??? Months ago—how do we know and how will that help you find out reservation more so than just typing in our name, email, or phone number? She finally found out reservation—and handed us our keys without apologizing for the inconvenience. 

Our room was fine—until we laid down to go to sleep. DO NOT ALLOW THEM TO PUT YOU IN ROOM 2223–or any room that ends in “23” for that matter—It is right next to the elevators and all night long we could hear the elevators going up and down. Literally, the elevator shaft is 3 feet from the headboard of your bed and you can hear everything from the mechanisms of the elevator to people talking and coming in and out with their luggage. We did not sleep at all. 

My husband went down around noon today to request another room. They obliged, but then downgraded us to a room that was smaller and did not have an updated bathroom like our original room. We went back down and declined the Room explaining we were not going to pay for a nice room but be downsized and downgraded. The front desk gave my husband another room key—before we moved all our belongings for a third time, he went and looked at the room—again, it was smaller and did not have the upgrades that we had in our initial room near the elevators. 

The last option they gave us was to completely check out, leave our bags with the bell desk, and wait 4 hours to see if they MIGHT have another room available tonight that was either better or of equal standard to room 2223. The hotel is sold out so we obviously aren’t going to take the risk—so now we are stuck in a room where all we can hear are the elevators and every guest checking in—far louder and noisier than the streets of New York outside our window! 

We will not return to this hotel and I absolutely would not recommend it to anyone.

title: Good size rooms but the rooms need updating
text: We stay at the Manhattan Club on an RCI timeshare exchange.  Rooms have plenty of space.  Although well maintained the furnishings feel older than other places we have stayed in NYC. The location is excellent

title: Bella vacanza
text: Ho trascorso una bella settimana a scoprire New York per la prima volta. Servizio eccellente, l'albergo è molto centrale e accogliente. Il Central Park, i teatri di Broadway  tutti molto vicini.Da consigliare.

title: l'emplacement et l'ensemble du personnel du Manhattan Club ont contribué en grande partie à la réussite de notre séjour
text: séjour du 05/09/2023 au 10/09/2023 inclus dans la suite métropolitaine toujours tenue très propre. Toute l'équipe du Manhattan Club est vraiment accueillante, agréable, très professionnelle. Cet hôtel est véritablement très bien situé : face à la salle de concert Le Carnegie Hall, à l'angle de la 7ème avenue, très proche de Central Park, de Times Square, de Ellen's Stardust Diner à l'angle de Broadway ... balade à pied sans problème pour voir Rockfeller center, Cathédrale Sainte Catherine, Empire State Building... Tout ça pour dire que l'emplacement et l'ensemble du personnel du Manhattan Club ont contribué en grande partie à la réussite de notre séjour.

title: Nice hotel and good location close to subway
text: My family stayed 3 nights in this hotel. We love the hotel location easy to take subway. We have one bedroom unit the room space is very comfortable and spacious. Only thing I don’t like is the elevator entrance to access our room looks like not for hotel customers.

title: Very nice hotel
text: It’s a very nice hotel, good location, quite and excellent customer service. Only two blocks from the Central Park, close to 5th Avenue and Time Square. The guys on front desk was perfect, the room it’s a good size and very clean. We recommend!!

title: Hotel The Manhattan Club New York
text: Consiglio vivamente, ottimo hotel per rapporto qualità prezzo a cui si aggiunge la posizione eccellente in pieno centro Manhattan a ridosso di Central Park e vicino a Times Square. La qualità dei servizi e dell'igiene è molto buona.

title: Warmest and friendliest hotel ever
text:
Absolutely fantastic hotel.
Large rooms
Great cleaning staff
Fantastic front desk staff
Superb reception
Perfect bell staff
Absolutely wonderful concierge and security
This hotel has a wonderfully accessible location to subways and also walking distance to the best tourist sites.
The staff are caring and attentive and go out of there way to assist.
We checked in with our luggage being delayed on our flight and the staff went out of there way to help us, sign it off on arrival, and advise on shops location as well as great restaurants and bars in the area. 
Adam from the front reception is do pleasant and helpful, and continued to make sure our stay was everything we expected, providing information on the best restaurants and bars around the hotel.
Lauren was also fantastic with a smile and warm welcome.
Faisal and John were our stats highlights, they were super excited that our luggage arrived and assisted us with grace and warmth.
I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, it is by far the best New York hotel I’ve stayed at.

title: Gem of a hotel!
text: What a gem of a hotel.  We stayed there for four nights in late August 2023.  The staff goes out of their way to help you!  Very warm and welcoming and extremely helpful with recommendations and tips.  Shoutouts to Jesse and John the bellhops, Dousha, the maid, and Adam at the front desk.  We are a family of four and stayed in a one bedroom suite with two bathrooms (a saving grace).  The suite was fully equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, dishes, cutlery etc. -  perfect if you want to bring food back to your room to eat or keep your leftovers and drinks cold in the fridge.   The main bed and pull out couch mattress were comfy.  Wifi and air conditioning worked no problem.  It was great having two bathrooms although they desperately need some kind of counter space for beauty supplies and toiletries. The room overall was very clean which we appreciated.  Now lets talk about location - this is what makes this hotel.  It’s close to so many major attractions.  Everything is within walking distance . You’re right in the broadway district, close to many shows, Carnagie Hall, a few bocks from Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, 5th Avenue Shopping, Central Park, tons of restaurants and delis and subway stations. Highlights of our trip included renting scooters right around the corner from the hotel on 57th Street and taking them through Central Park.  Fabulous!  We also went to a comedy show (Brooklyn Comedy Club)  just a few street’s over…fantastic!  We would absolutely go back to this this hotel!  NYC is awesome and we were pleasantly surprised how nice the people were and how clean and safe it was considering the size of the city 😀

title: New York City weekend vacation
text: We were here for 3 nights and it served its purpose.  It was clean and the wait staff was nice.  I thought this was a condo type setting and not a hotel but I still give it 10/10.  Walking distance to everything we wanted to do and if it wasn’t there was always a taxi outside the door.

title: Beautiful room
text: My husband and I used our RCI points to stay two nights before school started. I was pleased with its location. Jason, the bellman, was our first impression. He was a positive person. He wore a smile every time I saw him. He took our luggage because it was too early to check in. Who didn’t wear a smile was Vania, behind the desk. She refused to even discuss a check in before 4. We had 5:30 dinner reservations. She didn’t care. Then at check out, she didn’t have a smile. I worked the front office of the hotel. Smiling is a necessity. On the other hand, James was so kind.  He checked us in, with a smile, at 3:45. He understood. Every time, even this morning when we check out, he smiled. We were in room 2403. Nice and roomy. Two bathrooms. The bed wasn’t comfortable, nor were the pillows. The windows were filthy and were in desperate need of cleaning. $35 a day was charged for parking our car.

title: Best Value, Location, Staff
text: Unbelievably great location. 2 blocks to Central Park; across street from Carnegie Hall; 4 blocks to theaters; 2 blocks to MOMA.  The studio was very large with king bed, sofa, dinette, kitchenette. The housekeeping staff were courteous and excellent. All the staff were unbelievably nice. The Manhattan Club really made this trip to NYC exceptional.

title: Excellent Choice for a Week in Manhattan
text: We love the Manhattan Club. The staff is extraordinary - friendly, accommodating, responsive to every need. The whole place is very clean and the one-bedroom suites are extremely spacious with 2 bathrooms. Upon check-in, desk staff noticed my disability and asked if I wanted a walk-in shower. It was perfect with several grab bars. Lost a phone under the couch and maintenance responded quickly and retrieved immediately. Can’t say enough positive comments about this wonderful place.

title: Girls Week
text: Fantastic hotel, near to all NYC's fabulous sites, great service and staff. My oldest daughter and I took three of my grandaughters for their high school graduation celebration. It was a trip of a lifetime!

title: Très bonne adresse!
text:
Nous avons séjourné 10 nuits dans cet hôtel, dont nous avons apprécié la situation géographique : A 5 min à pied de Central Park,  10 min de Times square et proche de plusieurs stations de métro.
Le personnel est franchement très agréable , d'une extrême politesse et très attentionné: que ce soit à la réception, au service petit déjeuner ou service bagagerie (merci Joel😉) .
Nous n'avons pas souffert du problème d'ascenseurs , notre chambre étant au 2e étage, nous avons bénéficié en plus des ascenseurs de service.
Le petit déjeuner est très bien: du choix parmi beignets, salades de fruits, céréales, pancakes, croissants, pains au chocolat, muffins, fruits, jus de fruits.
La chambre est bien entretenue, la literie extrêmement confortable, kitchenette bien équipée avec vaisselle jetable. Il y a un whole food market à columbus circle à 5 min à pied de l'hôtel, ce qui permet de changer des fast food.
Tout était parfait hormis un point négatif à notre arrivée : le canapé lit n'était pas préparé donc il a fallu aller demander des draps et faire le lit à 1h du matin.

title: Posizione fantastica, residence puliti ma un po vecchi
text: E perfetto per tutto ma la doccia deve avere almeno il telefono perché necessario per lavarsi bene.. Cosi come i materiali tipo la moquette che ormai non si usa più da decenni e la carta da parati che è ancora bella ma vecchia

title: Great Location, Excellent Room
text: Great location, walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, Central Park.  Very safe feeling.  Lovely, large rooms!  Excellent place for a NYC getaway!  Welcoming staff.  Short walk to subway stations.  We took Amtrak from Virginia and is was so easy to get around!

title: Great location
text: Wonderful staff and an amazing location.  The Manhattan Club is across the street from Carnegie Hall and is walking distance to Times Square, Broadway and Central Park.  It's also conveniently located to public transit that will take you anywhere else you want to go......

title: Great Location, Great Staff
text: Great location, close to Central Park and subway lines.  We had a kitchenette in our room, so we were able to keep and prepare our own food.  That's hard to find in a NYC hotel.  Staff was excellent.

title: My 2 cents worth
text:
Reading through the previous reviews, here’s my take on the hotel. There are the 2 main elevators to the hotel rooms. But there are also 2 elevators to the left of the checkin desk. There’s a door to go through but also a sign to direct you. We found those to be a bit busy in the morning when housekeeping was arriving but otherwise empty. 

We never went to the 26th floor for breakfast. Why?  There are so many places a 5-10 minute walk away. Broad Nosh bagels was a favourite. The Carnegie diner was also very good with HUGE portions. I didn’t like the Illy coffee maker in our room but brought our travel kettle, filters and pour through funnel and just popped out to buy ground coffee. 

We stayed in room 1509. Not at all outdated, very clean and comfortable and a great view. WIFI was great and we used it with no problem. This was my fourth visit to Manhattan and the other hotel rooms I stayed at were tiny in comparison. New York is an old city. So are the hotels. 

Express checkout is offered. Dial 0 to reach the front desk. Tell them you’re checking out and drop your keys in one of the labelled boxes. No need to line up at the front desk. Twice we got a bellman to hail a taxi for us. Easy peasy. 

We loved our stay here and all the staff we encountered during our 5 night stay were friendly and professional. We would definitely stay at The Manhattan Club again.

title: Hidden gem in the heart of Manhattan
text: This was the first time that we stayed at The Manhattan Club.  The location is great -- close to everything and easy to get in and out.  The room size is huge for NYC and it is great to have a kitchenette.  I appreciated the daily housekeeping service which seems to have gone away everywhere else and they even replace the popcorn daily :) -- The staff were friendly and accommodating.  I would absolutely recommend staying here and will stay here again.

title: Excellent Stay Experience
text: This is our 2nd stay here at the Manhattan Club and we were impressed each time.  Our room (1-Bedroom suite) was spacious and had 2 full baths and  kitchen.  The staff were very accomodating and helpful and our rooms were cleaned each day.  Very conformatable bed, lots of pillows and blankets and free toiletries.  An issue with our TV was remedied immediately and the baggage staff was quick to assist with getting cabs.  The breakfast weemed fair although not complimentary ... whether it is a vlaue to you or not depends on your budget but coffe and tree are free and the lounge lovely.  I would recommend to anyone, especially RCI members.

title: Not what we expected
text: The elevator situation was horrible. It took up to 20 minutes just to get to the lobby.  There seems to be a lack of standard that are checked by staff between stays. We experienced some things in need of attention that could have been fixed with a screwdriver. There were dirty dishes in the cabinets in the kitchen area. When reported, the staff was responsive. Just felt like it wa a "fireman" situation. Reactive instead of being proactive with unit inspections.

title: If you are a RCI member leave this for last resort
text:
I don’t recommend The Manhattan Club for RCI members because you are treated as 2nd class.  We were assigned a room on 16th floor where there was renovation take place and our room with one window had a nice view of a brick wall.

Pro:
Good location, you are near Central Park, Broadway, Time Square, and many Subway lines

Cons:
After you paid $250 exchange fee, they charge you $54 a night for resort fee and it doesn’t matter how many night you actually stay there.  We stay for 5 nights and they insist on charging us $381 for the week even for nights we were not there and didn’t us any of their resources.  We reserved this hotel on Nov. 16, 2021 when there were NO resort fees listed in RCI so it not right that the contract was changed!  My sister stayed there a year ago and didn’t have to this resort fee which includes basically nothing, they just make your room every day.

It is an old hotel and walking into our room was a time wrap back to the 1980s, all furnishings were from that era.  The hallways are dark and dingy with no windows.

The pillows stinks to the point that my wife couldn’t sleep at night.  They reek of BO from many previous guests.

If you plan to leave between 9 to 11AM, you’ll need to be patient.  We waited 15 minutes because every elevator was already full.  Eventually we got into elevator going up so we could reserve our place then went to the top 26th floor then come down to only stop at just about every floor because people were trying to come down.  So be prepare for that if you need to catch a flight.

Dishes and utensils were sparse and dirty.  We had to run a dish washing load first before using them.

If you want a pleasant visit do your research, there's probably better options.

title: Seconda volta a NY
text: Hotel centralissimo, un po’ datato ma accogliente. La camera è spaziosa, i mobili andrebbero rinnovati, il divano letto molto scomodo. Il personale è gentile e disponibile, buona la colazione. Location ottima. Rapporto qualità/prezzo buono.

title: Hôtel très central
text: Très bonne expérience dans cet hôtel il est proche de tout ,nous avions un pt salon ,une cuisine avec évier ,four ,frigo ,…La chambre a toujours été bien nettoyé ,elle  est dans un style assez kitch .Il y a du tapis au sol donc ne convient peut-être pas à tout le monde . Le personnel du petit déjeuner était très sympathique .Nous n avons eu aucun problème d ascenseur .

title: Great Stay but avoid the breakfast!
text:
The property, location, and staff were amazing!!!!

Housekeeping cleaned the room, took the garbage, made the bed, and replenished fresh towels daily!  It was a nice size room for NYC that allowed us the space to store 2 bicycles.  The kitchenette was nice to have and came with popcorn and coffee!   I also had friends that stayed on the sleeper sofa for a nigh and said it was very comfortable.  

The bell men, security, and front desk team were always smiling and greeting you, and quick with any assistance.  The valet parking was convenient and $35 for 24 hours.  It you pass that 24 hour mark it goes right to the next $35 so make a mental note of it in advance.   A concierge was available in the lobby for any recommendation needs. 

Although I didn't get to use it, the fitness room was one of the nicest I have seen.  There is also a business center.  Both are on the 26th floor with the lounge, along with the ice and vending machines, and bathrooms.  

The property is across from Carnegie Hall and had eateries all over.  It's a quick few blocks to Central Park, Times Square, 5th Ave,  St. Patrick's Cathedral, and Rockefeller Center.  It was about 1/2 hour walk to Madison Square Garden, if you don't get distracted, which is quite easy to do in NYC.  

We did have a miscommunication about the coffee service.  We were told it was free but apparently that was only at a certain time.   We went for 2 coffee's and had them separated because one was decaf.  The waiter in the room took the coffee's and mixed them up and said they were $15 to be charged to the room, and gave them back.  We dumped the coffee's because now we didn't know which was which.  Called the front desk and asked for the charge to be removed.  They would not remove it but offered 2 breakfast's.  We then had to miss other things we could have been doing to go take advantage of this breakfast which was regularly priced at $30 and consisted of coffee, bagels, fruit, and croissants.   It was not worth the time or the money had you been paying for it.   My room did not initially have decaf in it but I requested some after this incident and they did bring it.  The machine in the room is neither drip or Keurig and you have to watch a video to figure out how to work it.  I had already packed my own creamer. 

They hit it out of the park otherwise, but steer clear of the lounge, unless you like $30 bagels.

title: Very enjoyable stay
text: We loved our stay at The Manhattan Club (we stayed there through a timeshare exchange). Our room was comfortable and well-maintained, the staff was friendly and efficient, and it's a great location. We would definitely stay at The Manhattan Club again in the future.

title: New York a portata di mano!
text: BELLISSIMA esperienza al Manhattan Club! Prima volta a New York per me e i miei figli e questo hotel centralissimo e vicino ad una importante stazione dell'Underground ci ha reso possibile visitare facilmente la città! In più personale cortese, camere dotate di ogni confort e spaziose a rendere ancora più confortevole questa esperienza indimenticabile! Se verremo nuovamente a New York torneremo qui!

title: The Manhattan Club
text: Good location but will be nice if staff in reservation can at least give a residence a call when required. Booked 7 nights but we required 8 nights reservation team said they are fully booked but booking.com was able to book us with a cheaper cost. We requested if we could retain on the same room to save packing and check-out and check-in but not accepted. Rushed to Checked-out and to do check-in but been told that we can stay in the same room. How annoying... If staff could have given us a 1-minute phone call will be very much appreciated.

title: Decent hotel in a great location
text: Snooty at the front desk when I told them I was unaware of additional hospitality charge of $50 per day for RCI members. Snootier still when my card didn't work the first two attempts and I called my bank. Otherwise the hotel lived up to my expectations, except for having no view. I guess they save those rooms for the RCI members.

title: the corridor floor adjacent to the bathroom was black and full of fungus
text: The hotel is generally old, but its location is good. During our stay, we discovered that the bathroom was leaking water into the corridor floor, and we brought it to the attention of the workers for three days, but they didn't take any action. The room smelled damp and foul, and the corridor floor adjacent to the bathroom was black and full of fungus. Unfortunately, the workers completely ignored our complaints and showed no interest in resolving the issue. The hotel is not cheap at all for this kind of treatment and room condition."

title: Excellent venue, spotlessly clean and very comfortable. Highly recommend.
text:
Great hotel, clean, bright, comfortable and set in an excellent location neat Central Park, Times Square…We had a City Lite Suite, for a family of 4. Huge kingsize bed in bedroom, pull down bed, which we left down during our stay. The kitchen has a fridge, microwave, coffee machine with complimentary coffee ( you can ask for more pods if needed) and crockery. Bathroom and room was spotlessly clean, such a relief. Big thumbs up! 
The hotel has an ice/water machine that was great for filling up water bottles. 
Would highly recommend and would be happy to stay there again.

title: Almost excellent stay
text: Everything as expected, except from the pizzas offered at 26th floor, which are very poor quality (at least the night we decided to give them a chance), and expensive for what was served. Except from that, we don't have any other complaints.

title: Central location, perfect for our visit
text: The Manhattan Club is centrally located to many key attractions and subway stops, making it a convenient location.  The staff were welcoming and very pleasant. Our suite size was much large than anticipated which was a pleasant surprise. Would stay here again.

title: Broadway trip
text: Centrally located to Central Park, Broadway and Times Square. Great staff. The 26th floor lounge has a nice view. Only downside, a mile plus from the major museums. But we were there for Broadway, so it was great. I do recommend US Tours, friendly and knowledgeable guide, only a few blocks from the hotel.

title: Trip to Midtown
text: This is an excellent place to stay. Great service and friendly helpful staff. Great location 1 block to the subway. Great resterauts and only a few blocks from times Square. They checked each day to see ifou wanted your room serviced which I thought was great as I had experienced the opposite of that just a few days before in another city .

title: Nice place in midtown
text: Great hotel - really a timeshare and very nice. Big lounge on 26th floor with free coffee. Owners are paying 3-4k per year maintenance on top of their capital investment so for under $300 a night it's a good deal. Gym and business centre also on 26th floor. 4 pm check in is late and they stick by it. Two nice groceries a block away. Rooms have kitchenette, crockery and flatware.

title: Centrally Located
text:
We stayed a week at the Manhattan Club doing 4th of July. The staff were extremely nice, kind,  and helpful in every way possible. We had a one bedroom with 2 bathrooms. The hotel furniture can use some serious updating in rooms. There were holes in some of the chairs, drawers would not stay closed, the shower door would not close completely-causing water to come out, and furniture was chipped.

The club is certainly centrally located not far from Central Park, Times Square, and Broadway. There are several restaurants around to enjoy. The breakfast at the hotel is $29 but is only continental breakfast with no meat.

title: Lovely stay, great location, spacious rooms
text: What a lovely stay we had at The Manhattan Club! The check in and customer service was quick & friendly. The rooms are SPACIOUS. We had 8 suitcases and were able to fit all of them plus our hung clothes in the closets. There was a bit of a cigarette smell in the passages but it was gone by day 2, there was a sign advising that there were renovations being done on that floor. The Bell Men were helpful and super friendly. Complimentary coffee, tea and popcorn was in our room. I would DEFINITELY go back. Location is also perfect

title: Good location but outdated
text: Well located hotel, but outdated and not in great shape. Room size is relatively large compared to Ny rooms but the condition makes it feel small and not especially comfortable.  Slightly early check in which was appreciated. However out of nowhere cleaning staff opened the door, even though it was my first day and cleaning had already been done.  The room smelled like cigarette smoke, which apparently is being piped in through the vent. I called down and was told security would investigate but I doubt they did, as it persisted and was there on the second day. Walls and ceilings in visible disrepair. Hope they will renovate the hotel as that’s clearly what is needed.

title: excellent sejour au manhattanclub
text:
La résidence est idéalement située dans la ville. La chambre est grande .
Le personnel est professionnel et compétent.
Un seul bémol : il y a deux ascenseurs qui visiblement ne suffisent pas et l'attente est toujours trop longue même lorsque l'on est décontracté et en vancances.

title: NY Staycation for 2.
text:
Location is excellent. Plenty of food options in the area. Hotel is as pictured. Amenities look slightly dated, i.e. fridge, bed small, couches in room and lounge very small if 5'11 or taller, no working USB charger on the clock. But nothing that would stop me from going back.  Staff were excellent. Only one person, seemed like they didn't think black people should be there. But that person was either black or a darker skinned Spanish person. Go figure. But that didnt stop our time. Everyone else was welcoming. Check in and Check out was the easiest. The lounge on the 26th floor  is a great size, they should play some light R&B music and get some taller couches. There should also be more food options for lunch/dinner at the hotel for thosr that dont want to go out. Suite size was great. The hot water and water pressure was great. The elevators are slightly slow. Waited 3-5 min or so each time as it fits 4 or 5 people. 
Overall a great time, we will definitely be back if we can get in with our points last minute. Ushally you have to plan months in advance, which isn't always an option. Also we only used 20k points for 2 days for this July 4th weekend  which was excellent. Usually it's a lot more points.
Have a great time. P.s. Carnegie diner on corner of 57th st and 7th Ave is excellent. Great prices and great servings. Also extremely quick.

title: large but outdated apartment
text:
The  very spacious apartment 2705 on the 27th floor  has a lot of storage space and even 2 walk in closets.
2 bathrooms, each of them also has a toilet.
The bed is very comfortable, the air conditioning works great.

We booked the largest apartment that was available, a 60 square meter king deluxe  suite. The description of the apartment states that there is a kitchenette equipped with a refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, coffee machine and kitchen utensils. It didn't occur to us that in the kitchen that has a dishwasher will have  no stove and therefore there is no way to cook anything except in the microwave. we find this is a bit misleading, we could not cook breakfast. It is not clear what a dishwasher is for when there is no pan or pot.
The hotel needs an update and adaptation to our times - no USB sockets, no sockets by the bed sides. And apart from side lamps  there is no central lighting. And turning off and on the side lamps requires getting out of bed because the switch is next to the bulb. The whole apartment is dark and not lit enough. even in the living room the light is very weak.
When we got to the bed-room it turned out that the two side lamp bulbs   were burnt out, they were replaced and since then they have been blinking all the time.
The internet is extremely bad, it disconnects all the time and basically it is not possible to surf on Wi-Fi.
There are 2 smart TVs in the apartment that were not connected to the internet, after we asked, they connected them but after one day they did not reconnect .
there is a computer and a fax machine in the apartment - needless to say they were disconnected. 
After 7 nights we asked for the bed linen to be changed and then it turned out that the room did not have the card that the guest is supposed to put on the bed when he wants the sheets changed. If we hadn't asked, they probably wouldn't have changed on their own initiative at all. 
There were evenings when they put chocolate on the bed, it was very nice but not consistent.
The 2 telephones in the room did not work, it became clear to us only on the last evening of our stay when we wanted to talk to the reception, we had to go downstairs.
In such a large hotel we would expect there to be a self-service laundry room - there is none.
The elevators are busy all the time, for our apartment that was on the 27th floor, we need to change the elevators on the 26th floor.

The evening before check-out after 10 nights stay, we asked if it would be possible to keep the room for an extra hour, we were told that it could not be guaranteed the night before and that we should ask in the morning of the check out. We asked, and we were told without checking and automatically - "We don't do late checkouts". They could have spared us the request the night before and said right away that this was their policy.
The receptionist at check-in was courteous and very nice.
The receptionist at check-out was not nice to say the least, without any pleasantries such as-"I hope you had a good time with us", I hope you will come again". ...we received the invoice without an envelope.
In conclusion, the return did not justify the price.

title: Great Place!
text: Excellent location for touring NYC.  Staff and unit were flawless.  Attractions and local travel methods worked very well for moving around the city.  Lots of great restaurants nearby.  I would recommend staying here to both NYC newbies as well as "old hats".

title: Recent stay - charge for excessive "resort" fee
text: The "resort fee" that is charged is a total RIP-OFF.  We get nothing for it, and RCI allows this to happen.  I purchased my timeshare with the intent of trading a week for a week.  Yet now RCI allows these resorts to charge excessive, greedy fees!!!  Ridiculous and unnecessary.

title: Manhattan Club
text: GREAT location, enjoyed the hospitality.   over all please, the elevator issue was the only draw back.  the price its worth the stay for sure.  Better view would have been nice. I would recommend this hotel for sure.

title: Very good stay at Manhattan Club
text: The staff are very friendly and helpful.  The room is clean and cozy with nice amenities.  Breakfast on 26th floor is great.  Location of this hotel is ideal, within walking distance of so many things in Manhattan.  The only negative is the slow elevators.

title: Loved my stay
text: The hotel is really nice. It is close to central park and not too far from time Square.  The staff was always attentive and helpfull.  I would definitely go back again. It has breakfast if you would like to eat there

title: Excellent location in New York~
text: The Manhattan Club is a perfect location near Carnegie Hall and Central Park!  The Club is extremely clean and the staff is very helpful and friendly.  Our room overlooked Central Park and we watched fireworks from our room.  The subways and busses are easy to get to from this location.  Lots of restaurants within walking distance.  Time Square easily walkable.  Definitely recommend The Manhattan Club for your stay in NYC!.

title: NYC
text:
Elevators slow, some broken. Resort fee of over $55 a day not sure what for.
Nice room friendly staff. Good location. Jr. executive suite includes sofa bed and queen bed. Sink, microwave, dishwasher ..

title: Outstanding location
text: The Manhattan Club has very friendly staff, excellent access to many train and bus lines, and easy to get around the city from here. NYC is an excellent vacation place with its many theaters, museums, and tons of activities.

title: So many wrongs... Only good thing was room size.
text: This property is DATED. Rooms look like they haven't been remodeled since 1985. Also, for 25 floors or so there are 2 (!) small elevators. There were lines to get to the lobby from my floor and worse from lobby going up. Service was friendly but that's not much comfort. If anyone wants to pay 400 a night to feel like they time travel or stay at grandma's then ok. Stay here. If not. Stay away.

title: Manhattan club hotel is spacious minutes from time square and within walking distance to most attractions
text:
The Manhattan club is a very spacious hotel with a separate living room own ensuite bathroom and a separate cloakroom with shower could easily sleep four people. The bed was a little high. I had to do a jump to get on it but it was so comfy I never wanted to get out of it.
The hotel is also just minutes from time, square, and within walking distance of most of the attractions, very clean and comfortable with highly recommend

title: Manhattan club hotel NYC
text: I would like to share my experience at Manhattan club. I booked a deal at Travelzoo for 1 night to stay after the concert we attended. The room was nice, but the air-conditioner didn't work and during the night it got very hot and stuffy. We were very upset and disappointed and just left early in the morning. I called the hotel day after and complained. Supervisor Andrew apologized and told me that if we stay at this hotel, we will get a 10% discount. I booked again on Travelzoo  this hotel for June 23 and wanted to get my discount. When I called the hotel, they said, I have to contact Travelzoo. I did and they told me that the discount is only if I book through the hotel directly. Also they told me that I had to call the front desk at night and asked them to fix it. At this point neither the hotel nor Travelzoo are willing to take care of this. It is not that much money, but I didn't expect such service from a reputable hotel and Travelzoo. Very disappointed.

title: Need wi-fi!
text:
Love TMC and splurged on a Penthouse suite. 
Wi-fi has not worked for the past two days. we are told they are “working on it” Wi-fi is essential when traveling for communication, planning, tickets, directions, etc. This is too expensive to not have wi-fi

title: Excelente
text: Excelente a todos os níveis, localização óptima, atendimento óptimo, limpeza apartamento óptima,qualidade sono excelente, simpatia pessoal excelente, climatização excelente, ambiente muito tranquilo não obstante estar no centro da cidade

title: Great location, warm welcome, friendly staff, great  breakfast, very well stocked kitchenette..highly recommend
text: Only downside was the variable wifi but otherwise no  complaints.  Everything you want within a block of central park and definitely go for the breakfast deal.. well worth it. Thanks so much to the staff at breakfast who made it a very pleasant experience and to the concierge for getting us to jfk.. all in all, if not for the WiFi (not the biggest issue for us but could be for others)  5 out of 5 stars..

title: Good accomodation close to everything
text:
Received an upgrade on arrival.

Room was spacious, great bed and a little kitchenette.

Very close to Central Park and all attractions in Manhattan.   

Staff were nice and friendly and happy to help.  

New York itself was okay but dirty. Garbage bags littered the streets and they smelt bad.

title: Hotel confortevole
text: Hotel di un livello alto, con camera (mini room) comoda e completa di servizi per una vacanza con famiglia. Posizione perfetta per muoversi in città, a due passi da Central Park, fermata metro vicinissima e per chi ama camminare a piedi da qui si possono visitare i principali punti di attrazione di New York

title: Very good, but the Internet.
text:
The hotel is excellent. The only thing that did not work was the Internet. They charge a expansive daily fee for amenities and the Internet is included, according to the person who did the check-in, the Internet
was included with the payment of the fee. My Internet did not work and they refused to give a refund.

title: Exceptionnel
text: Le confort de la literie la propreté du logement et la gentillesse du personnel une grosse dédicasse pour JOE (Billy Joël) il est au top du top adorable !!  Très réactif vous trouve un taxi en un instant….

title: scandale
text:
Une honte nous avions réservés une suite pour 5 adultes ,nous sommes arrivés à minuit , en decouvrant la chambre il n'y avait que 4 couchages , nous sommes redescendu à la reception pour informer de ce probléme ( le bon échange était bien pour 5 )  la receptionniste n'a pas voulu résoudre le probléme , elle nous a proposé un lit d'appoint en plus avec un supplément de 80$ que nous avions refusé car nous avions réservé et payé pour 5 , fatigué et heure tardive , mon mari c'est couché à même le sol sur les coussins du canapé , le lendemain notre agence à réglé le probléme en rajoutant un lit  sans supplément  , le seul hotel au monde ou vous reservé pour 5 et que l'on vous donne une chambre pour 4  
Bravo pour un 4 étoiles  !!

title: Indimenticabile vacanza a NYC
text:
Ottima struttura, posizione eccellente, personale disponibile efficiente e cordiale. In ogni momento, nella hall, è possibile trovare assistenza per ogni necessità.
Appartamenti ampi, molto ben attrezzati e curati.

title: Clean, Roomy
text:
This is our second trip/week  spent at The Manhattan Club. This hotel has some really wonderful things about it. I love that there is a separate bedroom (no door) dining nook and kitchenette. It is a large room for New York City. I like the linens and it is very clean. The location is amazing for going to Broadway plays, museums, Central Park, etc. 
But there are a few things that need improvement. 
The bathtub is very slippery with no available mat. 
The couch (hide a bed option) is unbelievably uncomfortable. The cushions slip forward, and it has 0 support. We have to put bed pillows behind our backs to sit on it. 
The bathroom has a pedestal sink. It's a very small bath with NO storage area. 
$50/day charge for maid service
No information on the hotel....are there restaurants here? Where is the gym? Etc, etc. 
WFI is terrible. Cuts out constantly. 
And, the elevators are a long wait. 
If you can get this hotel at a reasonable rate you will be happy.

title: Top !
text: Hôtel idéalement situé à deux pas de Central Park et du métro. Chambre city light très spacieuse, idéale pour 4! La literie est très confortable. Le personnel est adorable et serviable. Le petite cuisine est un vrai plus pour réduire le budget repas, les dosettes de café et le pop corn sont offerts chaque jour. Pas de mauvaise surprise sur les prix, seule la caution est demandée en empreinte bancaire. Parfait, si nous avons la chance de revenir à NYC, nous séjournerons à nouveau sans hésiter au Manhattan club !

title: NY junto a Central Park
text: Estuvimos 5 días un matrimonio y 2 hijos. Este alojamiento tiene muchos puntos positivos para visitar NY. La ubicación es excelente, muy cercana a varios puntos de interés y en un lugar céntrico para organizar todas las visitas turísticas y salidas a restaurantes, espectáculos, etc. Elegimos un suite con dos baños que resultó muy cómoda y espaciosa. En general muy buena valoración.

title: Très bien situé mais besoin d un rafraîchissement
text:
Hotel idéalement situé sur la ligne jaune et à deux pas de  Central Park.
Chambre Suite Junior idéale pour visite avec kitchenette et machine à café (dosettes fournies chaque jour). 
Literie confortable y compris pour le canapé lit.
Demander une chambre en étage élevé pour plus de calme : la contrepartie est l attente aux ascenseurs mais en vacances ce n'est pas un problème.
Reservation via booking sans problème ni surprise.

2 petits points négatifs : moquette et meubles qui commencent à dater : cependant lors de notre présence des travaux de peinture étaient en cours dans le couloir : peut être que les chambres vont aussi être rénovées?
Simple vitrage sur les vitres donc bruit de la rue mais avec la fatigue du vol et des visites cela ne nous a pas gêné.

En résumé idéal pour visiter New York avec une kitchenette pour réduire le budget repas.

title: La plus mauvaise chambre que nous ayons eu !
text:
Nous avions réservé  The Manhattan Club sur les évaluations TripAdvisor, quelle déconvenue ! 

C est la pire chzmbre que nous ayons eu depuis que nous voyagons :
- pas de double vitrage toute la nuit le bruit de la rue
- climatisation qui rafraichit pa ou peu
- papier peint déchiré
- prise electrique cassée
- moquette tachée 
- troisième matin pas d eau chaude
- ...
Point positif : literie
L hotel a besoin d un gros rafraîchissement et d une mise aux normes.

title: Excelente experiencia
text: Viajamos a finde de febrero con mis hijas. La experiencia en Manhattan Club fue excelente, tal cual nos habian recomendado. Se destaca la limpieza tanto del lugar fisico como la ropa blanca, Ubicacion del hotel es barbara, esta a dos cuadras del central park, a una del subway en una zona muy linda y tranquila , pero a la vez cerca de todo. La atencion del personal del hotel es muy buena, destaco especialmente a un maletero llamado John, nos recomendo lugares por conocer y nos dio tips sobre el hotel que nos ayudaron, por ejem poder esperar en forma comoda en el piso 26  hasta que nos pasaran a buscar para volvernos a Buenos Aires. Volveriamos sin dudarlo

title: Erhohlsames Hotel in New York
text:
Sehr gut gelegenes Hotel. Solche sauberen Zimmer haben wir zuvor in keinem Hotel gehabt. Einige Möbel angeschrammt aber hochwertig und sehr gepflegt. Frühstück ist gut, es gibt keinen Aufschnitt oder Käsr, was w
Ohl normal für die USA ist. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich, die Unterkunft war perfekt.

title: Ni muy muy ni tan tan
text: El hotel tiene habitaciones cálidas y agradables. La atención en recepción fue amable y servicial. Sin embargo, me quedo con un mal sabor de boca, porque olvidé el cargador de mi celular en el cuarto del hotel, volví en cuanto me percaté del asunto y me dijeron que no estaba. Sé que no es culpa del hotel, fue una omisión mía, pero, la persona que lo haya tomado, un mal ejercicio de ética.

title: A nice suite in Manhattan
text: This accomodation is a hotel suite located in a nice area of Manhattan, close to everything. Not very spacious if you want to spend much time in the room, but that's not what you do when you are in New York. Comfortable bed. Everything went smoothly during our stay and we will probably go back next year.

title: Excelente opción en Manhattan
text: Un hotel con una ubicación excelente y muy buenas comodidades. En el último piso hay un lugar común muy acogedor para tomar algo o simplemente esperar la salida de tu vuelo.Totalmente recomendable. Seguramente me hospede ahí nuevamente si tengo oportunidad.

title: Adequate.
text: It was adequate. We bit on a travel zoo promotion for a weekend there ( in reality it was not much of a "deal" anyway) , so should have expected to be assigned the worst room, and we were .  Got the lovely "elevator" room lots of noise all night. The layout room was fine, and what you would expect in an old hotel. Super tiny bathroom with zero  counter-space. Sort of had a kitchen a little countertop and a microwave and a refrigerator. Calling it a "luxury" hotel is a stretch, in my opinion.   I will say the staff is super nice and accommodating, overall. but  we were a bit put off when, in the rooms, they had an ad for those "On the Rocks" cocktails (pre-mixed cocktails in a bottle). We decided to order a couple of them. We called the extension on the card to order. No answer. Called later no answer but it went to a voicemail. Finally my husband called the front desk (again super nice)...but seems they were "out of" any of the ones we wanted..even our second choice they were "out". Not a big deal decided we saved ourselves $15x2 plus tax and tip...but then ya may want to take those cards out of the room.  and while they are at it they could update the cards with their "Christmas  breakfast"ad. (this is March).

title: Fun stay at the Manhattan Club
text: We had a great time at the Manhattan Club and we stayed in a 1 bedroom, 2 bath unit.   The location is fantastic and you can walk to virtually anything you would need but its also very close to the Subway.  There are great restaurants within just a few blocks (and closer) and you will never run out of things to do.  We did have a car and we used their valet service which was fast and reasonable. The unit was very big however some of the furniture (in our case the sofa) could use some updating.  The sofa in our unit although clean and physically in good shape was not very comfortable.  Additionally we had a problem the the tub stopper in the master bath which although maintenance came up and looked at the issue was never fixed during our stay so we used the shower in the second bathroom which was nice.  The could also use some type of shelving or storage in the bathrooms as there is no place to put any of your bathroom items. Make sure you take advantage of the owners lounge on the 26th floor as it is really nice and the bartender makes great drinks although sometimes he would display a very New York attitude which although I enjoyed I think others may be put off by such an attitude.   Overall we had a great time and as long as you are not bothered by some minor issues and don't expect absolute top of the line facilities you will not be disappointed as The Manhattan Club offers good value.

title: Utmärkt lägenhetshotell med bra läge
text:
Ett härligt hotell med perfekt läge på 200w 56st. Trevlig och hjälpsam personal som verkligen vill hjälpa till.
Rummen är fina och välskötta kanske inte nyligen renoverade men bra ändå. Saknar eluttag för laddning av telefoner och Ipads.

title: Stay at Manhattan Club in Manhattan NYC
text: The location of club was perfect. Staff for the most part was very friendly and helpful. We never did see the concierge and would have been helpful at times. The unit was clean and we had 2 bathrooms which was GREAT! Bed was not as comfortable as some property's we have stayed in. Some of the furniture had some wear problems. But overall we enjoyed our stay. Still would stay there again.

title: Nice place to stay in NYC
text: This was our 2nd time at The Manhattan Club, first was in 2014, and I’ve always been happy with the location! It’s a good walking distance to a few tourist destinations - Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, St Patrick’s Cathedral, 5th Ave shopping, MoMA, Carnegie Hall, lots of restaurants and gift shops around, and if you don’t like to walk, 57th St subway station is just across.
