The place is clean overall, comfy beds, there’s also a nice owner’s lounge on the 26th floor to hang out. I’ll definitely be back in the future!!

title: Amazing
text:
The hotel was perfect. 
very clean, best location, outstanding service. we had a wonderful and unforgettable time. we did not need a car or any other transportation service because everything is around and nearby.  I would definitely recommend this hotel..

title: Great staying in NYC
text: We really had a great stay at The Manhattan Club. Great service and cleaning and great location just south of Central Park with several Metro stations just close to the hotel. We really enjoyed the great and clean gym.

title: un soggiorno di qualità
text: Residence ubicato in posizione eccellente, pulito e ben mantenuto. La mia stanza (junior suite) era ben suddivisa e molto tranquilla. Il personale si è sempre dimostrato disponibile a qualsiasi richiesta.

title: Average hotel. Nothing special.
text:
Stayed here with my partner for 3 nights in February. Very average hotel. Rooms don’t look like the pictures, they are actually more dated than the photos that are shown online.
The rooms are quite small.
The location is literally 5 minutes walk from Times Square and Central Park so right in the middle of everything.
In hindsight we would of preferred to stay in one of the areas with more local people which would be less busy as we found the area very busy/crowded and ‘touristy’.
Probably wouldn’t stay here again.

title: A+ hotel centrally located in NYC
text: We stayed here as a family in Feb 2023 and had a wonderful visit. We had a one bedroom suite with two bathrooms that we traded in from RCI. We stayed on the 18th floor and had a nice view and the room was very clean and we had daily cleaning service. The fridge and microwave was nice to be able to make a quick breakfast. They also provided coffee and microwave popcorn at no fee. The hotel is very centrally located and we walked just about everywhere. It is only about 5-10 min walk to Central Park and 15-20 min walk to Times Square. The Valet Parking is super easy and affordable too. I would definitely stay here again if I were in the NYC area. A+

title: Wonderful hotel in the heart of NYC
text: This is a wonderful hotel within walking distance of Times Square, the shopping at Columbus Circle and Central Park.  We used both the hop on, hop off bus and the subway and both are very close.  My husband did valet park and it was affordable (for NYC) and quick.  The lobby and rooms were nice and the staff was just wonderful.  The staff also said hello, made sure our needs were being met and helped in any way they could.  We definately recommend and hope to be back.

title: Family Trip
text: Confusion about credits that should have ben issued. Staff was very attentive.  It was a pleasure to arrive "home" after a walk through Manhattan.  Loved the atmosphere of an elegant New York hotel. I hope to return again but you must book early.  \

title: Super je recommande !
text:
Hôtel très sympa, proche de la station de métro, propre, bien aménagé ...
Le personnel était très chaleureux et très serviable . 
La literie de la chambre excellente.

Le must : la proximité avec Central Park un vrai bonheur ! 
Le seul problème c'est le clic-clac en guise de lit 2 places pas du tout confortable c'était même une horreur.

title: Outstanding and memorable vacation!!!
text: We chose The Manhattan Club to celebrate a 70th birthday, Super Bowl and Valentines. Our experience with the resort location, grounds, cleanliness, services and staff was excellent contrarily to what we had read on negative reviews. Our one bedroom unit was beautiful and very clean, with two bathrooms, a very comfortable bed, perfectly run heater, strong water flow and excellent shower, serviced everyday with changed towels, replenished coffee and toiletry as needed. Elevators were new and efficient. No long wait. The 26th floor lounge was beautiful with a breakfast menu, good snacks and drinks, and a surprised complimentary Valentines wine tasting experience. Concierge staff were very helpful. Andrew, Front Office Manager and Jordan, Housekeeping Manager were very pleasant, efficient.and helpful. We had a fabulous time and plan to come back here again next year.

title: Great Location
text:
We have just returned from our trip to New York, staying at The Manhatten Club. 
The hotel is in a perfect location. Within easy reach is Time Square,  Central Park, Broadway and there are plenty of subway stations  restaurants and delis nearby. 
The room was spacious and the beds were very comfortable.  The room has a coffee machine  dishwasher and microwave, as well as an iron and ironing board. 
On the 26th floor there are vending machines and a gym. 
Overall, we were happy with the hotel. The only negative was the WiFi, which didn't work throughout our stay.

title: Sem arrumação de quarto e troca de toalhas / they never make the cleanig  of the room
text: We have a reservation from the 01/27/2023 to 02/06/2023 but in the 28 and 29 , what is yesterday and today, nobody cleaned our room, nobody took The trash, and also didn't give us fresh towel's . Last night, the 28, I complained to David at the front desk, but tonight, as we arrived, every thing was the same as yesterday: unthouched in our room, it was Just like when we left this morning. This is a expensive place to stay and, unfortunately, we are very unsatisfieid and disappointed in our stay at Manhattan Club. The pictures speak speak for themselves. We updated the front desk.

title: Amazing location
text: Excellent location, spacious rooms. We stayed in the penthouse, it is dated and needs a refresh but is clean and a lot of room for nyc. The staff are hit and miss, some great others disgustingly rude. Our room was quite warm but windows partially opened so fresh air was great. Overall I would recommend this hotel

title: Nearly perfect
text: A fantastic place and experience.  The room is spacious and has everything you could need.  The bedroom is separate from the livingroom and kitchenette.  Really, just perfect.  Everyone, up until my very last encounter at this hotel was friendly and professional.  The last person, the Bellman, made a snarky comment when I pointed out one of the bags was missing.  I just wanted to make sure he knew - I was not criticizing him.  He had to make a big deal out of it and show me he only had two hands.  Those hands didn't receive a tip.   It wasn't enough to ruin the experience for me, but it was annoying.

title: Don't stay here
text: Unless you must stay in Manhattan on a budget, don't stay here. The furniture is old, the appliances small, the TVs old, the faucets and sinks in disrepair - and looks like they should be for their age. The vents aren't cleaned (and why would I even notice the vents!!). It's a motel. At its high price, you can do much better. Besides Manhattan is a filthy, stinking City, especially after dark. Do yourself a favor and just don't.

title: Excelente Hotel
text:
Quedamos sorprendidos con este Hotel, definitivamente lo recomiendo. Para empezar la ubicación nos pareció de lo mejor, a unas cuadras de Central Park y a 10 minutos caminando de Times Square, alrededor hay muchos locales de comida y se siente segura la zona. Hay 2 estaciones de metro muy cerca del Hotel. 
La habitación en la que nos hospedamos era una Suite con 2 baños y una sala de estar, es muy amplia, yo me fijo mucho en la limpieza y la verdad es que es excelente. Nuestra habitación estaba en perfectas condiciones. Todos los días nos hacían la limpieza. Estaba alfombrado y no estaba manchada. Las almohadas y el colchón muy cómodas. 
Hablando del personal, son muy amables y siempre dispuestos a ayudar, yo tuve un pequeño inconveniente en mi segundo día, me esguince mi pie en la calle y el personal del hotel me prestó una silla de ruedas sin cargo por toda la semana y siempre estuvieron al pendiente de mi, hicieron que mi estancia fuera muy amena. 
Sin duda regresaríamos aqui la próxima vez que visitemos Nueva York.

title: Overstated room description - not getting what was paid for
text:
Booked here because lured in by the room description "One Bedroom Suite with 2 Bathrooms" which purported to have "maximum comfort and privacy, with 526-748 square feet to relax and enjoy impressive city views of the Big Apple". 
At the time I was booking, similar sized suites at known hotels were approximately the same price, but those hotels didn't offer the impressive city view.
Turns out, neither did TMC. 
Our 14th floor room looked straight at the building across the street - there was NO view. The room was directly opposite the elevator ... not at all "maximum privacy" as we got to hear every elevator open and close.
When we checked in, I asked if we had a good view, was told yes. I had checked the hotel rez the day before, the One Bedroom ... were unavailable, presumably all were booked; conclude the hotel could not change our room even if they were willing.
emailed this complaint to hotel mgmt.
Proposed resolution:  Refund an average price differential for a "City View" room vs a regular room at comparable hotels. 
No response from mgmt.
The hotel itself is worn, out-of-date, nowhere near comparably priced hotels in the area. 2 elevators serve the floors, always a long wait. Furnishings in room were dirty, worn out, drab, less than comfortable. 
We also booked a regular room for adult children traveling with us. It had the same problems - though there was no promise of a view for the regular room, the window looked into a closed air shaft - why bother putting in a window?
One would think the hotel would be more reasonable with a customer who booked 2 rooms for 4 nights each.
Never again - stay away. If the price looks low compared to other places, that's because it is low.
There is no possibility this is a 4-star hotel per the Tripadvisor info page.
The provided coffee maker is Illy, good if you like that brand, otherwise notsomuch. The small bottled water is $8.

title: Not worth daily amenity/resort fee
text: This is a resort that charges a hefty resort fee that is definitely not worth it if you can trade into the Hilton! We are not owners. I would hope owners are not charged the same daily fee, which IMO is beyond ridiculous for essentially internet. The new Illy coffee makers are extremely inefficient and produce at best 3/4 cup of coffee so if you’re 2 people and like 2 cups of regular (not decaf) coffee you will CONSTANTLY be calling the front desk for more coffee. Definitely no way to “dazzle our day” with those coffee makers - please stop saying that when you answer the phone as it is so pandering and insincere.

title: Holliday in NY
text: Spending holliday at Manhattan Club is confortable.. Its position is awsome and allows to visit the city, easily getting to all amenities.The room was large and pretty. Hotel personnel was kind and friendly especially the loobby guys

title: Pleasent stay, BUT
text:
Facility was nice enough, however, room was unbearably warm; had to keep all windows open all the time. (air conditioning is only available seasonally, not in fall/winter months)
Biggest ouch is the parking fee: yikes!

title: Worst hotel i have stayed in in Manhattan
text:
I would NOT stay again. Better quality, cleanliness, and value out there. I visited in September with my 19-year-old nephew. One Bedroom Suite with Two Bathrooms. (Via Bookings.com as cheaper than booking direct) I have stayed in Manhattan twice before and picked this hotel due to the location to the underground lines and due to the rooms set up gave us both a little privacy. I requested a high floor and quiet room. I was allocated room 2404.
The window was stuck shut and they did not come and fix it. The Air Con is either On or Off and is very hard to get the settings right.  There is nowhere in the bathroom to unpack toiletries and make up and the light over the mirror is poor to. The wallpaper in the smaller bathroom is large python snakeskin wallpaper which a lot of people may not like. The décor and furniture are of an old style with lots of dents and scratches. 
The rooms are a good base but not if you wish to sleep. The headboard of the sofa bed backs on to the bank of elevators and you could hear them up and down late at night and early morning. Not my idea of a quiet room ask requested. I visited reception first thing in the morning, and they could not change our room. The only option offered was to pack everything, leave it at reception, wait for a room to become free and then collect the bags and unpack. It was decided was not worth the hassle as we were only there for a short time. The manager offered a bar voucher (my nephew is underage) or a breakfast voucher (my nephew could not eat this as he is gluten free this, they were aware of due to previous communications.)
I also mentioned that the room was not clean, and the Manager Anzhelika Masheyeva spoke to me and reassured me that housekeeping would come can clean the old dust on the furniture etc. this never happened. Not very good considering the resent pandemic we have been through.  I mentioned this to her on our last day also and she said she you get a uber voucher sent over this never arrived either.
I requested for the sofa bed to be made up, but this was not done so I called reception, and this was rectified whilst we went out. 
This was my nephews first trip to the USA as was hoping for better I tried to resolve the issues whilst there rather than being a key board warrior upon return but to no avail. A company is only as good as its customer experience, and I would not stay here again. 
Wi-Fi included in price. Luggage stored for free.

title: Our Home in NYC
text: Great location.  Staff is super helpful.  I come back here every year. I run in Central Park and it is great to be able to run right from my room.  Our room was always clean and the cleaning staff did a wonderful job in keeping things stacked.

title: Crooked operation, misleading ad
text: Don’t book if you want to sleep as there is all night construction going on outside of the hotel.  Definitely do not book their metropolitan suite options, as it means you are booking a second floor bedroom, which the ad on Booking.com doesn’t say.   I tried to get a refund as soon as I checked in due to the noise, which their ad also doesn’t warn about, and they said I would be liable for one out of four nights.  I checked out, found another hotel, then the manager, Angelica, called me the next day to inform me I would be charged for all four nights since I left.  Basically trying to steal my money, so I disputed with AMEX.  Angelica is a crook

title: Adventure in New Yourk
text:
The best possible thing about this hotel was the location……5mins walk from Central Park and Times Square. Very important when you’re 73 !!
Maintenance staff were on the ball when we had a few problems.

title: amazing place
text:
not enough elevators and toilettes for a lot of people 
old furniture
just three chairs for 4 people
the place was amazing just close of the central park
we can not cook because there are not enough things...

title: Un hôtel très propre et un service au top !
text:
Tout était parfait !
L'accueil, la propreté et le service... certaines personnes à l'accueil peuvent paraître blasées de vous répondre mai s le service est là. 
Le petit déjeuner doit se faire dans les chambres sinon c'est payant pour le prendre à l'étage 26 qui a une vue superbe !
La règle pour le petit déjeuner (1 drink and 3 foods) peut paraître déroutant mais c'est largement suffisant.
En résumé, nous avons passé 6 bonnes nuits en famille et tout s'est très bien passé.

title: NOT A 4 STAR!
text: This is not a 4 star hotel. Windows facing inside of the building, humming of ventilators is a constant noise inside the suite due to poor insulation of windows. Room is dated, furniture too, no lamp on one of the bedside tables by the bed, front desk simply said that some other guest just have broken it and that they didn’t have any replacement. TV sets are old, not modern flat HD TVs. Don’t be fooled by the room photos in the hotel website, they are probably as old as the TV sets. And the hotel WiFi blocks TripAdvisor.

title: Not worth the price.
text:
Average at best. Skip at this price point.

Breakfast is 'grab and go' for $22, which is a mix of stale pastries and bagels or some cereal packets. There's also drip coffee. The kicker? You cant eat in the breakfast bar, you have to take it back to your room. Save your cash, for $3 you can get a bagel nearby of far superior quality. 

My room was nice and fairly big, but the cooler blew warm air despite it being set to cold, and the pillows were average. 

Service was ok. I checked in late and found the night time servers to be average, but it's probably on par with other NYC service. 

It serves its purpose, but there's far better, cheaper options.

title: EXCELENTE HOTEL!!!
text:
Hotel excelente!! Estuvimos 7 días con mi marido e hija en una habitación amplia, con cama matrimonial y sofá cama. A la noche no funcionaba el sofá e inmediatamente trajerin una cama de una plaza.
Tiene cocina , con cafetera, heladera, lavaplatos, etc etc
Baño espacioso con todo lo necesario. 
Muy cómoda la habitación.
Los ascensores funcionaban muy bien.
El bar, muy lindo.
La atención EXCELENTE!!
Hotel ubicado cerca del Central Park y a pasos de la 5a. Avenida y a pocas cuadras de Time Square.
Volvería, sin dudarlo!!
Hermosa estadia!!

title: Perfect Manhattan accommodation
text: I cannot praise The Manhattan Club highly enough.  I stayed with a friend in the one bedroom suite.  This suite had 2 bathrooms (very hard to find in NY) and a bedroom door that closed, so with the foldout sofa, provided night-time privacy to each guest.   There is a small kitchenette, no cooking facilities, but a quick visit to Wholefoods in Columbus Circle provided breakfast supplies and snacks.   The Brooklyn Diner is a two minute walk as is Patsy's Italian Restaurant, both highly recommended.  Now, the furnishings are a little dated but that can be easily overlooked as the rooms were large and spotless.  All staff were very professional and attentive.  A big highlight was the Executive Lounge, perfect for a nightcap at the end of a busy day.  The hotel is located within an easy walk of Central Park and the theatre district is also conveniently close by as is the subway.  We had a wonderful stay at the Manhattan Club and highly recommend for a stress-free visit to NY.

title: Great location, make sure your room is on high floor so you get the view
text: We choose this hotel due to the location. It is 10 min walk from Central park. We had suite which was really nice, very nice bathroom. Only doubt side was our view! Second floor and room view was on some kind of roof and offices. Very depressive, we were really hoping for a nice view. So we think the suite they gave us was not worth the money we paid. The staff was very friendly.

title: Amplio, buen estado y buena ubicación
text: Nos alojamos en una suite con una sala y un dormitorio (eramos 4, con 2 hijos adolescentes). El espacio amplio y en muy buen estado. Un baño con box de ducha en la sala y otro con bañera en el dormitorio. La sala con microondas,  heladera, lavavajillas y mesa para comer con 4 sillas. Nuestra habitación era muy silenciosa a pesar de estar a media cuadra de Broadway, pero era muy oscura, incluso durante el día parecía de noche. El resto todo muy bien!

title: Perfect location in midtown Manhattan
text: You cannot ask for a better location for a NYC vacation. The Manhattan Club is located only 7-8 blocks from Times Square, only a block to several subway stations, and lots of good restaurants nearby. The staff is great too!

title: Excellent location
text: The resort is close to the theatre district, Central Park and within walking distance to Times Square. The subway is within a block which makes it convenient to go practically anywhere. Staff is friendly and rooms are clean and spacious.

title: Don’t stay unless you’re an owner
text: If you are an owner this hotel is wonderful.  Have had excellent experiences here as an owner.  First time staying as a “regular “ guest , as Bluegreen is often difficult to get into.  Small room, poor service.  Would not recommend.

title: Wedding Anniversary trip.
text: Fantastic hotel well located for attractions, 5 mins to Central Park, 12 mins to Time Square. The staff where really polite and helpful, organised transport back to JFK, all the doormen know yellow cab drivers and will see you right. The room was superb, clean and very comfortable, excellent amenities we where really pleased with our choice of hotel.

title: High end spacious and clean
text: We enjoyed a great vacation in nyc this fall, the Manhattan club was fantastic, comfortable  two baths and very roomy, staff were courteous and helpful. Nice location just south of central park, great breakfast spots and close to the hotel, walked everywhere for meals and entertainment

title: Kinda disappointed
text: The location is great, but loud in the night. No heat in the room, toilet kept flushing every 5 minutes. No complimentary bottle water provided daily. Pillows and the mattress are two soft, the entire room needs some major upgrades.

title: excelente
text: la ubicación es excelente ! muy confortable las habitaciones espaciosas . excelente el servicio de la recepción y conserjería siempre muy atentos brindando el mejor servicio al huésped . la calle que queda es muy linda segura iluminada cómoda

title: Super !!
text:
Stayed at this location using RCI points during the Usopen. Hotel has Easy access to subway station, just around the corner !!
Great location, near great places to visit right in NYC area. 
Definitely planning to stay here next year..

title: unica pecca
text: L'hotel è in una posizione comodissima, è pulito e il personale è gentile. Unica pecca: la colazione, non certo economica, prevede di prendere solo 3 cose da mangiare da un buffet molto povero ed è take away. Ossia, ti mettono tutto in un sacchetto e devi consumare la colazione fuori dal salone a meno che tu non sia disposto a pagare 32 dollari in più. La follia...

title: Lovely 2 night stay
text:
Delayed trip to New York due to COVID, the hotel held our reservation for 2 years which was super generous of them.
Considering you hear the rooms in NY are so small, we were so grateful to have plenty of room, and the mini kitchenette. Breakfast grab and go was perfect, including bagels, pancakes, plenty of fruit and delicious coffee.
Lift is slow, but there was an extra elevator in use opposite our room, or we could walk.
Location was perfect, Central Park and the Spy Museum were super close. Carnegie Diner had great food.
Only downside was roadworks at 3am, not great when you are jetlagged. Not sure if it would be any quieter on a higher floor?

Overall, would love to return, staff are friendly. 

Thank you for making our introduction to New York a positive experience. I wish you well for the future.

title: The manhattan club
text: Très moyen hormis sa situation géographique entre Times square et central park rien d’extra.. pas de rangement ds la salle de bain étagère au dessus des toilettes ?! Ridicule amabilité moyenne à la réception pour partir plus tard et surtout caution de 300 dollars encaissée alors que la chambre a été réglée a Air France et qu’il n’y a absolument rien ds celle ci mm pas de mini tard une empreinte suffirait, nous ne reviendrons pas dans cet hôtel

title: Manhattan Club is Centrally Located in the City.
text: The Manhattan Club is situated in the upper West 50's and near to Columbus Circle,  Central Park West, Carnegie Hall and walking distance to Times Square.  The bus and subway lines are also nearby, allowing you to travel to various parts of the City easily.

title: Two filthy rooms
text: I have stayed here before numerous time but this last trip I stayed in two different rooms and both were filthy for different reasons. The first because there were bugs in the bathroom and even after pest control, the housekeeping left the clearly visible dead bugs all over the bathroom  (which means they didn't clean anything) and then the second room on the second floor which smelled of raw sewage and in which the shower was so filthy- both the walls and the shower head - and when I showed that to the Housekeeping Manager his responses were "the sewage smell is normal for this second floor"; and "this is not a new hotel" And when i asked him the last time the shower was cleaned, I expected a response of -we clean it daily, regularly, etc. - but instead he kept running his hands over the dirty walls and filthy shower head as if that was proof that they were clean. Disgusting! I will never stay here again.

title: Great location, large, comfortable rooms
text:
We’d booked this hotel as a package with a cruise company, so had no choice as to venue.  However, I would have been more than happy to have chosen the hotel myself as it was very good.  Great location near Central Park & Columbus Circle, with easy access to the subway also.

We were also lucky to get an upgrade to a Exec Junior Suite and this was excellent, loads of room and our daughter actually had a degree of privacy thanks to us having a slightly separated bedroom. The room facilities were great, albeit we only used the fridge, but the supply of glasses and other crockery is very useful. Reasonable view out over 7th Avenue.  The massive bathroom was nice too, albeit only a shower available. 

Made no use of the lounge/bar, but it did look nice!

It is a little dated inside, but the comfort was first class - I’d happily stay here again.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Stayed here via RCI exchange. Our room was on the 18th floor, 1 bedroom unit, not much of a view but that wasn’t a big deal for us. The room was clean (very important to me) and spacious. I can not imagine a more centrally located hotel as home base to explore the city. Across the street from Carnegie Hall, easy walk to Central Park, Times Square, Columbus Circle and tons of food options. Hotel charges $50+ per day for RCI guests, but even with that it was still way less expensive than a comparable hotel with this location and with a full separate bedroom and 2 full bathrooms. It was perfect for our family of 4. As others have noted, it is very quiet despite the location and the perfect respite after long days traversing the city.

title: The Perry's
text: I always stay at the Manhattan Club when visiting the City, because of its central location..  It's convenient.. with close-by access to the many attractions that the city has to often.  such as Central Park, Broadway Shows and Museums.

title: An ideal location for NYC
text: You are right in the middle of everything.  Across from Carnegie Hall, close to Central Park and Times Square, walking distance to Rockefeller, Radio City Music Hall and St. Patrick's Cathedral.  Easy access to the subway.  Nice to have 2 bathroom in a 1 bedroom unit.  An ideal timeshare in NYC!

title: city break at its best
text: We had a nice stay at The Manhattan Club. The location is ideal; it is in the heart of the city. The rooms were big and very neat. The view from the room was exceptional. The services provided by the staffs were professional and friendly.

title: Great location
text: RCI resort owners are on the 2nd floor, no view and street noise. The kitchen items are all plastic and therefore cannot microwave.  They charge you $54 a day for I don't know what - they say amenities - only amenity is a gym - no rooftop deck, or swimming pool.  But you can't beat the location - near Central Park, Columbus Circle, subway stops, Fifth Avenue, etc.

title: Midtown centrally located property
text: Great property!  Well maintained and only a few blocks north of Times Square and Broadway.  We spent a week in NYC and stayed in one of their studio rooms.  The room was just the right size for my 2 teen sons and myself.  We practically just walked to Times Square/Broadway for shows and restaurants.  Carnegie Hall is just across the street and the MOMA is just 2 blocks SE of the property. Very convenient and well staffed property.

title: The Manhattan Club
text: Rooms are well spaced with two full bathrooms. The furniture and decoration are old. The windows are extremely dirty. The plumbing fixtures need to be upgraded and include a hand-held shower. The breakfast lounge offers only a "continental" breakfast/ highly overrated and expensive $29/pp. The location and proximity to the city attractions are great.

title: Old Hotel in NYC!
text: This hotel is very old with two slow and overly used elevators in the front foyer.  The staff are always attentive and available to help.  The room floors and hallways are very visibly worn and outdated.  There is a stuffy and overly used smell to the room.  The appliances are just as worn as the building!

title: Great Location But Room Was A Disappointment
text:
We did an exchange through RCI for a studio unit. Our room at The Manhattan Club was located on the 21st floor, Room # 2115.  When we first opened the door, we immediately noticed a musty smell throughout the whole room. We didn't request to be put into another room because quite frankly,  we were tired and at least, it didn't have any cigarette smell.  But that musty smell never did go away during our 5-night stay. This unit was supposed to sleep 2 privately, 4 people total.. Definitely not 4 adults, but perhaps 2 adults with 2 small children.  The small dining table only had 2 seats and again, this was a studio unit.  It served its purpose during our stay, which gave us a (GREAT) central location for our first time in NYC.    

The small kitchenette was nice to have with the 3/4 refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot (with free Seattle Best coffee), and a small sink. We didn't need a stove as we didn't plan on cooking during our short stay in NY.   The bathroom did not have ANY counter space at all and that was an inconvenience to us as we like to spread out,  especially since there was only one bathroom.  It did have a bathtub, which I used and appreciated. The lighting in the bathroom (and throughout the whole room) was dimly lit and didn't provide enough lighting for me being that I'm visually impaired. 

Don't expect to walk out on a balcony here.  The glass screen door was screwed shut and wouldn't open.  Kind of a bummer but definitely understandable.  Our view from this unit was of another building across from us.. But we did have a side view of the city!! We did like the double adjustable blinds that had a room darkening effect.  

The one thing we noticed is we barely heard any outside noise.  It was so quiet considering where this hotel was located.  We didn't even hear anyone in the hallway or the elevator that was right across from us unless we were right next to the door.  

I'm not sure if this room was one of the renovated rooms or not.  In my opinion, it looked tired and dated.  The room was fairly clean (don't look underneath the bed!!) but it could use some updating and it needs to be aired out!!  I did not like the snakeskin wallpaper in the bathroom or the glass dining table.  The dresser drawer was old where a small TV sat on.   

Would we stay here again?  No.  We personally didn't like Mid-Manhattan but that's our own personal preference. This hotel IS within walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, many restaurants, gift shops, and so much more. So, if you're looking for a centrally located hotel, then this place would work out perfectly.

title: Expensive but great location
text:
We liked its location and roomy 1 bedroom with 2 full baths. Our friends in another unit were able to visit us comfortably. 
Daily housekeeping service was nice but with $55 per day and we couldn’t get the service on Sunday after many calls was disappointing.
Wi-Fi was really poor.
Carpets showed aged.
We recommend folks to try once.  We’re still undecided on weather we should return.

title: ****Great Location, fantastic Hotel*****
text:
****Great Location, fantastic Hotel*****

->Area and Surroundings:
The hotel is very well located. It’s right in the heart of Manhattan say only 10 minutes’ walk (South) from Times Square. And if you go the other direction (North), you could enter Central Park.

One could easily find conveno store like 7-Eleven, Subway, Pizzeria, Chipotle etc. in vicinity of 5-7 minutes’ walk.

->Room:
We booked a suite room and I was very happy with the room size and the way it was organized. The room had a couch and table setup (Which my brother utilized to sleep on at night), a table chair setup to have meals, and also, we also noticed that if you are with your family, then adjacent room can also be interconnected. 

The room also has a well placed mini kitnette with all the glassware and cutlery. Microwave oven, a wash sink etc are a great feature to make a stay more comfortable.

The room has enough storage in form of big drawers below the TV cabinet and also on the bed side. Also, it had a huge walk-in cupboard to stow luggage and extra bags. One more thing was two beautiful windows which gave me great views of the city.

The only minus to the room was its “Queen size” bed. If it suits you, then its no problem.

->Bathroom and Bathing experience:
The bathroom was decent in size but had all the amenities which are required. A Hair dryer, Shaver voltage points and toiletries were provided. The wash basin faucets, the door handles were all gold finished giving it a luxury feel end to end.

->Hotel Staff
The hotel staff was always helpful and warm. The rooms have good fast wifi and its Free.

->Breakfast:
We did not opt the for breakfast at this hotel.

->Swimming Pool / Gym / Spa:
The hotel does have a pool and a fitness center but I was not able to visit the same

Special mention:
Wifi Speed was good during our stay and we loved our stay in this hotel and city.

title: Old but good location
text: Overall an okay hotel. Staff was friendly, besides a housekeeper that was less than willing to bring us extra pillows and blankets for the pull-out couch. Bathrooms are small but room is generally a good size (given the fact there is a mini kitchen and kitchen table). Would not run back, but it's a clean place in a good location. The elevators are brutally slow!

title: Great location...extra fees
text: We enjoyed our timeshare exchange at Manhattan Club until we had to leave unexpectedly midweek due to ilness of my wife. We were dissappointed to discover that we we were charged $54/day for service fees for the 4 days that we were not there.  Clearly, we did not use the services. They should just admit that it is a non-refundable booking fee.

title: Muy buen ubicado, necesita upgrade urgente
text:
El hotel está muy bien ubicado a dos cuadras del central park y cinco de times square, a pocos metros del subway y con acceso fácil a todas las atracciones de Manhattan.
En cuanto a las habitaciones, nos alojamos en una One Bedroom/ two Bath, en el piso 17, la habitación está bastante bien en cuanto a tamaño, es amplia y pudimos alojarnos un matrimonio con dos niñas sin mayores problemas, la habitación principal es muy amplia y en el Living hay un sofá cama donde durmieron las niñas, que abierto quita un poco de espacio, pero igualmente está muy bien.
Cuenta con un microondas, un mini refrigerador y un lavavajillas, así como platos, vasos y cubiertos, lo que realmente haría falta es al menos una hornalla o “cooktop”, de manera de poder aunque se hervir agua o calentar algo, tampoco ofrecen tostadoras o aunque sea un hervidor de agua, solo una cafetera individual.
En cuando al hotel necesita remodelación, aclare el piso en que estábamos porque el elevador paro en otros pisos que se venían más modernos, en el nuestro se veía viejo y las habitaciones poco iluminadas, de cualquier manera es limpio y cómodo.
Un tema que quedó como una gran incógnita y no pudimos verificar, es que nos faltó dinero, dado que no logramos confirmar cómo pudo ser, ni siquiera lo reportamos porque recién lo vimos al armar la maleta.

title: Excelente experiencia en famila
text:
Muy recomendado hospedaje por cercanía a todos los sitios, servicio del personal y lindo hotel
Por mejorar es el parking, que se permita con el pago del día la salida y nuevo ingreso del vehículo sin nuevo cobro

title: Beautiful old hotel in great location
text: The Manhattan Club is a wonderful old hotel just below Central Park and around the corner from the subway. One bedroom unit was large with 2 bedrooms. It's getting a bit tired, but still has great charm and warmth. Would return in a heartbeat.

title: Relação custo-benefício excelente
text: O hotel é bastante simples, contudo tem benefícios interessantes. Bem localizado, próximo da times Square, a uma quadra do metrô, duas quadras do Cental Park. Tem forno de micro-ondas no quarto, pratos, talheres, cafeteira, lava-louça, assim dá para fazer facilmente uma refeição no quarto e economizar nas refeições, sem necessidade de fazer todas as refeições fora. Tem um mercadinho a um quarteirão e meio com tudo que Vc pode imaginar, frutas, congelados e com café da manhã e almoço a quilo (economia).

title: The best place we've stayed to date ! and 2 bathroom unit !
text: We came across this option through Airbnb.  What a gem find !!   Definitely we will be back !   Fantastic location.  Also we got a unit with 2 bathrooms which is a must for me and hubby.   Concierge is also extremely helpful.   I almost hate to leave this great review - the secret will be out !

title: Super Staff - Excellent Location
text: We were a little apprehensive after reading some reviews about the cleanliness of the hotel and the friendliness of its staff.  I'm here to tell you - don't believe it!  Great location, awesome room, clean and extra large.  But the real superstars are the Manhattan Club's staff.  The bellmen were the very best at giving directions, suggestions for dinner, calling a taxi, etc etc.

title: Elegant Grand Dame! Accessible Luxury!
text: The staff were outstanding, Adam, Lizette,  and James made it special with their kindness. I had surgery and they were so attentive. We stayed in a Metropolitan Queen Suite. Elegant and comfortable! There was a beautiful couch and sitting room and a wet bar in the room with coffee machine (I didn't get a chance to use it). and fridge with ice box in it. The shower was classic "Restoration Hardware showpiece" with marble and traditional fixtures and a bench in the shower! In sum, the room was gorgeously appointed and I am still using the toiletries as they smell divine! Sadly we could only stay one night as they were booked solid, but this hotel I will check first for availability when I come back to NYC.

title: One Week In A Very Good Hotel
text: The 7 nights we spent in Hotel Manhattan Club was in every respect the best among our hotel-stays in the last 10 years! The location (Midtown, very close to Central Park), the quality and cleanless of the room, the kindness of the hotel-pertsonal makes this hotel to an excellent place

title: AVOID
text:
The only thing going for this hotel is the location.
Nothing else at all. 
The rooms are tired, look old (even the 'refurbished' rooms).
We were moved after complaining and no difference.
Booked a 1 bedroom suite with a view - had a view of a brick wall. Room was so dark that the lights had to be on all the time. Suspicious of why all the curtains were drawn in the room when we arrived!
Do not believe the photos on their website. If they are real, they are not of rooms you will ever get!
The towels and sheets has hairs of previous guests on them.
The rooms are are not clean, mould in bathrooms and in the showers.
The wifi is basically no existant and keeps losing connection every 10 minutes.

The staff do their best but heavens knows why they work there.

I would really recommend looking somewhere else. I will never go back and will never forget the experience.

title: Great location
text: I've stayed here twice & you can't beat the location. Easy walk to Central Park and several great restaurants nearby, Carnegie Hall is across the street. Don't be afraid to ride the subway, it's very economical. You can get a week-long pass for unlimited rides for about $35. The Manhattan Club has subway stops for the blue, red, yellow and orange lines within walking distance. Comfortable rooms but poor lighting (for doing make-up, etc) and lacks bathroom counter space for toiletries. The AC didn't keep up which made it uncomfortable, but staff brought us a fan which helped. We were here in May so I can't imagine what it would be like in the hot humid summer. This is why I rated the sleep quality average, but the bed was very comfortable.

title: Great stay! Wonderful staff!
text: The location is fantastic! 2ish blocks from central park and an easy walk to times square!!! It was the perfect location for our needs. The room was nice. My only complaint is that the a/c didn't get the room quite as cool as I would have liked. I was really disappointed that the bar wasn't open or that breakfast was still not offered. Eating in the city is very expensive and I'd hoped to eat breakfast at the hotel and enjoy some cocktails at night. The staff were fantastic - friendly, funny & incredibly helpful always! I would definitely stay here again!

title: Mother's Day Week Visit
text: Staff very consistent from door men to Admin (Sabina) to front desk and housekeeping. Very nice to come back to after pandemic, clean and cautious. New elevator floors nice. Windows still "bleed" so wish this could be fixed. Miss the cookies!

title: The worst hotel experience of all time
text:
This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The pictures on their website were clearly taken several years ago. The first room we were assigned had a renovated bathroom but that was the only thing that looked like it had be improved in over a decade. The wallpaper was peeling, the carpet was stained and unraveling, the paint on the cabinets was chipping, and the windowsill (inside) was filthy. We called to ask for a different room, and while the man who helped us was very nice, the room they moved us to was even worse. There was water damage on the ceiling, the bathroom was old, and there was a door connecting to the next room that did not have a lock. I don't know how anyone could feel comfortable in this hotel. We checked in rather late, so first thing the next morning we checked out and asked to not be charged for the nights we would not be staying but they refused and charged us over $650 for the 9 hours we were in the hotel. 

Don't be fooled by the pictures and the price, this is not a luxury hotel, it would be more appropriate to call it a motel.

title: 25 things you must know about the manhattan club
text:
The only 1-bedroom suite with 2 full bathrooms, 2 TVs, and kitchen in midtown Manhattan.

This place has become my go to place in New York City, having stayed here Oct 1-8, 2021, and May 2-9, 2022, with reservations later this year.  

Flew into JFK, took the $8 Airtrain, then the $2.75 E subway line , transferring to the F subway line at Kew Gardens, arriving at the 57th and 6th station,  a 5 minute walk from the Manhattan Club.

500 square foot 1 bedroom suite here is cheaper than a 200 square foot studio in West 57th by Hilton.  But Manhattan Club built in the 1920s, while West 57th built in 2009, and a far more luxurious hotel.    

Two elevators service floors 12-25.  Two other elevators in the adjacent Park Central Hotel service floors 3-11.  They need more elevator capacity, as each elevator can only hold 7 people max, without luggage.

During rush hours, it is common for people to be left waiting because the elevator is full.  2 guests plus employee pushing the hotel luggage cart will take up 1 elevator, common at 4pm check in time.  

They do have a service elevator, but this was used to transport large hotel laundry carts, and likely dead bodies during the peak of the covid epidemic in late March 2020.  

Queen bed suite, with bedroom, TV in bedroom, kitchenette-dining room, and living room, along with bathroom with new marble floor, and new marble tiled shower walls.

Our 15th floor room 1509 comes with large windows in the living room and bedroom, with a French door for darkness in the bedroom, when living room in use

Approximately 500 square feet, or 25' x 20' with 40" flat screen TV on very used dresser facing living room with sofa and padded sitting chair with padded arms.  Closet next to front door has an electronic safe, which will fit a 15.7" laptop.  

Kitchenette has CV1 coffee maker, 30" refrigerator, microwave, dish washer, utensils, bowls, plates, glasses for 4.   No free breakfast provided.  Refrigerator unusually quiet for it's size -refrigerators are like dogs -the smaller the more noise they make!   Noisy dishwasher -run it only during daytime when you are out.

No stove, no toaster, no oven, no pots and pans.  With ready to eat hot food at nearby Morton Williams on 57th street, and Bread and Honey on 8th Ave.

Bed is very comfortable, four large pillows, two night stands with lamps, with nearly new mattresses that hasn't been pulverized by kids using it as a trampoline.  

From the 15th floor you can just hear the dumpsters being serviced starting at 3am in the morning.  Otherwise very little street noise at night, as 56th street is a single lane street with parked cars on both sides, compared to 4 lane 57th street.  

Bathroom by the front door has shower and toilet and sink.  Bathroom by bedroom has bathtub, and toilet and sink.  Totally remodeled, with new white marble floor tile, and white marble wall tile on the sides of the shower.  Noisy plumbing -running the shower wakes up the neighbors directly upstairs and downstairs.  

Daily housekeeping has returned after the pandemic to empty trash, vacuum the rugs, change the towels, and make the bed.  I brought 25 1dollar bills for tipping housekeeping $3 a day.

26th floor has business center with 6 desktop PCs and printer, free to guests, with access using electronic room key, 6am-11pm.  

Decent wifi, free to guests in rooms.  

Ice machines only available on the 2nd and 26th floors, a real pain.  Have to bring plastic bottles from home and keep them filled with water inside frig.  

26th floor has exercise room, with multiple elipticals, stationary bike, treadmills, and TV, again with access using electronic room key.  Wife bought an exercise outfit at the thrift store to use the exercise room during the 3 days of rainstorms.

Stayed in the owners lounge on the top floor, with plush seating for at least 70 guests -great place to stay waiting for housekeeping to clean your room during the 3+days of windy, rainy, cold weather outside.  You need a room card key to access the bathroom.    

$75 cab fare to JFK, cash strongly preferred.  Ride share somewhat cheaper, but they can't stop in taxi pick up zones.  

Expect to pay $15 Lincoln tunnel surcharge, plus another $15 out of state drop off surcharge when going by taxi/ride share to Newark airport.      
.
$21.50 for two people to take subway and light rail from JFK, but you better be prepared to carry your luggage and wife's luggage up and down  30+ stairs, as no escalator on final flight.    

Phone next to toilet, so you can multitask even at the most inconvenient times!

title: $50 Hospitality Fee per night without hospitality
text: The location is great !  Staff is ok. That's all positive things about this hotel. We knew we had to pay Hospitality Fee $50 per night  but there was no service which worth of the price.We stayed 3 nights they came room cleaning only once . We knew Green Policy which they wouldn't change all towels but only ones on floor. We didn't mind that but second day we came back to room they didn't even pick up those towels on the floor and didn't even empty trash cans. So why we have to pay Hospitality Fee$50 every day even they didn't give us any service ? Room was stuffy , temperature control didn't work.And timeshare consultant never available , no breakfast in restaurant like they advertise. We don't think this hotel is 4 star hotel ....Holiday inn is better even they are 3 star hotel they at least provide free breakfast

title: Fantastic value at a great hotel
text: For RCI member, this is a must do. Fantastic value in the middle of everything Manhattan. This is a hidden gem. Great staff, great location, well maintained unit. The hotel might appear a bit dated, but its really minor, this is the charm of New Yor City Midtown.  Walking distance to pretty much everything, and metro is right under your nose to go anywhere else. Loved every minute of staying here.

title: not time share owners
text: We were 3 women staying 4 nights in the unit with 2 bathrooms.  The furniture was scratched and worn looking and as was the carpet and room.  It was not the beautiful room in their website photos.  The coffee maker was of flimsy plastic and start button was  worn out and hard to make work.  The 2 regular generic coffee pods was an issue for 3 women!  The next morning we left a note and tip for the room attendant asking  for 3 regular coffee pods and 3 clean wash cloths.  Upon returning that evening found no one had come to the room so we went to the lobby and asked for those items and for the room to be cleaned the next morning.  Later a man who didn’t speak English brought us 2 coffee pods and 1 wash cloth.  The next 2 days no one serviced the room!  We asked a gentleman on our floor if his room had been cleaned the last 3 days and he said “it had and he heard from other guests the hotel did not provide daily service to those who are not time share owners”!  We spoke to a manager and someone did clean the room, left clean towels and coffee pods, the afternoon before we left.  The internet is iffy and didn’t have a strong signal.  We paid $450 a night.  The location was ideal for our visit but the service and room condition wasn’t worth it.  The door men were kind and helpful.  The bed was comfy.

title: I highly recommend you to stay in the Manhattan Club.
text: Friendly staff. Many places very close to the hotel, just walking distance. Maria, Lissette and the boys are the best. Very helpful. Room is super, but just one bed. Look no more. Just experience New York City at its best. Christian church near the hotel.

title: Happiness at the Club
text: The staff and the accommodations exceeded all of my  expectations. This our first trip to New York and the knowledge of the Club's staff of the venues, restaurants, stores where spot on and greatly appreciated The club put us within walking distant of the Neil Simon Theatre, Time Square and Central Park. Following their suggestions and adding and little adventure of our own made our NY experiences one for the ages. I can't wait to visit in the summer and catch a Yankee's game.

title: Awesome Location! Good sized 1 bedroom
text:
Booked a 1 bedroom and was pleasantly surprised when it had two full bathrooms. It was great that teenage son could sleep on the pullout bed in the living room and have his own full bathroom.  Pullout bed was better than a normal one. Separate bedroom had a king bed and bathroom that were good sized.

Location is the real attraction. Easy walk to theaters, restaurants, subways, central park, 5th Ave, trendy restaurants in Hell's Kitchen, Times Square.

title: Top Location nice suites
text:
Great location a few blocks from Central Park, times Square  etc...
We enjoyed a one bedroom with small kitchenette. This allowed us to stock frig with wine ,water and charcuterie items.

Lobby is small and efficient.  No onsite food services due to covid but lots of outstanding restaurants nearby. And a quality grocery store close.

The rooms are dated BUT clean ....no issues with quality of bed or linens.  The second bathroom was a nice surprise .

Highly recommend .....throughly  enjoyed our week in NYC.

title: Location, Bed Comfort and Room Size are the only good things
text:
The Manhattan Club was one of the most expensive places we have ever traded to for an RCI resort, and we regret our decision. We loved the location of the "Resort," the comfortable bed, and how big the room was in NYC, but that was the extent of our likes at this resort. 

When we booked, nothing was stated on the RCI site that the food at the club level was still going to be closed, and the ridiculous 54/night hospitality fee did not go down in price when those were not offered currently. When I reached out to ask what was covered in the fee, they told me it was non-negotiable and didn't give me any idea what I was paying for with that high cost. 

They send out almost daily messages about being green and nondaily room service, but it was still performed every day in our room, and towels were swapped, and beds were made. The Valet at the front door was always pleasant and kind, but we didn't use any of their services; when we arrived, they didn't offer to help with any bags. The bed in the room was very comfortable and was a nice place to sleep every night, but the view was just a building next door with people working in it every day. The location to the subway lines was fantastic; it was a short 10-15 minute trip to just about anywhere we wanted to go in Manhattan. The room was not worth the cost of the points to trade in; we stayed in rooms in the single digits for trade points that offered more to do and better-looking rooms. The quality was terrible, and you could see the grout coming through in the bathrooms, the fans did not work, and it was always very humid in the rooms. The room size was great; we could fit our family of 4 in it without issues. The appliances in the room were ancient and needed to be updated; the refrigerator door had gaps and had a very inconsistent temperature. The microwave did not work very well, and you needed to double your time even to try to use it. We will not book this hotel in the future and will find another place to stay.

title: The Best of NYC
text: I lived in NYC decades ago, and my entire apartment was smaller than this hotel room, and nowhere near as good a location.  Look, this is NYC, space is scarce, but we had a very decent-sized hotel room with plenty of storage, a sizable bathroom, and a kitchenette.  The location is fantastic, just a block from Columbus Circle, so very close to Broadway theaters, Times Square, Central Park, and an easy walk to the Museum Mile.  Several subway lines stop nearby if you want to wander farther afield.  The staff is very responsive to visitors' needs, but there was no timeshare push.  A great place!

title: Good location; standards may be slipping.
text:
Do not buy timeshares, no matter how good the deal seems to be. Timeshare sales are supremely deceptive. Too many hidden fees. Being a timeshare owner is like being on a run-away roller-coaster and there is no way to get off. Timeshares have no resale value.
We came here on an timeshare exchange and had to pay more than $50 extra per night for “amenities” of which there are few.
While we were given a room on a higher floor, it was hard to enjoy the view as the windows were all extremely dirty.
The wallpaper was peeling in the bathroom. 
All of the above being said, the location is good, the suite was large, clean and well equipped.

title: Good Enough
text: We stayed for a week.  As they say in real estate location location location.  The place is steps from Central Park and a few blocks from Times Square so high marks for that.  The entrance and front lobby is kept spic and span and people are friendly enough.  The guest rooms are just average.  Wallpaper is pealing off the wall and red stains on the carpet (why would you have carpet in a room anyway?)  The bathroom had mold on the walls because there are no vents.  There isn't much of a view but that's true almost anywhere in NYC.  I'd go back for the location but if you are looking for a nice room you might be disappointed.

title: Muy buena Ubicacion
text:
Estuvimos en el hotel por 6 noches, en Febrero 2022 el check inn fue rápido, nos dieron la habitación antes de las 15 hs.
La calefacción perfecta.
La habitación era amplia, era el ambasador, living con mesa y 4 sillas, un baño completo con ducha. Sillón cama de dos plazas, muy cómodo y tv. Tenia una mini cocina, con un frigobar amplio, set de cubiertos, platos, vasos y tazas, microondas. Un lavavajillas, una cafetera de filtro que te dan ellos los sobres individuales.
NO tiene tostadora, había comprado una en target por u$10.
Luego una habitación con cama king, otro baño completo con bañera. un Tv.
El servicio de limpieza lo hacían todos los días, por covid desistimos, lo único q pedíamos a la mañana era café, toallas, jabón para el lavavajillas. 
Excelente ubicación.
A 3 cuadras de columbus circle y a una cuadra del central park.
Muchos delis para comprar comida, que estaban abiertos las 24 hs.
Reciben paquetes por compras que uno realice online.
Muy buen servicio y sin lugar a dudas para recomendar el hotel.
Los ascensores funcionaban muy bien y llegaban rapido.
Lo único a mejorar seria los tv que son viejos y pequeños.

title: Spring Break
text: Took our granddaughter to NYC took look at the area for possible college choices. We liked the central location to everything including shopping and the theatre and fine restaurants. The hotel staff were very accommodating and courteous from desk to concierge staff.

title: Resort Fee = Greed!
text: The "Resort Fee", of $50/day, is outrageous.  This is for wi-fi and daily cleaning, basically.  Yet each morning we get a letter under our door saying that they are going "green" and will try to conserve, etc, so if cleaning is not needed please do not request it.  They want to go "Green', another way of saying Greed.  A fee which get nothing more than is expected at any normal location.  This is no "Resort" facility, no restaurant., bar,lounge, sitting area.  What kind of resort is this?

title: Gem in NYC
text: We love NYC and chose to make our 1st trip in over 2 years of Pandemic isolation to NYC. We had stayed at The Manhattan Club several times before and were lucky enough to be able to exchange for a week stay. Having a kitchenette  allowed us to avoid indoor restaurants as the pandemic, although waning, was far from over. The location of The Manhattan Club allowed us to easily walk to our daily theatre destination, nearby grocery shop and Central Park. We enjoyed the 8 Broadway shows we attended and getting away once again.

title: Must stay hotel in NYC
text: Highly recommend this gem hotel.  The room was oversized with 2 bathrooms and bedroom with French closing doors. Kitchenette perfect with coffee maker, sink, fridge, microwave, dishwasher. The shower pressure was excellent and plenty of soft towels.  King bed dreamy and pullout sofa worked well for child.  James at front desk checked us in and he was very knowledgeable and friendly. All service people were quick to respond for extra coffee and comfy robes.  Would definitely stay next visit.  I was on 20th floor - remodeled and very luxurious.  Location excellent for Broadway, 5th Ave, restaurants and subway.  Nothing negative to note.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: The location was excellent.  The bellman was excellent, always making sure we had a cab when requested, even walked to us another block to be sure we caught a cab.  Front desk recommended a wonderful restaurant where we quickly made friends of the owner and wait staff. Food for every time of day.

title: Location and staff are amazing.
text: For starters, I think if you take away the pandemic aspect, this might have been a 5 instead of a 4. The staff was amazing, they greeted us, answered all of our questions, took care of what we needed, almost got run over helping us take a picture of the entrance, helped us find the hair dryer that was hiding in the bottom drawer of the tv cabinet (insider tip, remember that one), kept our room spotless and even ran our dishwasher (which if you're a Bluegreen veteran you know how cool that is). The hotel is perfectly placed to get a street hot dog from Central Park when a craving grabs you, take a short hike down 7th or Broadway to Times Square or to check out a show, or dash over to Rockefeller Center in the early morning to peek in on Hoda & Jenna (which by the way is not pronounced Yoda, people will look at you funny, then point and laugh and hurt your feelings) I think a return trip after restrictions are lifted would be in order so that we could get the full experience of the breakfast, lounge and other amenities that weren't fully available. Things we now now: Applejacks for breakfast, Brooklyn Diner, Premier Cafe, Angelo's Pizza are all good lunch or dinner ideas, when a storm blows through quickly those pretty orange chairs at Junior's become missiles and will chase you down Broadway. Great place to stay and we'll be back.

title: Great location. Benefits stop there!
text: Service lacked. Concierge non existent. Unit had some maintenance issues but customer relations was downright terrible. Per policy charged for 5 days of unused unit due to emergency early departure with no consideration and given run around when inquiring. In short too many better options than the sub par found here. Do better!

title: Great place to stay in Manhattan
text: This location is idea for a stay in Manhattan.  The suites are ideal for a short stay, with a comfortable amount of space and all the creature comforts you need.  Be aware there is a housekeeping fee attached to your stay that may or may not be a surprise to you.

title: Primo NYC Location
text: Excellent staff.  Very professional and attentive. Room in excellent condition. Nice to include a fridge and coffee.  Even sofa sleeper was comfortable. Just wish they had the continental breakfast still, but ended it with covid. Perfect location for park, restaurants, Broadway, museums, subway.  Didn't want to leave.

title: Pleasant Stay in NYC
text: The property was well maintained, the staff was courteous and the check in/out process was quick and efficient.  We felt well attended to.  The baggage hold service was quite convenient.  Overall it is a good value.

title: Nice place near Broadway
text: This was a nice place and convenient location.  The lighting was a little dark and the table we sat at was not close to the window, so we couldn't sit, have a drink, and look at the scenery. The staff was quite friendly. Several times, we stopped in the lobby and had a nice, frien

title: Lovely unit with great location
text: Manahattan club units are like "old New York" in decor. But location can not be beat. Walking distance to Central Park, the theatre district, Fifth Avenue, many great restaurants - super location! Friendly staff.

title: NYC vacation
text: Everything about the Manhattan Club was top notch, professional, efficient, and Covid compliant from the minute I checked in, until I checked out a week later.  I have no complaints what so ever. Looking forward to returning in April 2022. The location is perfect for everything in NYC.

title: A fuir Absolument 0 service
text:
Service proche du zéro 
Hôtel bruyant, très mal isolé 
Tous les services soit disant Ressort fees que vous payez en plus sont fermés ( restaurant etc ) et pourtant vous payez plein pot sans ménagement 
Le ménage n est pas fait ou très mal fait , voir les photos et de plus, ironiquement, ils affichent être Green et qu ils demandent aux clients des efforts sur le changement de draps et serviette s et la vaisselle est en plastique !!!
A l étage 17, une cigarette vidée est restée pendant 6 jours posée dans le creux du distributeur de gel hydroalcoolique sans être retirée ! 
Bref a fuir , c est juste un de ces hôtels de plus qui s en foutent de leurs clients de passage car les autres ou ils se concentrent sont des Propriétaires en Time sharing 
Ils sont signalés par des écriteaux sur les portes , # Owner club here #
Bref a fuir

title: Superb choice in midtown, bw Central Park & Times Sq
text: This place was superb for our needs in NYC. Lobby staff were friendly and accommodating for checkin, touristic questions, and bag check. Location ideal, shouting distance to south end of Central Park, and a short walk to Times Square. Clean, modern room.

title: Manhattan Club Hits All the Marks
text:
We had a beautiful VRBO reserved in Weehawken that cancelled a few hours before our flight. We searched frantically and happened upon the Manhattan Club. What a blessing in disguise it turned out to be. 

First off, the staff is great, friendly and super helpful. They made us feel at home despite being packed as we neared New Year’s Eve. They, as much as anything, will be the reason we come back. 

The rooms were clean and comfortable, worthy of their rating as a four-star hotel. I don’t find many hotel beds that I like, but I slept like a baby here. I love that they have plates, utensils and a dishwasher. We ordered a few meals and desserts, and they came in so handy. 

Lastly, the location is great. You’re just south of Central Park, and a quick stroll to Times Square and the Broadway shows we were to see. Apart from airport rides, the only Uber we needed was a quick one when it started pour after Phantom of the Opera. 

So don’t look any further; just book now.

title: December stay.
text: We were at the Manhatten Club the first full week of December. I was there in August for a four day stay and asked at that time for one of the big corner rooms. Did not receive. No bellman to greet us and take our luggage up to our room. I asked for daily housekeeping and even after calling every morning did not receive.needs to be updated thruout the building. Very worn. I am an owner and would not recommend staying here. Good location is about all it has going for it.

title: Nice hotel in good location
text:
Excellent hotel in good location to sample the Big Apple.

Room was clean, comfortable and Covid measures were adopted and staff adhered to hotel policies for mask wearing in all public areas.

Plenty of food options available within easy walking distance of the hotel (try the nearby Brooklyn Diner for breakfast). Wi-Fi available and was reliable.

title: Wonderful stay
text: I come to NYC the first week of December every year and the quality of everything at the facility is first rate.The service at the club is excellent and the same folks are there from year to year making it feel very familiar. I will continue to a regular.

title: The Manhattan Club New York City
text: Excellent resort. We enjoyed our time there. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was clean, very comfortable and everything was in working order.  The decor was up to date and beautiful. The resort was strict on their health and safety protocol, adding another layer of comfort to our stay.

title: Terrific Hotel in the Middle of New York
text: We stayed at The Manhattan Club for one week over the Thanksgiving holiday -- and I can't say enough good things about it.  We were in a City Lights Suite -- which was spacious , very quiet and immaculately clean. Furnishings and finishes were up to date and very comfortable.  Staff was helpful and the location can't be beat.  It's the first time we've stayed at the Manhattan Club and it will be our "go to" place whenever we return to New York.

title: Cena
text: Es una muy buena opción para cenar o comer con una variedad de mariscos y carne la atención es buena. Precio accesible lugar muy céntrico en Nueva York. El ambiente es excelente y tiene un bar por si no desean tomar alimentos que es de mucho ambiente

title: Reserved 1 week
text: Horrible experience. Many staff put mask under their nose. Room service was half done or not done. No desk personnel to help and direct for activities in New York. Elevators supposed to carry only 4 people at a time, but this was never controlled and not clearly written on elevator doors, frequently having 7 or more people crowding the small space.

title: Location and Service, Who could ask for anything more!
text: Great location near Broadway and 2 blocks south of Central Park. We walked everywhere. Great staff, very helpful when we extended our stay by a day. Housekeeping very attentive to our requests. Security always available and welcoming.

title: A Week in the Big Apple
text: Great location!  Walkable to many restaurants, subway stations, the theater, Central Park.  Front desk staff was welcoming and friendly throughout our stay.  For the daily  "hospitality fee" we were required to pay, the "high speed internet" left much to be desired.  Also the kitchen was lacking a toaster! Housekeeping staff was exceptional - resort quality linens and towels.  We'd definitely stay here again!

title: Pleasant surprise
text:
This is New York… so to find a well located hotel at a reasonable price with an awesome and comfortable bed, great pillows, first rate bed sheets and towels, is not that easy. We also had a small living room and kitchenette which complemented the room beautifully.
I hate carpets but there’s nothing anybody can do about that (or is there?).
Room service was good. We hardly talked to the staff but everyone seems to be polite.
I don’t give it 5 stars because it’s an old hotel that can always improve the little things and because of the carpet but that’s my pet peeve! Hahaha

title: Satisfactory
text:
It did not meet my expectations as the quality that I expected.
No restaurant, no pool, shortage of cleaning staff for part of my stay.  Gave me some credit for that but the maintenance fee they charge was excessive for what you got to start with.
Close to a lot of amenities.

title: The Manhattan Club
text: Great location, easy in and out of the city. Convenient to all aspects of NYC, theater, sports, sight seeing. An easy walk to and from great restaurants, reknown music halls and museums are just a short cab ride in all directions. Personnel at the facility are incredibly friendly.

title: Excellent location, great hotel!
text: Great hotel. Stayed as a Bluegreen member, and had nothing but a positive experience. Didn't have a chance to explore any of the amenities, but I'm not sure if they were actually even accessible due to covid restrictions. The one bedroom suite is very spacious. Decor is a little dated, but everything is in very great shape, well maintained and very clean. My husband and I don't care about decor, and focus on location, so this hotel is perfect. You cannot beat this location - only 5 minutes to both central park and times square. The staff were all friendly. We had one issue with our blow dryer not working, we called down to the front desk and within 10 minutes someone had brought us up a new one. Overall we definitely recommend this hotel, and will absolutely stay again next time we come to New York.

title: Great location
text: The best thing about the resort is the location, near Times Square, Central Park, many good restaurants.  Our room was on the inside of the building with brick wall views, but was kept clean and was nice and quiet.  We spent 83500 RCI points for the exchange, a rather high amount for average accomodations.

title: As a RCI unit, not the greatest
text:
I'm an avid timeshare traveler and this location is questionable as a RCI gold crown resort.
It may have used to be a luxury resort/hotel back in the 80s, but doesn't meet the standards in my perspective. Furnitures are very outdated, no way close to modern or high end. I only stayed for one night to test out so I can stay longer for later and we decided not to go back. 
We had an one bedroom unit and the major problem for me was that the kitchenette had no stove. Only microwave and a dorm size fridge. That's the biggest problem for us. I wouldn't stay for a week without any cooking capabilities but that's just us. Bedroom is acceptable but living room and dining area being too tight wasn't just comfortable for 2 adults and 2 pre-teen kids. One bedroom unit might be comfortable for 2 adults? Considering that this resort charges premium of $45 per night stay on top of exchange fees, they offered no amenities during this covid era. It just wasn't a pleasant nor comfortable unit to stay in. Also their sofa bed was uncomfortable and unsanitary. I saw hairs and debris on sofa bed sheets as if it was never cleaned after a use. I called housekeeping and front desk around 9pm but nobody answered. I gave up and ended up using sheets from the bedroom to cover the disgusting sofa bed sheet. Extra linens in the closets were disgusting as well. Blankets were almost burnt or so old that it was scratchy. Just unacceptable for a gold crown resort.

title: Tired in the Big Apple
text: First, I will say this is an AMAZING location & the staff was friendly & helpful! Our room on the other hand (which looks nothing like the pics on this site), was in desperate need of a REMODEL Rx!! Everything just screamed “TIRED” - from the doors & windows that wouldn’t work properly, to the mismatched furniture, the squeaky, saggy bed (we woke up sore every day), the toilet that ran loudly every few min, the thermostats from the 70’s that could only be “on” or “off, the dingy wall paint & carpet, to the master shower tub that filled to the tops of my CALVES (despite repeated service efforts). We toured another room & the wallpaper was peeling up at the seams everywhere. This place just needs a giant facelift! So much of these are easy, cosmetic fixes & a much needed investment in a place that has such an excellent location! Sadly, I would not stay here again or refer someone here.

title: NYC at its best!
text: Amazing location in mid-town Manhattan!   The  staff was helpful and accommodating and very welcoming.  There is also 24 hour security  in the lobby and Covid precautions are in effect which is reassuring.  The units are very comfortable, however, the club itself is in need of repair and upgrading.

title: Magic in Manhattan
text: The Manhattan Club, situated across from Carnegie Hall afforded us a safe and well situated NYC home for our magical week in New York. Central Park, Times Square, Broadway plays, Rockefeller Center and other New York “must sees” are within easy walking distance. Subways are only steps away from the doors of the Manhattan Club which gave east access to anywhere in the five boroughs.  We went sailing on the Sheerwater in the bay, played golf on Staten Island, saw three plays, went to Coney Island, saw the “regular” tourist attractions (Ellis Island, Statue of Liberty, Empire State Building, 9/11 Memorial and took in a drag show…all easy access and with help from the Manhattan Club staff.  Most importantly, they were friendly but firm about masks and adhering to Covid safety guidelines.  I can’t wait to return to the Manhattan Club…it’s a very special place to stay while in NYC.

title: The Manhattan Club is a must stay location if traveling to New York
text: The Manhattan Club is located near several of New York's iconic landmarks (Central Park, Time Square, Broadway). Many restaurants are located close by. The subway stations are very close, so you can easily get around the city. The employees were very friendly and helpful. Resort very clean. We had an amazing time at The Manhattan Club.

title: Honest Review of The Manhattan Club: 2 Pros + 6 Cons
text:
Pros: 

1. Really good location. 
2. Nice shower with GREAT water pressure. 

Cons:

1. Our experience with The Manhattan Club started poorly. We booked a room ~4-5hrs before check-in. We arrived at the hotel early and they said that my reservation hadn't come through the system yet and to come back at 4pm. Understandable. We left and came back, as requested, at 4pm. Still no reservation. I asked the nice concierge "why don't you have our reservation?" And he said it's because reservations are closed on Sundays. Seems odd for a hotel like The Manhattan Club. Anyway - it took way too long to get checked in. 

2. The room was OKAY. We were on the 2nd floor and it was pretty dark and dingy.  We had to call to request another roll of toilet paper b/c they only had 1 in the room for our 3-night stay. 

3. The restaurant/bar is still closed due to COVID. Most other places are open, just requesting proof of vaccination, so there's really no reason why this can't be open.

4. No water in the rooms. C'mon. A 4-star hotel? At least put 1 or 2 bottles of water in each room. 

5. I requested more towels and it took housekeeping 2-3 hours to bring us 2 fresh towels. WHY?

6. Icing on the cake: the fire alarm went off the morning of our last day (two days after 9/11) when we were packing and getting ready to leave. It went off for ~30sec or so. Many residents on the 2nd floor were standing in the hall wondering if we needed to panic. Lol. When the alarm turned off, somebody eventually came over the intercom to inform us that it was just a drill. Why would you let us know AFTER the fact? It makes no sense! 

Overall, we won't be back. Too many other places to stay in NYC.

title: Fantastic NYC Property
text: It was a fantastic weekend in NYC. The Manhattan club was superb. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful.  The room was immaculate. The service was amazing! Attention was paid to every detail throughout our long weekend. I would definitely recommend the Manhattan in Club and plan to make future visits to this property.

title: Week stay at Manhattan Club
text: The location is fantastic in the heart of Manhattan.  Lots to do all around including Central Park, Columbus Circle, Times Square, restaurants, museums...and on and on.  The Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, the room décor is a bit dated, nice, but dated.  Overall The Manhattan Club is a fantastic place to stay.

title: Location is everything
text: First timer and I'll definitely come back. I got a studio and was placed in the 2009 room which, according to James at the front desk, it's one of the renewed floors. It's not as new as you'll think but very nice and spacious. At least this room. Bell men are very attentive, as well as the cleaning personnel. Comfy, we could accommodate 4 with perfect comfiness. Elevators could be more than those two. Location is great. Just 2 blocks down form Central Park South, very nice restaurants around and a CVS a block away. Loved it.

title: Good location
text: The Manhattan Club was very clean and easily accessible to Central Park and Times Square. Valet parking right onsite too.  COVID protocols were in place and enforced due to CDIC rules.  Also kid friendly.

title: Excellent Resort in a Great Location
text: The resort is lovely and the staff great.  Located near Carnegie Hall, it is easy to get any where in NYC from here.  Plenty of local restaurants near by and never had an issue getting an Uber or Taxi.  Our room was lovely and could see Central Park.  Very clean and well maintained.

title: Manhattan Club
text: Muy buena localización cercano a diferentes estaciones de metro, supermercados, tiendas, zonas turística; la unidad es pequeña para 4 personas pero comoda cuenta con refrigeradora pequeña y microondas con vajilla para 4 personas.

title: Best Location
text: Fantastic location near everything.  The studio unit was perfect for us, Roomy with a private nook for the bed. it also had a refrigerator so we could eat a meal or two in our room, a big plus as the food prices in NYC are very high..

title: Good location, less than average resort.
text:
The only positive about this resort is the location.  Centralized and closed to everything in mid town Manhatton.  The staff were also nice.
