 But the resort itself is very dissatisfactory.  If you plan to spend time there other than to sleep and shower, then do not go there.  They charge $54 daily for resort fee, but no additional service or aminities. The rooms are very small, no bedroom door for privacy.  I guess the name resort allows them to charge extra. No pool, no hot tub.  No lobby.

title: Another wonderful stay at the Manhattan Club
text: We have stayed at the Manhattan Club many times and it is always a wonderful experience. The property is beautiful and in a great location.  The staff are also amazing and we love staying here. We will return here every time we visit NYC.

title: Not what I was expecting
text: The service is sub par due to Covid.  The gym is a joke, with the best pieces of equipment roped off, and no water like the photos show.  You are supposed to wear a mask to work out.  We had no maid service at all one day out of three.  They make you wear a mask to enter, but both the security guard and front desk staff were often seen without any masks at all.  At least the location is good.

title: Never forget anything!
text: Staying at the Manhattan Club was okay with one major exception. We left a brand new jacket in our room and when we called the next morning - less than 24 hours after we departed. No jacket! Not possible!!! Since it was brand new it went home with someone. Sad to think the Manhattan Club has fallen to such low standards.

title: Glorified 3 star hotel
text: We stayed in a Penthouse Suite - and while the space is nice, the decor is completely dated (bathrooms are fine but other furnishings are circa 1990) and service is terrible.  Housekeeping might or might not decide to leave towels, IF they show up.  Want ice?  You need to travel up or down a few flights to a machine.  Air conditioning is terrible, with some rooms cool and others somewhat sweltering.  Some suites are positioned on top of the elevator shaft in the hotel underneath - so be prepared for clanks and weird noises day and night.  Security guards swarm the lobby and enforce the hotel's mask property as if they are talking to prison inmates.  This is basically a suite version of the Park Central, marketed as luxury.  It is not.  Needs some attention and stronger management.

title: A wonderful experience!
text: The minute we arrived we were treated by efficient and friendly staff and every need was attended to. The room was clean and comfortable. And all Covid 19 protocols were observed. A really great trip!

title: Great location!
text: We visited New York before shows opened, but most restaurants and stores were open. The hotel is in a great location. Close to Central Park, Broadway, restaurants, subway, buses. I thought the resort amenities fee for RCI customers @ $50/night was a little steep considering there is no pool or restaurant. There is a bar/lounge and it was still closed due to Covid-19. Free wi-fi  was only amenity.

title: GREAT PLACE but read reviews about the thermostats!!!
text:
PROS: The staff was very friendly, housekeeping promptly arrives with requests, location is great, the pull out sofa bed was a foam mattress( which was a huge surprise usually those mattresses are not much more than a box spring mattress) which was comfortable and long enough for my 6 foot plus teenager who sleeps on a Casper bed at home. The real bed was comfortable, pillow are soft.  The room is a fine size, plates, silverware and bowls  are provided, fridge and microwave were nice.  There is a large grocery store one block away on 57th, subways are near, two blocks from Central Park, Time Square is not far
CONS: this con may be the only reason you don't choose this place- you CAN NOT set the thermostat. there is a dial where you can make the room cooler or warmer but  It's either on or off on low or high fan.   so the room does cool very quickly and does seem to keep the temperature.   It was fine for us because I got up earlier than others and turned it off- the only other cons are the water pressure in the shower not very much pressure and the towels are cheap- not soft

title: Great location to visit NYC
text: We had a cute little studio. Perfect for 2 adults with a tiny kitchen area (no stove and very small fridge). The location was great to walk to the museums, Time Square, the theater (once it reopens) and more. We will definitely be back!

title: Nice stay
text: Am an owner at Manhattan Club for 15+ years, first stay there due to near impossibility of reservations until pandemic started. Used points to stay elsewhere during this time. Unit was nicely furnished,  sofas a bit rundown, everything clean, well.kept overall. Was upgraded from Studio to 1 bedroom with 2 full baths. Staff attentive and accommodating. Quick retrieval of my car from parking.

title: The Manhattan Club
text: The staff was very helpful from the moment we arrived. The unit was good size, very helpful to have a small refrig/dishwasher/microwave and dishes. The couch was not overly comfortable but we spent little time in the room. The only complaint was that the toilets ran and they were unable to fix them. Otherwise the unit was extremely quiet. Would definitely stay there on our next trip.

title: Boutique hotel converting to Timeshare
text: We stayed a week here the week NYC reopened post pandemic. The place is clean, friendly and has a great location, especially if you are there for theaters.  Central Park and Carnegie Hall are around the corner. While we were here there were no services available except a room and good security.  This is not a good Timeshare value.  After considering my home resort maintenance feee, RCI trade and membership fees plus the $50 a day “RESORT “ fee I wish I had just paid the nightly rate for a hotel.

title: Great Staff, Great Location!
text: The staff is exceptionally friendly, they made the stay even better than expected!! Location is ideal, you can walk to Rockefeller center, central park & Columbus circle. Safe area, lots of restaurants & bars near by. Valet service offered for a very reasonable fee.

title: location at it's best
text:
The Manhattan Club is 2 blocks away from c
Central Park. It is also close to other amenities which are currently closed due to covid19 such as Carnegie Hall and Lincoln Center. The units are a bit old fashion and nights may be chilly as it has central heating which is off in May. The unit we had was adequate for us - one bed and sitting area plus minikitchenette: the fridge, microwave and coffee maker are fantastic. You get fresh supply of coffee every day. The staff is wonderful- all very nice and professional. Covid precautions in place everywhere added to our feeling of safety.

title: Not a luxury resort
text: I thought this would be a high-end resort, but they have no heating and cooling. I don't want to spend $$$$$ to have worn out furniture and no heating or cooling. No lounge/bar, no breakfast, no laundry, no business center, and you have to open the windows. I question some of the reviews on here. My feeling about the place is that it is a rip off. I saw reviews on Yelp that were more in lines with my experience.  The only thing good about this hotel is the location.

title: RCI Traders Beware. Deceptive fees and practices and poor customer service
text:
We had a very disappointing stay. The drawers on the dresser by the bed would not stay closed.  The carpet is in need of repair, and the furnishings, in general, are very dated and shabby. 
Google "rci manhattan club lawsuit," and you will learn a lot. The NY attorney general is aware of their practices, and there is a Facebook group called "Manhattan Club Timeshare Scam.  I was charged nearly $50 a day for "amenities," including for the day after I left! There were no amenities except a  fitness center that was reservation required. Housekeeping was promised,  but, on multiple days, there was a note left under our door stating no room service, with no explanation why. We were able to call down and get items delivered, such as clean towels, but the person made it clear that  we were bothering them.  We decided to leave early and go to Boston's Custom House. They did not charge us any fees, and we had access to laundry and free tours. Not only did the MC  not offer any amenities, they didn't have working services, such as heating and AC. As another reviewer noted, we were told to open a window. When I complained to the manager, I was told it was an old building.  I also believe they have mold. My husband was sick while staying there. It was not COVID but a "respiratory infection,  triggered by mold.'  Others complained about mold problems (consumeraffairs.com).  We did notice that the air filter was not properly in place and was extremely dirty.

title: If I come back to New York City I would definitely stay here
text: Great location,  short walk to Times Square and to Central.  Staff was knowledgeable and friendly housekeeping was thorough and professional. The view from our window was nothing to write home about. The Manhattan Club is one of three timeshares in all of New York City and the best of the three. We stayed in a one bedroom suite with a mini kitchen and two bathrooms in the living room.  If I were to come back to New York City I would definitely stay in this timeshare

title: Manhattan Club NYC
text: The men at the door were nice and helpful. The room was clean and the bed was comfotable. The couch however was terrible. It was old and shabby and very uncomfortable. The location was good for what we were interested in seeing.

title: Great experience with the Manhattan Club, all amenities were great and the service was overwhelmingly awesome.  The city
text: Great experience with the Manhattan Club, all amenities were great and the service was overwhelmingly awesome.  The city right at our disposal with fine dining and Time Square being right down the street.  The rooms were a very nice size and it was more then we bargained for.  We enjoyed our trip by just being at a great hotel and realizing we had a great place to relax.  The parking was our only issue, but it was fair.

title: Some good, some not-so-good
text:
Our stay was April 9 to April 16, 2021.  We stayed on the 18th floor in a one bedroom suite.   We did not use the bar/lounge, the business center, nor the fitness center.

Pros:
•	Nice room, nice furniture, and very clean.
•	Comfortable bed.
•	Courteous staff.
•	Convenient location to the subway, Carnegie Hall, and Central Park.

Cons:
•	Temperature control is either heat for the whole day or air conditioning for the whole day.  While we were there, they still had it on heat because of the cool nights.  We are generally comfortable at 67°F and sleep at 65°F.  The room was 71°F to 73°F for the first couple days while they tried to “fix” the issue.   Finally, their suggestion was for us to open windows.  That helped a little (not completely because the windows don’t open very far) but city noises at night are not conducive to a sound sleep. 
•	Even though it is convenient to the subway, the NYC subway system is not kind to people who have mobility issues.   
•	The one morning we decided to sleep in, housekeeping called us to see if we would be leaving even though we had their version of a “Do Not Disturb” sign on the door.  We had been up late and wanted to try to get some extra sleep. 
•	Then there is the “Service Fee”.   Of the $54.51 they charge per day, $7.01 are state and city taxes.  The rest, $47.50, is listed as RCI-Hospitality Fee.  The more I think about this the more it irks me.  I have a timeshare into which I pay annual fees and pay RCI fees (annual and exchange) to be able to exchange that unit.  I feel like I have already paid to be there.  None of the other RCI places we have used over the past 17 years have charged us a daily fee.  None!
•	The Manhattan Club says there is Concierge service.  Other than the gentleman who checked us in at the Concierge Desk, not once did we see anyone at that desk.  At first, I blamed it on the COVID shutdown but then I realized that there were lots of workers around (behind the front desk, a security guard stationed between the front door and the elevator, and there was a hotel porter helping with luggage and cars).
•	TV Channel choices were a bit limited for fun entertainment.  I know this is a bit nit-picky but who doesn’t even offer the Food Network?

title: Super Outdated- Needs a good cleaning- Great Location
text: Although the room is very large for Manhattan, I would not stay again.  The bathroom had moldy appearing black spots on the tiles, the entire unit was furnished like it was 1985, and the drain on the floor of the bathroom had several small bugs crawl out of it which was gross. Ancient and needs an update  refinish of Bathroom.  Also, the pictures on the website are not accurate to the room they put us up in.

title: Excellente location and good size of the room
text: Near 5th Avenue, central park and broadway. Spacious rooms, something difficult to find in NY. Good quality and clean rooms. With kichenette, so with kids it helps a lot. 2 bathrooms. Very helpful staff. The best choice in NY.

title: La limpieza de la habitación no la hacían aún que nos cobraron por ese servicio a diario durante toda nuestra estancia
text:
El hotel está ubicado en una excelente zona de la ciudad, limpio las instalaciones aún que no había personal que hablara español 
La limpieza en la habitación fue otra cosa, nos dijeron que no tenían personal para ello así que medio limpiaban y aún así nos cobraron el cargo diario de más de 40dlls por día 
No nos pareció justo por qué no la cama tendían, la alfombra con basura y el baño sucio

title: Great Location
text: The Manhattan Club has a great location for doing anything you want in NYC. Central Park and Time Square are a short walk. Due to COVID the amenities were not available for us. A couple of nearby restaurants had discounts with your room key.

title: Great Stay
text: The Manhattan Club was so nice, people were courtesy and the facility very clean. Loved the location - spent a lot of time in Central Park. Lots to do even during Covid. Visited a few museums (25% capacity, socially distanced and timed entry) and ate at restaurants with outdoor/sidewalk facilities. Great to support this great city during a financially devastating time.

title: Wonderful
text: The Manhattan Club is a gem located in the heart of the city.  During these times, it was refreshing to get away and enjoy vacationing in NYC. The walks in Central Park; shopping and Wholefoods were some of my best experiences.

title: Poor room assigned to returning guests
text: Family and friends had enjoyed the Manhattan Club especially the room sizes for the past three years.  Last stay's room size was a big disappointment especially when there were very few guests due to Corona virus.  Also, the bed linens were coarse to the touch.

title: Making the Best of the Holidays During COVID
text: We could have canceled our plans to travel from our home state in the south, but we decided to make the best of a trip to Manhattan in a much different way than we have experienced in the past. Suggested options were walking in Central Park,  bike riding, visiting the restaurants that we have been so fond of in the past (if only for takeout), and possibly seeing the tree in Rockefeller Center. So it did not turn out to be a complete bust, although we were very saddened by the governing "leaders" who shutdown all indoor dining. I hope that these businesses will survive this COVID crisis. Some have not. The lucky ones could afford outdoor space heaters and vinyl enclosures. I wondered if the NYC mayor and NYS governor dined in these sidewalk and street structures, too.  Anyway, the Manhattan Club staff could not do enough to make sure that our lodging accommodations were enjoyable. All of the staff (including the reservations specialist) were very pleasant and helpful.  Our room was both clean and sanitized, and the furnishings were just as comfortable as they have been for all of the years that we have been staying here. We had to do without certain things like the business center, the fitness room, and the 26th floor lounge, but we made good with walking around the city and seeing family who live in Manhattan. It was a very memorable trip, and the Manhattan Club staff helped to make it so!

title: Nice Resort and Great Location in Manhattan, New York City
text: Nice units, helpful staff that provides dining and entertainment suggestions in the area. Great location in mid-town Manhattan, very convenient to restaurants and activities. Excellent attention to current public health requirements.

title: Great location, friendly, limited offerings during covid but you still pay an RCI resort fee
text: Daytime reception staff was helpful and friendly. Room was quite spacious for 1 person, with 2 bathrooms. Great location, steps to Central Park and next to subway. Hot water took 15-20 minutes, make sure to run the tap way before you plan on taking a shower/bath. RCI members pay a resort fee, the same as pre-covid price, even though the lounge and gym are closed. I thought the fee should be decreased to reflect decrease in offerings

title: great location
text: Manhattan Club is centrally located. Within walking distance of Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park. 5th Ave is also close for shopping and site seeing. Subway station is nearby as are many dining options. Staff was friendly and helpful

title: Just "ok"
text: This hotel was great for a location near the Broadway show we saw.  We visited February 2020 (right before everything shut down).  The lobby was nice and the staff was nice. The room, however, was just ok. I guess for the price, what do you expect. The bed was horribly uncomfortable and the carpet needs replacement.

title: Excellent
text: Excellent location can walk to many attractions. I think resort need to add a toaster and portable electric heater to the units so that  some one can cook meals. But overall great resort. We had a great time!

title: so close to everything
text:
1 bedroom suite actually had 2 full baths!  quite spacious
very quiet, very clean
staff very accommodating and focused on health and safety
location made it even more perfect for the trip my daughter and I made to the city from NJ

title: NYC Stay
text: This is not your 5 Star hotel by a long shot. The hotel units are slightly larger than what you might find in the typical Crown Plaza. The kitchenette did not have the appliances listed in the RCI literature. It is conveniently located to many attractions. My biggest complaint is charging a $50 per night SERVICE FEE during Covid when there were NO SERVICES offered during the stay. I expect a one time housekeeping fee which is more common with RCI exchanges now.

title: Manhattan Club
text:
It was a good time to visit NYC during Covid.  NYC was quiet and practically everyone was wearing masks.  I was able to get a match through RCI which ordinarily is difficult to do.   The Resort was quiet and I felt safe.   The location of the resort is excellent and it is within walking distance to Central Park, numerous restaurants and shopping.  
My only complaint was the overnight parking fees as we weren't able to exit and re-enter without paying additional fees.

title: Read the fine print!
text: I get I paid for exchange fee and my points.  I missed I had to pay an extra $109.02 for some reason.  Fool me once shame on you (print needs to be bigger) fool me twice shame on me.  Now I'm told my review is too short!

title: Fantastic Location
text:
Due to a family emergency, my mom and I flew to NYC with very short notice. Because of COVID-19, not a lot of people were traveling here and we were able to book a two week stay at The Manhattan Club using timeshare RCI points.  I have family in NYC, therefore my family visits the city frequently. We stayed in a 1-bedroom suite (sleeps up to 4 with sofa bed) from June 20th to July 3rd. We advised we would be late checking-in (close to midnight).  Thankfully with the 24-hour front desk, we had a smooth check-in!

Pros: Location!, size of suite with kitchenette, Manny’s car service to the airport (LGA), friendly doormen/security team, mostly friendly housekeeping staff, 24-hour check-in. 

Cons: service fee, not remodeled/dated room/floor, unavailable amenities (not the hotel’s fault)

The location of this hotel is quite amazing and it’s absolute best feature. It is within a 10-minute walk to many landmarks in central/midtown Manhattan. Grocery stores are within walking distance. This was convenient for our long stay to pickup some basics (yogurt, milk, drinks, cereal, tea&coffee) especially since the hotel’s food service was non-operational. The hotel is conveniently close to the subway trains (which at the time of this review were not crowded, sometimes we had an entire car to ourselves).  Trains were fairly frequent, the most we waited was 15 minutes.  Most stations let you know when the next train will be arriving.  Download the free NYC Subway app to assist you with schedules and best routes.  Most people wore masks. A few didn’t. Take the subway to Brooklyn. Walk to Brooklyn Bridge Park for a beautiful view and then walk back over Brooklyn Bridge to see the spectacular bridge architecture and NYC skyline. If you’re really adventurous take the subway to City Hall/Brooklyn Bridge and walk over Brooklyn Bridge to Brooklyn then walk back over Manhattan Bridge to Chinatown. 

This hotel is steps from Central Park.  I was only able to visit and stroll through the park only a few times during my stay, but it is a must see if you’re staying at this hotel (and since the gym is closed!). Because of COVID, the park roads were closed to traffic so runners, walkers, and cyclists could spread out.  This made the park even more special by stepping out of the urban elements and into tranquility.  There are Citibike and bike rental shops nearby if you’re short on time and/or you want to see more of the park. 

“Service” Fees / “Resort” Fees / “Luxury Tax” of $54.51 per night is ridiculous, but somewhat typical for timeshares. We stayed 13 nights using more than a years worth of RCI points, paid a reservation fee, and then these service fees.  Totaling it all up, it is overpriced. We only decided to stay here to exhaust our RCI points, because we would lose them at the end of the year.  The lounge, business center, and gym are all closed.  The manager said the fees covered the internet and 24-hour security team.  There were not a lot of guests staying so we had no issues with waiting for the elevators. It seemed we were the only ones on our floor until the last few days of our stay. We were on the 14th floor which took us back in time to the 90’s. It is definitely ready for a facelift. I would not refer to the rooms as luxurious or elegant as the website claims or as some of the photos show.  The whole suite could use an overhaul. The wallpaper was peeling/lifting on most of the walls. Neither bathroom had exhaust fans. Both bathrooms’ showers had drain issues. The maintenance team was able to fix one, but not the other for whatever reason. Which I advised again upon checkout. There was a tub/shower in one bathroom and a stall shower in the other. My mom appreciated having the stall type shower since she is older and didn’t feel safe stepping over the tub. All that being said, the suite was spacious for a NYC hotel, clean, and very comfortable for the little time we spent in the hotel. The size and two bathrooms are perfect for families. Having a kitchenette was very convenient. It had a good size refrigerator, small microwave, small sink, and dishwasher.  It also had plates, cups, glasses, silverware, small utensils, single-serve coffee maker, and an ice bucket.  The room had an iron and ironing board, a safe, hair dryer (inconspicuously placed in the living room dresser bottom drawer), two luggage racks, and alarm clock.  My mom and I are fairly neat and prefer not to have daily housekeeping. The lovely housekeeping staff would supply us with extra supplies as needed when we saw them in the hallway.  We had them come once in the middle of our stay to freshen the room and linens. 

We had a north facing room with a scaffolding/city view. It seems they are doing an exterior facelift as there is scaffolding up on at least two sides of the building. There was road construction on the corner of 56th and 7th Avenue. Only one morning we were awakened by jack hammering at 7am! If construction is still going on, you may want to ask for a room further away from this corner. 

Since my flight home wasn’t until 3pm, I asked for a late checkout. They offered only a 1-hour extension and advised it would be an extra $25(?) an hour to stay any longer than that. AND because of COVID-19, we were not allowed to wait in the lobby.  But, they did allow guests to stand and wait directly outside the lobby doors.  I realize the rooms need cleaning, that they may have limited staff, and maybe some other unknown to me reasons, but with the exorbitantly high service fees, and all the limitations/restrictions; at minimum the hotel could give some concessions back to their patrons for a better, “luxurious” experience (extended checkout, remodeled room, etc.). 

We used the hotel’s recommended car service to the airport (LGA). Manny was very nice, accommodating, and competitively priced. His 6-person black SUV was immaculate. I highly recommend him.  We had used Uber’s car service on arrival. It was a terrible experience for nearly the same price. 

Things to work on:
Add USB outlets to lamps and/or wall outlets. Being an internationally visited city, it is expected. 
Add an electric kettle and a toaster. These two appliances would be very convenient for long stays and those with families. 
Install exhaust fans in the bathrooms. 
Relax checkout times minimally during the pandemic and/or as long as waiting in the lobby is not allowed.

title: No Bargain
text:
I stayed in a 2 bath suite through an interval  exchange, meaning I wasn't slammed with resort fee as with RCI.  Having stayed prior, I knew to ask for an interior room, so as to avoid street noise.  
If I'd owned here, I'd be furious about sofas, which will put you in orthopedist office in a day (owner maint is $3400 annual).
Few cable channels, but streaming is possible.
It is a good location.
Booked 2 extra nights through booking.com., which didn't specify suite size. I had to move to smaller suite second night.  Were I a business traveller whose office was footing bill, I'd be OK with unit.  For price charged, not so much as a leisure guest.

Oh, yeah;  the move to smaller suite was unnecessary and cost staff a sizable tip.

title: Brilliant service  from these guys during bad times
text: Sadly after looking forward to this trip for 2 years we had to cancel our trip. I was not expecting anything back as the hotel was non-refundable however these guys didnt use that fact to keep our money and we were refunded very quickly and i was so happy. Prices are higher for next year so doubt we can afford this hotel now but i highly recommend these guys for fairness and communication.

title: Lovely, sumptuous stay
text: Hotels in NYC can sometimes be more about the location than about comfort, but this hotel luckily has both.  It's conveniently located in Midtown Manhattan, near Central Park, theatres, and multiple restaurants, but the rooms don't lose any quality.  The rooms are spacious enough and the beds are comfortable, and the lobby is clean and well-maintained.  Checking in was a smooth process, and all of the hotel staff were friendly and professional.  We had a nice view of downtown NYC from here, although thankfully our room was still quiet.  The deli/snack shop in the lobby was a bit overpriced, although I suppose that's par for the course in this neighborhood.

title: Lovely Thanksgiving stay
text: We stayed here Thanksgiving 2019 (by coincidence than design, those dates worked best for us). The staff were very helpful, the room was comfortable, although we did  ask them to adjust the heating, which apparently couldn't be controlled for individual rooms only the entire building, but it wasn't a major issue for us. It's an excellent location, walking distance for many of the sights or a subway station if going a bit further. The staff provided us with a map of the Macy's parade route which was much appreciated! There's a bar on the top floor which is called something like "the owners lounge" but guests are allowed up there too. It was very quiet when we went up (which we liked) and had excellent views - be warned, the drinks are strong!

title: Excellent accommodations near Central Park, Columbus Circle and Radio City Music Hall
text: Spacious quiet accommodations, daily room service and replenishments, very clean and private, friendly polite setvice, lovely hotel. I was very lucky to find these very reasonable accommodations on short notice during the COVID 19 pandemic in NYC. The security guards were very kind and protective and I felt very safe staying there.

title: Excellent
text: Perfect location for Central Park and mid town Manhattan. Check in staff and housekeeping excellent and charming. Timeshare one bedroom was clean, spacious  and functional. Will most definitely return here.

title: GREAT ROOMS. GREAT LOCATION
text:
We arrived at The Manhattan club and were nicely greeted by security and receptionist. Check in was easy and fast. We spent 11nights here and enjoyed everything they had to offer. We stayed on the 18th floor. Room was very spacious with two bathrooms (1 with a bath), kitchen/dining/lounge and a bedroom. The beds were super comfy and such a dream to sleep in after a long day exploring. Rooms were cleaned daily, they weren’t modern but still very nice. Our view looked over to the offices across the road (Didn’t bother us). Business hub, gym and vending machines on the 26th floor. All staff we very friendly and very helpful. The location is PERFECT! You are close to literally everything! We loved NYC! Check out was quick and easy. We didn’t want to leave! When we return to New York, we will definitely be staying at The Manhattan Club again. 

Thank yous

title: Tråkig receptionspersonal och management. Se upp!
text: Vi bodde på hotellet en vecka och fick rum mot gatan, trots att receptionen var väl medvetna om att huset fasadrenoverades. Vi hade byggjobbare utanför fönstret hela veckan. Riktigt tråkig receptionspersonal som valde att ge oss ett dåligt placerat rum. De bryr sig verkligen inte om sina gäster. All övrig personal var dock toppentrevliga.

title: Great hotel
text: We have just had a weeks stay at the Manhattan Club. We stayed in a Junior Suite which was big enough for our needs. The room was very clean and was cleaned daily. Didn't try any of the food. The location was perfect a few minutes walk from Times Square and Central Park. Would definitely recommend.

title: Very nice hotel overall.  Near everything
text: This hotel is very nice and quiet overall.  It's near everything: 2 blocks away from Central Park, half a block away from the subway, across the street from Carnegie Hall, walking distance to The Metropolitan Museum, broadway district, Times Square and the list goes on.  The only down side is that you don't really get a full view of Central Park  but you can partially see it from your window.  I recommend staying here if you have kids or even if. you don't.

title: Well located
text:
The Manhattan Club is a perfect fit for travelling families like we were (party of 8, french family). The rooms and bathrooms are clean and the bedding is comfortable. 
We had 3 junior suites, these were not too small not too big, just à little damp due to the lake of a good glazing like a lot of places in the USA. 
This hotel is very well located just near Central Park, and it was wonderful being here for Christmas.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Excellent hotel. Très bien situé entre Central Park et Times Square. Chambre (suite familiale) parfaite pour une famille de 5 personnes, très propre. A améliorer : pas de menu de boissons, cocktail au bar de l'hôtel.

title: Excellent séjour
text:
Nous avons vécu un excellent séjour dans cet hôtel. Il possède de nombreux avantages, la localisation à deux rues de central Park, d'un super "deli premier", à quelques rues de Times Square, l'accueil chaleureux et la gentillesse du personnel qui a toujours le sourire particulièrement Bojan et Yamil au petit déjeuner et les chambres spacieuses,très bien équipées.C'est un hôtel à dimension humaine où le client est considéré. 
Nous avons été enchanté et nous n'hésiterons pas à choisir à nouveau cet hôtel pour un prochain séjour !

title: Great location and service
text: Excellent spacious room and service,staff very courteous and helpful. Wi Fi and internet service in room somewhat spotty. Lobby too small and cramped, Porters very helpful and friendly. Resort fee of  $50 per day is rather high considering limited benefits mainly Wi Fi

title: Fantastisch, schoon en rustig hotel. Perfecte ligging!
text: We hebben genoten van de schone en ruime kamer. Van alle gemakken voorzien. Ruimte genoeg, compleet uitgeruste kitchenette en een heerlijk bed. De wifi was prima en er was een schone en ruime badkamer. En je kon je in alle rust terugtrekken! De ligging is perfect, binnen 10 minuten sta je op Broadway en Times Square. We zouden als we terug gaan naar New York dit hotel wéér kiezen!

title: Belle semaine à NY
text:
L’appart hôtel est très bien situé, dans un quartier vivant mais au calme, à deux pas de Times Square et Central Parc, à pied même avec des enfants. L’accueil est parfait, personnel pro et attentif. Les chambres sont propres, avec tout le confort nécessaire et spacieuses, ce qui est rare à Manhattan ! 
Super rapport qualité prix je recommande vivement !

title: Fabulous location, pleasant accommodations.....a quiet & comfortable spot to stay in NYC
text: We've stayed at the Manhattan Club several times, & will again. It is a small, older boutique hotel, located at 200 W 56th St...... just 3 blocks south of Central Park, & sided by 7th Ave.& across from Carneige Hall. There is nothing fancy about the lobby and/or rooms, but , they are clean & accomodating.....just a bit dated in decor! Nice , but not swanky , in the least.

title: New York Icon
text: Stay here for the first time. Wonderful staff when checking in. Room was ready when we got there. Clean and smelled good. Lots of room in the Penthouse with a small kitchenette. Deco was done nicely, not outdated. Would go back and stay longer.

title: Pior hotel de Nova York
text: Os funcionários são extremamente grosseiros e mal educados. Não possuem a menor vontade de ajudar seus hóspedes. Estragaram minha viagem a Nova York. Não recomendo a ninguém este hotel! Tive um problema com a minha reserva. Reservei e paguei um tipo de quarto e chegando no hotel me disseram que no sistema constava um quarto inferior ao que eu já havia pago. Apresentei meu voucher comprovando minha compra e reserva, mas negaram o documento, e ainda usaram serviços dos seguranças do hotel para intimidar meu pai e a mim.

title: Très bien placé
text:
Points positifs:
- suites très spacieuses avec kitchenette et salon 
- très bien placé à 2 pas de Time square
- la gentillesse du Responsable des petits déjeuners
- isolation sonore correcte

Points négatifs:
- amabilité du personnel à l’accueil moyenne
- 2 ascenseurs pour 26 étages donc attente certaine
- le petit déjeuner: système de « panier » de 3 items à choisir hors boisson et à emporter dans sa chambre.
- petit déjeuner de qualité très moyenne: salade de fruits sans goût, viennoiseries pas top..
- chambres à « rafraîchir »: la porte de la sdb fermait mal, pas de lumière dans la kitchenette, fenêtres mal isolées
- pas de peignoirs la première nuit. Il a fallu les réclamer le lendemain
- sèche cheveux avec un cordon électrique de 50 cm
- la vaisselle est lavée: parfait mais elle est emportée et pas remplacée donc, en ce qui nous concerne, pas de tasses le lendemain matin

title: Heart of the city
text:
This is a nice, clean hotel in the heart of the city. Anything anyone wants to see in NY is within easy access to this hotel. The staff was courteous and friendly. The suite we stayed in was small but there aren’t too many affordable things in NY that aren’t. Even the elevators and halls were narrow. 

We had a king-size bed in its own room and a queen modern pull out. There were also two full baths. The kitchenette has dishes, micro, mini fridge and dishwasher.  There was also a small eating table w three chairs. 

The gym was excellent as well as the lounge. Both on the top floor. 

Parking was valet only at $35/24hrs. No in and out access. Metro was a couple of blocks away. 

There was intermittent street noise of some sort all night so if a light sleeper, recommends earplugs. 

Overall I would stay again but only in a suite. I can’t imagine how much smaller a regular room would be.

title: Royal Holiday members
text:
This is the second time we've stayed here through our vacation club.  
The location is great.  Right across from Carnegie Hall.  Close to Broadway shows and Central Park.  
The room was neat and clean. The bed was really comfortable. I like the little nice touch of popcorn in the room!  
The lounge on the 26th floor is great to sit and relax.  They serve coffee, tea and cookies every afternoon too!
We would definitely stay here again!

title: Beautiful NYC
text:
Location perfect for plays, close to central park and Carnegie Hall. Excellent restaurants in area and close to major bus stops. Lobby staff very nice
 Right exit out of Hotel took you through another lobby that pit you around the corner. Nice in case of rain or cold weather

title: Great location but
text: Location is really only nice thing about resort. Prepare to spend $8.00 for the bottle of water in tour room. In order to keep the room comfortable the windows have to be open, which also lets all the outside noise in. We were not impressed with this resort.

title: Tankful and gratitude
text: I booked this last minute on Hotwire. My low price paid was 55% less than published price. Accommodations were fantastic. Clean, quiet, comfortable bed and linens. Great location located across street Carnegie hall, who could ask for more?

title: Amigas en NYC
text:
Excelente hotel 
Lo recomiendo 
Limpieza: muy buena
Atención: excelente 
Celeridad: excelente 
Cerca de todo
En pleno corazón de Manhattan 
Seguro
Terraza: excelente 
Que más decir....
Vayan 
Gracias por esos 10 días de estadía

title: God beliggenhed
text: God beliggenhed. Vi betalte for morgenmad, men fik kun grab-n-go. Ikke lige hvad vi forventede. Vi var tre personer, men der var kun gjort klar til to. Det udbedrede de dog. Værelserne er lidt slidte.

title: Terric property in a PERFECT location!!!!
text: We enjoyed the room, the staff, and the location to the attractions, museums, the park. It's so nice to stay at this property and hope to be back again soon. It's been delightful to have family and friends come see us and convenient for them to find us. We had a great week.

title: Thumbs up.
text: Great property, perfect location, you can pretty much walk to everything, the theater district, restaurants and bars. The shopping in the area is the best in the city. The cleaning staff did an amazing job.

title: the manhattan club
text: This was my second time staying in Manhattan Club,  had the best time ever.  Friendly atmosphere ,  comfortable bed, nice & clean.   You are in the heart of the Manhattan.  I wish I can come every year, unfortunately with RCI I am allowed to return every 4 years.  Hope , the policy will change, so I can return every year.  LOVE IT...........

title: New York, at it's best
text: This is an ideal location, close to New York City highlights and conveniently located with excellent public transportation around New York City.  Close to ethnic restaurants and all types of eating establishments.

title: Disappointed
text: Be aware that the photos on the website aren't what you will get. The room I booked was called a suite and the photo showed something completely different than what I was given. They put me in a room barely big enough for the bed and loveseat that were there and it's definitely not a suite. Also the A/C blows warm air. The TV reception was also very spotty

title: Très bien
text: Nous avons passer un séjour dans cet hôtel avec notre fils de 6 ans et c’était juste parfait l’hôtel est très très bien situé et les prestations sont parfaites! La chambre était spacieuse et fonctionnelle ! Merci

title: Nice hotel
text: Loved the apartment style rooms. Separate living room, 1 bedroom with 2 baths, full kitchen so you can cook. Great staff very helpful if you have any questions. Have been at this hotel 4 times already. Only complaint is that they have only 2 elevators which only hold about 4 people inside(very small) and they are always crowded, waiting time is long to get into the elevators.

title: Fantastic place to stay
text:
My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights last week. 
Great hotel. Great location. Great staff. Great value. 
Thoroughly recommend staying here. Have stayed in many places in NYC and for the price, this was the best. A third of the price of other major hotels. 
Go for a suite. It isn't much more expensive and you have so much more room.

title: Great Staff. Great Location.  POOR building upkeep.
text: The resort staff was most excellent.  By far the best thing about the resort. Location was also good.  Resort has outdated décor.  Wall paper in bathroom was pealing due to mold.  Not a bad stay, but unless it is updated, will not stay here again.

title: Okay Hotel
text: The Manhattan Club has a very good location, and helpful staff,  Some are friendly.  The rooms are not that great.  the room that we stayed in has poor drainage in the shower, when it got fixed.  The sink in their mini kitchen became clogged.  for the price that they charge, they should have nice bathrooms that are working even if their rooms are old

title: Wonderful Hotel in the Centre of New York
text:
My daughter and I stayed in the Manhattan Club at the beginning of December.   It is a wonderful hotel and the staff are helpful and fantastic.   We in stayed in a beautiful suite with two rooms, kitchenette and a lovely large bathroom.   Everything about the hotel is fantastic and can't wait to return there again.

We would highly recommend this hotel

title: 場所、部屋はいい
text:
ロケーションは良い所です、7Thストリートに近いしどこに行くにもアクセスは良い。カウントダウンもホテルのカードを見せて横入出来た。
ただ、扉の開閉音がうるさくて隣近所の音が響いた。
後は散歩するにも安全でいい場所だと思う。
今は外壁の工事中で2日から煩かったのが残念。
エレベーターが混む。

title: CITY treap
text: Très belle suite en plein cœur de Manhattan . Un véritable coup de cœur lors de ce deuxième séjour à New York , l’emplacement est parfait tout prêt de Times square et du rockfeiller center ainsi que de central parc nous avons quasi tout fait à pieds . Le petit déjeuner était assez varié et très bon , la chambre récente très grande et pratique avec son salon et sa cuisine , pas de soucis de bruit et personnel très sympathique .

title: Very Nice!
text: The location is centrally located to most of the main attractions and close to the subway entrance for those places that would be too far to walk. The room was very nice and clean. It did get a little too warm for us but we were able to turn the unit off and open the window a bit to cool it off. The bell hop, Ishmael, was so very nice. Not only did he help with our luggage but he also took it upon himself to call a particular restaurant to see if it was open, since it was Christmas Day, to save us a walk, because it was the end of the day and he could tell we were tired. When he found out it was closed, he referred us to a restaurant within a short walking distance that was very good. He also gave us a map of the subway and helped us with directions to get to the ferry. Every one that we encountered in the hotel, was friendly. Very nice experience for our first trip to the big city!

title: Beautiful New York
text: Location! Location! Location!  The Manhattan Club in centrally located and within walking distance of everything I wanted to do in New York.  As an RCI resort, it is the place to stay!  We stayed in a non-renovated room which was acceptable.

title: Loved It!
text:
We own points as an associate with this hotel! It was a nice place (older and a little outdated) located near everything you would want to see. We walked everywhere (Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, 5th Avenue, etc...). If we couldn’t walk it, we took the subway (lower Manhattan). 

It was great being close to everything and it allowed us to go back and forth to our room to rest up. 

The staff was amazing, super nice, and extremely helpful in every way!

title: Hotel bien ubicado
text:
Acabamos en este hotel después de que nos cancelaran nuestro Air Bnb... El hotel está muy bien ubicado y las habitaciones son espaciosas, tienen cocina, televisión y en nuestro caso una cama grande y un sillón cama.
La atención en la recepción es buena. La habitación que nos asignaron no era la mejor, pero por el precio que pagamos y la ubicación del mismo tampoco nos podemos quejar.
Estuvimos alojados en la primera planta. El hotel cuenta con dos ascensores.
Si quieres estar cerca de Central Park y otros lugares de interés en Nueva York, sin duda este hotel calidad-precio (teniendo en cuenta que es Manhattan) al menos cuando nosotros lo cogimos es bastante ajustado. No hablan español

title: Wonderful stay
text:
My wife and I returned to NYC after a 20 year hiatus. We wanted it all including a comfortable place to call home for three nights following very full days in New York. 
We found it at the Manhatten Club. We were given a Junior Suite ..a clean comfortable place to relax with a separate bedroom an a kitchen.. Our package included a bagged breakfast each morning with a great selection of choices. Every  hotel staff we spoke to were polite and courteous. When we return, it will not be to a cramped NYC hotel room. Manhatten Club is a great alternative.

title: Great location
text:
Upgraded to a small suite with king bed. Only window is a small one in the sitting area. Heat was on in the building and the room thermostat showed 75. No way to cool it down except to open window. Since the temps were in the thirties and forties, it was a bit uncomfortable. We had them turn off the heat in our room.
Breakfast is in room. You pick up three items and beverage. That was ok with us.
Personnel was pleasant; we felt safe. Bed was very  comfy and water was hot. The room was extremely clean.

title: Manhattan Club in December
text: Conveniently located near restaurants, entertainment, transportation. Parking is $35 per day, no in/out privileges. $245 for week.  We went the 2nd week of December and attended several plays, Radio City Christmas Show, saw "the tree" after the show. Taxis abound but Uber/Lyft cheaper. As a timeshare you can have meals such as breakfast in your room with the partial kitchen. We enjoyed our own wine & cheese happy hours b4 heading out for the night. Flat screens in L/R and B/R.  Bed was comfortable and there was a pullout sofa if we had children or guests. Room was slightly warm even turning down the thermostat. Room was cleaned and made daily. Room was on an upper floor. It was called an "L shaped" studio which in effect is a studio in a T configuration with the bedroom. No door seperating the bedroom. Since it was the Holiday Season area traffic was significant and drivers honk in NYC. That is life there. Sine we are originally from NY, we are used to it and tune it out. There is nothing quiet in NYC. Total cost of trip was 60 RCI points, $245 for week of parking, 7 days of daily Hotel fees $381, plus tips to get in/out maid. Concierge available for questions/planning. If going during the holidays make your dinner reservations 6-8 weeks ahead. Long waits at restaurants between Thurs & Sun from 4-8pm.

title: Units were typical timeshare Unit except a bit smaller.
text: The staff did their jobs well. Many hotels lend you an umbrella if it is raining, this hotel did not provide this service. If you are RCI exchange, they charge 60 poitn for a week AND THEN charge you an INHOSPITABLE "Hospitality fee" of $54 per day for minimal services that  are typical of any normal hotel/timeshare.(small exercise room, business center, shampoo etc). Then you pay extra for  parking,  It was disturbing!!

title: Excellent hotel, location, and room. Minutes from everything exciting
text: The room was spacious and clean. The staff was excellent. We can’t wait to go back. We look forward to taking our kids next time. It’s right across from Carnegie Hall and minutes from other sites. The room was super spacious.

title: Too expensive for the kind of service provided
text: The only good thing I can tell about this resort is the location. Close to Central Park and other important places near the Rockefeller Center. The resort is old, the employees at front desk and bellboys are rude, not willing to help you, not even to open the door. Not a single time in 8 days. Hospitality fee of $47.00 daily for a poor service is too much.

title: Muy buen hotel
text: Excelentes habitaciones, muy amplias, las más amplias que conocí en NYC buena limpieza y mejor atención ideal para vacacionar en familia y cerca de todo, a dos cuadras del subte a JFK, llegas en 40 minutos al aeropuerto

title: New york
text: Posizione ottima, camere di buon livello  un po vecchiotte ma, comunque spaziose, la colazione lascia molto a desiderare costosa e pochissima scelta 20 dollari troppo per mangiare poco o nulla personale gentile

title: New YorkTTour
text: Our visit was for a one week exchange through RCI. Great facility and location, but very expensive, especially the mandatory hospitality fee. The continental breakfast was so expensive that we did not eat there. Access to public transportation was very good. Exterior room very noisy. Had to switch to interior room, which they kindly did.

title: Great place!
text:
Stayed for 3 nights and loved it! Had a executive jr suite and it was huge compared to New York hotel room usual standards. Fridge, microwave and dishwasher and dining table was so great!  Room was clean and had everything we needed. The outside of the windows were super dirty so hard to see out.

Included a takeaway breakfast which was perfect to take back to your room. Bagels, cereals, pancakes, yogurt and fruit. Was perfect to get the day started. 

Location was amazing!! So close to Central Park and a main subway station. 

Would def stay again!!

title: too many extra charges
text: Not the best timeshare place to stay in NY.  Too many extra fee's, not real value when trading a timeshare . The Hilton Club down the street is much better if you can get a room. Everything about the Manhattan Club is costly

title: RCI経由で予約
text:
RCI経由でニューヨークのマンハッタンクラブに泊まってきました。

マンハッタンクラブをRCI経由で予約するとRCI Hospitality Feeというリゾートフィーがかかり他の税金と合わせて1泊につき54.51USDが加算されます。
問い合わせたところ部屋の大きさに関係なくRCIを使って予約をすると1泊につき加算されるそうです。

今回4泊だったのですが予約手数料で約20000円、RCI Hospitality Fee4泊分で約24000円ニューヨークのホテルは高いと思いますがマンハッタンクラブは普通に予約できるしお得感はなかったです。
RCI経由で予約される方はご注意を。
施設は古いですがバスタブ、レンジがあったのは寒い時期なので良かったです。
場所は便利ですが、フロントスタッフは愛想がよくありません。
ニコリともせずほとんど目を合わせる事なく早口で説明のみ。
ハウスキーピンクの方はどの方も感じが良かったです。

title: Nice hotel with good staff and great location
text: We had a very nice time at this hotel. All the staff were friendly and helpful and especially the concierge who  helped with any question we had. We would be happy to go here again Our room was nice and the maids cam by daily and kept our space in good shapeonly negative there were not many hangers to keep our clothes in the closet

title: HOW TO GET RIPPED OFF!
text:
I made a reservation for The Manhattan Club on West 56th Street in Manhattan   through Hot Wire, on their "special hot deal" offering. I bought the cancellation insurance, just to be sure I was protected. I am scheduled to arrive on Sunday November 17th and leave Tuesday November 19th. 

When I found out that the hotel was the Manhattan Club and based on prior experience, I immediately tried to cancel the reservation. It was less than thirty minutes from reservation to cancel request. 

The Manhattan Club refused to cancel and return my money. Hot wire refused to return my money unless I agreed to accept the money in credit for another Hot Wire use in the future. 

The insurance company Aliance (spelling) Global had conditions that I did not meet unless I agreed to lie about the reason for my cancellation. 

The reason for my immediate calcellation is that the Manhattan Club is from previous experience, a toilet, with management that equals the toilet description. 

The Hot Wire on-line ad was deceiving and the Aliance Global cancellation insurance was a total fraud. Unless you actually take the time to read the "hidden" small print, the $14.00 premium to insure yourself incase of a cancellation is a complete lie. 

My warning to all who travel....Travel without Hotwire and Aliance Global. The few dollars saved is completely lost if you ever have to depend on the courtesy, honesty and dependability of Hot Wire or Aliance Global. The Manhattan Club is at the very bottom of the garbage can.

title: Location was the best!
text:
Four of us went to New York City for a girls week.  From the moment we walked in the doors of the Manhatten Club we felt welcomed and comfortable. The staff were efficient, helpful and extremely friendly.  The room was very clean and spacious.  The couch bed was very comfortable.  The housekeeping staff were outstanding and met our every need with efficient friendly service. The lounge on the 26th floor was very elegant and beautiful. All staff were honest.  One of the girls left her purse in the lounge with a lot of money in it and it was turned in and returned in tact.
 
We couldn't have stayed in a more perfect  placed for doing the New York scene!!  We highly recommend it.
 
The location could not be better.  We were within walking distance to Central Park, Broadway, TimeSquare and much more.  We used the Hop on Hop off bus to tour the city....a great added amenity.

title: Great Location for Upper Midtown
text: We were very fortunate months ago to book RCI timeshare exchange for 4 nights/kitchen suite only being charged for typical local taxes and a daily resort fee. Enough good restaurants, transporttion access and short walking distaces.

title: Favorite place to stay in NYC!
text: We’ve stayed here several times, and it’s our favorite place to stay. Great location, and you can’t beat the price for the size unit you get. I only wish they’d update the furniture/carpets. I’ve never gotten a suite as fresh looking as the photos. I assume those are saved for the owners, but even some new carpet in the others would go a long ways.

title: Migliorabile
text: Io e il mio ragazzo abbiamo pernottato nella junior suite per sette notti. La camera è molto spaziosa e la posizione dell'hotel è ottima, con dieci minuti a piedi si è a times square. La nota negativa è la pulizia  che non è molto accurata anche per via della presenza di moquette.

title: The room was spectacular and clean. Three of us had plenty of space
text: Three ladies went to New York City for a weekend. The Manhattan club was fantastic, from the front desk help, to the upstairs bar and lounge area which had spectacular views.  The location was perfect for catching subways or walking to your upper Manhattan events.

title: Comfortable, convenient stay in New York City
text: The Manhattan Club provides a "home away from home" experience in the city.  Accomodations are spacious, each with a dishwasher, refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave.  The beds are comfortable and there are plenty of windows. The common lounge has a bar, breakfast, newspapers and televisions.  The entire staff, from concierge to housekeeping, is outstanding.  Conveniently located with all public transportation nearby.

title: Fantastic Location
text: My first impressions of New York was wow the place is crazy busy, The Manhattan Club is in a fantastic location close enough to Times Square to walk same as Broadway shows, the friendliest staff would definitely stay again

title: Clean and Well located But !
text:
Nice clean hotel But watch out for adjoining rooms. We were woken at 11.30 pm when our neighbors arrived and were loud until 1am.
Contacted the front desk with no resolve as hotel was fully booked and talked with the morning manager who refused to offer any discount for our inconvenience.
Lots of other places to stay for future visits.

title: Great "Home" when visiting NYC
text: Nice, efficient, satisfying unit - Loved that it was within walking distance of two subway lines and close to Central Park.  We liked the convenient location in mid-town Manhattan.  While we were there only a week, we got to see so much of NYC.  Came home every night exhausted, and found the conveniences of the unit most welcome - so much better than a hotel room.  Even though we just had a studio, the bed was separate from the living/dining/kitchen area, so had some privacy and separation while sleeping.  Would definitely visit again.

title: Great place
text:
Right down the street from Carnegie Hall, this hotel is also nearby some great restaurants as well as only a short walk from Times Square. The staff were all very pleasant and the accommodations were great. Even the pull out couch was quite comfortable. We stayed in a penthouse suite, so I can’t speak to other rooms but I’m sure the quality is throughout. They also have a cozy lounge available to those staying there as well. 

Also...I’ve never been to a hotel where I liked the shampoo brand so much I actually found them online and ordered it.

title: Manhattan Club - centrally located with nice restaurants nearby
text:
We enjoyed our stay - walked to Time Square every day, walked to the Broadway shows on 45th street, walked to the Museums in Central Park on 80th street and to the Metropolitan Opera Theatre on about 72nd ?) street.
We would stay there again.

title: Another Fantastic Visit
text:
Our family of four just finished our 3rd stay at this property. We love it every time.  Location: Steps away from the Subway, 2 blocks from the entrance to Central Park, and a 10 min walk to Times Square.  Staff is friendly and accommodating. Our room is always clean. Even the carpets pass the white sock test. It's a pleasure to be able to spread out after a long day exploring. The sofa bed in the living room is probably the best one we have encountered in a Hotel.  Kids slept fine.
Amenities: The largest suite you will find for the money, including 2 full bathrooms, a kitchenette and separate bedroom.  Traveling with young children we often don't want to sit down in a restaurant for dinner, but instead return to the room to relax.  Within 2 blocks of the property is a full service supermarket (next to Carnegie Hall) with hot food bar and delicious deli/bakery.  You can find everything you need.  The hotel provides in room coffee & tea daily w/ cleaning.  We can wake and feed the kids before heading out for the day.  It's very quiet (have never heard neighboring guests).  For added convenience, there is a Wash n Fold 1 1/2 blocks away and a brand new TJ Maxx store 2 blocks away (you never know what gets left at home).  I love that we can walk south to Times Square in 10 min and find a myriad of restaurants and Broadway Shows-- Or walk North and be in Central Park in less than 10 minutes.  This is our East Coast home away from home.

title: Wonderful!
text: Great suites in a very central NYC location - close to. Columbus Circle, Carnegie Hall, Times Square and much more. Each suite has its own kitchen, nicely equipped. The staff is extremely nice and friendly and the concierge is very helpful. We’ll definitely come again.

title: Great staff and lovely hotel
text:
We stayed 4 nights my son and i
Staff so polite and helpful and lovely room cleaned very well
Good location 
Will return soon 
Kitchen area with dishwasher and microwave 
Lovely shower 
Only problem were rooms are sooo hot and aircon didnt circulate

title: Old Property
text:
My parents have a BlueGreen membership so we stayed here for business travel.  The location was great for us as we were exhibiting at the Javitz but this property just feels super dated.  The vibe in the property is old and tired.  The room, while clean was SO dated (gold fixtures everywhere) super dark etc...  It smelled like the air hasn't moved in the property for some time.  In addition, I had issues with the concierge staff.  I was running to the airport to catch a flight and called to let the concierge know were near in our taxi and if they could bring our luggage up to expedite the process it would be helpful.  To say the least, it was handled poorly and rudely.

I will not be back.

title: Over the Moon
text:
The staff was friendly and very accommodating.  The hotel was close to everything and easy to get around.  The gym was nice and clean for my work outs.  Breakfast was tasty.
The business center was nice and clean and very helpful for our visit.

title: Perfect Location
text: The Manhattan Club is the perfect location for a week stay in the city. Close to Central Park, Times Square and the subway. I traded using RCI so I have to complain that an extra $381 fee was added to the stay for an amenities fee, nothing other than housekeeping was provided, so go figure. All in all, a good stay with comfortable beds. Close to everything! Of course, as always, one of the elevators went down while I was there. This has happens every time I have stayed there and that’s been multiple times. Otherwise, good choice for the city.

title: East West Vacation
text: Like the location as its near Columbus Circle, Central Park, etc. Decent Size Room with Double Beds,  The  sleep quality is average. Specifically in my room, first we had room facing another room. Moved to another room facing the street, but we got dump truck "singing" every morning as a plus, hehehe.

title: Enjoy NYC for the holidays
text: Great location for walking anywhere...NYC is magical at Christmas.  Clean room, friendly staff , a little pricey. Valet parking is reasonable and very good. Nice bar and room for enjoying cookies and tea or coffee in the afternoon...nice, relaxing break.

title: Surprise guests
text: The armchair in my room had fleas.  I called the front desk and they sent someone to remove it right away.  Unfortunately I had already been bitten by them; so I had to take some allergy medication for the bites.  The beds were fine and I had no issue with the linen.  Next time I will request a pet-free room.

title: Manhattan Club
text: Great location and great rooms. Staff is very helpful and courteous. Very busy so, availability is a problem. If you can get a time you like, grab it. I just keep trying and hope something opens up. Again, a great place and near everything in New York City.

title: Not quite what you would expect
text: We were graciously upgraded to a penthouse. However, the constant banging from the elevator system made it unbearable so we moved to a 1 bedroom suite.  Heating system is for the entire building so some rooms are warm and some are not.  While the rooms are spacious and well appointed quality is lacking.  I’ve had better bath towels in a Doubletree. The windows are single pane glass.  Therefore street noise is quite loud and NYC always has a lot of noise.  2 elevators for a 26 story building means a long wait especially during checkout time if you are on a lower floor good luck having room enough to get on.

title: Muy buen appart, con excelente ubicación
text:
Estuvimos con mi esposa e hija en una habitación del piso 21... Muy bien acondicionado todo. Todo impecable y con una cocina chiquita a la que solo le faltaba una pava eléctrica. No viene con anafe pero comprábamos comida en un supermercado que esta muy cerca y la calentábamos en el microondas...
Muy recomendable

title: Hotel that's in need of major upgrade
text:
Junior suite booked was of reasonable size. But floor carpet is old n musty. One of 2 elevators were non operational for the 3 nights we stayed. It's totally unacceptable, lift is small, guests with luggages waited 10 to 15' for lift. We have to resort to using the service elevators sharing with hotel maintenance staff with their trolleys.

Housekeeping was good though.
Location was good, closed to Central Park n restaurants, subway.

title: Good Location
text: The staff was great! This old hotel has been renovated and while the rooms are smaller and well presented the lighting is awful especially in the bathroom. Ambient light only is not good for putting on makeup and with no vent in there everything is wet when you come out of the shower. However the real downer was no real coffee pot. I expect something more than the cheap ones you find in motels. And, at this price I also expect not to use plastic cups. Would I stay here again? NO!

title: The Manhattan Club 200 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019-4300
text: I and my wife with our tour group of 44 persones stay in this Hotel. The staff natur ewas very good as well as polite. The food quality was also very good and as per indian styal. The rooms with toilet also very good.

title: Excellent base in Manhattan New York.
text: The Manhattan Club is an excellent base for walking to many tourist places or the subway to get to more distant places. Very helpful staff, good rooms, common lounge, gym and business room on premises.

title: Pretty typical high-end NY hotel
text: The hotel was very clean, and the bed was comfortable. The staff were very nice. I appreciated the free WiFi. The hotel is very close to Times Square and scores of restaurants. The hotel offers a valet service, but I did not use it.

title: Une suite à NY Oui c est possible!
text: Quelle claque! Un appart hôtel dans NY avec coin cuisine (lave vaisselle compris!) salon élégant avec canapé (super confortable), table en verre, 2 sdb, 2 wc et une chambre canon avec lit King size méga confortable que ce soir la literie, l oreiller ou la couette. Le petit dej (grab & Go) à emporter (une boisson chaude et 3 items) est largement suffisant. Bref je n irai dorénavant que dans cette hôtel pour les futurs séjours à NY

title: Parfait en tout
text:
Tellement de compliment à faire, le volume de la chambre est parfait, le coin cuisine agréable et très bien aménagé, la literie est parfaite et l’emplacement de l’hôtel semble idéal. Le petit déjeuner à emporter est de qualité et suffisant en quantité. 
Nous reviendrons avec plaisir et sans regarder ailleurs.

title: Quick 3 Day Trip to NYC
text: The Manhattan Club worked out great for just the 2 of us. It’s in a great location for walking around and central to the subway. We received great tips from the concierges desk. We really liked PJ Carney’s restaurant, Premier Deli and the Buttercup bakery. We visited the Statue of Liberty, Ellis island, the 911 Memorial.

title: Used to be so nice... Not anymore
text: The MC is a timeshare that has been mismanaged by  management  company.  Please do Not buy anything from this unscrupulous bunch of people. The funds the timeshare company got from the owners was not applied to upgrading the rooms which remain dark and dank.

title: My trip to Manhattan
text: Great area to everything, restaurants, central park, Broadway or just to walk and soak up the city. The Manhattan club was Great in all respect and amenities, The room was generous in size and well designed and furnished. We wished we could stayed longer but we will definitely be going back.

title: Enjoyed
text: We own at Manhattan Club where you can use an individual day at a time. Love coming back to a familiar place we're the people are kind and courtesy of your needs. The rooms are Clean, spacious bedroom, two bathrooms, kitchen and living area with pull out couch. Close to Broadway plays, central park, shopping on 5th Ave and restaurants galore. Highly recommend.

title: Great Vacation
text: Being from the west coast,  my wife and I enjoyed our daily walks in central park and bring new Yorkers for a week.  I always wondered why "they" say new Yorkers are friendly.   They just are,  especially at the Manhattan Club.

title: bon accueil, chambre propre et bien équipée
text:
Emplacement de l'hôtel très proche de Central Park et Carnegie Hall, un peu plus éloigné de Time Square.
Accueil agréable. Mini-suite bien équipée et propre, quoiqu'un peu vieillotte. La cuisinette est appréciable. La salle de bain est grande, propre et bien équipée.
J'ai demandé un étage élevé pour éviter le bruit. La chambre était au 16° côté cour (ce qui implique un mur 10 mètres face aux fenêtres) donc très au calme et un peu sombre ... mais c'est New York ! Pas de souci de bruit des voisins, donc soit ils étaient respectueux, soit les chambres sont bien isolées !

title: Our 38th Anniversatry in New York
text:
Ther resort was excellent, it was located near Central Park, Times Square, basically it was the perfect location for us. we enjoy the stay at the Manhathan Club in New York
The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The cleaning crew were very dedicated to their jobs and wanted to help every time possible.

title: Worth the price & great location
text: Located in Midtown, near Columbus Circle & Central Park.  We stayed in a suite - king bed, 2 baths, 2 closets, mini kitchen for a week.  Close to subway lines & tons of restaurants, bakeries, shopping, etc.  Staff very courteous.  Room very clean.  Bed comfortable.

title: Was charged with $350 USD of damages
text: The location of this place is amazing, less than one block away from Times square. It's location can make it noisy. The hotel is a little old but the staff was friendly. Overall the experience was good unfortunately I noticed an additional 350 USD charge when arriving home. When I called the hotel I was directed to the manager who explained me there were damages in the room when I left. As much as I insisted this was not me. He still proceeded with charging me. I stayed for seven days and did not do any damages (used the room only to sleep). Today I'm still struggling to get this charge removed.

title: Margaret
text: Location and staff very good but room was a disappointment. Quite dark with old decor. Carpet looked stained and also rotten near bar fridge as was wood work. DidnWifi want to walk on it without shoes. Wifi not good and lifts small and slow

title: Poor Customer Service
text: I accidently booked a non-refundable room through a 3rd-party agency online  but didn't notice the date I booked it for.  I hit the button that I thought would take me to dates.  Upon discovering the error, I notified the 3rd-party agency that I needed to change the dates on the reservation.  They informed me that the hotel could not accommodate me for all the dates I needed because they were totally booked.  I explained I needed to cancel the 1 night I accidently booked and they turned around immediately to notify the hotel.  Because it was night time and they were unable to reach the correct person, the hotel wouldn't cancel the reservation.  When someone was reached, they refused to issue a refund.  So, instead of trying to rent the room for 1 night when they had 4 days to due this when the hotel was extremely busy, they took the easy way out and just kept my money.  When I called to speak with them, they were "sorry, but it was non-refundable and we can't do anything about it."  So much for customer service.  It was one night and they could have had someone occupy the room.  I won't do busy with them again and caution everyone to be extremely careful when booking online.

title: Rude and patronizing staff. Place smells mouldy and musky.
text: Rude staff. Building old with a mouldy and musky smell. The drains were all blocked and maintenance came to clear but still issues. Unclear and misleading stating breakfast is provided but take away only for 2 (although booked for 4) and we were not permitted to eat in the lounge / dining area. Staff advised to pick 3 items and they packed them up for you in plastic containers creating so much land waste because they don't want to wash a plate.

title: Roomy enough studio in midtown
text: This is our second time staying at the Manhattan Club and we have been very happy each time.   The amount of space in the studio for the price you pay is an excellent value.    The furnishings are a tad worn and the sleeper sofa is not very comfortable to sit on.  We didn't try sleeping on it, so cannot comment.  However, the location cannot be beat.  The little kitchenette is functional.   The reception staff is great.  The housekeepers are thorough and unobtrusive.  The lounge on the 26th floor is a perfect place to wait while your unit is being prepared.   We were on the 21st floor, which is great to be above the constant street noise (cars and taxis honking!)

title: Great location and accomodations
text: We took our 14 year-old son to NYC for spring break and stayed in a 1 bedroom suite room.  The accommodations were amazing for a hotel in NYC - a separate bedroom/living room and 2 full bathrooms.   We loved the staff and the location.  It was perfect. Only downfall was meeting someone who was a member of the Manhattan club in the elevator and having them complain that they rent the rooms to "people like us" for way cheaper than they pay for their membership. We didn't let that rain on our parade though! I highly recommend The Manhattan Club for NYC stays and will definitely consider it for our next trip.

title: Vieillot
text: Hôtel bien situé mais vieillot. Accueil pas du tout sympathique, la première chose que l'on vous demande c'est 300 dollars de caution. Ne pas accepter les chambres dans les bas étages.Seul le concierge est sympa.

title: Great place to stay !
text: Went on a girls trip and we loved this place .very convenient location ! Great staff and even a cute bar with wonderful bartenders too . Beds were comfortable and front desk was helpful too . We have stayed in several different places in the city and this was by far our favorite . We didn’t do the breakfast and there were places all around the hotel to eat from walk in fast food to dinners . Easy walk to everything you need . No complaints at all , going again in December .

title: Amazing
text: We stayed on The Manhattan Club for a week. It was perfect from every angle. It is on the most central point, two min walking from Times Square and just two blocks away from Central Park. Clean, cozy and really unforgettable.

title: Muy buena ubicación, muy buena atención!
text:
Todo en este hotel es agradable, muy buena ubicación, a 2 cuadras de la 5ta avenida, a 5 cuadras del Times Square. Los empleados del front desk, los botones, la gente de limpieza, todos son muy cálidos y siempre nos ayudaron mucho.
Por la tarde, dan merienda gratis hasta las 16 hs, todo es muy rico, y esa sala de estar es realmente un lujo. El gimnasio y la sala de PCs son geniales también. Muy recomendable para familias y gente grande.

title: 立地が良くて、部屋も快適！
text:
地下鉄E線7th Ave駅の7th Ave & 53rd St at NE cornerという出口から徒歩約４分。JFK空港からのアクセスも楽！

夏休み期間中なので、どのホテルも高くて、同じ位の料金ならここのスイートルームにしようと思って予約しました。

泊まった部屋は、２階にあったので、窓から外が覗けないようになっていましたが、広くて快適でした。
うれしいことに、バスルームが2つあって、お風呂もトイレも順番待ちしなくて済んだので良かったです。

Wi-Fiは使えましたが、ただ、アプリのビデオ通話とメールの送受信ができなかったことは不便に感じました。

泊まっている間に、ミュージカルThe Phantom of the Operaを観に行きました。

ホテルから劇場までは徒歩で約15分とのことでしたが、大勢の人で賑わっている夜のタイムズスクエアを通って行ったので、３０分近く掛かりました。早めに出掛けたから良かったです！

title: Todo bien
text: Nos alojamos mi famila y yo una semana y todo  bien la habitacion amplia y muy limpia los dos baños muy limpios la ubicacion a solo 10 minutos de times square, la unica pega que nuestra habitacion daba a un patio interior donde tienen las maquinas del aire acondicionado y se oyen bastante por la noche.

title: Hotel marchiato "GOLDEN KRAUN" nel centro di BIG APPLE, Super Service e Camere
text:
Il nostro appartamento con 2 camere  + servizi sito al 17mo piano è stato per noi una meraviglia. Tanto spazio e ogni giorno pulito (extra) con 2 letti matrimoniali grandi e da sogno (king sitze) ogni giorno con lenzuola cambiate. E che dire dei 2 bagni?  Semplicemente accoglienti con una mega doccia  (tutto in marmo) e una vasca per rilassarsi. Abbiamo girato a piedi nella City vedendo tutto. E poi la fermata del BIG BUS proprio di fronte all`Hotel è un grande privilegio. 3 giorni girati anche con il Big Bus con tempo fantastico, sole e tantissima gentilezza e senso di ospitalità da parte di tutti. Con la macchina arrivavamo davanti all`entrata del nostro
albergo e subito venivamo acccolti dal personale che allogiava l`auto in un garage. Comodità assoluta ripagata sempre da personale super gentile: certo il tutto ha un costo ma veramente in ragionevoli livelli medio alti. In fine dei conti siamo stati viziati per una settimana come dei veri protagonisti. Il mangiare in NY è la nota dolente che però abbiamo superato frequentando le numerose pasticcerie e panetterie nella Fifth Avenue che offrono torte squisite e sandwiches di ogni genere e per ogni gusto.La visita della Little Italy è un obbligo ma le nostre impressioni sono state deludenti: nessuno più conosce cosa sia un caffè (espresso) e del resto rivolgendoti in italiano non ti capiscono. Vedere servite delle pizze con aggiunta di spaghetti come contorno è sata la certezza che in quei ristoranti non mettiamo piede: peccato! Tanto più favolosi e genuini sono i ristoranti cinesi, che rispettano i loro piatti e tradizioni, così invece di mangiare nei ristoranti  italiani siamo finiti in quelli cinesi Chinatown dislocati esattamente di fronte a Littel Italy.
NY  è in trasformazione e ovunque si ristruttura e  si rinnova, cosa assolutamente necessaria per cui spesso anche a piedi ci sono intralci. La città è travolgente e da ritornarci.

title: Disappointed
text:
Drain flies in the room and toilet!

Asked twice for a solution, first time they apparently just sprayed insecticide and let them die on the towels.

Second time someone came and have a look, and told us he'll come back but never returned.

I asked for another room and told they're sold out. Why rent a room like this at the beginning?!

I gave 2 stars for the location, and the spacious (but dated) room.

title: Nice hotel but room needed updating
text:
We stayed here ad 2 couples in a 1 bed/lounge bed apartment. On arrival the front staff were approachable and pleasant, the guy behind the desk was polite but a bit stern, all business and not really pleasant.
Our apartment was on floor 25 and my first impression was its a bit small and needed updating, yhe kitchenette was not in good shape and the carpet stained in front of the fridge. The main bedroom was fairly large with a nice ensuite, the sofa bed in the lounge area was comfy and large enough. 
Whilst we were there they had scaffolding across the whole of the front of the hotel which although not a problem did spoil the views of Carnegie Hall and the street below.
The staff were excellent, rooms cleaned coffee replaced and bathroom cleaned.
Overall a nice stay in a nice hotel, just needed to update the room to get a 5 star rating. Would stay here again.

title: Great Location
text: Very Courteous Staff. Expedient Check-in.  Outstanding Location near Columbus Circle, Central Park, etc.  Clean  Decent Size Room with Double Beds, not Queens. More than enough room for 2 adults.   The bed was average, not plush,  thus sleep quality is average.
