Specifically in my room, I felt that the lighting was not good and I would have liked a vanity in the bathroom vs a pedestal sink.

title: Perfect location
text: The Manhattan Club is located close to the theater district, Central Park and many wonderful shopping spots and restaurants. The size of the studio unit is spacious, love having the half kitchen and little round kitchen table. The only complaint would be slow and small elevators

title: Great location and great hotel
text: We had a one bedroom/ two bath suite which provided everything we needed.  The master bath was black and white marble. The bed and sitting area were very comfortable and we had a dining table.  Staff was mostly very helpful.

title: Excellent Resort Hotel!
text: If you are lucky enough to get a match at this hotel, you will have spent many credits, but it will be worth it.  The hotel is in a perfect location for walking, subway and buses.  The unit is beautiful, not overly large but worked well,  The bed is very comfortable with fine linens and daily service.  You should not be disappointed.

title: Perfect location!
text: Great location - walking distance to Broadway shows, Central Park, good restaurants, etc.  We've stayed there over 8 times.  Really good bartender and courteous staff.  Try the elevators to the left of the registration desk for faster service.

title: Nice timeshare!
text: Nice place to stay with a great location! The people were nice and friendly. We were able to leave our luggage with the valet before checking in because we arrived early. The room wasn't too large and the view was facing the inner courtyard but we didn't spend much time in the room. There was a daily charge over and above the timeshare fee that was unusual. Overall a nice place to stay in NYC

title: muy agradable
text: que rico pasamos una semana y las habitaciones amplias, el servicio excelente,la limpieza de la habitacion, y los lugares comunes  muy limpios, las personas que atienden estan listas a resolver tus problemas, el desayuno bufet no tan variado, muy pobre para su precio

title: Cadre enchanteur
text:
Bonjour 
J ai bcp apprécié mon séjour à l l'hotel the Manhattan club emplacement idéal confort génial suite très très bien agencée ce qui me marque encore et le personnel avenant souriant et professionnel quel plaisir d avoir séjourné dans cet hôtel au sujet de la décoration moi je n ai rien
à redire et d ailleurs je l ai choisit pour ça je préfère ce type de déco plutôt la décoration moderne aseptisée et sans saveur, A savoir que je séjourne régulièrement à nyc notamment à l hotel new yorker decoration similaire et d ailleurs je pense changer de qg tellement que j ai apprécié l intimité du Manhattan. Ne changer rien

title: NYC Trip!!!
text: The Manhatten Club was located perfectly as we were able to walk to 90% of the places we wanted to see other than a couple of cab rides.  The MC staff and amenities were everything we could hope for an more.  Definitely give it 5/5 and recommend it to anyone considering staying there!!!

title: Bel hôtel et très bien situé
text:
Nous avions pris une suite City light pour 4 personnes. 
La chambre est bien équipée, assez spacieuse pour le temps que nous y passions chaque jours, et la salle d’eau avec la douche à l’italienne très grande. 
Mention très bien à la literie et au très grand lit de la chambre!
Les 2 prises USB disponibles dans la chambre sont un plus (pas besoin de se servir d’un adaptateur)
Dommage qu’il n’y ai pas de vrai table pour prendre un repas. 
Dommage aussi que l’enceinte audio ne soit pas compatible avec la nouvelle prise des iPhones. 
Le personnel est très agréable, et il est vraiment appréciable de pouvoir laisser ses bagages le dernier jour. 
On trouve pratiquement toutes les lignes de métro à proximité (assez pratique pour le départ pour rejoindre JFK en métro et Airtrain)
Central Park est à peine à 3mn de marche. 
Il y a aussi un petit supermarché une rue plus haut ‘vers le Carnegie Hall), et des restaurants de toutes sortes. 
Le seul bémol pour nous, raison pour laquelle nous ne donnerons pas 5 étoiles,c’est que notre chambre était au second étage, donc on entendait un peu les bruits de la rue et surtout la chambre était assez sombre!
En définitive, nous recommandons cet hôtel à 100%. 
Ça doit être un des meilleurs rapports qualité/prix/emplacement à Manhattan.

title: Great location
text: We stayed 14 days an saw lots of NYC.  Great location.  Convenient to public transportation.  Near Time Square and all the Broadway plays.  Great staff. Great places to eat close by.  Had a great time. Able to quickly take public transportation to airport.  Went to Statute of Liberty, Ellis Island, Staten Island Ferry, Broadway play, Central Park, 9/11 Memorial, United Nations, Museum of National History, Museum of the American Indian, Wall Street and Stock Exchange, and NY Public Library.

title: Excelent
text: I ve been many times in New York where the hotel prices are really high. Manhattan Club is really  a very good place to stay because the situation makes really easy to move to any place you like and the apartments are comfortables.

title: Great Lodging in NYC
text:
A great timeshare and hotel in NYC. Great courteous staff, outstanding location, just a few blocks from Central Park. Plenty of restaurants and attractions are within walking distance. A nice quiet bar on the top floor to relax and have a drink.
Also, very reasonable parking for NYC.  $35.00 / day

title: Location, Location, Location....was everything
text:
The Manhattan property was wonderful (right around the corner from Carnegie hall and within walking distance to Central Park).  The decor was great but my greatest pet peeves was the lack of customer service.  For example, no one explained the Concierge services, offered to take our bags to our room, or explaine how housekeeping worked.  We found a pamphlet on a table near the elevators on our floor (after our stay was almost over) that listed activites, tickets available through hotel, etc.  We had to figure out where the subway was, recommended restaurants and nearby activites on our own.  Sometimes staff in the lobby spoke and sometimes they didn't.  

Because there were 30+ floors and only two elevators the wait time was long and annoying.

title: The Manhattan Club made NYC stay enjoyable
text: We stayed a full week at The Manhattan Club. The unit was very spacious, clean, newly remodeled, with 2 full baths. Could not ask for anything more. It's 2 blocks from Central Park, about a mile to Time Square. We walked to the West Side, to the Met(Art Museum) and to Harlem, as well as the Vessel at Hudson Yards. We took the $2.75 per person subway to Chinatown and walked across the Manhattan Bridge to Brooklyn to the Dumbo area and took the $2.75 per person ferry back. The ferry made many stops before dropping us off at east 34th street, allowing us to see a few sights. We thoroughly enjoyed New York City partly because we had a nice place to stay.

title: スイートルーム
text:
マンハッタンにあるセントラルパークそばのそこそこ上等なホテルです。カーネギーホールの近くにあります。セントラルパークへの散歩の帰りにはホールフーズの高級食材マーケットもあれば、ニューヨークにはよくある本格的な惣菜屋さん、デリの店もあります。ここは部屋が広くミニキッチン、カトラリーグラス、ワインオープナーなどすべて備わっていて、滞在型の客にも対応しています。ベッドはふかふか、ソファベッドもとても良いです。 
朝食がクーポン制で、3品選択ドリンクは1品選び部屋に持ち帰っていただくことになります。最初は呆気にとられましたが、翌日からは慣れたものでフルーツをたっくさん載せてパンケーキ、実だくさんヨーグルト、カップにフルーツをたっくさん詰めて3品、飲み物はクランベリージュースにしました。
窓際にテーブルを動かし、工事現場や行き交うニューヨーカーを見ながらの朝食は刺激的でした。

title: UBICACION Y PUNTUALIDAD
text: Excelente ubicación del Hotel y el servicio es puntual con rapidez tanto en el check in o check out; Las habitaciones aunque no cuentan con vista tienen un muy buen tamaño; El servicio de botones brindan un gran apoyo y atencion.

title: Great Location, friendly staff. Clean rooms, the shower had very low water pressure.
text:
A downside was you could hear your neighbors through the adjoining room door!
You also are close to a corner of block where vendors had there trailers and sometimes they played their music quite loud!

title: Super emplacement pour visiter NY
text:
L’hôtel est parfait pour quelques jours à New York.
Il est situé sur la 56 St sur Broadway donc idéal pour tout visiter à pied, à côté de Central parc, Times square.... et avec les métros proches pour les sites plus éloignés.
L’Hôtel est ancien avec du charme, il était en réfection au niveau de la façade.
Nous étions au 23 ème et la chambre était suffisamment grande car nous étions 3 avec mon fils. 
Nous avons pu laisser nos valises gratuitement à la bagagerie le dernier jour pour profiter des dernières visites.
Conclusion : super séjour !

title: Great location
text:
We got a good deal including breakfast for 2 nights and we had a great stay. Perfect location, 2 min central park, 5 min times square, comfortable beds, clean room, great with kitchen and fridge.
Breakfast was nice to bring back to the room, we would visit again.

Only negative, long wait for elevator, took between 5 and 10 min every time we wanted to use it.

title: Bom apartamento
text: As instalações são boas e o apartamento tem os utensílios necessários para o dia-a-dia. A localização também é excelente e dá para ir a pé para o Central Park ; outras vantagens: perto de estações do metrô e de mercados

title: Perfekte Lage
text:
Wir waren für 5 Nächte in diesem Hotel und können es für einen Städtetrip nur empfehlen, die Lage ist mehr als perfekt.
Das Personal war stets freundlich und hilfsbereit.
Lediglich im Badezimmer lässt die Sauberkeit zu wünschen übrig.

title: Great location!
text:
This hotel is in a fantastic location. Easy walking distance to both Central Park and Times Square, and around the corner from Carnegie Hall. The rooms are clean, well appointed, and very large, especially for NY. 

The only issue we had was that the room always felt a bit damp, especially if the AC was turned down. It was pervasive and noticeable to the point that damp clothes never dried really thoroughly after being hung up. Maybe it was just our room.

In any case, we could definitely recommend for less humid times of year, and only recommend with the above caveat during peak summer time.

title: Bonne emplacement mais vieillot
text:
Parfaitement situé à proximité immédiate de Time square
Idéal pour se déplacer
 en revanche notre étage et notre chambre étaient très datés et nécessitent un rafraîchissement.
Il était peu agréable d’y rester  en journée pour ce reposer.

title: TMCNYC
text:
Great rooms, perfect location, terrific staff !
Only thing that needs addressing is there T.V. Cable company 
Such a high end hotel and no Hi Def. tv channels , sad 😞 most low 
End motels have hi def . In their rooms why not TMC

title: NYC MANHATTAN CLUB
text: The Hotel was nice however, there were only two elevators that were very small and they couldn't fit a lot of people in there. The elevators had no Air Conditioning at all. There was only one restroom in the lobby which always had a line. The Jr. Suite we were in along with my friends Jr. Suite didn't have any room to put your items in the bathroom. We had to use all the furniture (chairs, living room table, etc) just to put our things on. The rooms were very musty and humid, you could smell mold. The showers even had black mold. The sheets were never changed when housekeeping came in because I noticed my daughter got something on the sheets and I waited all week to see if they would get changed out and they never did. The bathroom also had no lock on it or it was broken.

title: Buono ma migliorabile
text: La posizione è ottima perché vicino a tutto. Il servizio della reception lascia a desiderare, abbiamo dovuto sollecitare più volte per lo stesso motivo. ottimo invece il consierge. Le camere avrebbero bisogno di una rinfrescata

title: Great location
text: Positives  -  Very clean, nice staff, possibly the quietest hotel I have ever stayed in; no city noise at all.     Negative   -  If I'm paying almost $300/night, my view should not be a brick wall, three brick walls, actually.   I had to turn on the weather channel to see if the sun was shining.  Very disappointed with that.

title: Perfect location and great staff
text: I found the staff very friendly and welcoming.  Hotel was very clean and the location couldn’t be better. But... the room I stayed in, although huge and clean, had furniture that was chewed on (dog friendly hotel I guess??).  Not a deal breaker but odd.  Eat at the Redeye Grill across the street! Delicious meal. Bar on the hotels 26th floor had a great vibe and the clientele was very friendly.

title: Situation exceptionnelle
text:
Situation exceptionnelle pour cet hôtel entre Times Square et Central Park., à 3 mn à pied du métro, à 2 pas de la 5ème avenue, ligne directe depuis la station Jamaica, où nous a déposé l'Air Train.
L'hôtel est vieillot, mériterait un rafraichissement dans les chambres à la hauteur de son hall d'entrée mais les chambres sont grandes, bien équipées (micro onde, frigo, évier, vaisselle), c'est appréciable dans cette ville où les restos sont si chers. Merci pour le café en dosette fourni tous les jours. Quelques accessoires manquants dans la chambre (pas de lampe de chevet).
Nous étions au 14ème étage, aucun bruit de rue.
Globalement l'hôtel a répondu à nos attentes et s'est révélé d'un excellent rapport qualité prix.

title: Posizione splendida e buon livello generale
text: Classico 4 stelle, con stanze ampie e curate, buon servizio, molto professionale anche se distaccato. La nostra stanza era dotata di microonde e cucina attrezzata (molto bene con materiali di qualità). La posizione è stupenda comodissima con il centro di NY

title: Great location but ...
text:
It has a great location - but my experience on the very first hour of check in with the staffer on duty left a very bad taste and made for an unpleasant experience.

We reached the place after a long journey at around 11.30 pm or midnight - went to the room given only to find it had no view and also a small bed - my booking was for 2 adults and two children and the pics that were in booking.com suggested a king size bed - when my wife called the front desk to point this out she was basically screamed at by the guy on duty (Matt)- shocking it this is how they treat their guests. 

Also the AC is too cold and the furniture (at least in our room) could do with a new polish.

title: Emplacement idéal
text: Nous avons passé 13 nuits au Manhattan Club, notre avis sur l'hôtel est correct, son emplacement tout proche de Timesquare et Central Park est parfait et le métro est à 50m et le rapport qualité prix est bon vu le secteur surtout en famille. Après les prestations de l'hôtel sont moyenne, pas de restauration et petit dej à emporter dans le chambre passable et très bruyant au 14ème étage où l'on entend tous de la rue. Chambre sympa de taille correcte pour NY.

title: Location. Location, Location
text: Being in the center of Manhattan was perfect. We were close to the subway, Central Park, across fromCarneige Hall - walking distance to Times Square....and Tiffany's! The rooms were accomodating with coffee maker and fridge for a family stay.

title: Large Rooms, Great Location, Friendly Staff
text: My family of four stayed in a one bedroom suite for four nights in July 2019. The room was HUGE for NYC standards. The two bathrooms were an unexpected comfort. The housekeeping and front desk staff, and doormen were all extremely kind and professional--5 star service! The lounge on the top floor is well-designed but doesn't offer food at night and the drinks are what you would expect with a top floor lounge/bar--pricey. The $35 valet parking may be the best in mid-town though, so park your car for a few nights and you've saved enough for a few drinks at the bar!  Overall, it's an excellent hotel that offers great value.

title: Great stay
text: staff was great and very welcoming, had Great recommendations for food, shows, and sightseeing. Room was clean, comfortable beds, well stocked, felt like I was at a 5 star resort. Location was perfect. Close to Central Park and time square. Would definitely go back.

title: Location Location Location
text:
If you are visiting Manhattan you want to find a place that is close to all the key areas like central park, Carnegie Hall, West End, Times Square etc. You would not find a hotel that is better located than the Manhattan Club. 
We stayed in a suite which was spacious and perfect for a couple of friends traveling. The facilities are superb and really made you feel like home in the Big Apple. The added benefit is the reasonable cost. There are a number of restaurants that are located around the hotel so that makes for easy eating (my fav was Brooklyn Diner). Since the hotel doesn't have a breakfast option, we choose to stock up from Dean and Delucas (also around the corner) and have some yummy breakfast in the room itself. 
If you are going to spend your time out exploring the city or you want to just chill in the room, this would be my choice when I visit Manhattan again.

title: Home in Midtown
text: We have stayed at The Manhattan Club twice now and intend to stay there again. The location is amazing, the facilities are nice, and there is room to spread out. The business center and owner's lounge are both nice, and the,staff is welcoming and attentive. The elevators are slow, but there are 2 service elevators around back if you get tired of waiting.

title: Fabulous location, spacious rooms
text:
We stayed 4 nights.  My husband, adult son and I had a 1 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms.  The private bedroom and second bath allowed us privacy as our son slept in the living room area.  There was a kitchenette with microwave, dishwasher and coffee maker.  Coffee is replenished daily.  The shower was great!

Our daughter and her fiancé had an Executive Suite.  The living room/ kitchenette area and bedroom were all in was spacious room.

The resort is located about a block from the 57 Street/ 7th Street subway station which allowed easy access to the entire city including LaGuardia Airport.  Restaurants, theaters, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Carnegie Hall and Central Park are all within walking distance.  There is even a Whole Foods about 2 blocks away at Columbus Circle.

Staff were helpful to keep our bags when we arrived before 4pm check in time so we could go eat and check out the area.  

We would definitely stay again!!!

title: Emplacement idéal pour les activités
text:
· Le service etait super a l arrivé Et tout le long du sejour, on  Avait besoin de quelque chose on demandait. Emplacement idéal pour faire des activités. A  4 min a pieds du central park et a 10 min max du Time square.
Point negatif: nous n avions pas la meme chambre du tout que nous avions payé et vu en photo. C'était totalement different. Nous etions au 14e etages. C'etait petit pour trois mais sur la photo c'etait beaucoup plus grand et different. Et nous avions paye pour 3 personnes nous avions des choses pour 2
Terminons sur un point positif
Le plus belle etage c est le 26e vous avez tout la. Et le service des concierges wow un 5 etoiles.

title: Location, Rooms, Service
text:
A plus all around. We had a 1 bedroom suite. Large enough for a family...perfect for a couple. 

The location is outstanding being a short walk from the 57 st station, Central Park, and Columbus circle. 

The service is friendly and the housekeeping staff keeps everything immaculate. 

Plenty of close by restaurants, Carnegie Hall is across the street. 

Will be staying here again.

title: Nel cuore di Manhattan
text: L'hotel si trova nel centro di Manhattan, facilmente raggiungibile a piedi sia il Central Park che Time Square, a due passi la metro gialla. La struttura è moderna, le camere ampie e spazione, noi abbiamo prenotato due Executive Junior suite, con tre persone per camera. Unica pecca è stata la colazione, in quanto nella nostra prenotazione la colazione era di tipo "Grab-n-Go", ovvero su tre persone solo due potevano usufruire della colazione da asporto. Noi ci siamo comunque accontantati, in quanto a persona si poteva prendere solo 3 cibi solidi e uno liquido, noi ce lo siamo divisi per tre. La camera aveva tutti i confort, addirittura nel bagno, nello specchio era presente la tv.

title: Great “Location
text:
The rooms have a small mini kitchen, ( Which is was adequate) with refills on coffee every day, with a dish washer. A sofa bed for guest and two bathrooms, one main, and one off the bedroom. 
The cost is $35.00 daily to park your car. But while your there you’ll take a subway, cab or walk. 
We spent 3 nights and used the deli across the street for breakfast, snacks and lunch, and some other food stuff. With a nice selection of fruit, deserts, yogurt, sandwiches, etc. 
Central Park is near, and Carnegie Hall is across the street too.

title: hotel muy bueno y correcta la atención
text: excelente hotel, me atendieron barbaro, solo hay que objetarles que el dia que llegue en la recepción nadie hablaba castellano, buenisima ubicación a 100 metros del central park, wifi gratis en todo el hotel

title: Don't miss this hotel
text:
The  hotel is in a prime location. Staff were amazing. The bed was so comfortable that includes the couch pull out mattress. Those are NEVER comfortable, but this one was. I almost traded the bedroom with my kids :)
We had to request maintenance to turn on the AC but they were there quickly and the condo was great. 
We will definitely stay here again!

title: Несмотря на все, гостиница очень хорошая, в прекрасном месте, вежливый персонал очень рекомендую
text:
Номер был отличный, все было комфортно и уютно. Оборудованная кухня, достаточно места в ванной комнате, отдельный туалет, приятные полотенца и халаты, телевизор в зеркале. Кровать очень удобная, даже раскладной диван, который как правило не удобный, был сверх всех ожиданий. Все качественно и современно. Мне очень понравилось

 · Лифт невозможно дождаться, в основном мы пользовались лестницей. Карточная система завтраков меня просто убила. Упаковывали завтрак в пластиковую тару по счету продуктов (если берешь сок, то кофе не положено) с целью кушать у себя в номере. Такого я еще не встречала, особенно в гостинице на таком уровне, в результате куча пластикового мусора. Если б я знала заранее, то предпочла бы бронирование без завтраков, по близости достаточно мест где можно комфортно позавтракать. В номере на кухне была вода как в прочем и других гостиницах, но в этой она оказывается была за 9 долларов за бутылку цена не была указана на видном месте.

title: Perfect Location for a NYC Holiday
text: Convenient to all necessities for a well rounded trip to NYC girls trip. Comfortable rooms with small kitchen area for breakfast and cocktails.   We felt very safe with doormen in the lobby and outside. Doors are locked at midnight and ID must be presented to enter.

title: Small quarters in the heart of mid Manhattan
text: The Hotel is well situated, with short walking distance to Central Park, Carnegie Hall and other attractions. Time Squares and theater area were only a 10 minute walk away. Although the room was small, the checking in was smooth and they have reasonable priced valet parking, the overall service was very good and the room was very cleaned.

title: Anniversary Trip
text:
Fabulous location. Check-in was smooth (we arrived at 9:30 am) we were able to check-in, they stored our luggage and we were off exploring. When we returned at 3:30 our room was ready. We were on the 21st floor. Elevators can be a little of a wait, but truly nothing to get excited about. Rooms are spacious, clean and beds are comfortable. There’s some construction going on however, no noise to be heard from our floor due to this or the traffic. Next trip to Manhattan, I will be staying at this hotel which I highly recommend.
We did not have the breakfast therefore, I cannot comment on this.

title: Couple from the caribbean
text: Great location close to restaurants and shows. The staff from the door man, front desk clerks, housekeeping are all friendly and helpful. We have a special thanks to the concierge service desk especially to Ms Xiomara Mora-she's super great, courteous, helpful and always with a smile. We hope to return again and definitely stay at Manhattan club.

title: Manhattan Club in New York City
text: If you are an RCI timeshare owner and are planning to visit downtown New York City, The Manhattan Club is a great resort.     Great location, nice mini suites, accommodating staff.  I would recommend this resort to my timeshare friends and I hope to stay there again when I get back to New York.   This was my first visit there.   We only had this room for two nights but wish we had it for the full 4 nights we were there.    We did not use the bar or eat the breakfast so I have no comments on that.    I had wished there was an upper level outdoor space but we found others near by.

title: great location. nice hotel
text: excellent accommodations, very close to attractions, excellent choice, would like to vacation there again, we had a one bedroom unit but would get a two bedroom if available to travel with family. great accommodation for a points exchange

title: Our NY experience
text:
We had a wonderful stay. The hotel was really clean and very welcoming. The staff were very accommodating and so friendly.
We highly recommend this hotel. 
It was very near Times Square and Central Park which suited us very well.

title: WARNING HIDDEN FEES!!
text: WARNING: We booked via booking.com then got sent an email from the hotel that we would need to pay extra $$ each night for an extra person. When we refused to pay the extra (as we booked for the right amount of people originally) they said we would not provide you with a refund for your stay even though we are one month out from the 3 night stay! Best to stick to the large hotel chains as they dont send hidden fees after the booking is made and then make you accountable!

title: our new go to place
text: have an great stay at the Manhattan Club. Room was much more than expected, location in Midtown was awesome, price was very reasonable and the staff was more than accommodating. It is our new go to place in NY

title: Total Surprise - in a good way!
text: 2 Rooms, 2 Bath in NYC for about $200!?!  Best deal in town.  We did not get an updated suite, but our 1 bedroom suite had a separate living space with a comfortable pullout bed and 2 full bathrooms.  The rooms were clean, but in dire need of updating.  The bedroom was quite quiet - the living room not so much.  We could hear the enthusiastic children next door.  The staff was really very nice and helpful.  The lounge is nice for a quick cocktail.  The location can't be beat if you're in town to shop, go to a broadway show, or Lincoln Center.  There are quite a few subway lines that are a close walk.

title: Great hotel - nice midtown location.
text:
Weeks stay in the Big Apple and opted for the TMC due to location, price,standard and reviews.  We found the hotels location just on edge of Times Sq and Central Park suited us well.  Easy walking distance of most of the midtown manhattan highlights and subway access just around the corner.  
Lucky to have a small suite with separate main bed/ensuite and whilst showing a little in the way of aging and wear was very comfortable.  Handy little kitchenette area another bonus.  Excellent room service throughout stay and lovely staff. Good wifi service.
Overall we had a lovely stay and found our room suited our needs well. 
Would recommend and happily return. 

There were a few minor concerns;
 - staff at check in could have been a lot more informative about the hotel facilities and general information.  Friends checking in at the same time received additional information we were not provided and even with this it was still lacking.  No information provided regarding the adjoining hotel and the additional amenities available next door, no information on level 26 amenities. 
- elevators not so efficient despite having two separate banks so some waiting at busy times
- there is some exterior works in progress on facade but did not distract from our stay.

title: Great stay again!
text:
This is the 2nd time we've stayed at this property. Entire staff from front desk, bell service and concierge service were exceptional. Everyone was willing to take the time needed to answer any questions we had and offer suggestions. Room was cleaned daily (at $50 a day, mandatory). Everything in room worked perfectly. 
Location is the best part of this resort with many prime destinations within walking distance and a major subway terminal a block away.
Can't wait till we return!

title: Great location & friendly folks.
text: We always enjoyed staying here. Kitchenette is well stocked. Lounge upstairs is spacious and comfortable. Concierge always willing to hold our luggage after checkout. And it’s close to our favorite restaurant Molyvos-best Greek food ever!!

title: Great hotel, Great service, and centrally located
text:
We are Blue  Green  members and found this hotel via the Blue Green system.  Knowing absolutely NOTHING about NYC, this hotel and the staff was a perfect match for us!!
It's centrally located and easy to walk to Broadway, Central Park, a MILLION restaurants and two subway stops.  The hotel is very nice and we were on the 19th floor which helped defeat the din of the NYPD and NYFD sirens which howled all night.  
Carmi Spiegel, the Chief Concierge, really helped us a ton as he gave us his "NY Subway 101" course and soon had us riding the subways like we had a clue what we were doing and where we were. He also pointed out to us the fact we could get "Senior" tickets by going to the attendant and buying them which made riding the subways very cheap indeed.  Many thanks Carmi!!
If I go back to NYC, I'll definitely stay here!

title: Centrally located, close to Time Square, but away from the mobs
text: We stay at this hotel every other year.  Love the location, can walk to the shows on Time Square, can walk to Central Park, can walk to the museums.  Hotel is very well run, the rooms very spacious and comfortable.  Do not miss getting a drink up-stairs in the bar

title: Ótima localização, quarto confortável, mini cozinha, ótimo staff. Boa cama, bom banho, bom sono.
text: Um ótimo hotel para família. Tivemos dias maravilhosos com ótimo atendimento e qualidade dos serviços. Qualidade do sono, qualidade do banho, ótimo atendimento e arrumação do quarto, hotel bem localizado.

title: Enjoyable Location for Exploring NYC for a Long Weekend
text: We traded through RCI to spend Memorial Day weekend at the Manhattan Club. It has a great location in midtown near Central Park. The one bedroom suite was offered a good value with an extra large mini refrigerator and a microwave. The suite we were assigned had a courtyard view from the 18th floor. It was a very quiet room for NYC. The staff there was very friendly and were very responsive to our needs.The only issue at all was the air conditioner was a little weak, but it was not bothersome enough for us to contact the front desk. We let them know when we were checking out and staff said they could have easily adjusted things for us.

title: What a location
text:
Heart of bustling NY .  Can’t fault the location at all. Hotel is a little dated but well maintained.  Staff and concierge super helpful. 
Going back for an anniversary celebration 
Peter & Antonia - Australia

title: Weekend getaway
text: From all the times we have visited NYC this is the best accommondations we have stayed in. Excellent service and great location. Walking distance to the sites, and subway station right at the corner. The business center was excellent, the staff was very knowledgable and very professional and extremely polite. I would definitely stay there again.

title: A very good location!
text:
We have been spent there 4 nights at the beginning of April. It was very cold time for all over USA. 
We were very satisfied with everything: room size, cleanliness, coffee bar was okay. Not even interested in the fact that the room itself is a little old-fashioned, because if you're in NYC, you don't spend much time in your room. :)
So we got a very good value-for-money room. It was the most important: close to the most of sights for our first visit.
But for one thing I give "just" very good because, despite the cold outside, only on the second day were they willing to switch on the heating and it was cold. But after we indicated it was working.Thank you to not allowed us to freezing :)

title: Overnight stay
text: location location location for my wife and I was excellent.  Not only for daytime & evening activities near central park but access to transit system was on corner so made for an easy commute for us.  room was a nice accomodation with queen bed and 2 seperate full bathrooms in addition to the living area.

title: Nice staff and great location
text: The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The hotel is located near Columbus Circle and within close walking distance of several subway lines.  Good restaurants are located close by and several restaurants provide discounts to hotel guests.  The room on the 15th floor was quite large.  We come to NYC often and we appreciated the extra space.  The downside is that the decor and carpet is tired and needs updating.  The room and bathroom were clean.

title: A week in NYC
text:
The hotel was fine, nothing flash but a great location.
It was our first trip to NY it was amassing, we were on the go. All day and most nights. Subway is a must, it cost $2.50 to go anywhere. They have a great map that you can use to identify the correct platform and colour train to take. No timetable required as u wait no longer than 10 min. Wear comfortable shoes and walk / subway everywhere

title: Vacaciones en mayo
text: Nos quedaremos una semana en este hotel, pero hasta el momento (hoy es la 4a noche) puedo decir que es un muy buen hotel, cómodo, la pieza es espaciosa, una cama Queen y un sofá cama más grande aún, con microondas, refrigerador, lavavajillas y una mesa para usar como comedor, además de un mueble y closet para guardar ropa (incluso plancha y tabla de planchar) además de un baño espacioso. Muy buena opción, cerca del metro (media cuadra), del Central Park y a unos 10 minutos de Times Square.

title: Superb for family travel
text:
We stayed in a 1-bedroom, with 2 adults and 3 kids. The room is large by Manhattan standard, with a king size bed for the adults, full size pull-out sofa for the older kids, space for a traveling crib for our toddler, and still room for the kids to roam around. There are also 2 bathrooms, which speeds up the morning and evening routines tremendously. The bed is comfortable and there are plenty of storage space for luggages and jackets. There is also a kitchenette with a microwave, a dishwasher and plates and silverware for 4.

The location can't be better. Many days we went to Central Park/Time Squares/Rockfeller Center to shop and play, and go back to take a break before going out again.

The staff is very polite and helpful, from the front desk to bellhop to housekeeping. Valet parking is available for $35 per 24 hours, which is a bargain according to my NYC friends.

My only complaint is that the elevators are excruciating slow, so if you are living on the lower floors of this hotel (it starts on the 16th floor and we were on the 20th), in the morning rush hour, the elevator bypassed us a few times as they were already filled up while on the upper floors. So budget extra time to get down if you are not at the top floors.

title: Conveniently located
text: Manhattan club is conveniently located. It's only two blocks from Central Park and walking distance to Times Square and subway is very accessible. There is no restaurant but there are a lot of restaurants and diners close by

title: Bad service, not worth the money
text:
No one at the front desk both at checkin and at checkout! I had to wait until someone came. I checked out at 6am, had a flight to catch... this has never been a problem for me at other hotels that cost what I paid to stay here... 

Room was fine.

title: Awesome Location
text: The location of this resort was literally close to everything.  Definitely take the Hop-on-Hop-off bus at the beginning to see what and where everything is.  The subway was a block and a half away.  We had our 90 yr old mother who could walk short distances but otherwise we pushed her in a wheelchair most of the time.  Only $2.75 to go to any stop.

title: Staying out as long as possible to avoid the room!
text: Spent 4 days in NYC with a booking at the Manhattan Club, I can honestly say it's staff are its only redeeming quality. Not only are the rooms outdated, and smell damp, the first room I was assigned to the sheets were torn and it was just dirty -see picture after wiping the remote control, and you had to pick between hot water or water pressure. I requested a room change and staff was very gracious and did change the room....still outdated with peeling wall paper. We decided to stay out as much as possible just to avoid being in the room. I am not sure where the renovated rooms advertised are, but I certainly did not have luck at this hotel You would be better served looking for a deal online for a 4-5 star hotel room at the same price!

title: Great stay but need a bigger bed!
text: Loved this hotel from welcome at reception to concierge looking after luggage whilst we had a wander before room was ready.  We had booked a suite and it was really good, large, spacious, well equipped, clean and the ed so comfortable.  The only problem was we had travelled to five other hotels, not in New York, just before this hotel and every bed had been huge!  This was a normal double I believe, or maybe queen, comfortable, etc but not big enough, but that is a very small problem in the grand scheme of things.  The location is perfect with subways close by, Times Square a short but inter3sting wall and Central Park a stones throw.  I would definitely go back. Thanks for a great stay.

title: Wonderful hotel in every way!
text:
We recently stayed a week at Manhatten club.  I found a special on Travelzoo that included the grab and go breakfast.  Everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful.  The room was spotless.  We had a Junior Executive suite on the 23rd. floor.  We rarely waited long for an elevator and we never heard street noise.  The temperature of the room was always comfortable.  We never had to call for any problem, ever.  We had a small kitchen in the room with a table and chairs for eating our breakfast.  We also had a sofa and chair in the tv area.

The best part was the bed and bedding.  It was the most comfortable bed and pillow I have ever slept on.  I wish I knew the brand and model and I would order one for me as getting a sound sleep has always been a problem for me and wasn't while at the Manhatten Club.

I can only say the price was very reasonable, the room was spotless, and service incredibly friendly.  The location is one block from the subway to almost anywhere.  Much of the city is walkable from here.  Times square is just blocks away but removed and a much quieter less hectic atmosphere surrounds the Manhatten Club.  
The only suggestion I would give is that they are quite lacking in shelving in the bathroom and our toiletry kits had to go on the floor.  A small shelf or table would be a big improvement.  Otherwise the towels were soft, the closet had beautiful robes for our use, water pressure was always good.  What's not to love!

We couldn't have been more pleased and would recommend it to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Outstanding
text:
I found The Manhattan Club Hotel by accident and it’s one of the nicest accidents I’ve encountered. 
I’ve just had cervical surgery and in pain. I needed a hotel for the night before going to the hospital for a follow-up appt. The hotel couldn’t have been nicer or more accommodating. They upgraded me and the room was nice, quiet and large. The bed was very close to the bathroom which I needed.
The employees helped me w/a smile carry my bags in/out of the room.
The location is great on 56th next to 7th ave. 
A great cafe/deli is around the corner on 7th and 55th and it’s excellent. Big portions and cheap.
Looking forward to a return visit and the nice, accommodating people at The Manhattan Club.

title: "Excellente situation, très pratique"
text: Voyage à New York avec 2 ados cet hôtel particulièrement bien situé est aussi très pratique. Une vraie chambre avec un très bon couchage pour le lit double, une salle de bain avec une grande baignoire et une salle d'eau avec douche à l'italienne, vraiment très agréable lorsqu'on vient à trois personnes de ne pas faire la queue dans les salles de bains. Le canapé lit était plutôt confortable pour la 3ème personne. Une table ronde dans le coin salon-salle à manger plutôt spacieux. En revanche la kitchenette n'avait pas l'équipement espéré (pas de plaque pour faire chauffer de l'eau ou de bouilloire et la machine à café n'était pas complète... En revanche un micro-onde et même une machine à laver la vaisselle et 2 télés.Excellente situation à proximité du métro (57th street) et à une rue de central Park, vraiment pratique pour visiter New York uptown ou downtown et à pied de Times square (15 minutes). Apprécié également de pouvoir laisser les bagages gracieusement à la baggagerie quand vous partez en fin de journée pour l'aéroport. Personnel très souriant et agréable en particulier les bagagistes et le personnel des étages. Les chambres auraient idéalement besoin d'un petit rafraîchissement mais comme elles sont très bien équipées cela ne nous a parue anecdotique. Je recommande et en particulier pour une première visite à NYC.

title: Bien placé et bien reçus
text:
Je n'hésiterai pas à revenir y séjourner. 
Grande chambre propre pour 3 avec de quoi se faire un petit dej avec la kitchenette.ménage soigné tous les jours.Personnel discret mais à l'écoute. Bar au 26eme étage.
Il manque seulement un rooftop et on serait au top du top du top!
La déco est vieillote c'est sûr mais cela ne m'a pas dérangé. 
Quartier parfait.

title: Très bien
text:
Nous avons eu une chambre assez spacieuse avec une petite kitchenette au 23eme etage.
Assez calme, hôtel bien situé,  service très bien.
Pour une visite à manhattan c'est vraiment l'idéal.
L'hôtel se situe à 10mn a pied maxi de central parc et time square

title: Bien situé mais c’est tout
text:
Je ne recommande pas du tout cet hôtel. Son seul atout est d’être bien situé. Et c’est tout. 
En réservant trois mois à l’avance, on se retrouve au 2ème étage dans une suite incroyablement bruyante, sombre, triste, sinistre. 
En plus des échafaudages assombrissent encore plus les fenêtres. 
Tout l’hôtel a un côté lugubre. Et le personnel est à l’avenant, bien peu efficace et pas sympathique du tout. 
Allez ailleurs.

title: Non ci tornerò
text:
Vacanza di famiglia , sei gg a Ny 
Camere con la moquette , anni 70
All’arrivo il letto delle figlie non aperto e non preparato (divano letto ) con capelli sul materasso .
Unica nota positiva la posizione .

title: Excellent Stay
text:
We stayed in The Manhattan Club hotel for 4 nights during a Spring break to New York. On arrival we got a lovely surprise being upgraded to a suite. The young man working on check in was really polite and friendly. Our room was super. It was beyond comfortable and massive in size. I think it was room 2201. Everything in the room from the bed to the toiletries were luxurious. 
All the staff we met in the hotel were so friendly and always gave us the time of day.
Overall this is a super, well run hotel in a great location.

Well done to the management and staff for providing such a service.

title: Large Room
text: Overall my one night went well.  The lobby was a bit tired, but my room was large and comfortable.  The bed had updated coverings and I slept well. Old elevators.  I would rate the property a 3.5, but location and amenities make it a 4 star.

title: Accueil à revoir
text:
Pas tout à fait au niveau d’un 4 étoiles notamment au niveau du service (accueil...)
Canapé lit de notre fille pas prêt lorsque nous sommes arrivés. Par contre c’est propre et le fait d’avoir une salle d’eau en plus de la salle de bain dans la suite est très pratique. La chambre et le salon sont spacieux et l’hôtel Très bien Situé.

title: séjour a New York
text: apparthotel de luxe mais vieillot  ;appartement est minimum et impossible de cuisiné car il n y a qu  un four a micro onde .il est très bien situé car près de time square et quelques pas de central park

title: A great experience
text:
We stayed in the hotel with our two teenager grandsons for the 10 days, and it was a great experience.
We had one bedroom suite on a high floor, which has a large bedroom and large living room separated by a door, and each of the rooms has it's own bathroom. So both rooms enjoy their privacy. The grandsons slept on the largely opened sofa bed in the living room. The room has a kitchenette. 
Our deal included "Grab n' Go" breakfast, which means that one can choose the items of the breakfast from the restaurant on the  26th floor and eat it in his room. The deal is very convenient, saving time and money.
The location is great, a few minutes walk from Times Square to the south and from Central Park to the north. Many other attractions are at a walking distance from the hotel. The subway station is just around the corner.
There are many restaurants in the area, 
The service and housekeeping were very helpful and efficient.

title: Fabulous location and fabulous staff.
text: A great location. Room was very nice. Two baths, one bedroom!  Staff were courteous, helpful, and, friendly. We had a great family vacation. Traveled by subway and walking distance to Times Square, Central Park & Rockefeller Center. Great resort!!!

title: Nice hotel
text:
The service was friendly and helpful.  The front desk helped by suggesting and making a reservation for a local restaurant. Also a doorman hailed a cab for us.  The staff were also friendly and respectful.  
The rooms were cleaned well and larger than I expected.  I could fit 4 if someone doesn’t mind sleeping on a sofa bed. The website says that would be best for kids and I agree.  There was a microwave and refrigerator which could help a traveler save money. 
The fitness center was adequate for a decent work out if desired. We did not eat in the owners lounge instead choosing a nearby diner.  There was complementary coffee which I enjoyed, but I did travel once to a nearby shop for a pastry one morning.   The point is other options are very close by.  I would stay here again.

title: Location location location
text: My understanding is that The Manhattan Club is one of the most difficult to get resorts in the world.  I was lucky that my timing in looking for accommodation was just at the right moment, as there was availability every single day for a full year.  The Club is ideally located across the street from Carnegie Hall, a 15 minute walk to Time Square and Broadway, a 10 minute walk to Central Park, 40 minutes to the Guggenheim, 10 minutes to MoMa, and if you are up to it, a 45 minute walk to Chelsea Market and the Whitney.  The start of Restaurant Row is 5 minutes away.  Lincoln Centre (TKTS, for discounted Broadway tickets is 10 minutes, Whole Foods 10 minutes, etc. etc. etc.  In other words, walk everywhere, and take the subway (5 minutes away) only occasionally.  Remember that the Manhattan is a boutique hotel and not a "resort.  The rooms are large for a hotel room, but have limited facilities - a microwave and a bar fridge make it really only suitable for breakfasts (the continental breakfast buffet on the 26th floor is $20.00).  But why eat in when there is so much food of every ethnic variety, only steps away ?  There is a nice lounge on the 26th floor with complimentary tea and coffee and cookies at a specific time in the afternoon.  The front desk was very accommodating in our request to change rooms.  The "renovated" ones were small and it was impossible to get into and out of the queen bed from one side.  The "unrenovated" room is larger and better laid out.  There really is no difference between the two rooms other than decor, but importantly in the layout.  Each room is slightly different in its layout, some larger than others.  Note that there is daily maid service.  All in all an excellent timeshare in the best location (expensive in terms of points needed, but for obvious reasons).

title: Sweltering
text: They don't tell you, that you cannot turn your room's a/c on, nor do they care.  They will tell you just open a window, which means trying to sleep with the noises of the city.  The room has wallpaper coming off the wall and grime in the tile.

title: Excellent hotel and location
text: We loved our stay at The Manhattan Club in NYC!  Staff was very attentive and accommodating. It is in a great location, just blocks from Times Square and Theatres. Easy subway access and wonderful restaurants all around.

title: Eccellente e posizione in una parte strategica di Manhattan
text:
la vacanza è stata ottima anche grazie alla ospitalità dell'Hotel e alla sua posizione strategica.
la camera pulita
i servizi puntuali e gentili
tutto ottimo ad eccezione della divano letto che era da mettere a disposizione prima del nostro arrivo

title: nel centro del mondo
text: hotel nel centro di Midtown a pochi metri da Central Park e Times Square, camre spaziose, specie se si e' in  3, come la mia famiglia, 2 camere con un letto king + sofa bed.Il sofa bed comunque non all'altezza..duro e di qualita..scarsa. Uno dei pochi Hotel con angolo cottura. La moquette ha bisogno di essre pulita, piu spesso.

title: Great location, good price
text: I stayed here with my daughter a few weeks ago for Yo-Yo Ma's performance at the Lincoln Center.  We're not from New York, and this seemed like a good location.  It was much better than expected.  It was not a good location; it was a GREAT location--walking distance to the Lincoln Center and only steps away from Central Park.  The One-Bedroom Suite was large by Manhattan standards, yet "reasonably" priced, by Manhattan standards.  The staff was very friendly and helpful, which is counter to the stereotypical New Your City attitude.  We had breakfast included, which was great.  parking  at only $35 plus tax was also good by NYC rates.  We're planning to go back for a performance at Carnegie Hall (also around the corner) in April.  Did I mention the great location?!?!

title: Enjoy Manhattan at the Manhattan Club
text: Our stay at the Manhattan Club was a lot of fun ... even if the weather was cold outside.  We bundled up and walked to Lincoln Center for an Opera.  It is an easy walk to the NQRW subway station so we could travel about town underground.  We easily caught buses from our Manhattan Club location ... so be sure to get the 7 day transit pass, it makes life very easy.

title: A Great Home in the City!
text:
A special thanks to Socorro in reservations for her help in coordinating this stay. It was a bit complicated due to it being a blend of time-share and hotel reservations but she grasped the request and accommodated us beautifully. 
Another special person was James at the front desk who helped check me in and worked to keep me in my suite when I extended my stay, (yes, I stayed  longer because I was having a phenomenally great time!)
The suite was fabulous!  I didn’t know until the morning and when the sun came up that I had a view down 7th Avenue at Central Park. What a fabulous surprise. I was able to watch half marathon from my window! 
 The one bedroom suites have a kitchenette with microwave, coffee maker, dishwasher so going out for breakfast wasn’t needed. There’s a gourmet grocery a block and a half away that’s open 24/7 where you can stock up on necessities and culinary extravagances. They have everything there!  
Best thing about the suite is that they have 2 bathrooms. I was able to spend more time with my friend who lives in the Bronx. She had a wonderful night’s sleep on the pullout sofa bed and had her own adjoining bath. This is a perfect setup for families too.  I’ve done my research and as far as I’ve seen, you have to pay thousands per night to get this feature at other hotels. 
I couldn’t have been happier with my stay. Muchas gracias!!

title: Disappointed to say the least
text:
We arrived at the manhattan club excuted for our stay and were shocked when we walked into our room only to find it was not ready yet and there was still
someone in the room.This room had been on one of the renovated floors and the one we were moved to was old and quite unpleasant.The bathroom was dirty reaking of urine and carpet was old and needed replacing.The staff was rude and not in anyway sorry for our misfortune.If you ever come to new york DO NOT book the manhattan club hotel.

title: Nice hotel, good location
text: The hotel was nice and met our needs of a place to sleep at night.  The location is very excellent  - just a block from the RNW subway line, which we used every day.  Could walk to Times Square and Lincoln Center if you wanted to do so.  But, please note.  This is a hotel, not a resort.  And the Junior Executive suite, which we had, while nice, is a hotel room with a small kitchen setup added in a nook - microwave, sink, refrigerator and dishwasher.  It is not a roomy room.  There was a $50+ service charge added to our room everyday - not sure what this was for as there weren't any amenities or other services offered.  Additionally, and this can't be fixed by the hotel, we were on the 14th floor and traffic noise was noisy.  Lots of horns and sirens but you would hear this as most of the hotels.  I add this just so if someone is expecting quiet, staying in downtown Manhattan probably isn't for you.

title: Cleanest and most comfortable stay in NYC ever
text:
Our room was great!  We arrived before 4 PM check-in and dropped our bags off.  We were able to complete the paperwork for check-in and when we did return, we just picked up our keys.  We did not get back to our room until 11:00 PM and then we discovered that all the bed pillows were feather which I am allergic to.  A simple call to the front desk resulted in prompt delivery of non-feather pillows...We were so grateful!
This hotel is located within walking distance of the Lincoln Center and the Brooklyn Diner is right next door.  I definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.

title: Location Location Location
text: Great place to stay and the size of the room was what sold us on the Manhattan Club,  It was comfortable and we could sit down and relax with a cuppa after a long day.  The bathroom did need upgrading but other than that we enjoyed our stay.  Thank you

title: Excelente Resort em uma ótima localização
text: Adoramos a localização e o tamanho do apartamento de um quarto com uma suite e um outro banheiro para visitas ou para quem for dormir no sofa cama. Mini cozinha equipada com mini geladeira e microondas. Precisamos de uma cama extra por um final de semana e eles foram muito gentis em nos fornecer. Só tivemos problemas com um dos elevadores que quebrou no dia da nossa saída.

title: Pleasantly surprised!!  Great Home Base
text:
I had training in NYC and got a good deal on Hotwire.  The hotel is very nice!   The room was larger than expected and much larger than typical NYC!!!   My room had a view of Central Park, giving you an idea of how close.  Great area to walk including Central Park, Lincoln center and many restaurants.  
The room itself was a suite with a living room, a bedroom and two full bathrooms.  Perfect if you are staying a few days!  Plenty of room to move around.  Free coffee at the hotel too.  What a pleasant surprise this hotel was.

title: It may have been cold, but it was great!!!
text: It was great to return to a clean & cozy room after a cold day in New York.  The staff was friendly and very informative on things to do in New York.  After the sucky experience with American Airlines & Viator airport shuttle service, things got better when we arrived at the Manhattan Club.

title: Wonderful Resort right in the middle of NYC
text: We had heard that the Manhattan Club was a wonderful place to visit and we were not dissapointed.  The location was great and the facility was perfect.  The staff were very helpful and friendly.  We will return again soon.

title: 2-3 stars.   Hotel needs update.
text:
• HOTEL.  It's old. Needs to be updated badly.  Elevators are VERY slow to get.
• ROOMS.  PROS...  bed and linens were GREAT!.  Decent coffee area in the room.
CONS... One bathroom was updated in our room the other one was very old.  I had to put bath towels on the window sills and close the drapes and push chairs up against them because the room would not warm up.  For what they charge, NOT worth it.   OWNERS LOUNGE.   phhhht.  $20 for bagels and hard boiled self service tiny continental breakfast. Walk a block or two to some good diners,  $12.00 eggs, bacon potatoes.
• AREA.  200 W. 56th St. and that area is dirty and a LOT of scaffolds and construction going on everywhere all within 4 blocks of that location.   It's very dirty and congested in that whole area too.   Very loud area.  Nonstop horns, because it is so congested, and sirens most of the time.  It is a block from Patsy's Restaurant which we love so that was a plus for us.
•STAFF  is GREAT. CONCIERGE was GREAT.

title: Helen
text: Manhattan Club is conveniently located in downtown NY, within walking distance of everything we wanted to see and do including great restaurants, I was traveling with two teenage girls that were pleasantly surprised at the location and how close they were to great shopping.

title: Return visit to NY with family
text:
We booked a package with BA and picked this hotel for its location, we wanted to be further north nearer to central park. I'd emailed the hotel a couple of times to say we were returning to NY to celebrate our 10 year wedding anniversary with our young sons, as we got married in NY and had never managed to visit since so it was a special holiday. I asked if we could have a refurbished room as would be spending more time in the room with having the boys with us.

We booked a one bed suite (paid extra for this) and were pleased to see we had been given a refurbished room. I was a little disappointed that their wasn't any sort of gesture for our special occasion, I hadn't told my husband that I'd contacted the hotel hoping there may be a special touch but there wasn't. 

We were happy with the room, particularly the two bathrooms and space. Almost felt like an apartment. The bed was so big all 4 of us shared if rather than using the sofa bed.

Housekeeping were fantastic, made the bed and changed the towels daily. 

Coffee and tea were replenished daily too which was a bonus.

Kitchenette useful, particularly the dishwasher, but it would have been better to have a small hob as we couldn't actually cook anything. We ended up ordering take out most evenings. 

Reading the information folder on arrival I was surprised to see that the hotel kept reiterating that it is not a traditional hotel but a timeshare... okay but the travel companies don't pass this message on. It suited us but may not suit others.

There's no restaurant onsite, the floor 26 bar looked okay bit we only went up there on the last day to kill some time. 

Overall we had a great stay and would stay again.

title: A Good Place To Stay
text: It has been a while since we have been here. Our current visit is very enjoyable. The position is great. The rooms are spacious. The kitchenette  is not too big and does not have a kettle' but has some basics one needs. The rooms have two bathrooms, one with a bath and the other with a shower.

title: Enjoyed NYC
text: We just spent a week visiting family in NYC. We loved the location, the newly remodeled room, and the hotel staff . We were able to enjoy theater , shopping , and great food. The location also made it easy to stroll through Central Park and ship on 5th Ave .

title: Good experience
text: The position and the quality of the room/apartment are excellent. Average level of service. Bath probably requires a refurbishment, and it took a bit too much for fixing some problems. In general a positive experience

title: A perfect location for Manhattan holiday!
text: We booked a one-room apartment at The Manhattan Club one year ahead for family holiday in New York City for the first time. Our great expectations was more than satisfied. The hotel and its location close to Central Park is very nice anf highly recommended. The overall pricing is very reasonable considering the high standard. We will surely try to return to The Manhattan Club next time we visit New York..

title: Great hotel but poor service with NO SMILE
text: I would love to give this hotel 5 stars, it is in a great location and the rooms are nice and spacious, especially by NYC standards. However, I had a poor check-in experience. James, the front desk clerk was rude, surly and unhelpful. I asked for concierge assistance but I was told to ask security. There was no one else waiting, so it was not that he was in a rush. He was just providing service with NO smile or courtesy whatsoever.

title: Great experience
text: Friendly staff and located in great spot. Clean spacious rooms. Always staff available and security is visible and does a great job . Checking in and out was easy.  Recommend if you are traveling and wanting to explore the city

title: Excellent Hotel; très bien placé !!!
text:
Chambre très propre et Lit super confortable !
Personnel très accueillant et charmant; concierge; etc...

Hôtel très bien placé dans Manhattan : près du Carnegie Hall; et à 10 minutes de Times Square; et moins de Central Park !
près également de toute commodité...

title: GREAT STAY
text: We were very happy with this hotel! From entering the hotel and being greeted by the doorman with a smile, to being checked in by the front desk and taking a ride up to our room with the person running the elevator, overall it was so pleasant!  The room was nice and clean, the bed was comfortable and the lines and pillows nice and soft.  The person who cleaned our room was very sweet and helpful as well!  My daughter and I enjoyed the area when we arrived with great restaurants close by and shopping!  We really had a nice stay and are looking forward to our next visit next year!  Thank you!

title: Great location and comfortable
text: Great location for walking or Ubering.  Plenty of restaurants, and close to the south end of Central Park.Take in Thai food at Topaz, just a block or two east on 56th.  Times Square and Broadway (theater district) are a short Uber drive away, costing about $12 each way.

title: I'd like to live here!
text: It feels like having a nice apt. perfectly located a block from the Park and easy walk to Times Square. The quiet entrance feels residential and the option of breakfast, mostly continental in the lovely top floor, made it easy for me to work, take my time in the morning or catch a quiet drink in the evening.  I travel alone and this was perfect for me.  I was busy, and the great location made it easy to get back to change for dinner or enjoy walking, which is the best thing to do in NYC.  Subways are right there and the concierge answered all my questions, including where to get a quick nail fix.  Loved it. long time staff kept my room clean !

title: Great central location.  Excellent stay
text: This is a fantastic place to stay.  Its located 10 minutes from Central Park and Times Square, and a subway station allowing access to attractions further afield.  We had a one bed sleep four suite on the 21st floor, booked through an RCI exchange.. As you entered there was a small and basic kitchen unit, consisting of a fridge, microwave, fridge dishwasher and coffee machine.  Tea and coffee were replenished daily, but there was no milk.  Wear and tear noticeable on bottom of fittings.  There were two small wardrobes, one containing a safe, the other ironing board.  The lounge area was reasonably spacious with a double bed settee (which our daughter slept on), table and two chairs, one arm chair, chest of drawers and TV.  Off this was an open bedroom, with very comfortable bed, and bathroom, with plenty of towels and toiletries.  The room was very clean, and perhaps decor a little dated, but in keeping with character of  the building.  Overall the unit was very satisfactory for three adults, but would possibly be "tight" for four.  There is a well equipped  gym, and business centre on the 26th floor.  There are two lifts which may or may not stop when called.  We learnt to always get in and go up if you wanted to go down!! We had a really comfortable and enjoyable stay.  It is clean and staff friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend.

title: Great location
text: The location is perfect! We walked everywhere most of the week we were there. The bellman greeted us as we arrived and loaded our luggage onto a cart immediately while we checked in. Staff was so friendly and welcoming. Our luggage was delivered to our suite immediately and bellman was so nice! He helped us with restaurant suggestions,  directions,  etc the entire time we were there and always greeted us with a smile when we returned and asked how our day was. He even set up a car for us when we were scheduled to leave at 4am.  I was EXTREMELY happy with our stay at The Manhattan Club and will definitely be back!

title: Perfect Location in NYC
text: Our stay here was for a week booked as a timeshare exchange. Let me start by saying I would certainly stay here again. The location is awesome-1 block off Broadway, steps to Carnegie Hall, 3 blocks from Central Park, multiple subway stops nearby, the list goes on. Our room had a partial kitchen (small dishwasher, dorm size fridge, & microwave), one bedroom & 2 bathrooms-crazy for NYC!! We seldom heard other guests & even then, it was just that they were in the hallway. I  cannot speak to the bar area as we never actually went there for an adult beverage. We did check out the "grab & go" breakfast & both wondered why anyone would pay that much money when there are many options nearby (including markets to purchase your own food/meals to eat back in your room). Why, you wonder, am I only giving it 4 instead of 5 stars. First, even though our room (on the 16th floor) was well maintained & all furniture, etc was in excellent shape, it wasn't very comfortable. Most pull-out sofa/sleepers are not comfy to sit on & this one was no exception. The bed was far too hard for either my spouse or my taste while the pillows offered no support after about 5 minutes. As this is an older building, electrical plug-ins are pretty rare. One way to work around this would be to have lamps that include a charging station/plug-in on the base as I have seen at many hotels. I ended up having to charge my laptop in one of the bathrooms each evening. This resort is also listed as having a concierge on site. I can honestly say every time but one when we either walked by or intentionally went to the concierge desk, there was a sign saying nobody was on duty  regardless of the time of day. The one time my spouse actually found someone there, he asked about taking a bus tour. He was directed to the rack of brochures & told to have fun. Seriously, would have been nice to have been informed about the difference in the companies, where they picked up, etc. Aren't those the very reasons to have a concierge? Good thing we had planned much our trip prior to our arrival or we would have been SOL to have any help. The final reason for a removed star is the foolish daily fee. Now, we knew when we booked this location that the fee was part of the deal. They also reminded us at check in about the fee. What we got for that fee ($54-ish PER DAY) I couldn't tell you. We did get daily housekeeping service that was not needed and was inconsistent from day to day. Still a great stay for us.

title: Great Location
text:
This is  a great place to stay.  Great location, easy access to Subway, Restaurants, and activities.
We would definitely return here.  There is so much to do in NYC and this is a great place to do it from.

title: Idéal pour visiter
text:
Hotel très bien situé.Arrivée et départ rapide et sans problème.Chambre un peu petite pour une famille de 4 avec un canapé lit pour les enfants qui n'était toutefois pas fait quand nous sommes arrivés à 1h du matin.Avec le décalage horaire c'est un peu dure! 
Sinon personnel agréable et hôtel calme.

title: Beautiful hotel, amazing location...great price? (Lengthy but helpful!!)
text:
This is a beautiful hotel conveniently located just a short distance from Central Park. The lobby is open and inviting with very friendly staff. 
Space-wise, The rooms are great if you're fitting 4 people, which we were for the most part. However, when our 5th party member finally joined us and a cot was placed right in the middle of the room, it became very crowded. 
Location-wise, I loved the proximity to Central Park. On a less crowded day, you could walk there in 5 minutes. However, if you're looking for proximity to Time Square, you may want to look elsewhere. It was worthy of a cab ride for us but I guess that really depends on how much you are willing to walk.
Price-wise, I would say the price of the room per night is very reasonable. Like I said it's a great room, with a great staff, and even a great accidental view! There is one downside in my opinion. The cost of breakfast or even coffee was particularly high considering it looked like nothing more than what you would get for free at a Hilton.

Overall, I would definitely recommend staying here again. In fact, I am in June! The only reason I wouldn't give this hotel 5 stars is the price or breakfast. I am willing to look past this issue but I know for next time to bring a half gallon of milk and a box of cereal! As far as coffee, don't buy it there in the morning! For an extra dollar and a 3-minute walk down the street to Starbucks, your coffee will be better (and made by someone else!) ;)

title: Great place good location
text: We were happy with our one bedroom with two bathrooms. Worked out well for three ladies.  King size bed in bedroom was very comfortable.  Sofa bed was also good.  Unit had a mini fridge, small kitchenette area.  Internet worked fine.  The elevators were very slow at times.  The front desk staff and door staff are very helpful.  Location has a few restaurants around, many if you don’t mind walking a block or two.  Carnegie hall is just steps out the front door.very happy with ur stay.

title: I Love The Manhattan Club!!!
text: Certainly not an easy Manhattan hotel to get an overnight reservation at a moments notice, however, after lodging here just one night only… it is so transparent why this establishment is generally sold out! This is an outstanding hotel with a completely dedicated hard working staff who are all at your beckon call, 24/7. I want to give a very special mention to Paul, who is an extraordinary bell captain with an award winning smile and still says hello to me whenever I pass by this incredible hotel, which is known for its undeniably professionalism. I think very highly of The Manhattan Club, from their amicable staff to their elegant hotel rooms that come with a lovely designed kitchenette. I so enjoyed my one night stay over so extremely much and will definitely return again when there is room for me! Thanks again to the entire hotel staff for the wonderful way I was treated. I so appreciated it. Best, Jeff M. 🖊🕶🏨🌎

title: Inaceptable
text:
Estuvimos alojados en el hotel durante una semana, tuvimos que llamar a mantenimiento del hotel porque el sofá cama no se abría, el técnico de mantenimiento forzó el sofá para abrirlo y pasados unos días decidimos reclamar al hotel por lo que nos cambiaron de habitación, ese mismo día por la tarde al volver de una excursión nos encontramos que no podíamos acceder a la habitación, el motivo era que nos hacían responsables de la rotura de dicho sofá, el cual es un elemento de desgaste normal por el uso y sin darnos más explicación nos han retenido 500 $.
 
No ha habido forma de llegar a un entendimiento con dirección por lo que NO recomiendo este hotel , su política de reclamaciones es inexistente.

title: MALTRATO AL CLIENTE
text:
Hemos estado alojados durante 1 semana y al hacer el checking nos asignaron una suite con el sofá en malas condiciones, solicitamos al personal del hotel que abrieran el sofá cama y la persona que subió lo forzó al abrirlo y poner el somier plano, a la tercera noche el somier se hundió y lo comunicamos en recepción, nos alojaron en otra suite y nuestra sorpresa fue que al regresar al hotel nos bloquearon la tarjeta de entrada a la suite con todas nuestras pertenencias dentro y la razón que nos dieron fue que como habíamos roto el sofá cama de la otra suite nos iban a cargar en cuenta la reparación del mismo. Estuvimos hablando con la gerente del hotel y nos dijo que sus empleados dijeron que el sofá cama estaba bien y que habíamos sido nosotros los que lo habíamos roto, conclusión NOS JUZGARON Y CONDENARON A LA VEZ sin importarles nuestras alegaciones y nos pasan un cargo de 500 dolares por la reparación. Hablé con la persona de RCI que se encontraba alli (26 planta) y lo único que nos dijo fue que era problema de nosotros con el hotel, se lavó las manos. Realizamos varias llamadas a RCI España hablando con la Srta. Katia Sarmiento y la respuesta que nos dio fue la misma al igual que por la persona que me atendió al telefono proporicionado por la Srta. Sarmiento, teléfono de EEUU. Me siento ultrajada y muy ofendida por el trato recibido tanto del personal del Hotel como del personal de RCI.
Las habitaciones mal insonorizadas, instalaciones obsoletas, electrodomésticos funcionando pero en mal estado de mantenimiento. Desagües en mal estado.

title: No t what I expected for timeshare in the usa
text: Not  what I hoped it would be 🙁 Studio unit advertised as sleeping four, way to small for this to happen comfortably. You had to practically climb over the end of the other peoples bed to get to the bathroom at night. Small table with only two chairs so you couldn't sit and eat breakfast etc together. Pulled out the sleep sofa to find it full of popcorn and peanuts. Dishwasher door needed replacing. Had to call as sink/bath not draining. Used slot of points to stay here and the resort fee is very high for what you get. The units are poor value for money. Studio units should be advertised as only suitable for two. The location of this resort provides easy access to Central Park and Times Square.

title: DECEPCIONANTE
text:
RESUMEN. Para el hotel, la opinión y/o versión de los clientes no vale una xxxxxx.
EXPLICACIÓN. Estuvimos alojados 7 noches en un apartamento con cama y sofa-cama. Un sofá-cama que fuimos incapaces de abrir el primer dia. Mantenimiento se encargó de "abrirla" al más puro estilo español con las antiguas TVs de tubo, lo que llevó a que en mitad de la segunda noche, el sofá-cama se hundiera hasta el suelo. A la mañana siguiente nos cambiaron de habitación con la sorpresa que debiamos de pagar la reparación del mismo, $500 "justos".
Lo que vino a continuación os podeis imaginar...pues no! os aseguro que no se podía imaginar. Palabras textuales de la gerente del hotel, "nos fiamos más de las palabras de nuestros empleados, que de la palabra de nuestros clientes". Cambiaron la versión de los hechos, y nuestra agencia de viajes RCI se lavó las manos.
EL FINAL. Tiempo perdido, mala leche, 500$ menos en nuestra cuenta bancaria, y los "botones" del hotel riendose de nuestra situación.
CADA UNO QUE SAQUE SUS PROPIAS CONCLUSIONES.

title: Beautiful hotel
text:
Beautiful hotel, friendly and excellent staff.
We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was very large and modern and luxurious.
Staff are amazing, helpful, friendly and really nice 
Location is great - close to Central Park 
We Would definitely stay there again.
We loved it

title: muy bueno
text:
El hotel esta muy bien ubicado 
Los cuartos son amplios 
La limpieza es excelente 
El edificio esta muy bien mantenido .
La calefaccion funcionaba muy bien 
la cama era muy comoda  
Habia un microondas y una cafetera

title: HAPPY NEW YEAR NY 2018-19
text:
Hotel  con muy buena ubicacion
cerca de CENTRAL PARK,
restaurantes cerca 
habitacion equipada con cocineta
como a 3 cuadras esta un mercado en un centro comercial muy surtido
cama muy comoda
wi fi seguro
personal amable
RECOMENDABLE 100%

title: Solo Hiliday
text: Mostly excellent rating for cleanliness and helpfulness.  There are some minor things that need attention but overall I would definitely recommend and stay there again myself.Unsure about families as I was a solo traveller, however as far as I could see there were no facilities for children.  I could be wrong on this point as I didn't require any facilities so didn't enquire

title: Not really 4 star
text: A nice place but needs a bit of updating in the lobby. Not happy about having to pay for morning coffee in the owners lounge. Come on:( Not sure what the $54 charge per day was for? Got NOTHING for it. I even checked out early by three days and still had to pay the fee... crazy!

title: Great  location with amazing staff
text: The location was close to EVERYTHING! The rooms were a great size for a couple or small family. The rooms were very quiet as well. The city noises were not bad at all. The staff was very responsive to our requests and helped with directions to all of the sites. We will definitely stay here again!

title: Perfectly Accommodating!
text: This property has a great location in Midtown Manhattan, near theaters, restaurants, subway station and grocery and liquor stores.   It had a spotlessly clean and well designed unit, and the staff was most accommodating!   We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and will definitely return.

title: Excelente hotel con la mejor ubicación
text:
El hotel es excelente. Las habitaciones no son muy grandes pero son muy cómodas.
Tienen kitchinet con microondas, heladera y vajilla completa.
La ubicación es simplemente espectacular.
A dos cuadras de la 5ta avenida y a 2 cuadras de Central Park.
No incluye el desayuno pero estas rodeado de Starbucks y Donkin Donuts.

title: Fantastic spacious apartment in NYC
text: I have waited many years to be able to stay at The Manhattan Club and I was delighted when I finally made it.  I have stayed n Manhattan quite a few times before in mediocre, expensive hotels but The Manhattan Club was amazing.  I had read reviews saying it was a bit dated, not at all it is classy and homely in a really good way.

title: Excellent Resort
text: Everything was awesome! My only concern was the fact that the Resort charges a mandatory fee of approximately $325.00 for the week. I put on a search for a return trip on the second day that I at the resort. I've never done that before!

title: NYC visit
text: Location excellent. The resort was rather more like a hotel than the usual timeshare resort; there were no real facilities other than breakfast room/bar in the evenings, neither of which were cheap. There was housekeeping every day to replace towels, etc. The room was hotel quality but not top-notch - a little tired-looking. The kitchen area was a sink, fridge, microwave, and a very odd coffee maker. We asked for extra coffee and it was provided free of charge.
