The windows had ice on the inside during the very cold spell, but the heating was adjustable; we were not cold. There were 2 of us staying in a room for 4, with 2 bathrooms. It would have been crowded with 4 adults. One of the 4 elevators was being renovated during our stay, so that made for a little bit of ongoing waiting.  There was a lot of traffic noise from outside, but you are in the middle of the city.The property is very close to Carnegie Hall, around the corner from the subway station, with Central Park and Times Square within walking distance. There is an awesome supermarket and many bars and restaurants within a 5 minute radius walking. There are no laundry facilities, although there is a launderette close by apparently.As a base for NYC adventures, the property is perfect. $50/day service charge.

title: Great Place
text: The Manhattan Club is located in Midtown - west (great central location) and offers great unites (studio, 1 or 2 bedrooms). This time, I stayed at a studio unit - but extremely spacious, There is always a fully equipped kitchen - which is very convenient. The fitness center and the business center are both very good. Above all, the staff is very helpful and friendly - it is always a pleasure to stay here.

title: Short visit in cold January
text: Excellent location. Close to Central Park, theaters, restaurants, and several Metro stops. Hotel was very comfortable. Staff was polite.  Top floor lounge, bar, and breakfast was a nice touch although somewhat expensive considering there were other less expensive venues in the area.

title: The Manhatton Club
text: This has been a wonderful hotel in the past but needs updating. The service was not particularly friendly and at times quite rude. The daily service charge was extortionate for very little return... use of small gym, free internet, daily clean of room (sometimes unnecessary) and tea/coffee in room....water was $8 per bottle! Lifts were out of action and we had to wait up to 25 minutes for the one which was working, forcing us to use the service lift. The location was a great advantage.

title: New York safe and clean
text: Luxury residence.  Excellent location. Very safe and confortable. Don't miss Brodway musical. Subway in front of the residence. A lot of delicious places where dining. MOMA just behind The Manhattan Club

title: New York opportunity
text: The Manhattan Club is an ideal exchange for anyone interested in a New York vacation.  We had a wonderful week as the facility is about as centrally located as it can be.  We walked nearly everywhere, including the Broadway plays we were able to take in.

title: Great NYC loaction
text: Overall a fantastic resort with beautiful rooms and mini kitchens. Close to many sites:  we walked to Central Park, Broadway, Time Square, Rockefeller Center, St Patrick's church.  Also easy Subway ride to Statue of Liberty, 911 museum, Wall Street and Grand Central station.  We hopped a train at Grand Central station to get to Botanical Gardens or Harlem.  Only problem we had was check in.  We arrived early after overnight flight. Outside was in the low 30's and they did not offer to call us when rooms was ready, only wanted us to come back at 4 pm.  Not very friendly or helpful at check in, therefore a loss of one star. We also do not recommend their continental breakfast, for same price you can get a full hot breakfast one block away.

title: Love this place
text: I’ve been staying here since I was 15 and my parents had the time share. Recently (15 years later!) took over the cost it’s a great place to stay when you need a night or two in the city. The gym is a nice bonus as is the lounge on the 26th floor.

title: Needing a weekend away
text: I called in advance of a serious snow storm follwed by an ice storm to make arrangements to postpone my trip. I was told I would receive a call. I never did and as predicted the weather was awful. If this had been a hotel I would have easily been able to cancel and reschedule. Driving home in an ice storm is NOT safe. Our area of CT received the brunt of the storm and flights were canceled. I

title: Mixed Feelings
text:
The best thing about The Manhattan Club was its prime location. It was really close to Central Park and Times Square. In fact, most of the best places that we needed to explore on foot were visited with ease due to the hotel's great location. Also, there were lots of foodie places near by, including a Starbucks outlet too just round the corner.
Coming to the hotel and its service. We booked two rooms for our 6 day stay. The hotel had an old feel to it, but it was not bad. Our room was spacious with a comfortable master bed and sofa bed. Kitchenette was small but had basic stuff.  Wifi service was good throughout. The room service staff was friendly, but we were always short of toilet paper rolls and extra towels despite several reminders. The bathroom was way too small, most of the stuff had to be kept on a small table outside the bathroom. 
We had trouble with a bathroom door lock that had to be fixed and took the staff 4 days to finally sort the issue. The front desk staff were mostly nice except one lady who was really not there to help us and had a damn unfriendly tone and demeanour. The lifts were rather slow and we only checked their breakfast menu once and it was not worth trying.
All in all, we can say it was a good choice due to its location, but overall, I wouldn't say it was that outstanding for the money we paid.

title: Mid-week winter  Manhattan visit
text: Stayed two nights mid-week in January.  Staff was very friendly and efficient.  Checked in early without a problem.  Studio on 20th floor was quiet and of good size.  Furnishings were very good.  Location is top notch.

title: Great Location
text: We recently stayed at this facility.  The  units (we had 2), we clean however, when we first walked in it had a musty smell, which lessened within the day of us being there.  The location was super, and we were able to walk to many places easily, and also pick up our bus for the bus tour we did.  The elevators were the worse thing about this place.  We were on the 21st floor, and they had 4 elevators right outside our door, but only 1 worked.  We finally started using the service elevators, who were much quicker.  Other than that, because of the location and the units were clean, I would stay there again.

title: Timeshare in NYC - priceless!
text: We were thrilled to trade for a one-week timeshare in midtown Manhattan. We had a junior suite - that amount of space is rare in the city!Be aware of a $50+ per day facilities fee in addition to your RCI fee!!!Breakfast not worth the cost. Fitness facility very nice. Room very quiet especially considering you're right in the city.Can't wait to return!!!

title: Perfect location.   Great service!
text: Couldn't ask for better.   We had a1 bedroom on the 25th floor,  courtyard side.   We asked for this so we wouldn't hear street traffic.   The Manhattan club is in a great uptown location.   Only a block from subway.   The kitchenette was small but had all we needed.    The bed was comfortable and shower was nice. I would seriously recommend this property to anyone wanting to see NYC!

title: Underwhelming
text: The suite was not luxury as described in the hotel information. Our suite had only one window in the bedroom so the rest of the rooms were dark and inadequately lit. The blind at the one window was broken so it could not be drawn. The microwave was adequate but the revolving plate did not fit and slipped off each time it was used making a scrapping noise. The crockery is adequate but there are not cooking utensils so very basic basicfacilities.there was no hot water for a shower on our last day. The elevators were a nightmare and often took 5 or 10 minutes to summon as they missed our floor altogether much of the time in addition one was out of use for the whole stay. We were not provided with the bath robes though they were in the itinerary and despite letting front desk know we were waiting for them. On the positive side this is very well placed for time square central park Broadway etc. It was clean and quiet. I would be happy to stay there again because its adequate but not luxurious

title: Needs a revamp
text:
This hotel is old and is a desperate need off a revamp.
Reception, was not very willingly to assist when i needed a in-house doctor.
Only the conceirge, and bell man was helpful.
I will give this one a miss!!!!

title: Good Location with Added charges
text: Resort charges fee of $54 per day besides the exchange fee is outrageous. The resort should not charge this fees. I was shocked when I was told that I had to pay daily fees of my stay.RCI should disclose this fee at the time of booking. No resort charges this kind of fees.

title: Great Place To Call Home Base While In NYC!
text: I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the room, facilities , price and convenient location.    I stayed with my wife and adult son and we shared a suite that included 2 full baths , queen bed and sofa bed in separate sections of the room.. Very private and great for families that need that privacy from their children.  Each sleeping area and bath was fully independent with TV and toiletries, adequate linen and access to central hall with complimentary coffee,  microwave, popcorn, frig, dishwater, dinnerware adequate closet space, adequate heat, down pillows and comforters.  Huge lounge area takes up almost half of the hotel's 26th floor with complimentary coffee, cookies , large TV, sofas and tables where you can relax or work out of the confines of your room. Great location near Lincoln Center.

title: Excelente ubicacion
text:
Excelentes habitaciones, la atención del personal del hotel de primera,muy atentos y serviciales.
Excelentes opciones de restaurantes para comer, muy cerca  a estación  metro si necesitabas movilizarte lejos, podiamos caminar  al teatro.

title: Stay at Manhattan Club New York
text: The accommodation was extremely underwhelming. Our family was uncomfortable and did not look forward to returning after a long day. The overall cost of the accomodation compared to the quality was disgraceful and we will not be returning nor recommending it to anyone.

title: Buen lugar para hospedarse
text:
Fue difícil encontrar un lugar donde alojarnos para una familia de 4 (2+2).  Necesitabamos un lugar más grande que una habitación de hotel estándar de Nueva York, con al menos 2 o 3 ambientes, 2 baños y la posibilidad de contar con cocina o kitchinette.  Y por supuesto que la ubicación sea buena.  Club Manhattan fue la mejor opción que encontramos y volvería a alojarme acá si no contara con un presupuesto mayor.
La ubicación es muy buena, el edificio es viejo, tiene pocos ascensores, el personal no se destaca para nada por su amabilidad, la habitación era grande, no linda, tenía una kitchinette pero sin hornallas.  
Teniendo en cuenta los precios exorbitantes que tiene NYC para hospedar a una familia, lo recomendaría por su relación precio-calidad.

title: Excellent NYC Venue
text: Although some of the furnishings need updating the Manhattan Club is a great place to stay in NYC. Spacious suites, friendly staff, great location, and a relaxing place to stay in an otherwise bustling environment. We will stay again on our future visits to the city. Note: we stayed at the Manhattan Club as a time-share exchange so I cannot comment on the commercial rates charged by the club. However, I would highly recommend considering TMCNY when planning your next trip to New York.

title: Great Location !
text: After reading many of the reviews posted online we were a little nervous as to what to expect when we arrived at The Manhatten Club. We did not rent a car for obvious reasons, so for us, it was all about location. It is close to many of the points of interest. We walked or took a short subway ride everyday.  The room was adequate for the two of us. It was clean and quiet. We were pleasantly surprised that we heard very little noise. Remember you're in NY, if you want to be close to the main attractions you have to expect some noise. The resort caters to adults, there really isn't anything there for children. Our only disappointment was the high resort fee - we were charged an additional $385.00 at check-in! Because it doesn't offer any amenities, this seems very high.

title: Falta de limpieza
text: Hotel bueno pero con problemas de limpieza por que mi Sa se contagio pulgas de sillón y alfombra del hotel. Volvimos de viaje y mi sra sigue con tratamiento medico. Nuestra estadía fue del 30 de diciembre al 4 de enero 2019. Hab 1908. Resto normal.

title: Good Location
text:
Good hotel, excellent when it comes to location. The hotel itself is very comfortable and safe.It had all the crockery and cutlery that one would need; microwave and a small bar fridge.The water in the bar list is expensive so one could go to the many convenient stores (or pharmacies) around the hotel where you can get water (also very close appr. 2-3 minutes) Check-in was efficient. The elevators could use some updating/renovation though. We had a problem with our initial room however we were moved to another one seamlessly. The hotel decor is a bit outdated and a renovation would boost their rating. What saves this hotel is it’s close proximity to Times Square, Broadway, Hop-hop Off bus terminals (which are just next to Time Square) and Central Park(all within a 5min walk). I would say the only disappointment was when it was raining and they had no umbrellas and I had to go out in the rain to buy one. 
All in all it is a good hotel in a great location. 

PS: For those using timeshare, there is a tax fee charged at the end of your stay which is about $550

title: hotel bien situé
text:
Hotel propre très bon service. Le coin cuisine est très pratique Proche de Central Park, tres bien situé pour partir visiter la ville
Par contre nous avions une vue sur le mur de l'immeuble d'en face mais nous n'étions pas la bas pour rester dans la chambre. Chambre sans bruit Parfait

title: Excelente localização!
text:
Eu e minha família nos hospedamos nesse hotel através do Booking.
Ele possui excelente localização, conseguimos fazer vários passeios a pé.
O quarto é muito confortável e a limpeza é boa.
Com certeza voltaria a me hospedar lá!

title: Excellent Value, Superb Location
text: There were some snags at check-in due to IT issues but the rest of our stay was flawless. Staff was courteous, friendly and met all of our requests.  Short walk to Central Park, and 2 subway stations. Times Square and Rockefeller are also walkable.

title: Don't waste your money
text: I stayed here for Christmas Eve 2018 and it was terrible.  The water in the sinks and shower would not drain.   The room was so hot I felt like I was in a sauna.  I asked management to repair it and they gave me a fan.  The bed was hard and uncomfortable.  I do not recommend this property.  While the location is great the next time I do this I will look into the Sheraton instead

title: Idéal pour une famille
text:
Hôtel idéalement placé à proximité de Central Park et à quelques blocs de Times square.
Hôtel au calme et qui respecte autant que possible nos exigences.
Nous avions une suite, très au calme, avec kitchenette et 2 salles de bains.
Personnel accueillant et serviable.

title: Location saves it.
text: The location is among the best in one of the world's great cities, if not the greatest.  The lobby is tiny but serviceable. It can be very crowded and overly busy at check-out and -in time, so plan for that. Service overall is very good. The elevators are quite bad, 50 years behind the times. They remind me of elevators in old European hotels. They are too small and the wait can be considerable especially in heavy traffic hours. I suggest planning carefully, as it's easy to waste 30-40 minutes a day waiting for elevators.The decor of the hotel is drab. Insist on a renovated room as the older ones are actually shabby as well as being dark and dull.

title: We will book here again, for sure
text:
Location location location.  That's not the only wonderful thing about this hotel.  The service is out of this world.  The room was cozy and spacious, larger than any other room I have stayed in while in NYC. And, the lounge was phenomenal.  

Everything from check in to the baggage service to the service at the lounge bar exceeded my expectations.  Upon check in, we were informed we had been upgraded.  What a treat!  After doing our per check in and checking our bags we were off to see the city.  We returned early evening.  Our room was ready, we grabbed our bags and went straight up to the room.  Oh my!  The room was well appointed and welcoming.  The room had a hallway at the entrance leading to the living/sleeping area.  

After relaxing for a few moments we went upstairs to the lounge.  It was delightful.  The furniture is comfy and inviting.  The bar had plentiful options based on your preference.  We enjoyed one drink at the bar and took our 2nd drinks back to the room to relax.  The 2nd evening of our stay we visited the bar again before dinner.  The service was wonderful. 

 On Sunday, after shopping and exploring the city we wanted some downtime before heading to the airport.  The lounge provided just that option.  They had cookies and coffee as well as tea and water for guests to enjoy.  They had the tv's on showing the football games.  The lounge was wonderfully decorated for the holidays and provided the perfect place to get some rest and decompress. 

The furniture in the room and the linens were of high quality and were very comfortable.  The room had a wet bar including a mini fridge.  The towels were fluffy and soft, a huge bonus in my book.  

I look forward to staying here again in the future!

title: Very Polite Staff
text: Staff was very polite & courtesy.  Concierges were very helpful.  Managers come around and ask how things are.  Location is great -- near lots of restaurants, stores, and things to do.  Rooms were nice.  Only negative is their checkin time of 4pm is awfully late.

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: Booked a newly refinished suite here visiting friends that were also staying here. Would inquire as to whether your room is updated before booking.Wonderful spacious suite, great area & the staff were very welcoming.A true bargain rate wise for the area.Many nice restaurants within walking distance let alone Central Park & 5th Avenue.

title: Pire hôtel! du jamais vu!
text:
Comment la Ville de New York peut-elle authoriser un hôtel pareil dans une ville aussi touristique? Encore plus incompréhensible, comment peut-il avoir 4 étoiles? Quelle horrible image il donne à cette ville! Une profonde remise en cause est nécessaire, car il est incompréhensible d'avoir ce genre d'hôtel à 380.35 USD/NUIT HORS TAXES. Si on compare à d'autres hôtels dans d'autres villes du monde à Paris/Tokyo..., c'est une hérésie, et une honte pour New York.
Nous avions réservé une Executive Junior Suite pour 3 personnes pour 6 nuits. La suite est glauque et triste, mal agencée, vieillotte. La 3e personne devait donc dormir sur un canapé lit, en le préparant le soir, on s'est aperçu que le matelas du canapé lit était sale et tâché, en plus d'être très inconfortable après une nuit de sommeil. Aussi une fois le canapé-lit ouvert impossible de circuler dans la chambre. En ouvrant le canapé lit, nous nous sommes aussi rendus comptes aussi que le ménage était fait de façon très superficielle. Des médicaments et autres saletés étaient sous le canapé. Au prix de la chambre, 380.35 USD/NUIT HORS TAXES, nous nous attendions nullement à ce type de prestation et de confort. Le lendemain en expliquant à l'accueil notre déception, la saleté et l'inconfort du matelas du canapé lit, on nous dit d'attendre de parler à un manager. Celui-ci nous explique qu'ils vont essayer de nettoyer le matelas et de rajouter une alèse au canapé-lit, le soir en arrivant rien n'avait été fait. On leur demande donc que nous souhaitons trouver un autre hôtel, ils nous expliquent que nous avions une pénalité de 48 heures et donc que de toutes les façons nous devions nous acquitter de 2 nuits supplémentaires. Finalement nous sommes restés, contre notre gré, 2 nuits en plus puis nous avons changé d'hôtel. Nous regrettons tellement d'avoir choisi cet hôtel, au-delà de la chambre très décevante, la plupart du personnel de cet hôtel nous ont semblé tristes et blazés, quelle honte pour une ville aussi touristique. Le petit-déjeuner gratuit est aussi une mascarade, on a droit à 3 produits à emporter, extrêmement basiques. Peut-être que cet hôtel est bien situé, mais c'est franchement une honte qu'un hôtel pareil existe dans une ville aussi touristique, et qu'il ait de surcroît 4 étoiles! Au prix des chambres, c'est littéralement du vol! Ils ont complètement gâchés nos vacances, au prix que ce voyage nous a coûté, je trouve cela intolérable, au point que nous n'ayons même plus envie de retourner à New York tout court.

title: Location, location, location
text:
My family of 4 adults stayed at The Manhattan Club for our visit to New York to attend the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. The one bedroom suite, with 2 bathrooms and a kitchenette was a perfect choice for us. There was adequate room and housekeeping was excellent.

The best thing about TMC was the location. It was convenient to everything! Felicia, one of the concierge staff was terrific to work with, and made the trip easy to arrange.

title: Thanksgiving Break 2018
text:
Bluegreen had the Manhatten Club available so we grabbed it, I was hesitant due to fear of not having been there, the usual jitters of holiday travel and we’re  from a small town so trudging through a huge city is frightening... (just a little). We flew in to Lagaurdia and Taxi’s were readily available,it was late too! We taxied to 56th Street, and was warmly greeted by the Manhattan Club Doorman, (he graciously offered to help in pouring rain), the Desk Attendant welcomed us, didn’t take up my time with instructions but did explain enough that we wouldn’t get confused! Glory! We made it to 2nd floor, the room was cozy, warm and inviting! Small but comfortable everything clean, fresh and inviting! Our room was Queen bed, refrigerator, microwave and basic kitchenette. No laundry unless sending out. I could walk around the corner and find anything I could want even super glue, my glasses broke! 
The Manhattan Club is classic, historic and beautiful beyond words! Everything was literally around the corner! Walking, biking, taxi or bus just within minutes! Times Square, we done the Big Bus Tour, went to Radio City Music Hall and seen the Rockettes, Empire State Building Tour, basically I just booked our visits online from the Manhattan Club! Everything you could possibly want to do is within minutes, NYC has internet connection free! Manhattan has the friendliest people as well! Everyone was kind, go out of their way to help in any way! We didn’t see even 1 stressful situation, didn’t hear anything alarming even! Drivers are courteous to bikers even! Eating on the streets, unbelievable! 
The Manhattan Club was heated, 2nd floor was warm, raised a window in the room, and was fine, (yes noisy) but nothing that would be distracting! I biked around with my kids safely, walked around all hours day and night with my kids too! I know there are neighborhoods not to go into too, and I watched closely for anything unusual. Hey, don’t harness fear get out there! 

Lisa 52 years 
Caitlin 13 years 
Kelsey 12 years

title: Trato estupendo!!
text:
Estuvimos alojados en la habitacion suite con habitacion y dos baños completos para 3 adultos y un menor de 5 años. 
El comedor tiene sofa cama. Como cama no esta mal, entre pasable y bien. La cama de la habitacion principal es comodisima. Los baños uno con bañera y otro con ducha. Perfecto para los que preferimos la ducha. Hay secadores uno mas simple en el baño del salon y otro mas profesional, guardado en la comoda de la habitacion. En la cocina hay un micro horno y lo necesario en cuberteria. No es para cocinar. Pero es suficiente para desayunos y cenas ligeras. - Muy cerca esta Whole food (supermercado) en Columbus Circle, dentro del centro Columbus Cercle en planta -1. Tienen todo tipo de comidas prepradas y parafarmacia.-
Los trabajadores del hotel son todos educados, agradables y si necesitas cualquier cosa estan siempre atentos y dispuestos a ayudarte.
Las habitaciones limpias y si tienen algun descuido lo mencionas y enseguida te lo resolveran. -mi hija se indigesto vomito la ropa de cama, enseguida nos cambiaron todo y nos dejaron hasta otro recambio sin problemas- 
Unica pega: hotel muy anticuado, pero en buen estado de conservacion.
Repetiremos sin dudar!!

title: Rip off-Be Wary
text:
This is a nice hotel but I was ripped off by them and very angry about it. I received a special promotion for December for a room for $244. plus tax, breakfast included. When I went to check out I had $49. added to my bill for breakfast. Quite a price for a bagel and coffee.
When I went to complain I was told that the $49. was not for a meal but part of the price. Huh? The promotion didn’t say anything about this or I’m wouldn’t have booked
The room. They spoiled what was otherwise a
Nice stay and we’re not courteous enough to fix
It. Now I’m have to take the matter up
With visa. 

I

title: Clean, well situated hotel
text: The Manhattan Club is across the street from Carnegie Hall in mid town, a great location to go see anything in the city.  Subway is a block away, easy to access for getting around the city.  The hotel’s housekeeping staff is great and accommodating.  The lounge, open on top floor, is expensive and limited in drink offers and doesn’t offer food all day, only an overpriced breakfast.  The rooms are spacious, with a bedroom, living space with a pullout couch and two bathrooms-ideal for small families.

title: Great Location close to our Activities
text: I would have given this place 4.5 stars, but you can’t do half stars. This place was within walking distance of most everything we wanted, the theater district, Times Square, Dining, and only three blocks from Central Park. The rooms were nice and comfortable, however the heating and cooling were stuck off in a corner of the room so the Kitchenette would got nice and toasty yet the bed was still cold. The lounge could have been nicer and more available, and room service would have been nice. If it were not for these I would have given it 5 stars. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful, and again the location was great.

title: Comfortable stay
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 1 night, Dec01-Dec2, 2018

The check-in process was fast, the staff were courteous and the location is very convenient. Its near fashion square, many restaurants and walking distance to central park.

It was pricy but I am glad my husband booked it cuz of the exceptional service and convenience. The beds are very comfortable, we stayed at 05-06 hotels during our trip but we found their bed, the most comfortable and cozy.

Will definitely recommend to family and friends and will come back to stay here!

title: Great staff, but outdated units.  Not resort quality!
text: Wallpaper peeling, carpet worn and coming up. Dirty and dishwasher smelled horrid! Mattresses and pillows uncomfortable.  Unable to control room air. Room was warm and stale air causing stuffy noses and nosebleeds. No screens on window. Not enough linen for 3 people. "Lounge" overpriced. Small cup of coffee over $3! Resort fees OUTRAGEOUS for quality of unit. Elevators small and extremely slow. "Resort" handbook has entire page basically stating how high their standards are and if you complain, they really don't care.  My husband informed front desk staff about the disgusting smell of dishwasher and that unit was dirty, but they did not offer to change our unit. Most of the staff were friendly, especially the doormen and bell staff.

title: Great hotel in New York City.
text: Manhattan Club’s location is excellent. It is near subway stations and attractions. I like the proximty of it being near Central Park and Time Square. The service was excellent from the valet to check in. Housekeeping service was quick too when we had to ask for additional condiments.

title: Good choice for first trip to NYC
text: Great location. We are walkers and were able to go almost everywhere we wanted to see by foot with a couple of subway rides. The room was quiet during our three weekday stay. We had plenty of space and the foldout couch was comfortable as was the bed. The kitchenette area was handy. The staff were helpful and friendly and everything was clean. I'll be back.

title: Weekend in NYC
text: It was a quick trip to NYC for a weekend. The Manhattan club is in a great location, so close to Central Park, Lincoln center, theaters, etc. so many choices of restaurants. It was very quick and easy check in and check out. Really enjoyed the weekend

title: Love it hsre
text: We come every year, and have never been let down! The Manhattan Club is central to  sooo many things, you’re only a few blocks from TimesSquare one way and a few blocks to Central Park the other- also not far from Hell’s Kitchen. Clean rooms and building. Great staff!

title: MANHATTAN CLUB
text: one bedroom was a nice size .they had  very thin walls, we could here the next rooms conversations like they were in the room with us, so I'm sure they could here us as well. I think the staff could be more accommadating to guest. Location was great. Concierge was very helpful.

title: Location, Location, Location
text:
We wanted decent accommodation in a hotel with some character, at reasonable rates, close to Central Park (for daily runs) and within walking distance of most of Manhattan. We also needed a kitchenette and access to grocery stores. We got all this, albeit with a few surprises. 

Cons: 
– Exceedingly slooow elevators (get a room on the 2nd floor and use the stairs)
– Access to the stairs and the stairs themselves – both back-of-house and pretty sketchy
– Fruit flies in the kitchenette area (not a huge deal)
– No view whatsoever (our windows looked into an internal window well with mechanical equipment in it and scaffolding of some sort above) (kind of twilight zone-ish)
– A bottle of wine came with the room but no bottle opener (one arrived after 2 calls to room service... and a tip)
– No bathrobes which were included as well (another call)
– Really plastic-y dishware – and very little of it (another call to room service requesting something more substantial didn’t produce any results) 
– Easy to lose small objects in the dark patterned carpet!

Pros:
– Ace concierge
– Great location (5-minute walk to Central Park, Whole Foods, public transit)
– Friendly, helpful staff
– Incredibly spacious suite
– Large, updated bathroom and shower
– Generous amounts of shampoo, soap, etc. and fluffy, soft towels 
– Clean, very clean
– Comfortable bed
– Absolutely dead quiet – no noise whatsoever
– The bottle of wine (once we finally got it open)
– Large, comfortable lobby with entertaining artwork

The pros far outweighed the cons. We would definitely stay at The Manhattan Club again.

title: Excellent
text: We went to New York for 5 nights from the 20th October and stayed at the Manhattan Club. We had two rooms. When we arrived we were on separate floors and wanted to be on the same floor, so mentioned this. The next morning this was sorted for us. No problems at all. The reception staff were excellent, the door staff are all excellent, the rooms were excellent, the lifts were excellent and the location was more than excellent. Do not be put off by some of the reviews. We did not experience any issues. The beds were also very comfortable and....you guessed it, excellent!!! Will definitely return. Garry, Louise, Charlotte and Jessica. All I can say is we all miss it.....

title: Excelente lugar
text:
Compramos con 4 meses de anticipación y la verdad que resultó más barato que de costumbre.

El lugar es justo lo que se necesita. Espacios amplios y cuenta con refrigerador, platos, microondas y vasos.

Está a unas cuadras de Broadway, el metro, central park, realmente estás en el corazón de Manhattan.

Su ubicación es muy buena para ir a cualquier lugar de la isla, si por la noche quieres salir a unos pasos tienes metro o autobuses.

title: Ideal for trip to New York
text: We were a group of four adults and The Manhattan Club Suites were ideal for us.  I wouldn't go beyond them and would recommend them to anyone staying in New York.  The location was perfect.  Subway on corner on direct line but we were within walking distance of everywhere.  Central Park 3mins, Times square 5/6 mins, supermarket 2 mins.  Loads of lovely restaurants within walking distance, Century 21 & other shops in Columbus Circle about 10 mins walk. CVS, McDonalds, TJ Maxx all 2/3 mins walking. The Executive Junior Suite we stayed in was perfect for us. We had a renovated room on the 22nd floor. Plenty of room for us.  The bed & sofa bed really comfortable. Kitchenette ideal, especially with lovely supermarket so near. Staff very nice, efficient & really helpful.  We had an evening flight, our luggage was stored for us and the door staff arranged a taxi for us to the airport. Plenty towels etc and room cleaned daily. I was apprehensive about accomodation in New York but would recommend Manhattan Club to anyone planning a trip.

title: Excelente
text: Adorei o hotel, especialmente a localização, pois muito perto do Central Park e Columbus Circle. O quarto é muito bom e espaçoso. Tem uma mini cozinha, com microondas e frigobar. Ótima limpeza e atendimento cordial. Recomendo.

title: Medelklasshotell med bra läge
text: Ingen lyx och självklart heltäckningsmatta överallt, mindre lyckat för allergiker. Bäddsoffan fungerade över förväntan. Junior ex suite var lagom för max 2 personer. Otäta fönster visslade och skallrade när det blåste. Dålig ventilation i badrummet gjorde att imma måste vädras ut i rummet och att torka blöta handdukar var omöjligt för att kunna återanvända dem.

title: Great location
text:
This Hotel was the perfect location to explore New York, close to transport and the major attractions, Times Square, Central Park, the Russian tea house and Broadway. 
The concierge were extremely helpful and we utilised their services on a number of occasions. Our room was spacious and the bathroom elegant. The lounge on the top floor is a great way to enjoy a drink and view the beautiful sky line. I would thoroughly recommend this Hotel.

title: Nice hotel
text:
Great location near Central Park, Times Square, Columbus Circle, Met Museum.
Good team, room comfortable, with complimentary coffee and tea.
Small fridge, microwave oven.
The prices have variation during the week days.
Child friendly.
It will be good to have food options to buy on frontdesk.

title: 子連れに便利なホテル
text: ロケーションはマンハッタンの中心にも関わらず、街の喧噪はあまりお部屋では気にならずとても静かに過ごせました。電子レンジ、冷蔵庫、コーヒーメーカーがあり、1歳５ヶ月のこどものごはんやミルクを温めたりするのにとても便利でした。お部屋の広さもこどもが歩きまわるには十分でした。お掃除などもゆき届いています。母も一緒に行ったので二部屋予約したのですが、両方バスタブがあるお部屋との事前情報でしたが、一つのお部屋はシャワーのみでお湯の出が少ないのが残念なポイントでした。９月だったのでまだ良かったですが、真冬は寒いです。NYCなので仕方ないですが、価格は高いです。

title: superbement placé et bien organisé
text:
Nous  avons choisi le Manhattan Club pour sa situation,  la superficie et la configuration de ses suites qui permettent de vivre à 3 sans se gêner et qui disposent d’une kitchenette.

Nos motifs de choix ont été largement confirmés durant cette semaine de vacances  : le quartier tout près de Central Park et de Times square est génial, très bien desservi par plusieurs lignes de métro,  nous avons apprécié de pouvoir dîner le soir dans la suite après nos journées très denses de visite dans le Grosse Pomme.

La literie est très confortable y compris le sofa du salon 
Seul bémol l’établissement est assez bruyant du fait de problèmes de bruit de climatisation et d’une mauvaise isolation extérieure.

Cela reste cependant une très bonne adresse à retenir pour New York.

title: Nice staff, clean room and AMAZING LOCATION
text:
Stayed for 2 weeks in October. Loved that the room had a comparably large fridge for storing our self bought items. Room was clean and fairly large with window towards 56th street. Not too noisy even from the 2nd floor. TV was a little small and would have loved option to install own Chrome Cast. WiFi was usable but was a little too weak for steaming content.
Located 5-10 mins. Everything. Subway down the street, restaurant, fast food, Whole Foods and Times Square is a short walk away.
Staff was helpful when we needed them.

title: A solo dos cuadras de Central Park
text: Es un hotel muy recomendable tanto por su ubicación como por su conectividad con todo Manhattan. A solo  dos cuadras de central park  y 10 de time square. La habitación que tuvimos muy amplia, con una exelente cama King size, sala, cocineta y 2 baños. La limpieza la hacen todos los días y el personal y la concierge fueron muy amables. El viaje fue a mediados de octubre y ya el clima estaba fresco y bastante airoso. Para esta temporada es importante viajar con una buena chamarra con capucha y bufanda

title: Great location, suite was smaller than expected (especially the bathroom)
text:
We stayed here for a week (three of us, two adults and one 12 year old). Firstly, the hotel is in a GREAT location (two blocks down from Central park and across the road from the Carnegie Hall and the W57th Street Subway station is less than two minutes from the front door). However, there are some sticking points. Number one is that, although we had a junior executive suite, it was really not that big. It would have been find for two of us, but having to put up the sleeper sofa each night took up a lot of room. Number two, the bathroom (and especially the bath) was way smaller that expected, the "full marble bath" depicted in their photo gallery is somewhat misleading and ended up with us being a little "grumpy" with them on arrival (after a long trip from the UK). Having spoken with other guests, it seems like even the One Bedroom suite had the much smaller than expected baths! Another small annoyance was that one of the towel rails kept falling off and the bathroom sink was cracked.

That said, the room was clean, and the temperature was easy to adjust, we were overlooking a courtyard/light-well so it was quiet too. The Kitchenette was handy too and the Concierge was really helpful.

All in all, it was OK to very good but not outstanding.

title: Super bem localidade localizado
text: O hotel fica bem próximo de tudo. Se gosta de caminhar, como eu, poderá fazer quase tudo a pé. Central Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue, Lincoln Center, Rockefeller Center, Empire State... O hotel tem Wi-Fi de boa qualidade. Único problema para mim é o horário do check in: 4pm é muito tarde! O café da manhã é caríssimo, mas tem varias ótimas opções perto e você pode, se quiser, tomar no quarto. Tem forno e coisas de cozinha, além de uma cafeteira. Só precisei sair da região para conhecer a Estátua da Liberdade, Wall Street e o Memorial 09/11.

title: First NYC stay
text: The best thing about this hotel is its location in Manhattan. The front desk staff was unfriendly and uncaring. The room furnishings are out dated. Our view from our room was of a brick wall! Very few amenities at this hotel. The elevator always took a long time to reach our floor (17th).

title: Great Location!
text: Great for walking if you can. If you can't  use subway. Even taxis have a hard time getting you to & from exhibits easily. Buy broadway tickets in advance, they are very difficult to purchase week of your visit.

title: Outstanding Quality & Service
text: We could not have been more happy with our stay. Location is perfect. We walked everywhere; Times Square, Central Park, near restaurants, stores, etc. Our room was spacious, comfortable, and very clean. Bathrooms have super soft towels and nice selection of soaps. Front desk and doormen were friendly and efficient. We’ll be back. Thank you!

title: Boa estadia. Boa localização.
text: São rigorosos no horário, mesmo querendo pagar early check-in não deixaram entrar antes da 16 horas. Foi cansativo. O Quarto Metropolitan bom, um pouco apertado, no 2o.andar. Tivemos um problema, uma obra na nossa janela. Logo cedo barulho na janela. Reclamamos, o hotel estava cheio. Mas resolveram, nos deram um Up grade para One Bedroom Suite, no 11o.andar, linda com 2 banheiros. Atendimento perfeito. Bem localizado. O café não incluído, não é barato e não tem muita variedade, o que é comum em NY. Esta é a 2a.vez nesse Hotel. Também fiquei nessa suite superior. Não é barato, logo, tem que ter bom serviço.

title: Excelente en todo sentido
text: Quizás sería bueno que se contara con facilidades para cocinar. El personal brinda muy buena información sobre actividdes que se pueden realizar.y se pueden comprar en el sitio tanto para teatro como para excursiones.

title: Centralt och lättillgängligt
text: Centralt beläget på Manhattan. Enkel standard, men helt ok för vårt syfte med resan: att se mycket av Manhattan. Två vuxna och två tonåringar i bäddsoffa blev lite trångt, men funkade. Det lilla kylskåpet på rummet var lagom för att fylla på med frukost för ett par dagar till hela familjen.

title: excelente ubicación y comodidad
text:
El hotel está a 2 cuadras y media del Central Park y a 5 de Columbus Circle. Tiene estaciones de metro a 2 cuadras a la redonda para todas las direcciones de NYC. Las habitaciones son muy confortables y con todas las comodidades para una estadía confortable. Estábamos en un piso 2 y no se escuchaban ruidos molestos de la calle.
La habitación que ocupamos tenía un dormitorio con una cama king size y en el living un sofá cama de 2 plazas en muy buen estado. Las sábanas, toallas y batas son de excelente calidad.
Lo único para mejorar son las almohadas, pésimas!, lo otro que sugiero agregar a la habitación es un par de sillas extras ya que la única que había era insuficiente para sentarnos a comer con comodidad.

title: Hotel Dinner Broadway Birthday
text:
Love the decor, close to many restaurants and Central Park. 
Staff are very professional, polite and knowledgeable. 
Would recommend staying here, guarantee you will return for another stay. 
Walking distance to very nice places.

title: Great Location, Poor Maintenance
text: Loved the beds, slept great which is unusual for us.  Location amazing. 10 Mins to Times Square and Rockafeller Center. 2 Mins to subway and Central Park.  One of the elevators didn't work while there even told it would be fixed on day 2.  The bathtub drain didn't work.  Recommend Black Tap for crazy shakes.  Stardust for singing waiters. Wicked for a Broadway show. Spyscape is around the corner. Get a CityPass from Costco for best savings.  All winners with our entire family including kids.

title: An easy walk to Times Square and Broadway
text: We spent 6 nights here and were lucky enough to be upgraded to a suite which was excellent and had 2 bathrooms, a lounge/dining area and a kitchenette.  The kitchenette had a fridge, microwave and a dishwasher.  Very few kitchen items other than the cutlery, crockery and glasses.  No washing up liquid or tea towel.  The suite was very clean and an iron and ironing board were also provided.  No restaurant but many just a short stroll away.  A great supermarket nearby too.  Subways nearby also and only a short walk to Central Park.  We were very happy with the location.

title: Great location with a few nice touches
text: Room was surprisingly large for a new york hotel with typical finishes.  No real restaurant or bar (owners lounge upstairs has limited amenities) but lots of choices in immediate neighborhood.  Only 2 guest elevators, one of which was not operating.  Guest had to share "back of house" elevators with staff which I hope was just for a short while.  From desk personnel were very good..

title: Nice Upgrades but still needs attantion
text: We just returned from 4 nights in NYC. Since we own at the Manhattan Club, we stayed there. The room we stayed overlooked 7th Ave, which was a long room and nice but very noisy. They did a nice job at refurbishing the rooms all in grey tones, but I am surprised that the furniture is still the old furniture with scratches, etc. They spent a considerable of money and time on the upgrades but the least they could do was update the dressers also.

title: Excellent service and great location to all attractions in NYC!
text: This hotel is within walking distance to most NYC attractions! It is very close to central park, restaurants, and shopping! The housekeeping service is beyond excellent! We were on 20th floor with a view and an updated studio room!

title: Super comfortable suites
text:
I was not sure what to expect of this hotel. Prices in NYC were sky-high because of the UN General Assembly meeting in September, and this was the cheapest deal I could find. So I was prepared for a dump. However, the rooms were super-comfortable and spacious, and the location is great for theatre-goers. Be aware that there is no restaurant in the hotel - it serves an overpriced breakfast and there is a bar, but that's it. With so many dining choices around, though, it should not be a problem for most.

The one minor complaint I had was a smell of smoke in the room when I arrived. This cleared up after the first day, but then on the third day it was back. 

Otherwise, everything was perfect and I enjoyed my stay.

title: Ótimo
text: Excelente hotel, localização perfeita. Ficamos numa suite com King Size Bed , armários, cômodas, dois banheiros banheiros completos. Perfeito . limpeza ótima. Toalhas são pilhas! Bons produtos nos banheiros.

title: Great hotel in great location
text: We were very happy with his hotel. We have now stayed here three times on trips to NYC. The staff are friendly and more than helpful. The hotel is very homely and in a great location. The only downside was that our room (2118) was next to the elevator and was very noisy during the night.

title: More than happy!
text:
I visited New York on my own and stayed for 2 weeks in a Metropolitan Suite. 

I had spent alot of time searching for a room that actually had some space at a reasonable price. And was not disappointed at The Manhattan Club. I had a lounge area and small kitchenette with a fridge. 

My room was on the 21 floor and the decor was impressive and much better than some of the photos I have seen. 

I had also read many reviews on here and was a little concerned about some of the complaints people had made.. however even after 2 weeks of staying I could not complain about anything! 

Aircon worked extremely well. Lifts did not take as long as some people have suggested, yes at check in and check out it was a few minutes wait but certainly not to the extent I have read from some reviewers. Maybe 3-4 mins at most. 

Location is brilliant.. especially staying on my own, I found it so easy to get around.. subway stations with in a minutes walk, time square and Central Park also a short walk. 

Door staff were beyond helpful and mad sure everyday I knew exactly how to get where I was going. Nothing was a bother to them and they certainly made my trip better.. it was nice seeing familiar faces every day. 

Rooms were cleaned well and plenty of amenities and fresh towels everyday. 

My room was literally right at the elevator door and I was concerned about noise.. however was never disturbed. 

The wifi works extremely well. 

After hearing horror stories of friends not being able to open their cases on the floor due to lack of space in other similarly prices hotels.. I would not hesitate to book The Manhattan Club if visiting New York. 

I know I certainly will be when I am heading back again next year.

title: Great location and staff
text: Overall pleasant stay.  Rooms could use some improvements.  Staff very helpful.  Lounge pleasant, but drinks a bit pricey.  Nice bartender.  We would stay here again.  Location very convenient to central park and theatre distruct.

title: Luxury at a bargain price
text: We stayed here with a family of four—couple with two teenagers—while seeing shows and doing general sightseeing. The room was much more spacious than most NYC hotels. We didn’t use the kitchenette as much as I’d hoped, but having it was good. The location is ideal for Broadway shows (short walk; less time than a taxi), Central Park, and other midtown attractions. Carnegie Hall is about a block away, along with its subway stop. I had some concerns after reading a few negative reviews, but our experience was 100% positive. I can’t wait to return.

title: A stay at the manhattan club
text: I stayed here 2 nights in the middle of the week, tues/wed nights.  Fine for a place to sleep on biz but would never cone with my wife nor family.  These are small apts, had a kitchenette, lvrm, bdrm and 2 bthrms.  Ivused to kive in manhattan and this would have been a small 1bdrm which is not what i was expecting.  I was the you gest person i saw invthe elevators by 30-40 years.  Seemed like an hold age living home.  Was clean and comfortable but my room had a damp smell on very humid days.  To leave on a positive note they had he best pillows i have slept on anywhere.  Amazing.  Room rate was $320 a night when next clisest room was 480 and up.  Didnt realise how expensive NYc has gotten with many rooms over $1,000 a night, as such this was good value for money.  They only need to tweak a few small thingsvto make me come back, including phtting nicer staff on reception.  Not rude but i dont need NY attitude from the front desk, i get that as soon as i go outside.

title: características hotel
text: el hotel con muy buena ubicación. amabilidad del personal. buena limpieza. falta piscina. la habitación muy comoda. tv cable ok. climatización ok. wiffi aceptable y en todo el complejo. se recomienda el hotel

title: The Manhattan Club
text: fabulous resort, great location, great staff , many urban amenities,  great restrauant , great mid day treats, bar on site, lovely room, free wifi, spacious for a city room, quiet facilities, a must stay

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: I lucked out with this hotel through a Groupon deal. The property is in an excellent location; easy to walk to Times Square and Central Park. Rooms are decently sized. "Take away" breakfasts are provided. Recommended!

title: Simply wonderful
text: Just spent 4 nights here and we will definitely come back one day. Nothing was too much trouble and the place has a very pleasant relaxed atmosphere. The staff were exceptional as were the other guests we met. A very enjoyable stay

title: Central location and nice sized rooms!
text: Have known about this property for a long time but never had the occasion to stay until recently. Really loved it! After first going into the lobby of an adjacent (and connecting) property, it was smooth sailing. Rooms are much larger than the norm plus a handy fridge. The upstairs members lounge was also a nice amenity while we waited for our room to be readied. Great doormen! Can get anywhere from this location!

title: New York con i bimbi
text:
Trascorsa 1 settimane ad agosto con 2 bimbi 5 anni e 1 anno e mezzo.
Hotel pulito a 3 traverse da Time Square..per noi è stata la soluzione migliore per non trovarci nel caos più totale anche la notte o la mattina presto. Utilizzato transfer di Micky Disa prenotato direttamente dall'Italia ( lo trovate su fb).
Camere spaziose anche il bagno. Moquette in camera ma pulita ( mio marito e allergico e non ha mai avuto problemi).
Eravamo al 13 piano con vista su un edificio di fronte. Su richiesta é disponibile la culla. Buon rapporto qualità prezzo, prenotato tramite agenzia.

title: Great location - 5 min. from Times-Square by train.
text: Close to subway stations and had several options of trains N,Q,R,W to get around in.  Love the subway system.  Once I got use to it, I did all my travelling by train.Had a 1 bedroom suite with a huge king-size bed and a queen pull-out and 1 full bath and 1 bath with a shower, a bar fridge and a microwave.  It suited our needs.Staff was friendly and helpful.Nice gym and computer room which I used every day.Would have preferred more than a continental breakfast.

title: Très bien placé!
text: C'est un hotel très bien placé à New York!  Le personnel est agréable et serviable. Les chambres sont  spacieuses et classes! Le lit était très bon! Pour faire une pause ou avoir un rendez-vous le lounge au dernier étage est très bien! Alors, ce n'est pas la peine de prendre le petit déjeuner à l'hotel. Il y a plein d'endroits autour où vous mangerez mieux!

title: Great location and nice rooms!
text: You really can't beat the location of this place. You are in the middle to everything and steps away from the park. Book it! Rooms are well furnished and although the place isn't set up like a traditional hotel it's very clean and comfortable.

title: Great Stay in a great location
text:
Just back from 7 nights in New York, staying at The Manhattan Club. Check in was quick and efficient, and the reception staff very friendly.

We booked through British Airways holidays, and our room was a one bedroom suite. We were very impressed with the size of the suite. It had separate bedroom with its own bathroom, 2 wardrobes and TV. The lounge area included a double sized sofa bed, which was great for our 14 yr old. There was also a separate shower/WC bathroom off the entrance hall, which he used for himself. The lounge adjoined the dining area which has a kitchenette with dishwasher, sink and coffee maker. The kitchen also had complementary coffee pods and a pack of microwave popcorn.

There were also two bottles of Voss water available, however these were charged at $8 per bottle, and the same bottles of Voss could be bought at local stores for £3.49 a bottle.

The room was serviced every day, with beds made up, and bedding/towels changed if needed, and the coffee / popcorn replenished each day.

Our room was on the 18th floor, and close to two lifts. We had no issues with the lifts, however on a couple of occasions, one of them was out of service.

The Hotel featured an 'owners' bar on the 26th floor, but we didn't use it. They provided continental breakfast options, but we felt these were a little pricey ($19.95 to sit down or £12.95 to grab and go), and we had breakfast outside the restaurant. Also, having the kitchenette means you can have breakfast and/or snacks in room.

Only gripe about our room, the windows could do with upgrading, as they appear to be single glazed and despite being on the 18th floor, we still heard a lot of street noise (both sirens/car horns, and people shouting). There were also road works on 7th avenue outside the hotel, which whilst being beyond the control of the hotel, could also be heard through the closed windows. They started at about 5 or 6am.

All that said, once we got to sleep, we did have a decent nights sleep in the large, comfortable bed.

Check out at 11am was as quick and efficient as the check-in, and the bellhop kept our luggage in a secure room until we returned later to head to the airport for our evening flight.

Overall, we had a very good stay at The Manhattan Club, and would certainly stay again. It is in an excellent location on 56th Street just off 7th avenue - very close to the southern end of Central Park, and within a 10 minute walk of Times Square. The closest subway station was 57 7th avenue which was only 2 minutes walk, and this was on the main lines to downtown and brooklyn, and Coney Island.

title: Súper ubicado, excelente atención.
text: Excelente hotel con muy buena ubicación a una cuadra o dos del Central Park y muy cerca de Times Square, y lo mejor fue la atención al huésped en recepción siempre amables y dispuestos a ayudar. La habitación parecía un departamento pequeño con cocineta, refrigerador, cafetera, micro, vajilla TODO ! Tenía una salita de TV y el sofá cama de gran ayuda, el baño y la regadera confortable y la cama muy agusto. Sin duda volveríamos a este hotel que quizás no es el más nuevo de la zona pero tiene muchas cosas a favor.

title: A pretty reasonable place in a great location
text:
I’d been trying to get a week’s swap to this timeshare “resort” so when one finally came up for August I took it despite the heat.  The location is fabulous as it is close to many sites and to stations on most of the Subway lines.

The daily charge is quite a sting on top of the costs already borne in maintenance at our own resort and swap fees, but you can save money by having breakfast and some evening meals in the room using the kitchenette.  Also it was nice to have daily maid visits, so the bed was made, towels changed, the place was cleaned and bins emptied.

We had a studio which wasn’t overly spacious but not cramped for the two of us either.  It did have a sofa bed and it would have been very cosy for four people.

The biggest criticism we had was that the air conditioning just pumped cold air into the room and did not dry the air in the room.  As the humidity was high this meant that the water condensed out of the then cold air and everything in the room felt quite wet after a couple of days.  We decided it was better to turn the air-con off and open the window, apart from when it was actually raining.

Staff were all nice enough and helpful.  We would happily found back.

title: Uma boa escolha para férias em família
text: Estive hospedado com a minha família no Réveillon 2017. É um hotel muito bom para acomodar a família. A limpeza é boa no quarto e banheiro, tem cozinha com microondas, frigobar e lava-louças, assim você pode decidir o que vai comer sem gastar muito.

title: Pretty good place in a great location
text: The Manhattan Club is a comfortable place that I would definitely stay at again, considering what other nice hotels charge in this part of town.  It took a long time to check in, so they upgraded us to a suite-- we almost didn't leave.

title: Great Location
text: Located 2 blocks off Central Park  Easy walk to Time Square and other locations. Local places to eat. Stayed in studio with mini fridge, microwave, small sink, wifi. Large room. Old style bathroom notlike pictures on web page. Not many amenities. Breakfast expensive, chose to eat out every day.  It is a hotel. Bed comfortable. would stay there again but would also try other places to experience variety.

title: Rare timeshare property in NYC
text: Timeshare properties in NYC are exclusively Hilton, with the exception of THE MANHATTAN CLUB. With such limited inventory in NYC, there is high demand; but we have scored a week at Manhattan Club twice. (Hilton sales staff are always impressed that anyone has actually been able to book Manhattan Club through RCI—but we have.) The property has been renovated since our first visit, and it is an attractive refurbishment. Our first visit was a one-bedroom with two complete baths; this visit was a studio, which was ample (and I actually preferred the layout--the bed is in a separate alcove, not a room). Exchange guests have access to the owners' lounge (Hilton does not grant lounge access to exchange guests). Reception staff were courteous, professional, engaging, efficient, that is, perfect in every way. DRAWBACK--A resort fee of US$50 per night is steep, but daily housekeeping is a nice amenity. Even considering the exorbitant resort fee, I would book an exchange week at Manhattan Club again.

title: Buena Ubicación Correcto
text: Es un buen hotel, buen servicio, y excelente ubicación. El punto crítico en mi estadía fue la comodidad en la habitación para quienes, como nuestro caso, no estuvimos en familia, sino 4 adultos -y de buen tamaño- había en un solo dormitorio una cama doble y un sofá cama también doble y poco espacio y poco lugar para la ropa en armario. Buen Servicio de Bar en planta baja y piso 26.

title: Perfect for us
text:
We have just come back from a 7 night stay at The Manhattan Club and for us it was just perfect. The location for us was ideal, Central Park a 5 minute walk uptown and Time Square a 10-15 minute walk downtown. We were on the 22nd floor and enjoyed watching the city life go past us when we were in. The accommodation was ideal for us and we have no complaints at all about it. The staff were all friendly and helpful and  made the hotel better for us.  We didn’t use the facilities at the hotel. We found that there was enough places around us (and cheaper!!) to grab some food on the go and do our sightseeing. I was tempted to use the gym but with Central Park so close decided to have a run around it and was not disappointed!
The test that proved it to me was when we were waiting for a taxi to take us to the airport to return home, my 8 year old son refused point blank to leave the hotel and get into the taxi!!!  He loved New York and he loved the hotel............ Would I stay here again on my next visit to NYC...... DEFINITELY!!!

title: Location, location, location
text: I read plenty of reviews before I chose this hotel and it didn't disappoint.  From check in to customer service to amenities this is by far one of the best places to stay in Times Square I got a great deal for a junior suite and I was impressed. Its walking distance to Central Park, Times Square and all the fun NYC has to offer. Highly recommended!

title: A grand hotel-type building.
text: The building is mid-block, between 5th and 7th Ave in mid-Manhattan.  Subway can be fouind on 7th, a very short walk, but much is within walking distance: the theater districe, Times Square and Central Park, among other activities.  A block away there is a Morton Williams grocery, which is fairly large and well stocked.  A little further out there is a very nice Whole Foods market.There are restaurants on the block and many nearby.  Besides walking and the subway, taxi's are reportedly pretty reasonable, with an average fare of $10 (which will probably change with time as there has been a capping of Uber and Lyft licenses apparently.As to The Manhattan Club, it is well maintained, maybe a little older, but clean and classy.  Staff were very respectful and professional and appeared to take pride working there. Also, the resort gets very high marks for privacy and non-intrusiveness..

title: Great place to Escape
text: Always enjoy staying at the Manhattan Club when in New York. Biggest rooms in NYC nicely accommodates 4 people with two private bathrooms. Can't say enough about the people. Love the new Breakfast to go $12.99 upstairs on 26th floor. The rooms are clean, and enjoy the kitchenette. Thank you Manhattan Club.

title: quick and easy check in and out.  facilities are wonderful, bartender is great, even the elevators are working better.
text:
it is in the best location, at 56th and 7th ave.  great restaurants all around with broadway just down the hill.  
rooms were very clean and comfortable.  everything worked as it should.  the staff was very attentive and always ready to help.  the concierge was quite knowledgeable and provided what ever information i needed.

title: Manhattan Club
text: Rooms are spacious.  We had a 1 bedroom king/2 bathrooms.  Pull out sofa sleeper was comfortable per our teenage sons. Daily housekeeping is a plus.  No washer/dryer on site.  Partial kitchen-no stove, oven or toaster, but that's not a huge deal for NY.  Slow elevators.  Noisy-always outside construction and horns honking at all hours. Close to Central Park, Times Square and subways.  Very high ($54.51) daily resort fees.  No pool or hot tub.  There is a fitness center, which we never used. Knowledgeable and helpful concierge. We would still stay here again because of the room size and close proximity to a lot of key sights.

title: First Time in NYC
text: I drove my car and had it Valet parked quite easily (parking $35 per day). Like many have mentioned Location is great. I can’t think of a better location to stay in Manhattan. Situated in the Broadway district and close walking distance to both Central Park and Time Square. You can easily board buses, cabs, subway to get around Manhattan. There is so much to do and see and eat. Since it was our first trip to NYC we took several Hop on Hop Off Greyline bus tours, including downtown uptown night Brooklyn and boat tours. You can hop off anytime and explore then get back on another bus. We were able to get a pretty good idea of how to get around after one day on the bus. Do some research of the various plans available and have an idea of what you want to accomplish or visit. Not all plans are the same. I’d say 3 attractions per day is about max. I’d also recommend the One World Observatory if you only plan on one observation deck. It’s the tallest newest and views are amazing! I’d also recommend the play School of Rock I loved it! It’s reasonably priced and 2 blocks from the Manhattan Club in the Winter Garden Theatre.

title: The Location is GREAT!!!
text: It sit on the corner of 7th Ave and West 56th St. which 3 blocks from Central Park and 5 blocks from Times Squares which is great. I been to hotel at 4 times with reservations to stay there in November.

title: First NYC trip and it was great!
text: This was my first trip to NYC and it was amazing! The Manhattan club is a wonderful place to stay. It is clean and the staff is very friendly. The best part is it is close to eveything!! Trust me you will not regret booking with the Manhattan club!

title: Great stay!
text:
I've stayed here two years in a row, and both times my stay has been amazing. My guests and I very much enjoyed the proximity to Times Square and Broadway, and it's a great location to catch a taxi or an Uber. There are helpful staff members outside who offer to help with bags or to open up doors for you, and if you get there a little early when they don't have a room ready, they'll hold your luggage for you! It was nice not having to haul it around a crowded city after hauling it around airports all day. The staff at the front desk are also very cordial and polite.
In the rooms themselves, there is a mini refrigerator, coffee station, a nice room with (sometimes) a decent view, and a great shower with the best water pressure. After a long day of traveling and walking around the city, it makes a huge difference! The room we had fit two comfortably, and wasn't huge by any means, but we were really only there to sleep and unwind after a full day. It was perfect for just that!

title: Service Review
text: Great stay for the primetime location close to Time Square. Remind staff numerous time prior to arrival of the number of guest in your party.  Everyday we had to ask for towels daily because they were never returned.  Standing water when showering. If you leave an item, don't expect the staff to contact you, you will have to contact them.

title: Great location for New York Visit
text: We booked a room for a couple of nights while in New York before seeing our teenage daughter off to Europe from JFK. We were upgraded to a room with 2 bathrooms by the front desk staff which was nice. Very little counter space in the bathroom so the teens ended up using ours to get ready in the mornings. The wifi only worked in certain spots around the room. The noise from outside was horrific when trying to go to sleep and we were on the 19th floor! Room was very clean and location to Central Park, Times Square and Broadway shows was great. Bellmen were very personable and helpful with directions & getting transportation to airport ( unlike the sour concierge lady ) Room rate is extremely expensive but I guess that is Manhattan for you. The fitness center was very clean with lots of weights & equipment - A+ there.

title: Great Place to Stay
text: This timeshare/hotel has everything to make a great vacation.  The units are clean and spacious; the staff courteous and helpful.  The concierge is usually able to make recommendations for restaurants and theatrical events. The location is ideal; close to the Lincoln Center and all kinds of restaurants.  We stay there almost every year for 3 or 4 days and highly recommend it.

title: Would defintly stay again.
text: Our flight got  cancelled and we needed someplace for a quick stop over. We wanted to stay near central park which is why we chose this hotel. We had a room on the 23d floor and were very happy with the room. We had a king room which had two bathrooms, fantastic for a him and hers bathroom as I was able to take a nice bath while my husband showered and shaved in the other bathroom. Bedding was amazing as were the robes, very very good quality. I work in the hotel industry and I was very impressed. Check in took a while which was disappointing as I wanted a cocktail in their bar upstairs They state it closes at 11 and it was 10.55 when we went up so sadly they had it closed. They do have vending machines which was great. We are planning on returning to New York next year and will book with this hotel if the price is right. The only negatives I would say is 11am check out is very early and 4pm check in is very late. I understand this is to keep high standard of cleanliness but housekeeping were knocking on our door from 10am trying to get in. We had multiple people open our door in the morning to get in. I had to call reception to let them know we were still in the room and put a do not disturb sign on the door. It is good that offer express check out which means they slip the receipt under your door so you don't have the wait in line at the reception but they need to figure a way to identify checked out rooms easier other than keep opening the door.

title: Stay at The Manhattan Club
text: We were so glad and we stayed at The Manhattan Club this time (14 to 21 July 2018).  Location is superb walking distance to Time Square, Central Park, 5th ave etc. The hotel is very classy. Our studio room is big enough for 4 people.

title: Not a 4 star hotel- at least the old parts are not
text:
My family stayed here for 5 nights after booking a deal on Hotwire for a "4-star hotel" in the middle of Manhattan. The only pros of this hotel are location and the size of the room. Other than that, we stayed on the 16th floor which was unrenovated and it was disgusting. The room smelled terrible- musty, moldy, and stale. The window coverings did not work which left our room dark and dingy. There were stains all over the mattress in the pull out couch. The toilet clogged repeatedly. The shower curtain was moldy. Every morning when we left the very nice housekeeping staff would hover outside our room and kept asking what we needed- which was nice but also too much. I had our do not disturb on for a couple of the days of our trip and I have a feeling they still entered our room despite our saying we don't need service. Both times we did that we returned to a different sign hanging on our door that had wording to the effect that hotel had a right to enter rooms and had to knock before entering. That really put me off. 

I used the fitness center and it was nicer than my room. You are also close to Central Park which I really enjoyed. It is a good location. 

I have to believe all these great reviews are from people who stayed on a renovated floor or who were just happy being in the center of everything. I would not stay here again if I had to stay in our unrenovated room. I definitely feel like we got taken with our deal and that the Manhattan Club should have put us in a nicer room if that is what they are advertising on external websites.

title: Great location and staff and good value for money
text: I stayed a couple of nights at The Manhattan Club and I should have stayed here longer as the hotel I stayed the previous nights was an utter disappointment. The location is superb and in overall the hotel is okay and probably I would stay here again. Compared to other options in the area, I think TMC is probably the best in value for money.

title: Super værelser
text: Vi bestilte City light suite og blev meget positivt overrasket. To værelser og to badeværelser i fin standard. Personalet er meget venlige og opmærksomme. Hotellets placering er optimal for Central Park og Subway. Er også i gåafstand for de fleste seværdigheder i midtown. Super hotel !

title: Great location for weekend in Manhattan
text: TMC offers a great location, excellent staff and rooms that are competitive with most 3-star hotels in NYC.  Upstairs lounge perfect for sitting out the crowds, breakfast and happy hour.  Rooms OK but dated.  Prices are high but typical for Manhattan.  If you like Central Park, can't beat this location.

title: Great Location! Great Staff!
text: I love the Manhattan Club, its in a perfect location and has lots to offer. the staff especially Vania are all so helpful and friendly. Lots of great restaurants nearby for all sorts of cuisine, all hours of the day and night.

title: Great Location
text: I usually stay at another hotel when in Manhattan, the usual one was closed for refurbishment. I may have been won over by this hotel. It is near to Carnegie Hall and Central Park. The rooms are clean and a good size.

title: Great location; nice room; great service
text: We were fortunate to stay at the Manhattan Club for our recent trip to NYC. We had requested a high floor to be above the street noise. Even though our flight got delayed and we didn’t arrive until the wee hours of the morning, they still came through and we got a great room. Our room was a one bedroom with two bathrooms and a small dining/kitchen area. Perfect for our week stay in the city. The Manhattan Club is in a great location, close to Central Park, the theatre district, and mass transit.

title: clean and closer to everything
text:
stayed here for a week in july.
about 5 mins walk to central park and about 10-15 mins walk to times squre.staff was friendly .
walking distance to broadway theaters as well.subways just a minutes away.
convenient place to stay.

title: Great place to stay
text: Good location, nice place, friendly staff, close to Subway entrances helpful concier, doorman helpful with directions and suggestions, Fuji Sushi restaurant was great between 7th and 8th on 56th St. Times Square very close great for New Year's. Central Park a block away, close to the Met, MoMA. A quick subway ride to anywhere. We took a lot of subways they are faster than automobilesor buses.

title: New York
text: Awesome location for visit to New York.   Close to Central Park and Broadway.   Easy to get around and visit many attractions.   Plenty of restaurants and bars with varying food types and value.   Great place to stay to visit New Yorkb

title: Great customer service & location!
text:
We just returned from a last minute overnight NYC visit. We normally stay at the Marriott Marquis on Times Square but wanted to try another location and hotel.

The Manhattan Club did not disappoint. We liked everything about the hotel, from customer service emails (thank you Lena) to check out was great! We enjoyed a complimentary upgrade on the 17th floor and appreciated the early check in very much. One bedroom suite was spacious for the three of us.

The Manhattan Club was very clean in all areas and centrally located to everything we wanted to do! I am recommending this to my friends for their NYC trips.

Thank you Manhattan Club for a wonderful stay!

title: Exceptional
text: Stayed 5 nights in June. Checked in by Maria. Lovely person, very friendly and really helpful. A great ambassador for the hotel. Was able to upgrade us to a fantastic room. Hotel facilities and location excellent. Will definitely return when back in New York.

title: Decent venue if youre an RCI Member or a tourist
text:
The Manhattan Club is a hotel/vacation resort located in Midtown Manhattan, 56th and 7th Ave., which is a terrific location. Ive stayed in midtown on almost every visit to New York City over the last 30+ years. 
We are RCI members, (RCI is a portal available to vacation propertyowners that offers worldwide resorts)  which means due to our ownership  in other vacation rentals we can take advantage of this resort while in NYC. You have to book months or more in advance since this is one of the few venues like this available in NYC.
The location is TERRIFIC! Close to the center of Manhattan, Central Park, museums, shopping on Fifth Ave  and is easy to access by taxi or subway many other NYC neighborhoods. Many very good restaurants nearby.  
Our stay was 7 days, six nights. The advantage of this hotel is the suites. We are a family of four and we need room and the small kitchenette area it provides.
Our specific unit was on the fifteenth floor, and was spacious, with two bathrooms all done in marble.  Two TV's and sitting area with a couch that is a roll out bed.The bed was comfortable and had down pillows. It has a  small table and chairs, small fridge  and a sink and provides glassware, dishes and cutlery. It allows us to buy some groceries and eat some meals in our suite. NYC is expensive so to be able to eat a bowl of cereal with fruit is great. 
They provide daily linen and towel service and clean each day.
The service is very good by all staff. Concierge on site so that's  helpful.
We had zero issues, and the rooms are fine for the price.
Im glad we had the opportunity to stay in this hotel while in NYC. Definitely  recommend , and as I said the location is superb!

title: Time away from home
text: I took a few days off from my regular routine. Able to meet friends than live near or in NYC. My significant other works in the city, so it was great to avoid the commute for few days. The location and the staff are great. The only think that bother us it was the moldy smell of the room. We had to get odor spray to avoid that mildew smell. Otherwise it was a perfect get away.

title: Fantastic location
text: The location can't be beat for convenience of all types--Central Park, theatre district, Lincoln Center and subways.  The staff is helpful.  Club comes with concierges.  Check in and out is easy.  Room was always clean and well-stocked.  Big complaint was breakfast--inadequate and overpriced.

title: Great hotel!!!
text: The check in process was very easy. Hotel is very clean. Rooms were cozy. The only thing that bothered me was the windows. Looking out our window from the room besides for the fact that our room was looking right at a wall, the outside of the window was filthy. Even if we were to look out the window, we couldn't. But other than that was an amazing stay!

title: Spectacular Little Resort in a Big City
text:
The check-in process was easy. We arrived early, our room wasn't ready. When returning at the specified time and room still wasn't ready, the receptionist didn't hesitate to put us into a slightly better room. All of the staff were friendly and attentive, and very prompt. Need another pillow? No problem, it'll be there in five minutes. Our room was comfortable, what I would consider spacious for NYC, with updated décor. And it was SO clean. Everything was well maintained. The best part I'd have to say is the location. Central Park is just two blocks north, Times Square just a few blocks south. Everything we did during our 5 days was in walking distance, very convenient!
The only thing I would have liked that the resort didn't have is a pool. Then again we were so busy in the city, I'm not sure when we would have had time to swim!

title: Excelente ubicación y comodidad para después de largas caminatas.
text:
