Fue una buena elección. A contraesquina del Carnegie Hall, The Manhattan Club es sin duda un hotel cómodo, limpio, agradable y con una ubicación estratégica para largas caminatas por Central Park, la Quinta Avenida o Broadway.

Buen lugar para desplazarte por NYC y descansar.

title: New York City Vacation
text:
Manhattan Club is the finest!
Excellent location.
This is our second time visiting the Manhattan Club.
Absolutely the best!
Our daughter & her husband live in Brooklyn.
We had a much needed vacation.
Plays, food, parks, museums, shopping
 & lot's of walking. 
So much to see in just 1 week. 
We did not want to go home!

title: Excelente opción
text:
Un hotel cómodo, sin lujos pero que proporciona lo necesario para una estadía placentera. La ubicación es inmejorable!!
Nosotros no utilizamos el servicio de desayuno pero puedes tomarlo en el piso 26 con cargo extra. Posee tambien en ese piso un gimnasio bastante completo y una sala de negocios con 5 computadores e impresora. También un salón de relax y esparcimiento

title: Excellent time share resort with great service in an amazing location
text: This was my first time in a city centre time share. Manhattan Club is perfectly located and accommodation is very comfortable and convenient. Best of all though was the service. I had a few requests at the beginning of my stay ( an extra gown, a heater). All of my requests were responded to very efficiently and courteously within minutes. All round a great stay.

title: Excelente ubicacion
text: Es un hotel muy bonito, confortable, la atención excelente y muy servicial. Nos tocó viajar en época de frío y la calefacción en el hotel y el cuarto delicioso y más después de llegar del frío, las habitaciones amplias y las camas una delicia en verdad, el servicio de limpieza muy bueno.

title: Best in show
text: Our flight was delayed due to weather and we didn't get to our hotel until 5 in the morning. The hotel was well-lit and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was a small Suite with a kitchenette. Very comfortable. Very well laid out. Large rooms for New York City hotels. We stayed for 3 days and decided to extend our stay by one day. Because our room was already promised, we had to check out in the morning and check back in, in the afternoon. The Bellman stored our luggage and we left for the day. When we got back at about 5, we went up to our new room which was much larger and included a dining room table, chairs and a dish washer. There was also a living room chair next to the sleeper/sofa. Also very well laid out and comfortable. This has been our favorite Hotel in New York City and we plan to stay here anytime we're back again. And you can't beat it for the price. It is located three blocks from Central Park, exactly where the horse-drawn carriages and pedicab line up for customers. It is maybe four or five blocks from Times Square and safe to walk to Broadway shows. Good restaurants abound within walking distance. Stay here and you won't regret it.

title: Incredible customer service and very convenient
text: This hotel is awesome and so are the workers! The staff are all very friendly and want to help you have the best experience possible. I was extremely impressed by the customer service the manager gave me and my mom. Without him, our stay at the Manhatten Club would not have been nearly as wonderful. If you need anything, no doubt he will be there. Additionally, the location is very quaint-- in between Times Square and Central Park. The lobby was nice and the rooms were very clean. Definitely make use of the 26th floor where there is a lounge for guests to hang out in. I felt like this made the hotel special compared to others. Overall it was a wonderful experience and I would come back here in a heartbeat.

title: The Manhattan Club  - Perfect Location
text:
The hotel is nice, clean and the best part  - In a perfect location for our week in Manhattan. Great room  1 bedroom with 2 bathrooms and a kitchenette. 2 bathrooms is a must with a family and this was a very fair price for the quality and location.  
The only negative, which was not a major negative was that the elevators are very slow. If you stay on a high floor - expect that you may have some delays in getting the elevator.

title: Return Guest!!  Hotel hits the spot Again!!!
text:
third visit.  upon check in--think it was Vanna said room not ready but was selecting a room little better w/ better view and she was correct.  little better floor plan w view out 7th ave.  Great locale for me since enjoying running in the park each am.  
as well as easy walk down to Times Sq.

title: Great Place to stay in NYC!
text: We stayed at the Manhattan Club for an entire week & we loved it there!  We had a 1-bedroom so there was plenty of room for my husband, daughter & myself.  It's conveniently located close to subways, lots of restaurants, Broadway theaters, Times Square and more.  Stay here if you can - you'll be glad that you didi!

title: Chambre très agréable
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel 3 nuits et avons apprécié la qualité du lit 🛏 qui est confortable.  Un peu bruyant car au 2 eme étage ...Cela dit bien centré entre Time Square et Central Park .
Accueil sympathique à l’hôtel et le personnel est serviable .

title: A touch of class
text: I shall be making my third visit next month.  The Club is right near Carnegie Hall so easy reach of theatreland without being in the noisy heart of it.  The suites have small but adequate kitchenettes or full size kitchens and are perfect for relaxing in after or during a busy day sightseeing.

title: Best For Family stay
text: 1-bedroom suites are superb for family stay for 4 pax. Access lift is typical of 60s New York. My suite came with 2 toilets for great privacy with one bedroom with Queen bed while there's a sofa in living area that converts to another queen bed. Mattress and linen are 5-Star hotel quality and bathrooms are clean and well appointed with branded amenities. The single bedroom suite comes with microwave oven, fridge as well as ironing facilities. Unfortunately, no laundry facilities is available within the hotel but there are laundry shop nearby within walking distance. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Hotel is located 5 mins walk to Columbus Circle and Central Park, across the road to Carnegie Hall, 2 mins walk to nearest subway, 20 mins walk to Times Square, 5 mins to Broadway for best shows on the Theatre District, great shopping at 5th & 7th Avenues.  Great food in the area and very safe to walk late night. We walked 45 mins from Empire State Building back to hotel to take in the nightlife after 11pm. Needless to say all of Manhattan and beyond is accessible via subway, or my favourite, the Hop On Hop Off Tour Buses with their very entertaining guides.

title: Unexcelled location
text: I found the staff friendly and accommodating, especially in requesting the floor level of my suite.  The rooms were well presented and first class.  The Manhattan club's location is ideally suited for any sightseeing, dining, transportation and entertainment available in the big apple.  I highly recommend it.

title: Great location, but expect some noise and inconveniences
text: We used to own at this facility and we love the location and size of the room. The building is old and needs some upgrades, especially to its heating and cooling system. The noise from the adjoining rooms and street is very noticeable. If you go ask for an inside room, the view is not great, but there will be less noise. The mattress although comfortable, had a squeaky boxspring.

title: perfect location
text: The Manhattan Club was the absolute perfect place to stay.  The location made walking to all of the show and fantastic restaurants and time square and central park just so easy and the staff there were so friendly and helpful!  The suite was comfortable and the amenities were perfect.  I would stay there 1000 times over again.

title: Great location and service
text: The hotel is in a great location. It closes to subways that take you where you want to go. It’s very economic. Lots of places I want to go are in walking distance such as Times Square, Central Park, the met, Rockefeller building, Empire State Building, st Patrick cathedral and broadway so I can easily go to see the show. It is important for me who is the first time visiting New York. It is so helpful. It is also close to food and restaurant. I don’t worry about that if I am hungry at night. The staff is also helpful and help me to get the sense of direction in New York. I easily ease in.

title: Location location location
text: I ended up getting a great rate on Hotwire. The location is so close to everything. I would definitely stay here again rooms were perfect size. service was great!!! Central Park was right down the block and subway stations close by.

title: VACACIONES
text: excelente todo lo compartido con mis amigos, habitaciones amplias, cerca del shopping sawgrass, amplio parking, todos los elementos para cocinar, buena atención del personal de servicio, zona de pileta cómoda

title: Excelente lugar y excelente ubicación
text:
Al llegar te están recibiendo de forma cálida, en recepción lo mismo y el check in fue muy rápido. El depto era para 4 pers. nosotros éramos 2, así que resulto súper comodo. Muy bien equipado para 4. Con heladera, lavavajillas, microondas, etc.
La ubicación excelente, bien en el centro.Limpieza y atención muy buena.

title: Excellent Property, great location!
text: We spent a week at the Manhattan Club and enjoyed everything about it.  Excellent accommodations - we had a 1 bedroom suite; great staff and perfect location.  We walked or subway everywhere.  Great shopping near by, 10 minute walk to Central Park, lots of dining options that are not expensive.

title: First Time in New York
text: We are Wyndham owners, so used our timeshare points for this trip. The hotel is very well located, just 3 blocks south of Central Park, 15 minutes walk north of Times Square and half a block from the 57th subway station. We had a one bedroom studio on the 20th floor which suited us fine. Our daughter joined us mid-week and used the pullout lounge. The facilities were roomy, very clean, modern, plenty of storage with a very good bathroom. The staff were very helpful and polite, always with a smile. We did have breakfast on the first morning in the dining room, however, walk outside and there are plenty of diners half a block away. Overall, we had a great stay at The Manhattan Club and will be back. I would recommend this establishment to anyone looking for a comfortable room and a good location in New York. Remember, the transport in New York is fantastic, so buy a Metrocard which can be used on the subway and buses. No need for a car.

title: Great Location!!
text: The Manhattan club is strategically located in a hotspot of New York City! The location was superb! We were able to walk to most locations such as Time Square and Broadway. The only challenge for us were the beds in the particular room we stayed in. They just were not firm enough Causing our backs to ache when we woke up and sometimes in the middle of the night as well. The pillows, which were down feather, were just not firm enough as well.

title: A Star in the RCI Exchange
text: The Manhattan Club staff are excellent and helpful.  The accommodations are perfect.   We had 4 people in a studio with micro, refrigerator.  Perfect for those snacks before the Broadway show.  Cannot say enough about the staff, location, and accommodations.  We were aware of the daily tax/fees which are quite reasonable in New York City.

title: Love everything about this hotel
text:
Love the rooms... for the second time, I (we this time) had a full suite with a second bedroom and two bathrooms.  Nice little kitchenette with a stove, microwave and a fridge and a little table.  We picked up dinner around the corner and ate in the room.  It's clean and comfortable.

Love the service.  Great people at the desk.  And we went to an event and had to store our stuff all afternoon after we checked out.  It was free (we tipped the bellman) and one of the bellmen also looked after my car on the street while I went in and picked up my stuff.

And who can't love the location?  Steps from Central Park and one of my clients at Columbus Circle.  Not far from another client in Midtown.  At the north end of Times Square.  Our event was at Radio City, and it was an easy walk.  And we looked out at Carnegie Hall (and the Park) from our window.

By the way:  this trip combined business (saw clients all around Midtown), couples (had a lovely evening walking around and in our room) and family (went to our son's graduation at Radio City).

The site below asks to rate the price.  It is pretty pricey in-season, but mid-range for Manhattan and especially the area.  Much, much cheaper off-season (I also stayed there in March).

title: Mr
text:
Never ever book this hotel!! 
From my experience travelling the world..worst ever.
I book this hotel and room was terrible. Asked for a nicer one IF possible..we were given a ‘Disabled room’ with disable toilet and shower..
Asked them to have previous Room.They refused to changed back.. The staff were useless and incompetent!! Asked to speak to their manage but was even worst..he asked me to oay extra £75 per day to have another Room. 
The views were horrendous the toileteries stink as Detol. Toileries made of peppercorn, cloves...
See for youself below:

title: VIAGGIO CON FAMIGLIA
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo residence per una settimana con la mia famiglia.  Location in posizione eccellente, vicinissima a central park,a time square ed alla metro.
Vacanza perfetta sotto ogni punto di vista
Consiglio caldamente questo residence

title: Excelente ubicación y servicio
text:
Elegimos este hotel solamente por su ubicación y precio. Elegimos una suite pues éramos 3 personas. La segunda cama era un sofá cama.

Bueno, la impresión a la llegada no puede haber sido mejor pues la habitación superó las expectativas en tamaño y comodidad. Bastante espaciosa considerando que en general las habitaciones de hoteles en Nueva York son pequeñas.

La ubicación también inmejorable. A 2 cuadras del Central Park (donde correr o caminar es imprescindible) y a unas 10 cuadras del corazón de Times Square, lo suficiente cerca para caminarlo y lo suficiente lejano para dormir tranquilo.

El hotel muy pacifico y el aseo bastante bien aunque no excelente.

Recomendable

title: Excellent
text: Excellent hotel and service.  Every one is friendly, sufficient and on top of things.  I go every year and I wait until The Manhattan Club is offered under the get away packages -- I used to get a full bedroom and it always used to fall on the weekend.  However, the last two times I got the studio and it was on a Monday.  Nevertheless, I took it and used it to the best of my ability.  Hopefully, next year it will be on a weekend and I will get the one bedroom.  I'll just keep trying.

title: A week in New York
text: The Manhattan club is in a great location. It has easy access to the subway & within a very comfortable walking distance to loads of major attractions. The unit was very comfortable & gave us some room to move. Having a lounge area & a small table gave it a very homely feel & it was easy to relax after our long days out

title: Felices con nuestra elección
text:
Habíamos elegido este hotel por su cercanía al Central Park y las kitchenettes. Fue la mejor elección!

La habitación era amplia y cómoda. La cama confortable y el baño muy espacioso.

El personal fue siempre muy amable y simpático. Nos ayudaron con nuestro pequeño hijo, nos dieron recomendaciones de NY y nos brindaron un paraguas en dias de lluvia. Gracias a todos los que hicieron de nuestra estadía un momento tan disfrutable y feliz.

Lo recomendamos ampliamente.

title: Close to Central Park
text: Four of us checked into this room with a king size bed, a hide-away and two full bathrooms.  The furniture was dated as were the bathrooms but it was clean.  It was conveniently located near central park and the subway.  The walk to Times Square was also doable!  The elevators were slow during the peak morning and evening hours.  The staff was extremely courteous and helpful!

title: Una residenza albergiera da 5 stelle in una posizione strategica
text: Ci torno in media ogni due anni e vi rimango una settimana. Servizio eccellente. Suite di grande livello, forse bisognevoli di qualche piccolissima manutenzione per essere eccellenti. L'unica cosa che trovo non all'altezza è la colazione al 26° piano. Locale ben arredato ma la qualità ed il menù non è adeguato al livello del Club. Non obbligatoria. Business centre ed altri servizi al 26 piano sempre efficientissimi, come le informazioni al piano terra.

title: Weekend with friends
text: This is a very nice hotel with an excellent location. IThe F train is one block away.. I stayed in a one bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms.  I stayed with another female friend and it was very nice that we each had our own bathroom and space. They don’t have any rooms with 2 beds and that is the only thing that would have made it better. One of us had to sleep on the pull out couch. My friend was nice enough to give me the bed which was very comfortable. The room was very quiet. You would never know you were in the city. The staff were all very friendly, efficient and helpful.

title: Excellent emplacement, metro direct pour JFK
text:
Nous avons réservé une '´one bedroom suité' pour notre couple et nos deux enfants.
Beaucoup d'espace et deux salles de bain !!
Canapé-lit confortable, lit double queen size !
Seul bemol, la cuisinette n'a qu'un frigo et un micro-onde, pas de plaque electrique pour cuisiner.
Emplacement ideal, à deux pas de central park et ligne E du metro directe pour l'aéroport JFK.

title: Great location, good service, excellent units
text: A female friend and I shared a one bedroom unit with a small kitchen and Dining area. The pull out couch worked well. Individual bathrooms for two females was an added bonus. Daily maid service was unexpected but very nice. the location could not be better. Easy walking to Times Square, the Hop on Hop Off buses and Patsy's restaurant. Unexpected exercise program as New Yorkers walk a lot but enjoyed it.

title: Last two rooms were terrific, but not this time
text:
Be careful reserving your room as apparently they vary greatly.  Two and four years ago I had a great room with a lot of space, table and chairs, comfortable couch and Queen size bed, refrigerator, dishwasher, china and an ok view. This time room the room was smaller, no table, no dishwasher and plastic dishes that apparently I was to wash by hand and reuse. (Who knows how sanitary they were from the last guest.)  The room was on the 2nd floor with a window that opened to the roof with pipes and heating/plumbing equipment as the view. I could reach out and touch them. The weather was too warm to have the heat on, and there is no A/C available in the winter. Opening the window to let in cool air meant lots of equipment noise. Impossible to keep windows open at night and sleep through the racket. For $2000 for a weeks stay I expected much better.  I was unable to stay on the floors with my friends and family as "my type of room" was only available on the lower floor. You should check the hotel web site and maybe reserve directly unless you can get all the specifics about the room configuration and amenities before you order on this site.

Having said that, the hotel is well situated and if you get a good room completely acceptable.

title: Semaine a New York
text:
Souhaitant un Hotel au plus près de Central Parc, nous avez opte pour le Manhattan Club et sans regret
Idéalement situe entre la 7 av et Broadway, nous avons pu nous promener dans tous ces lieux magiques
Time square, les theatres de broadway et Central parc sont a quelques minutes a pied.
De plus chambre propre et services au mieux. Ptits déjeuner un peu cher mais on peut en prendre un ailleurs qui sont nombreux autour de cette place
Super, a garder dans les contacts

title: Excellente situation, hôtel confortable
text: Très bon hôtel pour découvrir Manhattan : à 2 min du Sud de Central Park (Columbus circle) et à 5 min de Times Square a pieds. Chambre familiale parfaite, spacieuse, avec 2 salles de bain. Demander vue sur la rue par contre si vous voulez avoir un peu de lumière du jour ! Bar lounge sympa, mais plutôt pour public du 3ème âge lors de notre séjour. Rien à redire sur la propreté et le personnel ; conciergerie pratique pour toute demande de réservation ou renseignement. Nous n’avons pas testé le petit déjeuner dans la mesure où nous avons trouvé et apprécié un diner à 2 pas de l’hôtel, sur la 7e avenue.

title: Excellent emplacment
text:
résidence située idéalement entre Times Square et Central park, a proximité de la 5e avenue, du Rockefeller center.
Appartements avec kitchenette très pratique, donnant sur cour intérieure donc pas de bruit, c'est important dans une grande ville qui vit 24h/24

title: love NYC - but....
text:
love the city. this 'resort' was tacky. OK bed and loved the 2 bathrooms. Lobby was uninviting, elevators often out of order, and staff at desk was unsure of resort systems. the best comment was the housekeeping staff. Really lovely and good cleaners. 
To be fair, location convenient.

title: Wonderful hotel and great lication
text: This is a suite hotel with spacious rooms    It is also a timeshare hotel but rents to the public.   It is very centrally located on 56th and 7th    The staff is the most accommodating that you will find in NYC.  There is a bar on the 26th floor with lite snacks   The beds are very comfortable, great pillows & sheets.   2 bathrooms in each room.   We had a corridor view of Central Park.    This was our 3rd visit to this hotel.   We love it    It is a terrific value for under $300/night

title: Week in NYC
text:
Lots of very good restaurants within walking distance as was Times Square where we took in a movie and two plays.Was able to walk to church and Central Park.
Super location.Very quiet and comfortable.
Local transportation right around the block as well as local coffee shops.
Really had little to do with staff.Housekeeping forgot facecloths and hand towels twice.
All was well!

title: Fun but cold week in NYC!
text: This is our 3rd stay here and it just keeps getting better. Thanks Vania at the front desk for being so friendly and letting us check in early. Thanks John the doorman for  being friendly & helpful too. Our junior suite had been updated more recently then the 1 bedroom we had 2 years ago. Location 2 blocks south of Central Park is perfect for everything we do. Thanks for the cookies and tea in the afternoon.

title: Idéal
text:
Idéal, c’est le mot.

Idéalement situé : 3 rues de Central Park, 10 rues de Times Square. Le métro est à 100m avec deux lignes majeures pour descendre dans le Sud.

Plein de restaurants autour (7e, Broadway et 56/57e St). 

Personnel serviable et toujours souriant, prêt à vous aider. Le réceptionniste nous a surclassés pour une suite beaucoup plus grande en voyant qu’on était là pour 5 nuits (nous avions une Junior Suite de prévue). Du coup, grande chambre avec sa salle de bain, grand séjour avec canapé convertible et sa salle d’eau. Et cuisine ! (Parfait pour ne pas passer son argent dans les petits dej - Il y a des petites supérettes autour qui vous permettent d’acheter céréales, lait, jus de fruits,...).

N’hésitez pas à demander des chambres le plus haut possible. Nous avions le 18ème (sur 26) donnant sur la 7eme Avenue : pas trop dérangés par le bruit.
Contrairement aux hôtels sur Times Square que nous connaissons, nous avons eu beaucoup moins de bruit. On s’éloigne un peu mais il faut 10 minutes à pied pour être au centre de Times Square. Alors n’hésitez pas.

Service de conciergerie à votre disposition. D’eux mêmes, ils ont appelé le service Shuttle pour réserver la navette du retour.

Hôtel très propre, chambres idéales pour un séjour à 4 (au moins 30m2 sans compter les deux sdb/sde).

Nous avons utilisé une fois, le jour de notre départ, le petit dej de l’hôtel. Pas mauvais mais pour le prix, allez manger à l’extérieur, ce sera plus copieux et plus « américain ».

Bref, nous recommandons vivement cet établissement. 

Merci encore pour l’accueil

title: Excellent Location
text: We booked an Executive Suite for 4 adults.  It was clean with a new carpet.  No view but what we needed to spend three nights.  Booked through a time share we would have booked a larger unit if it was available.  The staff was extremely courteous and helpful.  The location was excellent within walking distance of Central Park, Times Square, Broadway theaters, Rockerfeller Center and many very good restaurants. Very minor issues with small items in the room.  When contacted the staff reacted quickly and positively.  Would recommend it.

title: Excellent Location Option!
text: This hotel is close to many of the main attractions without being in the craziness and noise of Time Square. There are plenty of dining options within walking distance. The hotel offers a good suite layout when you travel with 2 young adults and not being separated in between 2 rooms. We are 4 and the suite provides us 2 bathrooms, the kingsize bed in the closed bed and a sofabed queen size and the option for an additional roller bed so both our kids could have a better sleeping time. The price for location and configuration was better than comparing with any other options in that location. These were the main reason for our decision and worked out. As many pointed out the hotel is outdated and everything is working but old technology at least in the suite we stayed because by some of Tripadvisor pictures it looks to me they may have some renovated. We wanted to have AC and they do not have an independent system per room while the hotel is in heater nobody has AC (that is what we were told). The TVs service was really poor. They have 2 guess elevators that at pick hours are not enough so then you can go to the service elevators but it is no apeling. In the end, it was a "good stay" for the price, size, and location.

title: Inget lyxhotell...
text: ...men duger för en New York-vistelse. Acceptabelt pris för att bo väldigt centralt på Manhattan, nära till Central park och en hel del andra sevärdheter. Frukosten kan man hoppa över, inte värd priset. Det är bättre att äta frukost på någon frukostrestaurang i de närmaste kvarten. Det är också ganska dyrt men men blir mätt. Trevlig och mycket hjälpsam personal.

title: A very good stay
text:
The hotel and suite is, as with many NY hotels, a little tired around the edges. However, it is well appointed, clean and has a very helpful staff team.

The suite was large and had everything I might need including a fridge and dishwasher!

title: Checked in late and was upgraded to a beautiful large room
text:
We checked in late after dinner. We were upgraded to a beautiful, newly remodeled
room. The King size bed was very comfortable. I was surprised though that it was 
a cloth headboard. To me that seems hard to clean....There were two large screen
tvs on the wall.
Really enjoyed coffee on the 26th floor the next am. Excellent price too!

title: Spacious Room with Kitchenette
text: Perfect for us!  We had a quick breakfast and coffee before heading out each day.  I'd say that saved us at least $30 per day.  The hotel is in a great location and the team working there were all helpful, knowledgeable and polite.  Close to the trains, Carnegie Hall, and a 15 minute walk from the insanity of Time Square.

title: Affordable luxury in the heart of NYC
text:
Stayed at the Manhattan Club Hotel for a first family visit with a 21months old toddler to NYC and we were glad we did. Everything was perfect from the moment we checked in and it really started off our week-long holidays really well. From checking in with friendly staff, Ciara to bags been taken up by the most helpful and professional, Jesse we were truly impressed. Throughout our stay, we found the hotel to be very welcoming, super central to everything, extremely clean and well decorated, great amenities and all the staff were very nice and approachable at all times. Thanks to John who often helped us with directions and recommendations. We loved absolutely everything about our stay and we'll definitely stay here again. As I got #engaged on this trip, this means that the Manhattan Club Hotel will forever be special to us and we look forward to seeing you in 2019 (God willing).

Oh forgot to mention too that despite been very central and with all the hustle and bustle outside, it's very quiet and tranquil inside. Our suite had a dishwasher, fridge freezer and microwave which were so handy for preparing and storing our baby's food. We've stayed in a lot of hotels around the world but this is by far the best best 4* we've ever stayed in and we truly recommend it 100% to all types of travellers. Thanks guys for the excellent service, keep up the great work because you're exceptional at what you do

title: I love New York and the Manhattan Club
text: Any place in NY is expensive let’s face it but this was a great deal through our RCI exchange . One bedroom well laid out even though a bit small. Nicely appointed. The bar on the top floor was great for drinks as well as morning coffee!!!! The gym was fabulous with new equipment . We were close to restaurants , museums theater all within walking distance!!! I would return in a heartbeat!

title: Georgeous Place - Great Location
text:
Just stayed at Manhattan Club this past weekend and we have a 2 night booking next weekend as well.    When in Manhattan, this is our go to place for staying.

Great location.   Central Park is 2 blocks away, Broadway is 4 blocks, and Time Square is a 10 minute walk.   The location is just across the street from Carnegie Hall.

We were in a Penthouse Suite this last stay but have also stayed in their 1 Bedroom suite in the past.  Very well done and recently renovated rooms.     AS it is New York, the suites are on the smaller side but plenty of amenities are packed into each unit.

Valet parking for $35/day  plus tip is a great deal for this part of town.  However, we normally park and then don't touch the car again until we are ready to leave.  Subway is just one block away and provides a fast way to any part of Manhattan.

title: Location, value, location, atmosphere, location
text:
NYC just blocks from Central Park, Theater District, plus so much more.  Try the 2nd floor, walk up & out from room to street in minutes. classy location!  

Free attractions every Day:
    American Numismatic Society (Broadway at 155th Street, #1 or B)
    Artists Space
    Carnegie Hall/Rose Museum, Weill Recital Hall
    Dahesh Museum
    The Drawing Center
    Museum at the Fashion Institute of Technology
    Franklin Furnace
    Goethe House German Cultural Center
    Guggenheim Museum Soho
    The Hispanic Society of America
    The Municipal Art Society
    Museum of American Folk Art
    National Museum of the American Indian
    New York City Police Museum
    Snug Harbor Cultural Center
    Taipei Gallery
    Whitney Museum at Philip Morris

title: Love this place!!!!
text: I am a huge Kimpton Hotel fan and rarely stay elsewhere but so glad that I stayed at the Manhattan Club!   The rooms are spacious ( 550-650 sq ft) and you get 2 bathrooms and a separate living room.......the bar on the 26th floor is a cool place to hang out and the gym is fantastic.  Had the pleasure of meeting the Director of Engineering ( Ken Grey)) and he is a terrific asset to the team there!   Great place to stay when in NYC!

title: Spacious and Great Locatioin
text: Absolutely perfect location.  We had a corner room on the 18th floor, one king bedroom, sofa bed, two full baths and a small kitchen area.  More space than we could have imagined in NYC and....are you ready for this?  A view of Central Park. The front desk personnel were very professional, as were the bellmen. I hold back a 5 star review only because there was not a free breakfast like we had in our last NYC hotel and I felt like furnishings and draperies in the room needed some attention. Would we stay there again? You betcha! I have read reviews about the heating and air conditioning being odd, but as we were there during a cold spell, our room was heated and it was just fine.

title: Afiliado a Royal Holiday Club
text: Cada viaje a NY alojamos en este hotel, con variaciones en cada oportunidad. Esta vez estuvimos 2 noches en Febrero en una muy buena habitación (Ambassador), con todo impecable y muy buena vista a la calle en un piso alto.  Nuevamente en Marzo 16 a 19 , con habitación similar (Ambassador) en altura, pero con vista a patio interior con ventanas de otras habitaciones en todo alrededor (Muy malo !!! y no pedimos cambio que tal vez habrían hecho)  Fantástico por ubicación y atención esmerada y amable de todo el  personal (desde recepcionistas a botones y personal de aseo)

title: Impecable, para volver
text: Las habitaciones son amplias, luminosas,. Tiene una kichenette con pileta, heladera, microonda, cafetera, lavavajillas y utensulios de cocina, muy bueno todo.  Un living, pantalla. Camas comodas. Tal vez el baño es un poco anticuado. La limpiez muy buena. La atenciòn es excelente.

title: In New York, location is very important -- The Manhattan Club has a perfect location.
text: The front desk and the concierge were super, and I really appreciated their help. The lounge on the top floor was excellent -- may be they can add some pastries, and croissants there instead of standard cookies. My room was an excellent size, and the cleaning personnel were great. The view from the room was average.

title: Great weekend in NYC
text: We had a great stay at The Manhattan Club  in March. We stayed in a one bedroom suite and had two bathrooms. Some of the furniture was a little tired but the room was clean. The staff was great and the owners lounge was very reasonable for drinks and breakfast. It was a magical weekend that ended in an engagement. We will be back to The Manhattan Club to celebrate for years to come.

title: Perfect location and great hospitality
text: Close to so many attractions. Front desk and bell staff were excellent. Joined brother and his wife as couples and they kindly put us next to each other. Warm reception and very complete rooms with refrigerator, microwave, coffee, convenient to time square and everywhere we wanted to go. Couldn’t have been happier. Good value and would highly recommend.

title: New York trip Feb 2018
text:
Stayed at the Manhattan Club end of Feb 2018, been to Ny many time but 1st time here. We checked into one of the city lights suites but we could hear some music which did stop late that night but when we woke the next day it was back again so we went to the reception and they were superb. They moved us to a suite on the 24th floor which was fantastic. Great location 2 blocks from Central Park and only 2 blocks from 5th Avenue. All the staff were very friendly.
Would definitely stay here again when I return to NY.

title: Séjour agréable
text:
Nous avons séjourné 7 jours au Manhattan club moi et ma famille. 2 adultes, 2 enfants. La situation géographique est parfaite, entre time square et Central Park, tout près d'une station de metro. 

Dès notre arrivée un valet s'occupe de nos bagages et de notre voiture. Il nous oriente vers la réception. Nous avons particulièrement apprécié qu'il prenne le temps de nous orienter en utilisant un anglais simple voyant de toute évidence que l'anglais n'était pas notre première langue. Un gros merci au valet sans cheveux ;) 

Le check in est a 16h et n'espérer pas avoir votre chambre avant cette heure. Une fois la chambre disponible, nous sommes agréablement surpris de la propreté et de la grandeur de la chambre. Une cuisinette est à votre disposition. Réellement pratique! Café et pop corn offert tous les jours dans la chambre. Attention aux bouteilles d'eau, elles sont 8$ chacune. Nous avons passé un séjour très confortable. Par contre la porte communicante à la chambre voisine n'est nullement insonorisée, croisez les doigts pour ne pas avoir de voisins trop bruyants. Au 15eme étage on entend parfois les klaxons des voitures mais rien d'étonnant pour New York. 

Au départ nous avons du emmener toutes nos valises et sacs nous même au lobby car aucun valet de disponible. Vu la quantité que nous avions (avec 2 jeunes enfants) ce fut réellement compliqué sans chariot. 
Je recommande tout de même sans hésitation cet hôtel pour l'espace la propreté et la situation géographique.

title: Manhatten Club
text: Ideal location.Subway stop 50yrds near Times Square and Central park.Very clean.Stayed in Junior Suite second bed pull out very comfortable.Fridge and microwave. Concierge and reception very helpfull.

title: Dingy with no common areas.
text: The housekeeping staff are great and the location is very handy. That’s it. Otherwise it’s a dingy, horrid place with no common areas where family groups can sit. Breakfast has to be eaten in your room which is a dingy brown with no daylight. The best bit is leaving.

title: On Point
text:
Quick, friendly check-in
Fast elevators
Spacious 1 bdr suite w/microwave, coffee, frig
Very clean
All interactions with staff were fab
Just North - Central Park
Just West - Hell's Kitchen for restaurants
Will definately revisit

title: Ottima posizione
text: Abbiamo appena trascorso una settimana in quattro, l'hotel è posizionato perfettamente per coloro che vogliono visitare Manhattan, nelle vicinanze ci sono tanti posti per la colazione, (in hotel è troppo costosa),la stanza era pulita, con un bagno spazioso, consigliato.

title: Great room...say no to Voss water
text: Room was great, comfy bed with comfy pillows. Nothing bad to say about the room or the hotel. The hotel has 2 bottles of Voss water in the room, but beware they are 8$ each!!! If you need a drink they have a vending machine on the 26 floor. I didn’t realize the water was 8$ till after I broke the seal and my wife pointed it out. Great location and easy in and out. Front desk was great and helpful.

title: Para lo que he pagado, esperaba algo mejor
text: Realmente para lo que he pagado no fue lo que esperaba, el hotel esta muy bien, pero el personal no es nada amable, habia pagado con anterioridad los desayunos y ellos insistieron que no fue asi, perdi casi 500$, por eso, asi que mi consejo es ver bien y hablarlo antes, ya que información ninguna

title: Very good to catch it.
text:
Perfect location next to metro, Central Park, 5th Ave, Broadway etc
Breakfast not something special although the price were very high.
Suites' Maintenance has to be renovated.
Very clean and very friendly staff

title: Awesome place
text: This place is awesome. Inexpensive valet , so much room in the 1 bedroom with a greAt view. Originally I was put in floor 22 at a room behind the elevator. I went back down to ask Maria my hotel check in receptionist if we could be moved. It was not a problem and she put us a floor down to the 21st floor. This place is beautiful with a wonderful staff. I’ve stayed in New York before and every other place was cramped. His place is spacious and was only 17 rci points. Only here for a day to see my favorite band. Wish I had more time in this beautiful gem of a place . Thank u Manhattan club

title: More room than you could possibly hope for in Manhattan.
text: For a very mid-range price, I was given a room that should have cost a fortune in Manhattan.  Spacious bedroom, large separate sitting room, spacious and nicely fitted bathroom.  Everything was clean, nice, and neatly appointed.  Plastic disposable cups in the bathroom reminded me that I hadn't paid for a luxury room.  But other than that, I certainly received one.  I travel a lot, including to Manhattan, and I was really surprised.  Great deal, and of course a very convenient location for midtown and Broadway.

title: Hotel The Manhattan Club
text:
Muy buena relación calidad/precio
Excelente ubicación de central park y time Square 
Estuvimos en una suite para una familia de cuatro integrantes muy buena opción, con salón con microondas, lavavajillas, nevera y vajilla ideal para tomar desayuno o alguna comida.
Súper recomendable

title: Great location.
text: Had a nice stay at Manhattan Club, right across the street from Carnegie Hall. The apartment style hotel and club is older architecture but updated interior.  We had a one-bedroom king and pull out couch. Very comfortable on one of the quieter streets close to Central Park. The price was quite moderate (~$200/night).

title: Buona posizione. Piccole dimensioni.
text:
Posizione ottimale per scoprire New York. Zona sicura e ben servita.
La nostra suite era piuttosto piccola per 4 persone. Fornita di angolo cottura con lavastoviglie ma... senza tavolo e sedie. Bagno discretamente spazioso.

title: Rockettes, city sights
text:
Nothing like Rockefeller center and Christmas in NYC. 
The Manhattan Club was great! Very accommodating staff and wonderful location. Rooms were spacious and clean. Parking was Valet and Doormen were swift and personable. What more could you ask for! 5 stars..

title: Fantastic hotel with even more than I bargained for!
text: This hotel surpassed our expectations. It was well priced but more importantly the room  was beautiful. Comfortable bed, comfortable couch, great sound on the TV, excellent shower etc. The breakfast room was beautiful and , while we did not purchase a full breakfast we did purchase coffee (free refills!) which was excellent. Staff was super attentive and polite. We will definitely be back.

title: Nice surprise
text:
Found a good deal on Travelzoo and took a chance.  Room with taxes and extras was only $180 per night. Great for NYC on a Saturday.
We arrived and were pleasantly greeted by the doormen.  Efficiently checked in - and I say efficiently because it wasn't that warm necessarily...which is why I can't give an Excellent rating. but it wasn't sour either...I did note on our reservation that it was our 25th Anniversary and no mention or "Happy Anniversary" was ever said. What a missed opportunity.  I don't need anything free for that, just an acknowledgement would have sufficed.  Don't allow notes/comments if you aren't going to read them.
The room was very very nice. We had a City Lights Suite.  Clean, spacious and the bed was comfortable. The sitting area was an added bonus too.
The concierge was just ok too - I was hoping for more than what I could find doing a Google search, but that's basically what we got.  Nothing that was recommended couldn't be found by doing a simply Google search - another missed opportunity.

title: Inigualable ubicación para visitar NY
text: Aunque las personas instalaciones ya tienen tiempo, sigue siendo un buen hotel con una excelente ubicación para estar cerca de los lugares mas importantes de NY. Cuartos amplios en suites y buena atención del personal recomendando buenos lugares a conocer. Cerca de Times Square, Rockefeller Center y Central Park entre otros.

title: Great location!
text:
The hotel is situated in one of the most convenient locations in Manhattan, right on the doorstep of Times square, Rockefeller centre, central park and 5th AVENUE.  Rooms are all suites and very comfortable. However we had to change rooms several times because maintainance and houskeeping seemed to overlook some major issues!e.g. a soaking carpet due to a leaking dishwasher! A a dishwasher that was gaulty to start with in the next room that we moved into and i woukd have appreciated a more thourough clean room which was only done on request!please make sure to ask for a room away from the lifts as they share building space with another hotel and the lift seems as though its pounding on your head. My husband n i stayed up an entire night!
Staff were very helpul in sorting issues out

title: A touch of old world NYC
text: Dated accommodations from the 1970s but  rooms are clean with nice staff.   Gym is newer although small.  Good deals for NYC.  Concierge staff very knowledgeable and helpful to secure play tickets and reservations.

title: great hotel
text: The room... was queen size bed with down comforter making it hard to get out of because it was so warm and comfortable. Also mini kitchen area had a small refrigeretor and microwave allowing us to bring left overs back to the room. We experienced an issue with the heat witch took them 3 times to fix but the each call was quickly responded to. My only complaints have nothing to do with the Manhattan club, it was the snow bomb making travel by foot next to impossible also it was New Years so security and revelers also made it difficult.

title: Pratique
text: Hôtel de bonne taille et de bonne qualité d'accueil, chambres confortables plus coin cuisine. Bien situé non loin de central Park, de la 7ème et de la 5ème des musées, des belles boutiques et de Time square. Prix New York...

title: Great location
text: Great location - easy walk to Times Square, Central Park and Rockafeller Center.  Room was huge, clean and had plenty of amenities.  People were pleasant.  Overall very nice.  The only downside is the breakfast is not included and cost between 22-25 dollars.  We opted out and went less than a block around the corner to the closest bakery - great food/coffee in the morning and much less expensive!

title: Classic bait and switch by staff
text:
Called the front desk to book a room and was routed to Felicia Bouschell in reservations. Over the phone Felicia [-]agreed to reserve and take payment in advance for 2 nights in a one bedroom suite for a specified amount that included taxes and fees. Over the phone Felicia [-]confirmed that there were 2 one bedroom suites available for the dates requested. Checked in several hours and was assigned a queen room (not what I ordered and agreed to reserve). When I asked for the manager, Jordan [-]., would not give out his last name, stated that there were no one room suites available, and that I am lucky to get a room at all. After describing the arrangement I made with Felicia [-]and prepaid for the one room suite as agreed he called me a liar.

Horrible staff, slow elevators, room was damp. I will never stay in this hotel again!!

title: Perfect location, friendly staff
text: This was the second hotel on our trip, which we only stayed one night. The first impression was great as we were welcomed by the bellman, management, and front desk staff. The staff were friendly and helpful. They do put a $300 hold on your account for possible damages so be prepared for this. The room was very large for New York standards and included a small kitchenette with a larger than normal fridge, utensils, plates, standard size microwave, and coffee pot. There was a pullout bed in the living room area (again not normal for N.Y.) and a separate bedroom with the most comfortable bedding in all of New York. The decor was a tad outdated and small wallpaper peelings throughout, but nonetheless this was a very comfortable hotel, in a great location, with very friendly staff.

title: I liked it
text:
Check in is easy. Staff is nice. Liked my one bedroom suite. The view was lousy, but that isn't something that I would consider a huge problem. 

The bathrooms do not have counter space so there is not space to put toiletry items in the bathroom.  Whoever hung the wall paper did not do a very good job, but bathroom was clean.

The room was clean and I liked that it had a stocked kitchenette. I walked to a corner store and purchased things I could microwave. 

They do not have any type of room service and I did not use their breakfast buffet because I bought my own food to eat in the room. 

It is in a great location and within walking distance to Central Park, shopping, pubs and restaurants. 

The concierge was very accommodating when I requested a car service.

I would stay at this hotel again

title: An Oasis in a Busy City
text: We were fortunate to find a 1 bedroom suite here fairly last minute. It exceeded my expectations in size of room; staff friendliness and customer service and location.  The room was large (for NYC standards) with 2 full bathrooms, a bedroom, a total of 3 closets, a dining area complete with mini fridge (with a working freezer) dishwasher and microwave. There were dishes and cutlery supplied as well. The living room area had a pull out sofa bed, chair, coffee table, end table and tv. The bedroom was very comfortable but the (only) feather pillows were challenging.  The room had windows that opened and the room thermostat worked well.  The only other challenge was that the connecting door to another suite made conversations easy to hear (we put a towel down at the bottom of the door). The front desk was very responsive to our needs (a safe that needed a reset) and we felt extremely safe in this hotel.  The location was incredible!  Very close to Central Park, Columbus Circle, easy walk to Times Square, subway stations around the corner and lots of good restaurants and shopping.  VERY happy with our stay here.

title: Annual December getaway
text: This place is beautiful and in the best location. Central park, and walking distance to time square, radio city. Fantastic restaurants within one block.   The service is great, they are helpful and prices are good. Weve been going for 15 years!

title: Great room and location!
text:
The Manhattan Club was a prime spot in the city. Close to Times Square, Rockefeller, Central Park, etc. We walked to most of these locations and the subway was close as well. Our room was also perfect. No noise could be heard and housekeeping was exceptional with checking every morning if we needed our room to be cleaned and not rushing us if we were still in the room. The junior suite was the perfect size for our family of 3. The kitchenette was also lovely to have with a child to store things in the fridge and having utensils and plates! The popcorn was a big hit for my daughter that they give in the room with the coffee and tea. No problems at all with the room or elevators. We did visit the 26 floor which was nice and also had a vending machine, which was a hit for my daughter as well. Bell staff always greeted us and opened the doors if we had a lot in our hands. It seemed the guests are mostly older, but it was no problem to have my six year old here. Christmas decorations were also lovely. 

We did have one problem when checking in. They charged my cards twice for the security deposit as they took one payment out the day before. When I noticed I contacted the front desk immediately and it seemed as if the front desk manager did not believe me or was not understanding. I notified him that the staff should put notes or read notes so this does not happen because it was such an inconvenience. Good thing I noticed right away and the front desk manager voided it and gave me a letter to send to my bank right away which was nice but still a hassle and did not need to happen if the staff checked their notes or whatever they put on reservations. I was expecting a sorry for the inconvenience apology, but did not receive that as well. Maybe its just how New Yorkers are? I don't know.  

We used the car service they have at the hotel to go back to the airport which was said to be a flat rate of $75. But when we got to the airport and were told that if we used card the price would be $85. Not sure if it was his tip or what not but we should  just took a taxi or uber. It was a nice car and quick to the airport, but just spent more than we intended and were told by family we would spend.

title: First class
text: Totally exceeded my expectations. Our room was a huge 1 bedroom suite with a pull out sofa bed. The bedroom was behind French doors with a private bath. Kitchenette was nice but didn’t use it. We went to the lounge on the top floor which was quiet and classy. Great location. Expensive but worth it.

title: Convenient, comfortable, and friendly
text: According to the front desk, our room represented an upgrade from the standard room we had booked. For mid-town Manhattan, it was a decent size. It included a seating area with a couch and small easy chair, plus a tiny kitchen with microwave, half-fridge, and coffee maker. It was clean, and the closet even had an ample supply of hangers! No view at all -- a brick wall couldn't have been more than 10 feet away. Front desk staff was helpful in answering one or two simple questions about the area, tool. So -- glamour, no; a good base for a night in New York, yes.

title: Great Location Great Staff
text: Although not all the rooms are renovated, this place was pretty much what we were looking for in NYC, coming from Scotland for a week’s holiday. We’d previously been there with family who have a timeshare and these guests get the best rooms, which seems reasonable. Clean, good standard bedding, good shower etc. and some facilities to microwave and make coffee. Free wireless was good and also a facility to print tickets, boarding passes etc. Location is perfect for a holiday in Manhattan. Staff were obliging and very professional. I would definitely return.

title: Awesome location
text: Stayed here while visiting NYC. Great location, short walking distance to Central Park and Times Square.  Doormen are super helpful with leading you in the right direction. Hotel is in immaculate condition.

title: Family stay
text:
Very clean, comfortable.  Bell/luggage person was a bit testy with my son and the cleaning lady walked in unnouncwd while I was naked apres-shower, apologized, then came back 30 seconds later while I was still naked to see when I was checking out.

Otherwise very nice.

title: Very good service and in the middle of the Big Apple
text:
We stayed for 4 nights at The Manhattan Club as part of a family roadtrip.

We used valet service for parking, which cost $35 per 24 hours. 

The first night we slept in a room on the 2nd floor. The windows were single glazed so lot's of noise came from the street. It kept us awake almost the entire night. 

The next morning we made our way to reception and complained about the situation. We then immediately were given a different room on the 15th floor. It was a recently renovated room. Very spacious! 

The following 3 nights we slept like a baby! :-)

The location is great! Smack in the middle of Manhattan. Only a 5 min walk to Times Square, 10 min walk to Central Park. 

The next time we visit NYC we will definitely stay at The Manhattan Club!

title: Buena ubicación
text:
Ubicado en un buen sector, con buen equipamiento, no pidas muchas estrellas. Te puedes preparar un desayuno, guardar alimento en el refrigerador, lava vajilla,wifi y aire acondicionado.
Cerca de Central Park, a cuadras de time Square y próximo a supermercados.

title: Close to Broadway
text: The Manhattan Club was close to the the places we wanted to see and things we wanted to do. We could walk to  Central Park, Times Square or the Rockefeller Centre in a few moments and we really took taxis. The hotel us well maintained and managed by a professional and helpful staff.

title: Family and friends visit for our 50th birthday
text:
We arrived on Halloween- greeted by the staff in fancy dress!!
Great location only a short walk from Times Square. 
All staff very courteous and willing to help. 
Junior suites well equipped with tea, coffee, popcorn and bottled water (fee to pay for water), fridge, microwave and dishwasher in the room. 
3 people in our room, 4 in my friends, plenty of room essentially to sleep, shower and dress for busy days in NYC. 
I would definitely stay here again.

title: got time for elevators?
text:
Best ever location. Walking distance to Time Square, Columbus Circle, Broadway, Central Park. 
So what's the problem?
Well, first of all, the elevators are so out of sync, you could literally wait 10-15 minutes!!!So frustrating!!
We had a suite which had an interleading door. There was no sound barrier and we could hear people in the next room as if they were in the room with us! As well very noisy, so can hear traffic constantly and we were on the 22nd floor
Otherwise no other problems.

title: Better Places than The Manhattan Club
text: We checked into The Manhattan Club for 3 nights.  One reservation was made through The Manhattan Club reservations for the 1st night.  The second and third nights were through Bluegreen  Resort Ownership.  We were given room 222 for the 1st night and then required to move the next day to room 228 and wait 5 hours after checking out of room 222.  Naturally when we checked out after the first night, it was a rainy, stormy day and we had no room to be in.  Both rooms had ugly views of the roof and pipes.  The second room had a love seat with holes in the arms and a stain on the wall behind it.  Needless to say after going there for 20 years, we won't be returning.

title: Nice room in a great location
text: This hotel is in a perfect location for visiting NYC.  It is very close to Central Park, museums, Broadway plays, etc.  There are many places to eat near by.  Souvlaki Gr is one we tried. It was reasonably priced, delicious Greek food. There is a wonderful breakfast place - Le Pain Quotidien I would recommend. Our room was not renovated; it was an executive suite on the 12th floor, which was clean and gave us plenty of room for 3 people. They can also arrange airport pick-up/drop-off as needed. Wifi is free. Overall, we were quite pleased with the accommodations.

title: Muitos problemas nos quartos
text:
Bem localizado porém quartos antigos, todos os dias algo não funcionava , energia, aquecedor, pia entupida. 
Tamanho do quarto que fiquei pequeno.
Bastante impessoal.
Colchões razoáveis 
Banheiro razoável fora os problemas

title: Hôtel très bien situé.
text: Idéal pour une famille de quatre en chambre familiale. A deux pas, de Central Park pour le footing ou une balade au "vert", à quelques rues de Times Square, à côté d'une station de métro... Hôtel propre et ménage fait tous les jours. Personnel très agréable.

title: Great Jr. Suites and Location!
text: Great location, front desk staff and beautiful room.  The Jr. Suite was a nice size with lots of closet space.  Large bathroom with bathtub / shower.  Room came with living room, kitchenette.  Large comfortable queen bed, sofa, kitchen table with chairs, and lounge chair.  Room, linens and furniture was clean.  All the electrical outlets need to be replaced since a simple cell phone charger kept falling out of the socket (the socket could not keep cord plugged in).  Overall, the room, staff, location and space was excellent!

title: Nice hotel near Central Park and theater district
text: This hotel is not right in Times Square it’s its not too far away.  The hotel staff was very friendly.  The hotel was clean and the rooms were nice.  They are actually pretty large for the city.  They have a breakfast available.  It is a little pricy - but you are in the city.  The lounge where breakfast is served is also a bar.  It is comfortable.  The one thing I will mention is that you can hear street noise in the night.  We slept fine with the street noise but if that bothers you, you might have a problem sleeping.

title: Ottimo Hotel
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel una settimana, è in piena Midtown quindi una zona molto frequentata. 
Eravamo in 4 adulti in una One Bedroom Suite Doppia, camera matrimoniale divisa dal salotto da una porta che preservava la privacy delle due coppie. Stanza ampia con un bagno completo e un letto matrimoniale, il soggiorno con un sofà a due piazze un bagno completo e una parete/cucina comprensiva di microonde e lavastoviglie.
L'hotel offre anche una colazione da asporto che si può consumare in camera, tavolo ampio anche per cenare (noi non abbiamo mai fatto colazione in hotel, sotto l'albergo ci sono moltissimi locali compreso Le Pain Quotidien). 
L'hotel è a 400 metri dalla metro 57 NQRW e dalla 57 F, non lontana dalla 59 ABCD (Columbus Circle)
Il plus è sicuramente la stanza, ottima per due coppie o per una famiglia con figli, noi eravamo una coppia con due mamme. :) 
Personale molto disponibile, camera e hotel curati e puliti, free wifi.
Free Business Room al 26° piano per fare il check-in e stampare carte di imbarco prima di partire. Ottima esperienza

title: fantastic hotel - highly recomment
text:
I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC - especially for the tourist sites.  A short walk to central park and times square.  Right across from Carnegie Hall.  Plenty of shops and restaurants around about. 
Our room (junior executive suite) was huge - there was 3 people staying in it and there was definitely enough space for us all.  Also cleaned/bed sheets changed every day (which was good as even though we blasted the AC, it could still get warm - this was more us though, as we had come from 5c weather in Scotland to 30c weather in NYC)
The staff were so friendly and helpful. 
We would definitely stay here again.

title: Ideales Hotel für Jogger (Nähe Central Park)
text: Ein respektables Hotel, welches über frisch renovierte Räume verfügt und wir hatten das Glück, eine Suite im 2. Stock als Upgrade zu erhalten. Diese war extrem geräumig, ca. 42 qm, mit Kitchenette und separatem Schlaf- und Wohnzimmer. Alles frisch renoviert und wirklich top. Im Bad gab es ein in den Spiegel integriertes TV, was ich noch nie vorher gesehen habe. Die Betten waren auch sehr gut (Box Spring) und das Angebot umfasste auch einen Coffeemaker mit kostenlosem Kaffee sowie Microwave Popcorn. Das Beste war die Lage des Hotels Nähe U-Bahn Columbus Circle (5 Min. Zu Fuß), eine große Auswahl an Restaurants und Cafés und die direkte Nähe zum Central Park. Ein Paradies für Jogger, sehr schöne Trails verschiedener Längen, motivierte Mitstreiter (besonders am Wochenende)  und das Ganze in einem alten Park mit majestätisch gewachsenen Bäumen und schönen kleinen Seen.

title: Great place to stay in NY
text: The suite was excellent with all the facilities you required.  Opposite Carnegie Hall, short walk to time square.  However far enough away not to get the noise.  Staff very helpful.  Club breakfast good value for NY.

title: Nice Property but still needs help
text: We are owners at the Manhattan Club. We have always loved owning a piece of New York City. We just returned from a 3 day stay and we were assigned an updated, refurbished room. The new color style is in the grey family which is very attractive, however the new furniture is very uncomfortable, the couch and chair in the living room is a back breaker. The dressers are still the old dressers and the make up mirrors in the bathroom are falling off of the wall. The toilets are still the old fashioned low toilets, so they were never replaced either. Thank goodness, we only went as a couple because even though the rooms are rated for 4 people, this particular layout was very cramped and claustrophobic.

title: Nice hotel but cheap widows
text: Nice hotel in a great location but they need to update their poor quality windows. We stayed on the second floor and the street noise was so loud at night it was hard to sleep. If you do stay here request as high a floor as possible.

title: Decent hotel but has some flaws to be aware of
text: Stayed here two nights in October 2017. Staff was very friendly. Great location near Central Park, Columbus Circle and several train stations. The kitchenette in the room was helpful to have. Also there is a nice lounge area on the 26th floor which was a nice place to relax when we had a few people over. In terms of the negatives: we had booked a Metropolitan Suite which according to the hotel's website are all located on the 2nd floor. We ended up getting a room on the 21st floor (2111) which was not one of the Metropolitan Suites. Rather than the 'warm tones' of the advertised metropolitan suite this room had lots of grays and blacks. Combined with the fluorescent white lights throughout, the room felt very sterile and uninviting. We didn't mind enough to complain, but would have been nice for them to acknowledge at check-in that we were not going to get the room we booked. Because it was on a higher floor that expected, we also had to depend more on the elevators which were very slow. The room itself was a decent size but a very awkward shape, with lots of random twists and turns. To navigate around the bed I had to squeeze through a very tight corner for example. Not an ideal layout. The room was also quite musty/humid. Thinking back, I would say the poor ventilation was the biggest issue for us. It smelled very damp even with the air conditioning on. Other minor issues were the windows which were quite dirty, and the furniture, which seemed to be a mix from different sets that didn't match. Would not stay here again largely due to very musty room/poor air quality.

title: great location
text: Booked through RCI nearly 12 months in advance. The hotel is in a great location, just 3 blocks from Central Park and just a few minutes walk from Theatre district. Plenty of meal options within walking distance of the hotel. All staff very professional and helpful. Would love to stay there again if we ever returned to NYC

title: Beautiful, Clean, Convenient...But the beds are really uncomfortable.
text: Like my title says,   This hotel is gorgeous, clean, and complete with high quality everything... except mattresses.   We're staying here as I write, and the mattress is so hard and uncomfortable that my husband and I -literally-both woke up barely able to take a deep breath because of lower back aches/ pain.  We both tossed and turned all night long,  and after a long day of walking the streets of manhattan this was not what we wanted out of a night of sleep.  Right now I'm wishing we'd looked for a Hilton. :(

title: What a gem!
text: Easy walking distance to Central Park, Times Square and 5th Avenue. Was upgraded to an amazing suite with exceptional facilities, including a TV in the bathroom mirror. Very friendly and helpful front desk. Would recommend

title: New York Birthday trip
text: We stayed here as a family in august as part of my 40th birthday celebrations. This hotel is amazing and in my opinion perfectly located to see the New York sights. We were greeted on arrival by a lovely young lady who was checking people in, she was very nice and was very accommodating. She had upgraded us to a bigger room which was gorgeous however we had a slight problem with a very low humming noise coming from the air conditioning unit outside the window. Absolutely not a problem to me and my hubby but my daughters autistic and it was kinda driving her mad. Anyway quick trip to the lovely girl on reception and we were moved within minutes to a different room which was as equally beautiful. We didn't use any other facilities of the hotel and just used it as a base for sightseeing but wow what a base. Highly recommend this hotel it was clean, had loads of character and the staff were lovely. I've only given an average rating for the noise as if your a light sleeper you can hear all the hustle and bustle of the city although not very loud it could be distracting for some. We loved it as it was part of our New York experience and the beds were so comfy we soon drifted off to sleep :)

title: Exceptional stay at the Manhattan Club
text:
We decided to visit NYC on the last minute; we booked this hotel 24 hours in advance. Still, we had a great stay and enjoyed the confortable luxury room, friendly staff and awesome location of this hotel. 
Upon our arrival, we were greeted by a parking clerc. The porter also came to us to help with our luggage. Please note the there is a fee for parking, but all parking is expensive in NYC. With the central location of the hotel, wear comfortable shoes and you will not need your car for your stay. 
The check in process was simple. We were disappointed to have a room on the second floor without a view, but we understood it was because we booked late. 
The room in itself was the most convenient  room we have had a pleasure of staying in. Huge room, with a sofa bed and a very comfortable king bed. A TV in front of the bed, a TV in front of the sofa bed, and a TV in the bathroom, inside the mirror. The kitchenette has a sink, a microwave oven, a fridge, and a dishwasher. We would have appreciate a few chairs to sit our children on as we were afraid they would stain the sofa while eating. Hint: there is a cheap pizza place right accross the street if you are looking for a convenient and affordable place to eat.
The bathroom in itself was absolutely amazing, a spacious shower, with a small adjacent private cabinet for the toilet. A big counter with a wide mirror. 
And the location of this hotel, 3 streets away of Central Park, is also great for families.

title: Great location staff very friendly
text: Our room was very clean and roomy, the staff was very friendly and you are walking distance to the park and time square.  Bathrooms were recently renovated and beautiful with marble top to bottom.  Nice kitchen with fridge, microwave and coffee maker.

title: Carino
text: Sabbiamo soggiornato presso questo hotel ad Agosto e ci abbiamo trascorso quattro notti. Le stanze sono un po’ piccole e anche la colazione non era niente di che. Era carino ma niente di eccezionale ...

title: Surprising Hotel with great room space...
text:
PROS:
Room: stayed in a recently renovated room with a kitchenette at the 22nd Floor (corner suite).
- Great size for NY standards (19m2), with a sofa-bed that can accommodate easily 2 adults + 2 kids.
- Nice kitchenette with all you need to have your own breakfast in the morning (fridge, microwaves and coffee maker).
- Recently renovated, everything in the room was quite new!
- Silent AC/heating unit (which is very difficult to find in NY).
- Good king bed, nice sleep.

Hotel Facilities:
- Did not use other facilities in the Hotel, but everything looked very well maintained.

Location:
- Great for tourism, at the beginning of Broadway, really close to the Central Park and easy access to many metro lines in the Columbus Circle or the 7th Avenue (including the E line that takes you cheaply to the JFK Airport)

Amenities:
- Excellent free wi-fi internet.
- lounge with breakfast.

CONS:
Room:
- TV could be located by the the bed. Where it sits it is only convenient to sit in a small chair.
- lack of a proper desk as work station.

Ammenities:
- fair breakfast, standard US continental options, but quite pricey for so few options.

I went to NY during the United Nations General Assembly, so the hotel prices were at the sky in all Hotels, so it is difficult to evaluate the value for money of this Hotel at its "normal" price.

title: Thankful
text: I recently stayed at the Manhattan Club for a one night stay. I booked through Hotwire and with how Hotwire works, it was a completely blind decision. I wasn't sure about the hotel at first. To my surprise, not only was it a comfortable and well situated hotel within mid town, I had one of the biggest rooms that can be found in the city. It was a suite with ample space for a small family with children. I traveled alone and was grateful for the level of security and friendliness of the staff. I previously lived in Manhattan and come back from time to time. When I am there I am running around all over and it was comforting to have a place like the Manhattan Club to just kick up my feet after all of it. It is a bit dated and my suite had not been renovated like you see the rooms on the Trip Advisor but linens are new and the towels are plush. My suite had a bathroom that at first I was not very happy about because their was a bad stain in the floor around the toilet. The management should replace the flooring. But, there was a second bathroom to my surprise and so I just used that one and avoided the other. To be fair, the stain did not mean dirty. It is just a hard water stain or something of the like. It really is only unpleasant to look at. The bed was comfortable but not the newest mattress. A bit too springy. Overall though, I couldn't want or expect more for the money spent. Definitely recommend the Manhattan Club if looking for value and comfort.

title: Great stay in a really comfortable hotel
text:
While this may be a mostly timeshare hotel, we cannot overstate the comfort and pleasantness of the place. As we were staying during Fashion Week, when NYC was jammed and the prices were out of sight, we were quite surprised that The Manhattan Club was appreciably less expensive but no less worthwhile. Great location, just across the street from Carnegie Hall and a short walk from the theatre district, and our room, which was one of the newly renovated ones, was on the second floor, but almost totally noise-free. And we were thrilled that it was really a one-bedroom apartment, complete with small kitchenette, coffeemaker, microwave etc., and the bathroom featured a wonderful walk-in shower with great water pressure.

We had a terrific dinner at a lovely Italian restaurant right down the street (Basso 56), a great breakfast nearby at Maison Keyser (and great pastries and cookies) and could not have been happier with our stay. A special shout out to front desk associates Maria and Lisette.

Highly recommended. Make sure to request a renovated room, and you won't be disappointed.

title: Timeshare owner's perspective- for hotel guests
text:
I have had a timeshare at this property for about 14 years.  Recently they have expanded to offer hotel rooms to the general public.  If you are considering booking this as a hotel room, here's what you need to know. Remember the first rule of real estate: Location,Location, Location.   1) "Location"This is New York City - average reasonable rooms here cost $300-400 a night. Great rooms are probably out of your price range.  The rooms are clean, up to date, and reasonably roomy for New York.  You get a little kitchenette (we had fridge, microwave, coffeemaker, dishwasher with service for 4 in dishes and glasses.). 2)"Location" You will not expect a "view" from your room in NYC.  If you look out the window you will see another building - not just here but most any hotel you stay in.  If you face the street you will get more street noise and smells, so if you face the back and a brick wall this is not all bad.  3)Location - The purpose of a hotel room in NYC is to have a homebase to see the city, which means a comfortable place to sleep and somewhere you can eat snacks or refrigerate restaurant leftovers while you rest up to go back out into New York.  So much of what you want to see is walking distance from here - and walking is the primary way to see New York !  You can walk to : Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, all the major theaters.  Carnagie Hall is just across the street (only important during their season approx. October to May). There is a subway station in this block - it's right under the hotel!  Using the subway opens up the wider New York world to you at minimum expense.  (Remember to notice that subway service changes somewhat on the weekend.) 
Many of the staff have been here for years, over time they don't quite get to know you, but kind of.  This trip I managed to leave my briefcase in the lobby in the rush to get to the airport.  When we realized it my daughter called the hotel...the sercuity guy recognized her by name and said " Yes, we have your bag - I was just about to call you."  They FEDEXed it to me at my office the next week.  
There is a breakfast bar on the 26th floor in the morning.  The price sounds high if you are from out of town...but any kind of regular meal in New York will run you $25 to $35 a person, so it's reasonable. 
The guests are allowed to use the service elevators to get more elevator access, look for the glass door with the sign just to the left of the desk when you check in. The regular elevators are at a premium during check-in and check-out time.

title: Great room after lots of issues, staff has attitude
text:
The hotel is in a great location just 2 blocks from Central Park. Refurbished rooms are very nice but you must ask, and ask again to get one. We arrived at 3:45 PM and had requested a remodeled room previously. They told us they had none ready and to come back at 4PM! I told them that was 15 minutes and they made me get back in line. I waited and then they gave us a room with a view of a walled courtyard that was dark. Long story short it took a half hour to get a good room after calling someone in the back of the office.
When the girl at the front desk gave me the key her attitude was very cold, as if I had caused a problem. I am not sure why they have a 4pm check in when we saw maids there at 9 am cleaning rooms...in any case if you can request a remodeled room you will be satisfied. We only wanted a view of the street as we had driven from Pittsburgh and wanted to see the street!

title: Hotel asqueroso
text: Me estoy hospedando hoy en día aquí, llegué el 6 de septiembre, nos dieron una habitación en el 15 piso, es súper vieja, se me cayó un tubo donde cuelgan las toallas del baño en la cabeza ya que es súper viejo, la alfombra se ve que jamás la aspiran ya que está llena de polvo y de manchas, los baños no los limpian solo cambian las bolsas de la basura y máximo cambian las toallas, los pisos del baño también están sucios y con la misma basurita que deje por la mañana para ver si lo limpiaban, hoy llegué y al levantar la sabana de la cama me doy cuenta que estaba debajo un short que dejé por la mañana, de verdad es asqueroso!! Mañana pondré una queja porque pensé qué tal vez tuve mala suerte el primer día, pero ya veo que no! Lo peor es que la estancia está pagada desde hace meses!!! Seguro hasta dejan las mismas sabanas entre un huésped y otro. Es el peor hotel en el que me he quedado. Lo único bueno es la ubicación y punto. Si pueden no se queden aquí

title: Superb location superb hotel
text:
Having read some reviews on this place I was beginning to worry if I had booked the right hotel for our stay. I have wanted to come to NY for as long as I can remember and as It was my first time in NY having saved for years to come to my dream holiday I wanted everything to be perfect, it was also my birthday the day we arrived and my moms whilst we were there. I had requested a renovated room as per the tips from the reviews. 

Check in Isn't until 4pm and we arrived just after 2pm. Our room wasn't quiet ready so we left our luggage at the hotel and walked the couple of blocks to Central Park. We returned just after 4pm and our room was ready. We were on the 16th floor and I was very disappointed that it wasn't a renovated room. However, it actually wasn't as bad as i thought it would be. We booked a one bedroom suite and it was massive. One huge bedroom with king size bed and still masses of room, the front room area with sofa (pull out bed) and chair, small kitchenette with fridge, microwave and dish washer and the best bit 2 bathrooms. Never stayed any where with 2 bathrooms before. I loved the space that was there. We travelled with 3 generations of our family. It meant that we had space and if needed a get away from each other for a few minutes we could. 

When we arrived in the room, there was no bed sheets for the sofa bed, called to reception and it was arranged but didn't seem to happy as they kept saying they were in the wardrobe.
