All that was there was a pillow and blanket but no sheets to cover the mattress of the bed or a top sheet under the blanket. We did ask for a duvet too but was told they didn't provide duvets for the sofa bed but never understood why. However we were eventually supplied with two sheets and we were happy with that. 

Even though we were on the 16th floor we could still here the traffic noise. But this wasn't a problem. We are in New York City and think you would be Hard pressed to find a hotel that doesn't have traffic noise. Again our view over the Main Street was restricted by other skyscrapers, but could see Carnegie Hall. But I didn't expect any different due to the location and it was fine.

The staff we did come in to contact with were very friendly and always greeted with a smile. On the last day concierge staff called to reconfirm our taxi for us. 

The location was great too. The hotel is a couple of blocks to Central Park and 5th Avenue and a couple more to Times Square. There is also three subways close by too so can reach other parts of the city. Took 25mins by subway to battery park to visit Statue of Liberty and was very cheap. If you go to the station at 57th street there was a ticket booth so if you are unsure about tickets and routes they will advise you. 

Overall, despite my initial worries I was very pleased with the hotel.  For us it worked out very well by upgrading our suite and for a first time visit it was the perfect location. I would have no qualms about staying again. 

Thank you Manhattan Club for a wonderful stay. It made my first time in NY perfect.

title: Great place to stay
text: Love the locations close to so much, love that a doorman was on at all hours to get ta xi for us, The top floor Bar is fun time about 10pm with Michael--wish they had better selection of vodka tho. Loved how nice he was and for my birthday they helped celebrate!! great place to stay as you are close to everything

title: Amplo, confortável e com boa localização
text: Estive em 4 adultos no hotel, o quarto era ótimo pois tinha 2 banheiros, copa com microondas, lava-louça, frigobar, cafeteira com café a vontade, isso fez muita diferença pois conseguimos tomar café da manhã no quarto mesmo. A cama do quarto é super confortável, já o sofá-cama deixa um pouco a desejar pois faz MUITO barulho, parecia ser bem velho, não é o ideal para duas pessoas adultas dormirem. Tem TV nos dois ambientes e a vista era linda de todas as janelas! A localização é um ponto forte, íamos caminhando para a quinta avenida, times square, central park, e tem uma estação de metro bem próxima. O atendimento foi ótimo, sem complicações do check in e check out, também nos ajudaram com motorista para o aeroporto e atenderam bem todas as solicitações que fizemos.

title: Very Convinient Place
text: Very Convinient Place. The apartments need a little bit of renovation, but the location is priceless. The staff is super friendly. I really like it and recommned it for families. Perfect to go with kids, specially for the kitchenette.

title: Our room was great!
text: We stayed through RCI. It was great! Our suite had two full  baths. The bellmen were fabulous, helpful friendly.  Our room was clean. We were close / walking distance to Many things. There was a 54$ a day charge a 35 dollar a day charge for the car with no removal. There was an owners lounge where you could get coffee or breakfast for a charge. A good, well maintained, usable work out room. Bed was comfortable. 2 adults and 2 children were very comfortable. Honestly, not one complaint. Elevators were fine, expected wait times.

title: quarto amplo
text: Quarto amplo, limpo,com cafeteira, café a disposição, microondas. Sala com computadores, internet e impressora a disposição. Atendimento muito cordial. Excelente localização. Melhor impossível! Perto das principais atrações da cidade. Tem estacionamento em frente ao hotel

title: Family girls weekend
text: Love this hotel!!! We have stayed here numerous times. The staff is so helpful and friendly. The rooms are a nice size and very clean. The location is so perfect. It's located near Central Park and close to the theater district but out enough to be away from the horrible crowds! I highly recommend this hotel for an enjoyable vacation. The mini kitchen is so helpful as well.

title: Breathtaking Hotel!
text:
My family and I just checked in and I must say the room is more than we could have ever expected. I literally spent 3 days searching for hotels online, you name a hotel web site or search site . I am pretty sure I was on it more than once. 

The first hotel I decided on was Park Lane. They have some amazing rooms that overlook central park, but after reading reviews the rooms I was looking at which stated "partial park view" were hit or miss. The customer service rep I spoke with told me to ensure I obtained a room with the view I wanted I would have to upgrade to a "park view" room, which at the time I was looking was $125 more dollars a night. Way out of my budget.

The next hotel I decided on was Hotel 48LEX. From the comments and reviews this hotel is amazing. I contacted their front desk and asked about a room and described the view my family really wanted for our first time in NYC. The gentleman I spoke with was super nice and told me, that he recommended for that breath taking view that I should upgrade rooms just one more step and he would take care of making our trip special. I was so blown away from his personality that I found his manager on here and sent a long email about my experience and that I would be booking the hotel the next day, as I still had not told my wife about the surprise vacation and needed to ensure she could get off work. Well long story short the price jumped $70 dollars overnight and I just couldn't justify paying the extra money. Especially since I was already spending more than I wanted to before it jumped. 

The third day of searching i was starting to feel defeated. Like I was never going to get a room I liked. That is when I stumbled across Hotwire. I had never heard of Hotwire, but they have what they call "Hot Deals". They offer quality hotel rooms for a cheaper price. The only catch, you do not know what hotel it is until after you pay, and there are no refunds. 

That brings us to today. The room is a suite, and very spacious. There is a tv in both the bedroom and living room. The decor is nice, not what I would have picked, but still looks good. The bathroom has a huge shower, and the toilet is separated by its own wall and door. Oh and the mirror has a tv built into it! As far as location it is extremely close to Central Park and Time Square. All and all my wife and I are extremely happy. The only down side is we did not get the view we were hoping for. (Which is understandable as we got the room cheap through Hotwire) Being on the second floor is also a bummer because you can hear the traffic on the street. Not to happy with that. 

If hotel management reads this, please feel free to contact me, I am in room 204, and I will gladly pay a reasonable price to upgrade to a room with a better view.  If I do not answer the room phone you have my cell phone number on file. Last name is Finch.

title: Very nice, great location
text: So my pics are only of looking outside of our room. This is a nice older hotel that has a lot of good points but has room for improvement. Arrival and check in went great. Bellman and staff were helpful and called cab for us. The room we stayed in was nice, 2 bathrooms with wonderful strong hot shower heads. While our room accommodated 4 people, 2  could sleep in the bed and 2 on sofa bed, sofa bed was not that comfortable with a very thin mattress. There were extra blankets and pillows available in the room. Our kitchen area was clean and had basic neseccities. Refigerator was very cold which was nice. Our room was very warm the first night, it took the air conditioning in the room a day to catch up to make it comfortable to my liking. Overall enjoyable stay. One thing that needs improvement is the slow and small elevators. We waited over 10 min several times and then due to smallness had to wait again to because we couldn't fit due to other people being on them. We always made sure we left our room 20 min early to get to anywhere. I would stay here again. It is very close to everything and we were able to get everywhere we needed to go within 20 min.

title: Perfect for this family and the location is tops
text: Amazing place to stay - especially if you have kids! Two rooms and two BATHROOMS! I didn't have that when I lived in Manhattan. There's a little kitchenette which is perfect for storing and preparing snacks and heading up leftovers. The location cannot be beat-you're just north of Times Square so you don't have the throng of people when you exit but you're still super close to the park and all the attractions in Midtown AND all of the subways. Staff was lovely. Parking wasn't even that expensive!

title: black mold?
text:
just had a terrible experience at this place from the check-in  to check-out I had to change rooms due to the fact there was mold and I think it may of been black mold.
the bell hop was suppose to help and never showed up. I was upgraded to this room.
how lucky could I get. the bathroom was disgusting and the wall paper was coming off the wall. the mold was behind the wall paper. then  tried to talk to management and  they would do absolutely nothing for me but offer to give me a deal next time I visit the city. well I get there about once every few years. yippee again. if at all possible I would avoid wasting your money at this place, they are all about themselves as far as I am concerned

title: excelente atención y ubicación
text: La ubicación es excelente, en los alrededores hay de todo a toda hora, muy cerca de la zona de teatros, del central Park y del time Square. La atención de todo el personal es excelente. la suite que nos toco era  muy cómoda. fue nuestro primer viaje a esa bellísima ciudad y la elección del hotel fue genial, es excelente para ir en familia, pasamos 14 días maravillosos.

title: Great place to stay for a NYC vacation.
text: This hotel is very nice.  Rooms are decent size, considering its New York.  I agree with other reviewers comments.  Beds comfortable.  Kitchenette complete.   Cleaning person daily is nice.  Concierge very helpful.  Two blocks from Central Park;  five blocks from Broadway shows.   TV shows even closer.   Tip:   Restaurants are pricey and need tips.  Cafes will do for most meals and save on the tips.  Breakfast in the room works and there is a Whole Foods store a couple of blocks away to stock up.

title: Lage wirklich top !!!!!!
text: Erst mal das sehr Positive: Die Lage des Hotels könnte nicht besser sein, fußläufig zum Central Park, zur Metrostation und fast in Sichtweite des Time Squares....die Lobby ansprechend, das Personal sehr freundlich. Leider hielt das Zimmer nicht ganz, was die Bilder versprechen. Das Problem: nicht unbedingt, dass es etwas dunkel  war. Schließlich wohnt man zwischen Wolkenkratzern. Wir hatte das Zimmer für 4 Personen gebucht, nur leider gab es nur ein King-Size-Bett. Das andere war ein Sofa zum ausklappen, das leider zum Schlafen so gar nicht ging. Sehr altersschwach und die Federn spießten hervor. Wir orderten noch 3 Decken zum Darauflegen, dann funktionierte es so einigermaßen. Auf Nachfrage, ob wir ein Zimmer mit 2 Betten haben könnten, sagte man uns, dass es in diesem Hotel nur Zimmer mit 1 Bett gäbe. Fazit: für 2 Personen sehr schön zum Übernachten, für 4 Personen leider nicht. Da sollte man ein anderes Hotel buchen....

title: Just ok
text:
My family had stayed there three years ago in Room 1919--a hugh bright 1 BR suite.
We had wanted to stay there again as last time it was the perfect vacation.
Unfortunately, the second time was not that great. 
I had called Manhattan club 2-3 weeks prior and asked for that room. They said they would try and honor my request. They also said to call that morning and request that room again. I did. 
When we arrived that night, we were given another room. It was smaller and very dark. We were put  next to a room with a service dog. Occasionally, the dog barked but it was not a problem. 
Housekeeping broke one of the mirrors (they may have not known this) I called and it was replaced within the hour. I have found the Manhattan Club to be very responsive. 
Housekeeping was ok. They did their job.  We only stayed 3 nights as opposed to 7 last time. (I also stayed here one other time)
Anyway, we will not be staying here again. 
The elevators are too slow. . Lots of good things about the hotel but not worth it for us. I have better hotels to stay at next time.

title: Suite rooms 3.5*
text: Great location on W 56th St between 7th Ave and Broadway - easy walk to 5th Avenue, Central Park and Times Square.  Besides the location, these rooms are HUGE compared to most NYC hotels - our room had a bedroom separate from room with sofa, table and chairs.  There were 2 bathrooms AND a kitchenette - sink, microwave and refrigerator.  Valet parking only $35 per night. Friendly staff.  We will stay here again!

title: Excellent hôtel tres bien situé
text:
Nous avons passé 10 jours en famille (2 adultes et 1 enfant) dans cet hôtel tres bien situé (entre Central Park et Time Square à moins de 15mn à pied)
Accueil et personnel agréable.
Gros avantage: nous avons pris nos petit déjeuné dans chambre car équipe de micro onde, frigo et machine à café avec dosettes renouvelées tous les jours.
Beaucoup de bon restos à proximité.

Je recommande cet hôtel !

title: So impressed!
text: The staff at the Manhattan Club was exceptional from front desk staff, doormen and cleaning staff.  The location was extremely close to Central Park and Time Square.  We hope to return over the next year!

title: Great Location, Horrible Customer Service
text: We were here for a week in a one-bedroom unit, then switched to a studio unit for an additional night. Both rooms were in need of major refurbishment, especially the sofas and carpeting. They had significant stains and tears in them. The second room was truly terrible, smelling like we were in a kennel with ten wet dogs, and stepping in wet spots on the floor with our bare feet. None of this, however, was met with any empathy or resolution by management. Only the housekeeper understood and was very apologetic for the circumstances. While the location of this property is excellent, and the one-bedroom units are spacious with great views, sadly, this hotel is now definitely off our list of acceptable places to stay in NYC. If you experience a problem, you're out of luck here. The awful last night and subsequent woeful customer service soured our vacation.

title: Very nice boutique hotel
text: I stayed here for just one night with my husband and teenage daughter.  This was one of the few higher end hotels I could find at a fair price that had a king bed and a double/queen in the same room.  We were given an updated suite which was perfect for us.  There was a king bed for my husband and I in the bedroom and a pull-out sofa bed in the living area for our daughter.  There were giant TVs in the bedroom, the living room and also a small TV screen in the mirror of the bathroom -- way cool!  The suite also had a kitchenette with a fridge, microwave, sink, dishes, etc.  The bathroom was modern and spacious.  The location was also very good -- close to Times Square and just a block away from the subway.  We didn't get a chance to check out the club lounge.  My only complaint would be that the continental breakfast they advertise should be included in the room price.  I guess I assumed it was but I was wrong.  The past two boutique hotels I have stayed in in NYC have included breakfast.  I would stay here again if the price was right.

title: Excelente equilibrio de Costo, Ubicación y Servicio
text:
El Hotel esta ubicado en un excelente lugar dentro de Manhattan, a 2 cuadras de Central Park, a 5 de Time Square.
La calidad del lugar y del servicio es muy bueno.
El personal es super amable y servicial aunque no habla Español, pero no es una complicación.
La calidad de las habitaciones es muy buena aunque un poco pequeñas pero no es un impedimento.
Tiene heladera, cafetera, microondas, y aire acondicionado muy eficiente.
En nuestro caso nos toco una habitación en pisos bajos (2ºpiso) y es algo ruidosa ya que la ciudad no descansa pero no es un problema.
El gimnasio, la sala de computación y el bar son muy recomendables.

title: Manhattan Club again.
text:
Once again visited the Manhattan Club, June 10th to 20th 2017. Rooms are great, we had queen and queen sofa bed. Seating and kitchen area,and full bathroom/shower.
Staff always welcoming and pleasant.
Near all sites within walking distance. Even used subway to the Bronx and Coney Island. Great.

title: Хороший вариант
text:
Хороший отель, но завтраки не съедобны,
плюс нам попались номера "во двор" но это не двор в нашем понимании, а колодец.
Когда вы живете на 17 этаже, а всего их больше 20, то дворик 10Х10 метров превращается в трубу.
но в целом, мы довольны - вокруг полно ресторанов и кафешек для завтраков, два квартала и вы в Центральном парке

title: Opposite Carnegie Hall ... how close to everything!!
text:
Probably older style hotel but rooms largish, Bedroom plus lounge area, Kitchenette was a bonus to cater for take out dinner options, 2 bathrooms/toilets were a boon.
Concierge service excellent.We didn't use Gym or Bar.
Duck around corner to "Bread & Honey" for quick  & enjoyable Diner style food, or grab something to take back to the Hotel.
All in all Manhattan Club hard to fault.  ( August 2016 )

title: Very central, great location
text: This hotel is in a great location and the suite room was well equipped but it could do with some updating. Bed was comfortable but sofa bed isn't viable for a long term stay and the room isn't massive for 4 people although the bathroom is very spacious. We booked it for the great location loads of great places to eat and drink around, visited many of the rooftop bars and the views are great, close to Times Square and a stones throw from Central Park. The higher floor helped with the view, The gym was ok, well equipped but got very busy after 7:30, reception staff were friendly and the lobby gives a good first impression and it was worth it overall as I got a late last minute deal.

title: Excellent emplacement
text:
Hôtel très bien situé, permet de rayonner à pied dans Manhattan pour Times Square, Broadway, Central Park, etc. Même avec un enfant en bas âge!
Service de qualité, clim glaciale comme partout dans la ville, mais vous pouvez la couper ou la régler dans votre chambre.
Nous avions une chambre pour 3-4 personnes avec coin kitchenette : très bien. Nous avons simplement été obligé, à la 3eme demande, de récupérer des draps et de faire nous même le lit du canapé convertible.
Tarifs très raisonnables pour la ville, donc très bon rapport qualité/prix.

title: Muy buen hotel en una excelente ubicación
text:
El hotel es muy bonito, ubicado en la 56th entre 7th y Broadway. Podriamos decir que es un apart hotel. Las habitaciones son amplias. Cuentan con heladera, microondas, cafetera, vajilla y lavavajilla. El desayuno, por el cual no optamos, tiene un costo de USD 20 diarios por persona. A menos de 200 metros a la redonda se encuentran mercados donde te puedes abastecer muy bien, incluido con comidas para llevar y lo necesario para prepararte un buen desayuno
Esta muy cerca de las distintas lineas de metro y del bus. Tambien del Central Park y la 5 Ave. Al Moma y a Times Square puedes llegar caminando sin inconvenientes. Tiene un business center muy bien equipado, solo con acceso a los huespedes.
El personal de recepcion es muy atento y se esfuerzan por comprenderte.
Nuestra habitacion daba a la calle (Piso 15) y no se sentian ruidos.
PArte negativa: el colchón del sofa camaque estaba en el living. Debe ser de cuando inauguraron el hotel.

title: 4pm Check In
text:
We are staying 2 nights at The Manhattan Club.
Check in time is 4pm and check out 11am.
This is the latest I have ever been able to check in at accommodation and it is extremely inconvenient.
Do they need 5 hours to clean an apartment?

title: Nota 10!
text: Estive com minha família casal e duas filhas pequenas . Adoramos o hotel ! Quarto super espaçoso com dois ambientes dois banheiros e cozinha pequena ! Limpeza ótima e diária . Ar condicionado perfeito . Nosso quarto era andar alto e com isolamento acústico ótimo . Super bem localizado e metro super perto . Adoramos ! Com certeza voltaremos na próxima ida a ny !

title: Great Hotel
text: Our stay here was excellent. Service is prime. We had a one bedroom suite. It was great have a kitchenette where we could prepare our own smoothies in the morning. The fitness room is newly renovated and very nice. Our floor and room was not newly renovated but we loved it just the same. We had a corner unit with great views. Make sure to ask for either a newly renovated room or a room with a view (maybe you could get both!) Would definitely return.

title: Muy pequeño
text:
El hotel está Muy pequeño no tiene desayuno pero lo mejor sin duda es la ubicación . 
Si recomendó a los que van a turistear y pasan todo el día en la calle y solo Llega al hotel para dormir . 
 No esperen Lujo .

title: Perfect Location
text: Old Manhattan charm in this hotel, bar on top, great service, fast personable staff. our room was musty smelling and they promised to have it perfect by the time we came back , and it was, as well as extras thrown in for our trouble. they parked our car, kept our bags ,even a few hours after check-out so we could catch some last minute sights. The location is right in the heart of everything. LOVED IT !!

title: 넓은 객실
text: 뉴욕에서 지냈던 7개의 호텔 중에서 가장 객실이 넓어서 지내기 좋았던 호텔이었습니다. 위치도 매우 좋았고, 룸 컨디션도 좋았는데 아쉬운 점은 직원들의 태도가 가장 불친절했던 호텔이었습니다. 유난히 웃으면서 응대하는 것을 보기 어려웠던 점이 아쉬웠습니다.

title: A good stay
text: We had a good stay here. Our room was nice, it was cleaned promptly. The lack of bathroom counter space was a bit trying. Check in time was pretty late (4pm)- something earlier would have been appreciated. The elevator situation was a bit odd. Due to volume, you could use the staff elevators in addition to the guest ones. The hallway by the guest elevators often had garbage bags lying in it which was a bit smelly. Elevator doors closed quickly on people. This was all pretty minor- otherwise all was great.

title: Muy buena ubicacion
text: El hotel es muy cómodo, las habitaciones son funcionales y amplias. Tienen microondas, heladera, vajilla y lavavajillas. La ubicación es excelente y el personal es muy atento y solicito. Hay mercaditos cerca donde se puede comprar comida para llevar. Esta cerca de las paradas de subway y de bus. Hay wi-fi sin cargo en todo el hotel y cuenta con un centro de negocios donde se puede usar las computadoras e imprimir sin costo alguno. No recomiendo pagar desayuno en el hotel, hay un mac café a una cuadra, o la habitación cuenta con cafetera y heladera, se pude desayunar en la habitación sin mayores inconvenientes. esta a una cuadra del central park, y se pude ir caminando a Times square y la 5 ave.-

title: Well located Hotel!!
text: My wife and I come this second time to this hotel due our vacantion club. The second time was exactly the same as the first. We were well received by the receptionist, with a quick and very well informed check in. The room was perfectly clean and neat. The daily room cleaning was perfect. Doormen always prestative. I strongly recommend this Hotel.

title: Nel cuore della Grande Mela
text: Viaggio con 2 bambini, hotel a pochi passi da Times Square e da Central Park e di fronte alla Carnegie Hall. La zona è tranquilla, piena di negozi, ristoranti e bar, servita da supermercati con prezzi buoni per acquisti alimentari, importante visto che avevamo la camera con angolo cottura (compresa lavastoviglie). In camera è presente un forno a microonde e la macchina per il caffè. Nella stanza oltre ai prodotti da bagno erano disponibili due accappatoi. Abbiamo sempre fatto colazione e cena in camera con un considerevole risparmio. Il consierge molto disponibile e gentile e si mette davvero a disposizione degli ospiti. Unica nota negativa in un addetto della reception che al nostro arrivo era piuttosto scocciato e supponente, ma pazienza. WiFi gratuita. Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo visto che si tratta di New York.

title: Great!!!
text: Visited with my parents and sister. We had a one bedroom suite which was spacious and very clean. The pull out couch was extremely comfortable and our suite had two bathrooms which made getting ready in the morning easier. The location is extremely convenient to Central Park and Times Square and there is a subway stop very close by. We will definitely stay here again when visiting NYC! This room had the most space in any hotel in the city for the price!

title: Nice hotel
text: We made reservations to stay here a week as we liked the location in Manhatten which was convenient to many places we wanted to see. There is daily room maintenance, a bit more attention needs to be spent on the marble showers- there was mold all over the shower -on the grout. You can take a short walk to many restaurants many within a few minutes of the hotel and that is a big plus especially after a busy day sightseeing. (make sure to make reservations to the restaurants).

title: Great Value! Large Multi-Room Experience!
text: This is mostly a time-share hotel in Manhattan. I felt lucky to find a room here for one night in NYC. We were traveling with my daughter and son-in-law. They were staying in the city but we were leaving for the airport after the Broadway show. It was wonderful to have a bedroom, living area, kitchenette, table, and two bathrooms for the day. We could relax in style! In addition to being wonderfully roomy, it was also a great value! I hope to one day repeat our large, multi-room experience!

title: Great location, great room
text:
This place is mostly occupied by people who own time share apartments, therefore the rooms are large, often have 
More than one room and bathrooms. Impeccably clean and quiet. 
The offered breakfast is expensive but w bagel shops, Starbucks and assorted cafes in all surrounding streets not worth it.
This is our second stay and most Broadway theaters are 5-10 blocks awY, Carnegie Hall across the street. 
We shall be back

title: BUEN HOTEL, ESPACIOSO Y CON UBICACION ESTUPENDA
text:
No es un hotel al uso, son apartamentos muy espaciosos. 
La ubicación es estupenda, y te permite visitar muchísimos sitios andando. Cuenta con acceso al metro para desplazarte a zonas que no estén en el Centro.
No es un hotel moderno y tiene un encanto "retro" que a nosotros nos ha gustado mucho.
Sólo destacaría que el personal no es "multilingue" como indican, ya que no encontramos a nadie que hablara español.

title: Good location to Times Square and Central, Awesome Bellstaff, dated decor
text:
We stayed in a one bedroom suite. It was a good fit for my husband, 18 year old niece, and myself. We picked the Manhattan Club because we were able to get a good deal on the one bedroom suite which was ideal since it provided my niece with her own bathroom, and the couch pulled out into a full sized bed for her to sleep on.
The bell staff was outstanding and very friendly and helpful. We looked forward to seeing them each day.
The location is close to Times Square and Central Park with subway stations close by. We walked to Times Square often and also had an easy walk to the theatre as well.
I will say that the website is a little confusing as one area shows the one bedroom suite has 2 bathrooms, and another area shows 1.5 bathrooms. Our room had 2 bathrooms. The master bath had a tub and shower, while the other bathroom had a shower only, however we consider that a full bathroom. Just a clarification for anyone wondering.
My only complaint is that, while the room was clean it was dated and had a musty odor upon arrival. We were told the scent would dissipate after the air was on for a little while and we opened the windows slightly for a few minutes. The odor did mellow but the room felt stale sometimes. The place could use a little decor update and our view was not great (no city view from our 14th floor room), but for as much time as we spent in the room I don't really consider it a huge issue.

title: Tranquillità nel cuore di New York
text: Ho soggiornato per quattro notti in questo hotel nel cuore di New York sulla 56esima stata, all'angolo con la settima a pochi passi da Times Square. Eravamo in quattro, due adulti e due bambini e ci è stata assegnata una suite, al piano 23, con angolo cucina, molto spaziosa e luminosa di informale eleganza. Personale della reception professionale ma un poco freddo. Hotel tranquillo e silenzioso, sembra un'isola di pace nel caos di New York. Bagno decisamente da migliorare, poco funzionale e senza spazi dove poggiare le proprie cose. Non posso parlare della colazione perché non inclusa. Hotel consigliato per spazi, tranquillità, eleganza, discrezione e letti king.

title: Me encantó el hotel
text: El hotel es muy lindo y sobre todo funcional, ya que la habitación además de cómoda tiene microondas, lavavajillas, utensilios de cocina y microondas. la ubicación excelente, ya que esta en una zona céntrica que tiene cerca estaciones de metro, locales comerciales, restaurantes y un supermercado a 1 cuadra que está abierto las 24 horas. El personal de la recepción es atento.

title: Not up to standard
text:
How disappointed I was to find the sad and sorry state of my room at the Manhattan Club.

The lobby is lovely and the staff efficient and pleasant but the room is quite frankly disgusting. Stained carpet, peeling wallpaper, musty smell and chairs so stained you need to put a towel down before you sit down.

The sofa bed has springs poking out from all directions and the air conditioning can't handle the heat.

This room is at best a 2 star standard.

Not good enough when there are so many lovely hotels in NYC

title: A Place to Lay Our Heads
text: Stayed here for a night while helping our son move and had a nice stay. We were greeted very nicely at check in and we're checked in within reasonable amount of time....no waiting. The lobby was busy with lots of guests walking in and out, good jazz coming through the sound system, setting a real nice NYC vibe.  When we got up to our room tho, it stunk of cigarette smoke. My husband called the front desk and we were immediately moved to another room, which smelled of mold and mildew. Finally, we were put into a 3rd room which turned out to be fine. The place was clean and bed comfortable.  Wallpaper was starting to peel off walls in all 3 rooms which didn't look very attractive. Kind of have the feeling that the place is not well looked after.  We were not visiting the city for the purpose of staying at the Manhattan Club. We just needed a place to sleep for the night and this worked.

title: Vacation
text: Excellent place to stay. The staff was extremely helpful and quick to answer all of our questions. Great location. Easy to get to Central Park, Times Square/Broadway.  Would highly recommend staying there.

title: great hotel -    great location -  wonderful staff -   couldn't rave about it more...
text: This is an excellent property -  close to Central park -   close to Times square -  across the street from Carnegie Hall...   Rooms are very well appointed -   staff is very friendly and helpful.    I would definitely stay here on my next visit.  Thank you .... Reenie

title: Excellent Second Visit
text:
We used our timeshare exchange to stay a week at the Manhattan Club. This was our second visit. And we were very happy this time around too. 
The central location is excellent, walking distance from Central Park, the Theater District and 5th Avenue. There are a couple subway stations for different lines just a couple of street blocks away. 
The room has a mini-kitchenette with a fridge and microwave. A dining table which seats 4. A big convenience for take-out breakfast and take-out dinner. 
The room and beds were comfortable. 
Daily housekeeping was good. Reception and concierge staff were helpful. I was pleased with all the services provided. And we would be happy to stay at this hotel again.

title: Good hotel, central location
text: Good place to stay, wifi included in room price, they have a nice lounge on the top floor with free afternoon cookies and coffee.  Rooms are a bit small, but that's expected in NYC.  Very centrally located.

title: Simply Spacious and Comfortable .
text: This is hidden gem on the Westside of Manhattan near Carnegie Hall, major shopping and Columbus Circle is perfect for couples, families and solo travelers.  The rooms are very spacious which took me by surprise.  When I say spacious I mean 1 bedroom apt spaciousness.  All amenities are modern and new.  The 2nd floor rooms are the newly remodeled rooms. Very quiet and you hear no city noise.  Bring your own water, $8.00 for Voss--there is a small kitchenette.

title: Not impressed!
text:
This hotel had good reviews so we were looking forward to our stay.

We were upgraded on arrival ( appreciated), however it soon became apparent that the room's air-conditioned was leaking and making the carpet in the kitchenette area wet.

As my husband had some work to attend to the next day he stayed at the hotel while I went shopping. When I returned at around 4pm, I returned to a room with two maintenance men still trying to fix the air conditioner. They had been in and out of the room all day ( much to my husband's annoyance). I was tired after shopping all day and would have loved a bath and a bit of time to relax in the room. Thus was not possible with the maintenance men present. A real invasion of space and privacy.

We expressed our dissatisfaction to the night manager who offered to move us. We were reluctant to move because of the inconvenience of packing and unpacking and asked that the problem please be resolved by our expected return at 9pm.

On our return at 10pm, the unit had been fixed but there was a large portable fan in our room, in an attempt to dry the carpet.
This was not acceptable to us and we asked to move. It was late, highly inconvenient and we were very irritated. 

We were moved to a smaller, lesser quality  room ( likely what we had originally booked). 

I was very unhappy and the manager on duty was quite unsympathetic, bordering on rude.

This was a great location but we will not return here.

title: Good experience
text: Comfortable metro suite with fridge and microwave which meant we were able to have breakfast there. With prices for eating out hugely expensive, it was good to make some saving. Lovely large bathroom (shower only) in Rm 236. Concierge staff very helpful, as are the reception and porter staff. Superb location for Central Park, Times Square and all things Manhattan. Even though we were in the middle of Midtown, the room was quiet overnight. The bar on 26th floor is ridiculously expensive. 28 dollars for two small drinks. The complimentary gym is good though.

title: Voyage new york
text:
Hotel très bien situé entre times square et central park
Métro a 2 pas

Accueil standard hormis que les hôteliers ne parlent pas français et ne font pas d'effort pour se faire comprendre (au même titre que les restaurateurs et vendeurs new yorkais), pour un hotel de ce standing nous avons trouvé cela anormal

Chambre spacieuse et confortable avec kitchenette microndes et lave vaisselle

title: Excellent option for NY to exchange RCI points for ...................
text:
Some while ago, we were able to use our RCI points to book at The Manhattan Club, seemingly its not that often that the opportunity arises. As such, it costs very little to stay a week in NY. The reviews all looked good, and we were suitably impressed on arrival. We asked for a quiet room on a high floor, and were allocated a suite with no view on the 12th floor. It was somewhat dark at all times, but very quiet. Unfortunately, despite the room being a suite, the only other bed was a rollout, and that was in pretty poor condition. Everything else was in good order, two bathrooms, lots of towels, blankets, kitchenette, huge safe etc We found it more suitable to reposition the rollout bed, it soon became obvious that this room had not been spring-cleaned in a very long time as there was piles of mess under the couch/bed, not at all good for allergies. But other than that, all good, Wi-Fi worked well, staff were accommodating, and the position of the hotel cant be beaten!    
At checkout, we became aware that the daily service tariff had been increased substantially, but once we produced our reservation form, reception obligingly reduced the rate to the lower one stated there. 
We did not make use of the breakfast or other leisure facilities.
These rooms are booked out by the week, so just some suggestions:
 - cant a proper (extra) single bed be provided instead of a rollout?
 - and a kettle should be included in the kitchen?
Would definitely recommend the hotel and the exchange option if one can get it .......!
All in all a great weeks stay.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Amazing hotel in the heart of New York City - Manhattan. Wonderful view from its windows. Luxurious furniture and room equipments. Very nice atmosphere in the common areas. Very nice and friendly staff.

title: Very convenient location with excellent housekeeping
text: We spent a delightful week at The Manhattan Club and found it much improved over a stay there several years ago.  They have refurbished the suites and they are sparkling clean with upholstered furniture and carpets in great shape, a nice kitchenette with microwave, refrigerator, coffeemaker and mini-dishwasher, and really nice bathrooms.  Beds are extremely comfortable with top notch linens  Towels are "thirsty" and there are plenty of them.  Years ago the elevators were painfully slow.  They seem to have addressed the problem by letting guests use the extra elevators off the lobby that are also service elevators and that helps a lot.  They thoughtfully provide packets of Seattle's Best coffee along with microwave popcorn.  There is ample drawer space in the units in the bedroom and two closets.  My one wish is that the hooks on the bathroom doors are more useful to people 6 feet tall or taller; I couldn't reach them, which made hanging the towel for re-use difficult.  WiFi seemed hard to get but I didn't complain because I decided with all of NYC at hand, I could skip online activities. The location couldn't be more convenient for Midtown activities and for public transportation.  Staff are cordial and the housekeepers do a fabulous job.

title: Excelente hotel
text: Ótima localização, perto do Central Park, broadway, estação de metrô. Vários restaurantes, cafés e lojas ao redor. Quarto espaçoso, com microondas e máquina lava-louça, Staff atenciosos e gentis! Voltaria a me hospedar neste hotel com certeza!

title: Great Place to Call Home in NYC
text:
Read all reviews before spending a week in NYC at the Manhattan Club.  Each one was spot on.  Customer service was wonderful.  First day, the safe didn't work, response and repair done in minutes.  Housekeeping missed our room, again, response and cleaning done all but immediately.  I really can't say enough about how kind and helpful all the staff were.  Even struck up a conversation with the gentleman painting our hallway.  He and I had several during my stay.

I also couldn't disagree with the state of the furnishing.  Although the room itself was clean, sofa was questionable to sit upon.  The single chair had the stuffing coming out at the bottom.  It really took away from the experience.  

The location is wonderful.  We walked to Central park everyday.  Broadway, Times Square were just blocks away.  We used the Train and Subways systems without issue.  

I would definitely return to the Manhattan Club for another whirl wind week!

title: I will surely be back when in NY!
text: Great location! Right in the heart of Manhattan. Walking distance to everything: Times Square, Central Park, Theatre District, Macy's etc. Friendly staff. Room was clean and big enough. The only minus :$20 for a carbs Continental Breakfast

title: Everything you need to know about the Manhattan Club
text:
We made reservations through the RCI website for the Manhattan Club up to 9 months in advance, having stayed at nearby West 57th St by Hilton in May 2016.

One week costs the equivalent in HGV points of about $2000 plus $300 in transfer fees plus a daily $49 "hospitality fee" , otherwise known as a resort fee.  $2650 for 1 week including all fees. for a 1 bedroom suite.     

If you arrive before the 4pm check in time, you may find your unit is not ready, particularly on the congested Friday, Saturday check out and check in days.

3:50pm uniformed hotel personnel take my luggage from the Uber car to the lobby.  Registration personnel are friendly and courteous.  I show them my government issued Global Entry card with my picture, and a credit card, and am assigned a 23 floor room.

We walk across the lavishly furnished lobby to the two elevators, serving 26 floors, with up to 20 units per floor.   There are also two service elevators.  For a hotel this size they need more elevators, as it can take a long time to catch an elevator.

We noticed that during our week stay, nobody got off the elevator between the 3rd and 13th floors.  Floors 3-13 are for the next door hotel, and this elevator doesn't stop at those floors. Judging from the corridor wallpaper, floors 14-18 have yet to be renovated.  

Our 23rd floor room is completely remodeled, with brand new wallpaper floor to ceiling, three windows with matching colored draw curtains and sun curtains.  

Queen bed suite, with bedroom, kitchenette-dining room, and living room, along with bathroom with new marble floor, and new marble tiled shower walls.

Approximately 400 square feet, with main room 30' x 9'.  40" flat screen TV on very used dresser facing living room with sofa and padded sitting chair with padded arms.  Closet next to front door has an electronic safe, which will fit a 15.7" laptop.  

Kitchenette has CV1 coffee maker, 30" refrigerator, microwave, dish washer, utensils, bowls, plates, glasses for 4.   No free breakfast provided.  Refrigerator unusually quiet for it's size -refrigerators are like dogs -the smaller the more noise they make!   Noisy dishwasher -run it only during daytime when you are out. 

No stove, no toaster, no oven, no pots and pans.  With ready to eat hot food at nearby Morton Williams on 57th street, and Bread and Honey on 8th Ave, no need to cook!

Bed is very comfortable, four large pillows, two night stands with lamps, with nearly new mattresses that hasn't been pulverized by kids using it as a trampoline.  

Tight squeeze between the bed and the closet sticking out of the wall with 3 windows.  Easy to stub a toe, which is why the wife gave me the far side of the bed!

Windows overlook a pebble filled brick balcony, which would have to have been demolished and rebuilt to meet current building code.  View of the 50+ story skyscraper office building across 56th street, with some occupied units at night.   

Very little street noise at night, as 56th street is a single lane street with parked cars on both sides, a midget compared to the 4 lane 57th street.  Most of the street noise from nearby 7th Ave, around the corner.

Bathroom totally remodeled, with new white marble floor tile, and white marble wall tile on the sides of the shower.  Pedestal sink, with little or no counter space.  Noisy plumbing -running the shower wakes up the neighbors directly upstairs and downstairs.  Phone next to toilet, so you can multitask even at the most inconvenient times!

Daily housekeeping to empty trash, vacuum the rugs, change the towels, and make the bed.

26th floor has business center with 6 desktop PCs and printer, free to guests, with access using electronic room key.  

Strong continuous wifi, free to guests in rooms.  Don't need to bring a laptop here, as business center open 6am-11pm.

26th floor has exercise room, with multiple elipticals, stationary bike, treadmills, and TV, again with access using electronic room key.

Tea, coffee and cookies served noon to 4pm in 26th floor lounge with bar and sports TV. 

Concierge on ground floor can make tour arrangements, discount tickets to Broadway plays.  

3 minute walk to Carnegie Hall, 5 minute walk to Morton Williams market on 57th St., 7 minute walk to Central Park, 15 minute walk to Times Square, 35 minute walk to the southern most section of the Theater district, 10 minute walk to Lincoln Center, 40 minute walk to Intrepid Museum.  

Stayed in the owners lounge on the top floor, with plush seating for at least 70 guests -great place to stay waiting  after we checked out at 10:45am until we left for the airport 3 hours later.  
. 
$48.50 including tip, Uber drive to/from Newark Liberty Airport 18 miles away, slightly less to JFK airport, 17 miles away.  $75 cab fare to/from JFK airport -$60 fixed fare, plus $8 bridge toll, plus tip.  

No washer, no dryer, no sauna, no hot tub and no swimming pool!  That will keep out the young riffraff during the hot summer months!

title: Location
text:
Very well located just a few minutes walking from Times Square, central park and the Rockefeller center.
Rooms are standard and the staff is OK.
There is a very convenient valet parking.
Restaurants are nearby but our room had a small fridge and microwave.
Overall very nice.

title: Customer Service Slipping Badly
text: Arrived at the Manhattan Club at 10:00 am on April18th.Was told a room would not be available until 4:00pm.After checking back with the hotel several times during the next six hours was still told a room wouldn't be available till 4:00pm.Magically at 4:00pm a room was available . When I  checked out on April 21st I asked for a later check out time and was very reluctantly only given an extra half hour. When you take a red eye flight from Arizona and arrive in New York at 10:00am you would expect a hotel to give you a room as soon as one is ready. Not make you wait around for six hours till 4:00pm.

title: Um tipo de flat. Com cozinha, cama bem confortavel
text: É um timeshare, ou seja, tem um dono e quando ele não está, o apartamento é locado, bem limpo, confortável, fácil acesso( o metro fica a meia quadra) atendimento cordial. Ficamos no segundo andar, e como o Nova Iorque é super barulhenta( sirenes, caminhões etc) as janelas duplas não foram suficientes para abafar o ruído.

title: Great time in New York City!
text: Stayed for a whole week at the Manhattan Club and enjoyed every moment. Hotel was in a great location near Central Park and Times Square. Our room was on the 20th floor and very clean. Furnishings could be updated a bit, but the bathroom seemed newer and bed was super comfortable. Bell hop/doorman Faisal was helpful and great to chat with & lounge bartender Michael was superb! I'd return just to see them both again! Overall we enjoyed our time at the Manhattan Club. Perfect accommodations!

title: The beds were so heavenly you didn't want to get up.
text: The staff was very helpful. I was in the business lounge and  having trouble printing my boarding pass. I called the front desk and someone was there in a flash. A Bell hop was always ready to get me a taxi, whether it was 5:30am or 9 pm.(even in the rain and wind) We had a spacious 1 bdrm, 2 baths and a partial kitchen room. The Manhattan Club is located in midtown, walking distance to just about every thing (3 blocks to Central Park, 6 blocks to Time Square,etc)

title: outstanding
text:
Stayed here two weeks ago in the timeshare suite-a little bit dated but superb location and awesome staff.
Room had great facilities and everything we needed,2 blocks to Central Park/5th Ave and Theatre District.

title: Ótima localização
text: Um hotel 4 estrelas de ótima localização! Vc tem estação de metrô muito perto e com isso vc vai a qq lugar em Nova York. Nas imediações você  encontra várias Delis para um café da manhã bem gostoso! Só não tome o café da manhã do hotel pois é caro e não tem muitas opções. Valor da diária: em média U$ 320,00 sem café da manhã!

title: Good value, great location
text: Very clean room and very nicely renovated/appointed bathroom. Furnishings were a bit dated but clean. TV not hd but wide selection of cable channels. Staff very friendly and helpful. Was able to get a very reasonable rate and had a very nice stay. Location is excellent. Would stay again.

title: Belle chambre rénovée !
text:
La chambre est moderne et charmante, le lit est très confortable, même le canapé lit pour les enfants, la salle de bains est pratique, dommage qu'il n'y est pas de WC séparés.
Attention c'est un quartier très bruyant, demandez d'être placé le plus haut possible, nous étions au 21ème étages sur 26, mais en simple vitrage cela reste très bruyant.
Evitez le petit déjeuner à l'hôtel, très chère (envi 30 euros) et pas très copieux.
L'emplacement est idéale 5 min de central park et 10 min de time square à pieds.
Le côté cuisine est très bien, tablette pour le lave vaisselle, frigo, micro ondes, café avec machine , pop corn et toute la vaisselle pour 4 qui va avec !
Manque quand même un peu de rangement pour 4 à la semaine.

title: Excelente localização
text:
Ficar hospedado a duas quadras do Central Park, na esquina com a Broadway e com direito a uma pequena cozinha, é um privilégio dentro dessa cidade. Pudemos tomar café com conforto e a lava-louças garantiu uma semana de cozinha arrumada. 
O quarto com sala dá bastante privacidade, caso queira receber alguma visita. 
Se quiser receber alguma encomenda, avise ao hotel e peça para guardá-la até a sua chegada. Caso não o faça, correrá o risco de ter sua encomenda devolvida aos correios em 3 dias.

title: Muy bueno
text: Muy buen hotel, la ubicación es muy buena ya que se encuentra en uno de los mejores lugares de Manhattan y a 50 metros del subterráneo , muy buen servicio muy lindas habitaciónes , TalveZ le falta un poco más de servicio en conserjería pero muy bueno en general

title: Hotel close to a number of sites
text: I enjoyed The Manhattan Club and would stay there again if I return to New York City. The staff was helpful and I especially want to mention the maid service on the seventeenth floor.. They were excellent. The room was clean and little kitchenette was just what we needed for any leftovers we brought to the room. The location is very good too. We saw four Broadway Plays and could of walked to the Theaters if we wanted. We took a cab and it cost about six dollars. I would recommend the hotel to families and to older couples. Many places to eat within walking distance. It is a nice place and I am happy we stayed there.

title: A  gem!
text: This place is a gem of gems! We booked it on a whim probably three weeks before we traveled. What a lovely spot, couldn't be in a better location for exploring Manhattan. Just block or two away from everything. Everyone was so helpful apron arrival, even the bell boy gave us a great recommendation for lunch just around the corner.  Room was fantastic, actually hope to stay longer next time around. Please keep doing what your doing because your not missing a beat.

title: Very Central to alot of places of interest.
text: The Hotell staff were curtious and helpful. The room was cleaned every day and the rooms had what we neede. View was ok to. I would recomend this hotell to Familys travelling With kids and to couples travelling alone.

title: Nel complesso un buon hotel, receptionist da migliorare
text:
L'hotel è in ottima posizione, vicino a central park, 5 ave, time square e comodo per i mezzi pubblici. Camere spaziose, abbastanza pulite ed abbastanza silenziose.
Il personale dell'accoglienza e la concierge sono stati ottimi, un appunto sulla reception molto rigida nel proprio ruolo, fin troppo, con scarsa propensione a dare quel poco di valore aggiunto che un tal ruolo richiederebbe: essendoci molte persone in concierge (posta di fronte alla reception)  ed avendo io necessità di effettuare la stampa di un documento, mi sono rivolto in reception le quali mi hanno detto di attendere che si liberasse il loro collega (in quel momento erano in tre e non erano impegnate in nessuna attività ), il quale, con moltissima cortesia, mi ha spiegato che con la chiave potevo accedere alla business room ove avrei trovato molte postazioni ed una stampante a mia disposizione. Non mi pare un informazione che non potessero darmi le receptioniste il cui scarso entusiasmo si riflette inevitabilmente sul mio giudizio complessivo essendo, loro,  vetrina dell'albergo.

title: Excelente ubicación
text:
Conseguimos este hotel a una muy buena tarifa en hotwire.com. La zona donde está ubicado es inmejorable. calle 56 y avenida 7. Nos permitía ir caminando o en subte para todos lados. Como es una zona donde hay muchas oficinas, está lleno de locales gastronómicos variados y con menú ejecutivo y precios razonables. Desde la esquina se ve perfectamente la zona del Time Square. El hotel a su vez es confortable. Camas, almohadas y ropa blanca de primera. Buena calefacción. La habitación standard tiene heladera bajo mesada, microondas y vajilla, una cafetera y café y te gratis. A su vez en el piso 26 hay un espacio con mesas donde uno puede sentarse a comer (si compraron comida para llevar) y donde hay un termo para servirse café. Por otro lado, y esto va para los argentinos que nos gusta comprar online para no perder tiempo en las tiendas, el hotel recibe los paquetes sin cargo y los tiene en custodia por 2 o 3 días.Si no es retirado en ese plazo lo devuelven al remitente. 
Lo único que tengo para criticar es que ningún día nos pusieron toallas acorde a la cantidad de personas que estábamos alojadas. Eramos un matrimonio con 2 chicos y siempre nos dejaban toallas para 2 o 3 personas. Cuando llegas a las 12 de la noche después de estar todo el día caminando y ves que no tenés toallas suficientes para darte una ducha, eso fastidia bastante. Si embargo, con llamar al front desk para pedirlas, al rato aparecía alguien con las toallas faltantes. Pero eso de tener que reclamar todos los días me fastidió bastante. El resto todo bien. Los empleados son muy amables.

title: NYC trip
text: The Manhattan Club was very nice! Beautiful view, close to everything. Very clean. The staff was amazing!  Every restaurant the concierge recommended was amazing. The only thing I didn't like was the breakfast at the hotel. I would recommend going to one of the nearby cafes.

title: Good Location, Good Price,
text: Not great and very good is the best summary of all this hotel has to offer.  I suspect all of the accommodations have not been renovated as our "suite" most assuredly was not.  Very worn paint, carpet, worn out small sofa.  However, compared to some other hotel rooms in NYC (e.g. Hudson!) I have experienced this "suite" was spacious.  Most of our complaints centered around small items so easy to fix I can only wonder at why they remain trouble spots: no chair in the room for sitting at the desk, no soap dish in the bathroom at the sink, and no where to store shampoo and soap, etc. inside the shower.  The top floor lounge is serviced by the most charming and amenable female attendant.  We like to walk in NYC and, for us, this hotel is within easy walking distance to the theaters, central park and several of our favorite restaurants.  Also, many food choices within several blocks.  Their top floor business center is efficient with working printers for your airline boarding passes.  Also, we had a special needs request of the management that was easily and graciously fulfilled.  For midtown Manhattan this hotel is a very good choice.

title: Worth the money
text: Warm welcome from the receptionist which was very friendly. Nice hotel, clean rooms, very well situated in NY. A bit disappointed by the breakfast as you have a limited choice of products even if you pay.

title: Más de lo q esperaba
text:
El hotel está sobre la 56st, a 25 metros de la esquina de la 7av. La ubicación es muy buena, sobre la 7 a media cuadra está la línea amarilla que te lleva al Downtown. Y en la 59 y Broadway , está la roja , azul para ir de punta a punta de Manhattan . 
El hotel esta impecable, nos toco la suite metropolitan , me brindaron una cuna para mi bebe, y la suite tiene una pequeña cocina , que si viajas con bebés es lo mejor. 
Por donde miraras el hotel está impecable , brinda desayuno x 20 dls por personas. Me pareció caro y opte x desayunar en la habitación usando La Cocina, si no hay miles de opciones en una cuadra a la redonda.

title: Out 17th visit
text: This is my first review of TMC in the 17 years I have stayed here, first night was on 9/8/2000, according to my personal journal. The experience has been consistent over the years. The location is convenient, the rooms very spacious. We always take a room with two full baths, a definite selling point over the usual room at nearby hotels at maybe twice the price. With a suite format, the living lounge and associated kitchenette let you spread out. Over the years the suites have been upgraded with good wifi, flat screen TVs, new bath vanities. The king bed is COMFORTABLE.  You can hear some street noise, depending on the room, but we have never been disturbed with sounds from the hallway or elevator. The 26th floor lounge and the business center are upgraded and attractive. If you have endless money, you can always buy more elegance and similar space. But for us normal people, TMC is a great place to stay in New York.

title: Our Review of The Manhattan Club
text:
REVIEW OF THE MANHATTAN CLUB, 3/24/17

We are ending our five night stay at The Manhattan Club in NYC tonight.  Sometimes it is the little things that can add up to a bad taste, and you find yourself just looking at everything.  

This hotel is not elegance, it's just old.  It starts with the old, ineffective HVAC system that reminds one of a Motel 8.  Then it goes to the old plumbing fixtures, then to the miniature golf-thin, worn room “carpet.” It doesn’t stop there.  There is an old and worn, fold out couch that we luckily did not have to fold out.  The sheets on the marginally “queen size bed” are literally so rough that they caused the psoriasis on my wife’s legs to bleed.  The thread count is too low to count.  There is no exhaust fan in the bathroom.

One day we had to go without wash cloths.  Said they ran out.  Ran out for 24 hours!  Something else we had to go without - There was one cable channel that was blacked out for 4 of the 5 nights.  It is back on our last night.  Curious that it was only one channel, Fox News Channel.  We called the front desk each day; even tried to talk to a manager, but he/she refused the call.  We were told that they don’t have any control over it.  Their provider is RCN, and their calls to them have not produced results

Now, I am just one residential customer with Spectrum at home, and any tech problem is handled in 24 hours on just my call; yet a huge hotel has no pull?  Not buying it.  We even walked to FNC to inform them yesterday that their channel was being blacked out at an entire hotel.  Interestingly enough, it was back on tonight.

Last, we come to the joke of a “breakfast” offered for sale at the hotel.  A continental breakfast for $20 and you can eat it there, or select 4 items for $13, that I painfully learned, that you “must” leave the area to consume.  Take it back to your small, European size room that has no table or chair to sit and eat!  Folks, we are talking about the small, packaged style cereal, some pastries,  juice and coffee.  Yeah, I know, this is NYC, but I also know that our friends stayed at a hotel up the street that provided a free breakfast that included all that plus eggs and all the meats.  The way in which I was told that if I chose the pick 4, I must leave, was just unacceptable.  I had my Kindle and I just wanted to read and take my 4 little morsels to a table.

So, yes, it is the little things that can add up quickly to a decision to never go back to a place.  I feel we wasted our points on this place and would recommend that Bluegreen rethink what originally seemed like a good opportunity for its owners.  If BG continues to offer, it should come with some disclosures, so that folks are not blindsided and disappointed.  Lower the expectations; it is not all that it is advertised to be.

title: Perfect Location for First Trip to NYC
text: The Manhattan Club is an older establishment, but it is very clean and well run.  We enjoyed a room on the 14th floor on the court side and it was very comfortable and quiet.  We especially appreciated the roominess of the suite with a sitting area for when relatives stopped by after dinner.  The mini kitchen was also a welcome addition for storing restaurant leftovers in the mini-fridge and for making morning coffee.  It was an easy walk to Central Park, to the theater to see Wicked, and to Time Square.  The location could not have been more convenient.

title: Deserving 5 Stars.
text:
Wishing we had discovered this class/classy Midtown hotel years ago. Elegant gray-blue theme throughout the public areas carried into our suite. Check-in cordial; welcoming; efficient. Among the least expensive hotels of any rating in the Midtown/Theater District thanks to Hotels.com promotional discount. The unexpected upgrade (nice!) to a suite and a complimentary bottle of quality Italian wine (nice!!) makes The Manhattan Club a must-to-return for this reviewer. The 26th-floor private club lounge affords generous space for casual socializing/imbibing plus a great view south of a skyscraper-framed full moon (once per lunar cycle, of course). 

Added perks: 1)  ICON parking garage - discount vouchers available (we got 24 hours for less than half of retail via LocalFlavor) - is directly across the street. 2) Hotel site says "27-minute walk" to Central Park; no, it's 7 minutes to Columbus Circle and the Park. 3) Multiple guides/booklets in the room let guests plan/update their city activities before (if necessary) approaching the concierge for (if needed) additional services. 4) Affiliated with RCI (to which we belong) ... and an excellent choice for a NYC time-share exchange.

title: Sentirsi a casa a New York
text:
È la seconda volta che vado in questo hotel. Sono socia RCI ed ho effettuato uno scambio.Il personale è gentile w dispinibile. L'hotel è in una posizione splendida! All'angolo della 56^st e della 7^av. A due passi (tre blocchi, non piu di 5 minuti) da Central Park e qualche passo in più  (9 blocchi, 10/12 minuti) da Time Square. Con la metro la cui stazione è sotto l'hotel con le uscite  agli angoli della 55 e 57 st. (1 minuto). Vicino al Columbus circle, e ai musei alcuni raggiungibili a piedi in 5/10 minuti. Stanze pulitissime. Angolo cottura con lavastoviglie ma ahimè senza piastre, solo con microonde. Macchinetta per caffè, fornitura di cialde caffè americano e The. E... popcorn!!
Ogni giorno pulizie anche del cucinino, cambio asciugamani. Presenti anche 2 accappatoi. Bellissima palestra anche se non ne abbiamo usufruito. Camere ben riscaldate: siamo stati nella bufera di neve, con voli cancellati e scuole chiuse.. temperatura fra i -6 ed i -16 e le camere erano ben riscaldate. 4 anni fa l'appartamento era piu piccolo con una sola fineatra che dava all interno e quindi senza vista ma era silenziosissimo. Queat'anno lappartamento era piu grande con 2 stanze ed un ingresso con angolo cottura e ben due bagni uno con vasca ed uno con doccia grande. È un bell'albergo piu che dignitoso direi non sfarzoso ma lussuoso sì. È comunque un 4 stelle. La hall è piccola rispetto a quanto si potrebbe immaginare per un 4 stelle. Lo consiglio a tutti!!! Nella foto l'esterno dell albergo e i primi fiocchi di neve per la tempesta il ghiaccio dalla finestra (scusate la foto girata) e lingrandimento della foto dove si vede l'ingresso della metro.

title: Midtown Must
text: The Manhattan Club is located in mid-town between 7th and 8th Avenues, close to Carnegie Hall and convenient to the subway. Our rooms was spacious and included a kitchenette with dishwasher and microwave, a nice off-set to the cost of eating out three times a day in pricey Manhattan. There is a small gym and a business center for the use of guests, and concierge services are available. A friendly and professional desk representative aided our arrival, and the lobby was a grand welcome to the City. We were here for a week of theatre, and the hotel was a pleasing choice.

title: Excelente Hotel
text: A localização é muito boa, perto da broadway, central park e estação de metrô. Os quartos são amplos, limpos e camas confortáveis. O atendimento foi bom e sempre foram simpáticos e prontos para ajudar. Recomendo esse hotel.

title: Posizione strategica camera silenziosa
text: Sono appena tornato da 9gg a New York con la famiglia, abbiamo alloggiato al 22° piano di questo hotel in una suite con finestre che davano in un interno, quindi niente vista particolare ma dato che a noi interessava il silenzio e la calma dopo una giornata a giro, andava bene. Camera pulita, ottimo servizio. Non fate colazione in hotel, decisamente cara e sotto la media, conviene uscire due volte a destra e dopo 40 metri Tisserie dove con $35 in tre facevamo colazioni esagerate da arrivare oltre orario di pranzo.. Hotel a 10 minuti da Central Park e 10 da Time Square. Di fronte ottimo ristorante di pesce e tanti altri di vario tipo. Lo consiglierei a chi non è esoso ne snob... valido!

title: Localização muito boa
text: Quartos amplos e limpos. Contudo, como fiquei num quarto triplo, a terceira pessoa fica num sofá bicama e isso não foi muito bom. Como todo hotel e NY, o preço é salgado, mas a localização dele, perto da Broadway (dá pra ir andando) e ao lado de uma estação de metrô facilitam bastante andar pela cidade. O atendimento é apenas profissional, não é tão sorridente como se está acostumado no Brasil.

title: Great base for family Broadway trip
text:
We love this place. Drive in from Connecticut. They valet park your car at a reasonable rate ($35 a day is very good for this area).
They help with your luggage, work hard to get you in early if you arrive before check in time.
We had the one bedroom suite for us and our adult daughter.
The outer room was big enough for 10 of our family members to gather for a casual takeout sushi dinner.
Could the place use an uplift? Sure. Carpets could be better. A door handle came off in our hand. But it is good value, nice location, nice workout room, lively top floor reading room and helpful staff.
We are not time share people but I think most if those staying there are. It gives it a little more of an apartment flavor rather than hotel but that works for us.

title: Great hotel in a prime location!
text: The hotel was in a fantastic location...close to everything!  It was clean...the staff were very friendly and helpful.  Mara...the concierge at the hotel was super and very helpful in directing us with decisions about shows and excursions.  Can't wait to return!!

title: Perfect smaller scene
text: Great for an overnight or two. Situated just below Central Park, TMC is convenient to many restaurants, bars and nightlife. We were upgraded to one of the penthouse floors and enjoyed the sky lounge, which is exclusive for guests. As in anyplace in NYC,  there are no real bargains except that it is clean, comfortable and classy.

title: 去度假
text: 房間很舒服！有一張雙人床還有一張雙人的沙發床！很亁浄也很滿意！服務很好！只是價格不便宜。離Time Square,Central Park很近.唯一缺點，旅館沒餐廳，所以一定要出去吃。

title: Brilliant location, friendly service, awesome room!
text:
We booked a 'standard' suite here at the last minute after reading bad reviews about another hotel we had booked which we cancelled, it was the best decision we could have made and really added to our holiday experience.

Our two girls aged 7 and 2 loved the suite, they put us on the lowest floor (2, one up from reception) which was a great start as we had requested this in our booking requirements as my wife is not good with heights.

The suite (I don't want to call it a room as there were three) had a bedroom with a 50 inch television on the wall, a wireless telephone and a dab radio sound system with docking station, a bathroom with a tv mirror and a shower big enough for four people (no bath) and a lounge/kitchen with microwave, another 50 inch tv, fridge freezer, sofa, arm chair and crockery. Free wifi throughout, good strength.

Popcorn was replenished every day which we loved, the cleaners were brilliant and even knocked to check if they had done a good enough job later in the day! There were bath robes to wear and the toiletries were great along with the hair dryer.

Concierge, reception, bar and door staff were all friendly and great with advice and were fantastic with our children. All locations were easily accessible; Central Park a 5 minute walk north, Times Square the same south, subway to downtown and Brookly bridge etc only 9 stops on the blue E line subway from 7th Avenue and 53rd Street corner only 3 blocks down.

We could have spent a lot more time lounging in our suite as it was superb and really was an important part of our holiday experience, highly recommended.

title: Super centrico
text:
Un hotel cerca del parque central y times square, el hotel es bonito , las personas son muy amables y las habitaciones son grandes para estar en NYC ; la pasamos muy bien, puedes ir caminando a muchos lados o el metro esta a un par de minutos
Recomendable !!

title: Fabulous Weekend at The Manhattan Club.
text:
My husband and I stayed at the Manhattan Club from Friday 2/17/17 to 2/19/17.  

The location of the Manhattan Club is perfect...close to everything...dining, theaters....shopping...everything!

The Manhattan Club is meticulous, the rooms beautiful and the staff outstanding!

I had emailed Stephany Keiser and she was so helpful in getting back to me on 
any questions I had.   I asked Stephany if there were any upgrades available at 
the time of our check-in and she kindly made notations on our reservation.

On arrival at the Manhattan Club, Paul was our bellhop and he was so friendly and
offered his assistance throughout the weekend.  Lizette checked us in and was 
very welcoming.  Matt the manager (whom I did not have the privilege of meeting) 
was able to upgrade our reservation.

I highly recommend the Manhattan Club...it is a first class place to stay.

Thank you again to Matt, Stephany Keiser, Paul and Lizette....you all helped to make 
our weekend so perfect.

We were in Suite 1512...Perfect!  It was spacious, clean and large.   It truly made our 
weekend so special.  

We hope to be back in August.

Ellen Corbett

title: Nice hotel, friendly service and big rooms!
text: Location is good, near the park and subway. I like the friendly staff over here and the room size, better than my previous booking near Madison. At the entrance the staff welcomes and assists us. The rooms are clean, large and practical. Huge showers, we unfortunately did not had a bathtub. Even while the fitness is not huge, the equipment is made from good quality and well maintained.

title: Location, WLAN, business lounge and gym perfect - otherwise little outdated
text:
Stayed here a week with my teenager son while visiting NY in January. 

All in all very good experience. Location is perfect for going around Manhattan either by foot or Subway. Rooms were big enough and had nice kitchen-corner. There was surprisingly good free Wifi and business lounge & gym on the 26th floor were a definite plus.

Rooms and corridors have seen their best few years ago and need refreshing (carpets, some furniture, TV, ...)

Cleaning is done daily but the quality varies too much (sometimes breadcrumbs on the floor, bathroom tub not clean, bathroom curtain in rust or blood etc...). 

As the place is not hotel (as they mention in their very outdated folders in the room) it would be a good idea to have laundry-room present.

What bothers me most is that some of the staff at downstairs was great and some was just working there without any service in mind.

title: We'll stay here again!
text:
Every staff member was friendly and helpful. The location was perfect for access to the park, theaters, Times Square, with excellent restaurant options nearby. Lovely lounge on 26th floor for cocktails. Most comfortable pull-out couch ever!

Decor was a bit dated but our suite was immaculate.

title: Weekend Stay
text:
I did an RCI exchange. The location was great, you can literally walk to Broadway on a nice day or on a cold day as when I was here you can hop on the subway around the corner and 1 stop you're there. Definitely eat at Carmines on 44th the food was excellent. 
The 1 bdrm was nice, kitchenette, small dinette/sitting area had a pull out couch, 2 bathrooms. The rooms were clean, I was on the 25th flr with a nice view.
Plenty of restaurants and coffee shops within immediate area. 
I definitely will return you couldn't ask for a better location within Midtown

title: A Great Base for New York City Exporers
text:
Summary
I’ve concluded that the Manhattan Club is perennially top-rated and difficult to trade into because of its location, just north of Times Square and the only independent timeshare resort in New York City. (This doesn’t count Hilton/Marriott/Disney owners using points for hotels.) Were it not in New York City, this would be an average, but expensive, place with little to recommend it. However, its position adjacent to some of the top attractions in the world gives it a panache that justifies its ratings.

    Unit Features
We exchanged a timeshare into a studio unit on the 24th floor, 2 floors below the Owner’s Lounge/Fitness Center/Business Center floor. The unit was about the size of a “suites hotel” standard room. A side nook held a queen bed with two nightstands, and was open to the living area. The living area had a queen pull-out sofa, one upholstered arm chair, coffee and side tables, and a small café table with 2 side chairs. A lowboy dresser completed the furnishings. Two windows in the nook and the living area looked out on the opposite side of the building and the street below.

    Kitchen Features
The “kitchen” was a 4-foot span of cabinetry with a bar sink, a microwave, under-counter refrigerator, and narrow, apartment-size dishwasher. Dishes, glassware and flatware were provided for four people, but it’s clear that no one expects guests to eat very many meals in the unit. The lack of a real stove, or even a hot plate or toaster, is testament to that. A coffeemaker is provided with complimentary coffee.

    Resort Amenities
The Manhattan Club has relatively little in the way of on-site amenities, other than a nicely-equipped but small fitness center, a business center with numerous desktop computers (both PC and Apple models, and all relatively new), and a spacious Owner’s Lounge with a fully stocked and staffed bar. The Lounge serves a “continental breakfast” each morning for $19.95 per person, or $13.95 for “grab-n-go”. Don’t bother – their are plenty of restaurants and coffee shops in the immediate area that offer better value.

    Size of Unit
Our studio unit probably had about 220-250 square feet or so, larger than some other studios we’ve been in.

    Condition of Unit, Resort Buildings, and Property
Our unit was very clean when we arrived, and daily, hotel-style maid service was a welcome difference from most places. The resort was carved out of the Park Central Hotel building, with the time-share conversion in the upper floors of one wing of the U-shaped structure dating to the early 1990s. The dove-gray color palette that looked sophisticated in the ‘90s looks a little tired and bland today. There were no “pops” of color in the décor, just a bland, overall gray tone set. Fortunately, you don’t have to (and shouldn’t want to) spend much time in the unit. The property is in good condition, and appears to receive conscientious maintenance daily. 

Don’t bring your car. Driving in New York City traffic is an acquired skill, and one better practiced with someone else’s car. Also, the $35 daily valet parking fee adds up fast.

    Staff Friendliness and Responsiveness
We arrived a day late due to other commitments, but the front desk was staffed and ready for us. We found office, housekeeping and maintenance staff cheerful, friendly and helpful as needed.

    Convenience to Area Attractions
The Manhattan Club is located on 56th St. between 7th Ave. and Broadway, in an area generally known as Midtown North. It is very handy to the Theater District and Central Park. Check TripAdvisor.com for many, many, many restaurants throughout New York City
.
The Theater District is a short walk south on Broadway. We recommend using “TKTS”, the discount ticket booth at the junction of Broadway and 7th Avenue. Anything on the Broadway stages (basically, 42nd to 50th streets between Broadway and 8th Avenue) will entertain. We saw “Kinky Boots” (lots of fun) and “Hamilton: An American Musical” (indescribably good, a cultural phenomenon).

New York City is full of attractions. We recommend the 9/11 Memorial Museum downtown, the Metropolitan and Guggenheim art museums, the Paley Center for Media, Mario Batali’s “Eataly” food hall on lower 5th Avenue, and South Street Seaport near the east end of Wall Street. Any good guide book will give you thousands of other ideas.

    Any problems encountered such as check-in problems, room changes, etc.
None.

    Your opinion on numerical rating for the resort and why.
I rate the resort as "very good". It gets top marks for location and nearby attractions. I down-check it for the bland decorating and the lack of on-site amenities common to other resorts, such as pools, hot tubs, and so on.

    Planned Resort Activities such as welcome parties, barbecues, kid programs, and outings
There didn’t seem to be any regular recurring activities. We arrived on Super Bowl Sunday, and there was a food selection and party in the Owner’s Lounge being promoted.

    Suitability of Resort for Couples and Groups
Our studio would be cramped for any more than a couple. There are 1BR and 2BR units in the Club, but they are smaller than average.

title: Another Nice Stay
text: The first time I stayed at this hotel, I was in town with my best friend to celebrate her 50th birthday.  This time around, I invited my husband and 10 girlfriends to help celebrate my 50th birthday.  We were given a decent rate so all of us stayed at this hotel, primarily for it's convenient location to Broadway, Central Park and other areas of interest.   Most of the girls who were staying for a long weekend were given a nice suite with separate lounge/dining area and two full bathrooms.  Most got updated suites as well.  My husband and I were staying for almost a week so I was a bit miffed (being the birthday girl and all) to be given the smallest "studio" type room.  It shouldn't have bothered me except we tended to congregate in my room versus the others; only when we decided to meet up in another room did I realize my room was the smallest (even the girls that roomed solo got a bigger room).  We then decided to congregate in the large lounge on the 26th floor, which had a nice bar and served complimentary tea and coffee around 4pm.
