I just figured reception would have thought it best to put two people in a larger room versus one.  Fortunately, our room was updated and the bed very comfortable - best nights of sleep in a while - no city noises to wake me up.  The only other complaints were that the water pressure in our shower/tub was not very strong and we couldn't control the temperature in the room (sometimes it got too hot).  The little kitchenette with a coffee maker was nice but $8 for a bottle of water seemed a bit steep.  We went to a Duane Reade drugstore nearby and bought water and just stuck it in the fridge - no problem.  The hotel also has a nice gym on the 26th floor (4 treadmills, ellipticals and free weights) and is well maintained.  There is also a nice business center with plenty of desktops and a printer.   Most of the hotel staff were very friendly and always willing to help.  Overall, I really like this hotel, primarily for it's location, and will likely stay again . . .  but will ask for the bigger suite the next time.

title: Very Nice, Convenient Location
text: We used some of our timeshare points to book a room here for a Valentine's day interval.  The club is close to many interesting attractions in Midtown NYC.  Upon arrival, the staff was efficient and friendly.  The suite we were assigned was nicely decorated.  The bed was comfortable, the bathroom, although only a shower was provided was very well maintained.  We had three days to relax and explore.

title: Hotel muito bom e bem localizado
text: Viagem em Setembro/2016, com membros da família. Ficamos 7 dias no hotel e gostamos muito. Aposentos grandes, sempre limpos , com  camas excelentes, hotel bem conservado, apesar de antigo. Camareiras gentis e prestativas. Experimentamos café da manhã, sendo razoável pelo preço cobrado. Próximo Central Park e Quinta Avenida, com facilidade de lovomoção. Voltaria a me hospedar com certeza.

title: Comfort in the Big Apple
text:
Went to USA with my partner to experience all things American. Our first stop was New York which is an amazing place, it really is the city that doesn't sleep! We stayed at the Manhattan Club which was a very comfortable place and a most welcome sight after 30 hours travelling! It was a great location, within walking distance for a lot of attractions, including Central Park, Times Square and Broadway.
The bed was super comfortable, and the shower was so good. Our room was a studio with a bed and television, bathroom, lounge with another television and kitchenette. There was also two extensive closets for our luggage. The kitchenette had a coffee maker, microwave, tea, coffee and microwave popcorn which was delicious.
They had just celebrated Halloween and the foyer was decorated with pumpkins which double as Thanksgiving decorations.
The staff were mostly friendly but not consistently so, some were excellent others a bit lukewarm.
The property was in the boutique hotel style, the building was beautiful, and there was a gym with a lot of equipment.
It is an RCI timeshare property and there is room for time share owners to relax and enjoy biscuits and coffee. 
I really liked the television in the elevator that gave weather forecasts and news of the day. We had arrived just after the election so it was very interesting times. We also saw a few television shows being filmed in the area. 
It was wonderful to be able to come back and relax after our many sight seeing trips.

title: Well....
text:
This place is....what to say...  it has seen better days... the rooms got grate potential.. 
And to be honest it is about time to do something with it.  On our room it was wallpaper hanging loose from the walls and everything looked so shady. 
If I remember right it was quite expensive to stay there as well,  so I guess I was just expecting more. For us the location is good when it comes to our needs and wishes.  

Starbucks is just round the corner and there is a dining place just over the road. That it's really comfortable if you got kids.

title: The staff super friendly, but room had awful view
text:
I booked the Manhattan Club hotel through Hotwire, which I will NEVER do again! When I entered the room I open the curtains and discovered the view of a brick wall. I said this must be the Hotwire special lol or they rooms given when booking with a 3rd party.
The room was decent, could have been a bit cleaner. I noticed the carpet could had had more attention. 

On the up side, the staff was super friendly!!!! The concierge really took his time and explaining to my sister and I how to use the subway system! Lol Yes the staff was great! They held our bags well after check-out! I'd stay again but in a room with a MUCH BETTER VIEW!

title: One of the best hotels in NYC
text:
This place is very nice, we had a one bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms, living room , kitchenette,sleeps maximum of 4 people. We stayed at the 12th floor. Business services, gym  and restaurant is located on the 26th floor. The housekeeping services is done on a daily basis with very nice staff in charge of it. The staff of the hotel from the doorman to the reception are very welcoming and hospitable. The place is modern with quality furnishing. Bathrooms are very nice and clean. Overall...we had a very good experience in this hotel  I will surely come back since I used my timeshare exchange with RCI.

The location of the hotel is close to all the main places to go to...Time Square, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller, St, Patrick Cathedral.

Restaurants and grocery store are nearby...like DuaneRead, MarketPlace, and good restaurants..  Time square is just 10 short blocks from the hotel and along the way there are malls, restos, M&M world.  Most of them close late.

title: Nice Location
text:
Located in mid town Manhattan near Broadway, Central Park subway stations...ideal.
We had a suite with king bed, plenty of room.  Only thing was carpet was soiled & worn, so that is why I rated them a 4.   Staff was great, always helpful.  Would highly recommend!

title: Good Theater Location
text:
This hotel is in Midtown and is in a great spot if you want to see a lot of Broadway shows as it's about a 10-12 minute walk. It's also near a subway stop and on the edge of the Times Square/Broadway hustle so you can get out easily while still being close to your 7pm show.
The building itself is a tad dated. Mainly older clientele. Pro-tip: the elevator is SLOOOW. I am not exaggerating when I advise building in 15 minutes to your departure time due to elevator issues. 
If you're looking for budget friendly with a kitchenette in Midtown, give it a shot. (It's NYC so it's still expensive.) If you want chic, I'd look somewhere else.

title: The ideal location in between Lincoln Center and Times Square
text:
We are frequent visitors to New York City. For us the most important aspect of the lodging is the location and The Manhattan Club is ideally located for convenient walking to all of the things which we like to do: Broadway shows, Central Park, shows at Lincoln Center and restaurants---- close to Times Square but not in the middle of the chaos of madness of Times Sq. Because of its location at 56th street and 7th avenue, the Manhattan Club is perfect.  There is convenient access to many different subway lines at various stations within 2-3 blocks walking distance (either at Carnegie Hall or Columbus Circle at 8th Avenue or at 53rd street at 7th avenue).  Overall the stay was fine with no major complaints.  In addition to the location another aspect that I liked were the size of the rooms.  For New York  City these rooms are spacious and it is nice to have a living room and a separate area for the bedroom (although there is no door between the living area and the bedroom) with a “kitchen space” with a countertop, small refrigerator, built in microwave and dishwasher.. Also, for a building of this size with so many rooms (26 floors) I found the check-in and check-out process to be fast and convenient. Others have commented that the décor is somewhat dated and the furniture is worn—these observations are true. However, I considered these to be minor details considering everything was comfortable, spacious and the location is ideal. The reality is that one does not spend a great deal of time inside the hotel room in New York City anyway. 

Some suggestions: 1) Bottle water in the room is expensive ($8 dollars a bottle). Go to the CVS at 57th street and 8th avenue and stock up on bottled water and other items that you can store in your refrigerator in the room. The gym on the 26th floor is very nice and has a filtered water machine which you can use to refill your empty bottles of water at no cost. 2) Breakfast: There is a breakfast that is offered in the owner’s lounge on the 26th floor for approximately $12 for cold items (bread items and fruit) and $22 for hot breakfast. That is a not a bargain for what they provide for breakfast. There are some great coffee, breakfast and pastry shops within 2 blocks of the Manhattan club which might be better options.

title: Wonderful stay!!
text:
I stayed here for 5 nights and it was wonderful!  Perfect location!  Could walk or catch a subway closeby.  I stayed in a studio which was fairly large.  The queen bed was a little hard but fine.  

Loved having a small kitchen with sink, microwave, decent sized little fridge (with freezer) and a small dishwasher!  Housekeeping would run the dishwasher & then put the dishes away.  Lots of little delis, etc. around to grab food and bring back.  I never ate out in a restaurant.  I got some tasty spinach lasagne & grilled veggies at Cafe Oliviera (turn right out MClub & right on to 7th, then down a couple blocks on the right).  The grilled veggies were super delicious!  I also got a Blue Nut Salad there that had so many greens jammed in the container that I was able to have a salad with my meals for 3 days.  Thought it was a little pricey, but hey it is NYC.

My favorite place and where I got the rest of my meals (except for a few that were popcorn that was replaced in the unit each day) was Beyond Sushi, a vegan sushi restaurant down 2 blocks (turn right out of MClub-straight down 56th, cross 7th & 6th, on right).  As a vegetarian I'm always thrilled to go somewhere where I can order anything.  Meat eaters would like this too!  So so so so delicious!!  I tried a variety of their dumplings & rolls.  Their Watermelon Mint Lemonade was super refreshing.  They have two other locations in Manhattan.  They will also deliver to the MClub.

Unit was spotless and the daily housekeeping was great!  Never missed a day even if I left later in the afternoon.

I asked Front Desk about recycling and they told me to put recycles in a separate bag and housekeeping would take care of it.  Would be nice if they had a little sign up that told me that.

Bathroom was beautiful marble.  Good water pressure.  Sometimes got super fluffy towels (others were just fine).  Toiletries were very nice, made in US and all vegetable based/cruelty free.

Living room area had comfortable (to sit on, nobody slept on it...) couch and nice size tv that could be angled to watch anywhere in unit.

2 closets, plenty of hangers, loved the bathrobes!   

Even though I was on the 24th floor and sometimes had to wait a few minutes for one of the elevators, once you got on, it was pretty quick to lobby.

Owners lounge on 26th floor has complimentary snacks & coffee/tea from 11:30-4:00 pm.  Cookies were tasty!  Nice after waking around outside in cold to go there & get a nice hot cup of tea!  Lots of comfortable seating.  Didn't use, but the bar area looked very nice.  Didn't go to the breakfast buffet, not interested at the price of $19.95 + bunch of taxes/gratuities.

All staff very nice, friendly, and helpful.

Free wifi which was reliable.  No problems with speed either.

Easy quick walk to many of the theaters.  As a single woman, I really appreciated how safe I felt to walk in the area at night.  So many people around.  Had no qualms about walking back after the theater.

Easy walk to Times Square, go down either 7th or Broadway.  What it took me a bit to figure out is that Broadway goes diagonally and 7th & Broadway actually cross in the middle of Times Square.  

Subway station for 57th street could actually be accessed on 55th if you were going downtown.  Turn right out of MClub, turn right on 7th, down one block.  Take the R or the W down to Whitehall St/South Ferry-takes you to Battery Park where you can go/see Statue of Liberty, etc., also catch the Stanton Island Ferry (it's free!  and also a good place for clean bathrooms in that area), Financial District down there-took an interesting tour there!  Don't miss the American Merchant Marine Memorial, offshore a little bit near where you get on the ferry to the Statue of Liberty.  Very moving.

Overall, I loved staying at the Manhattan Club.  Could not think of one thing that could have improved my stay!  I traded in here with timeshare points which made my stay for right smack dab in midtown Manhattan very inexpensive!!  But it is extremely hard to find availability but if I ever find it in warmer times, I will sure be back!!!!

title: Happy Birthday
text: The accommodation was fantastic.  We had a one bedroom apartment with a pulldown in the living room.  There were 4 of us and we stayed for one week, and we were very comfortable.  The position of the club around the corner from times Square and central park is ideal.

title: Great location and large rooms
text: This is my favorite location in Manhatten. I was suprised with the room size - much bigger than other NYC hotels in this hotel category. The front desk is unfriendly. The hotel is far from being luxurious. But - having said all that you get an excellent value for your money and this hotel was far better than other NYC hotels I stayed before.

title: Great location
text: The Manhattan Club shows character and has wonderful service.  The location is perfect for getting to all the hot spots in NYC.  They take time to get to know you while you're there and suggest things over and above what you ask for.  I stayed in a two bedroom unit and it felt like home.  You can bring home left overs and fix fresh coffee int he morning while you're watching your favorite morning program.

title: Appart-hôtel plus qu'un hôtel
text: Très bonne situation, accueil de qualité, chambres équipées d'une kitchenette avantage non négligeable dans ce secteur de la ville où la restauration est très chère, mais gros problèmes d'isolation phonique entre chambres. De gros efforts à faire sur ce sujet.

title: Dotisha and my hubby first mini getaway at the TMC
text:
Praises to God Jt & I had a great mini getaway here in Manhattan from 1/5/17 - 1/8/17 at the Manhattan Club Resort, we had booked our stay here for a 1 bedroom unit at this Resort and they are located at 200 W 56th & 7th Ave.    Our Stay here was absolutely all worth it.  Great customer service and the accommodations for our one bedroom on the higher floors was great....     
We were able to venture over to the Observatory at the One World Trade Center on 1/6/17 to do a tour and have our dinner at the One Dine Restaurant - One World Observatory One World.
It was great timing to do this event because there were no big crowds of people and no long lines to be waiting on for the Observatory and I also had made our reservation for our dinner at the One World Trade Restaurant in advance ...everything turn out to be good and easy breezy...lastly we had venture off after our dinner to walk around the Westfield World Trade Center Mall....it's beautiful and it's huge with numerous stores of all sorts of merchandise ...we had a great time there and it was a great time and a good experience for us both.
I was glad I've planned our outing event on 1/6/17 because it was a good-thing that I did because on 1/7/17 it turn out to be a winter snow storm and the weather was messy very cold so we had chilled at the Resort....overall we both have had a great mini getaway together....All was well....Thanks to God🙏🏽

title: Great location, great food
text:
Went there for a meeting / banquet.  Aside from the fact the room got "swept" twice by NYPD due to us having a police commissioner present, the location was very convenient, the food and the service was great.  

Normally when you order a steak at a banquet it's a sub par cut of meat that's tough as shoe leather.  The steak I had was large, tender and nice done medium rare.  The bartenders were great and remembered my drink the second time I ordered one. 

Management was very accommodating also.

title: Good location but decor is dated
text: We stayed here for 3 nights. Check in was smooth, but staff weren't very friendly. Our room was on the 15th floor looking out onto 7th Avenue. It was an incredibly spacious room, with a separate living area. Kitchen had a fridge and dishwasher, so great if you are on a budget. Decor throughout the hotel was very dated, with lots of wallpaper peeling. The best thing about the hotel was the location, its a short walk to times square and central park, with many amazing restaurants along 56th street.

title: Location, Location, Location.
text: A bit old but located in the heart of Manhattan. Front desk clerks are very cold and not welcoming. Need customer service training. Would definitly visit again but need bigger unit for the familu, was a bit cramped in the smaller unit.

title: Stay here and experience all NY has to offer
text: I've stayed at TMC every year for at least 10 years. I own a 1 week split, so in alternate years I stay 3 or 4 days. I look forward to every visit, whether it's Thanksgiving, the 4th of July, February or Easter vacation. The staff has always been polite and helpful, especially the concierge; the front desk people can be a little strict about the 4:00 check in, and I have never had occasion to worry about the 11:00 check-out. The suites are spacious by NY standards, which make them small for anywhere else, but that's part of the NY experience! Could some of the floors use a make over? Sure. But everyone here has always been polite (although I understand the sales staff can be ... persistent.)

title: 3 nights after time square ckears
text:
Walked with my fit wife from Penn Station in the rain to hotel. 35 minutes and it zoomed by. Check in was a bummer, Bluegreen failed to fax my upgrade on 12/28. No room to start with now, upgrade on my phone NFG without a backup FAX. After 20 minutes they found the original 2nd floor metro reservation and could only do that. Inventory is controlled by Bluegreen and they are closed for the holidays. Front desk was very cordial/nice. We were comp'd breakfast. 8:00 next morning, Bluegreen contacted by me, after another 20 minutes the right person sent the FAX. Nice 1 bedroom 2 bath with our son who joined us. 

Rooms were clean, up to date, comfortable and cleaned daily. 

26th floor $19.99 + tx Breakfast for sit down is upscale continental. Fresh fruit, Greek yogurt, great sweet rolls and New York bagels. Staff is there to toast what we needed and cleaned the grapefruit better than we ever could. 

Great location for all Broadway, Central Park and eateries.

title: Good place to stay but needs a face lift
text: Our stay at The manhattan club was a nice experience. The location was great, close to Times Square, as well as Central Park. Since traveling with a family with kids, it was nice having a 1 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms and showers. A mini kitchen with basic microwave, mini refrigerator, and dishwasher with dishes were provided, as well as daily housekeeping, which we had to pay an extra $38.50 a night for, even though I was using a family members timeshare. The suites do need a face lift, wall paper peeling from walls, carpet was dirty and dingy looking, couch needs a better mattress, as well the roll away bed, which the mattress was flat and you could feel the springs inside, so was rather uncomfortable. All personnel were nice and cordial. Overall a good experience and nice place to stay. Hopefully, a renovation to the facility is planned soon.

title: Can't beat this gem of a property
text:
Love this place.  Sometimes able to get it thru RCI as an exchange.  Be prepared to pay an extra 40$ a day for amenities and heaven forbid you want parking too.  Leave your car at home. 
The rooms are amazing, try for the 1 bedroom.  Love the 2 bathrooms.  Little kitchen.  Everything you need is here.  Right in the heart of the city near to everything and everywhere you want to be.

title: Great Hidden Gem in Heart of Manhattan
text: This underrated hotel in the heart of Manhattan is really nice. I only recently discovered it. Rates  are decent, and it's been recently remodeled. Rooms are large especially for Manhattan! Most include kitchens and living areas. I was pleasantly surprised by this upscale hotel centrally located on 56th btw Broadway and 7th Avenue.

title: Great location
text:
I booked this hotel for a 2 week stay based on the reviews, and it was not cheap.  No sooner had I done that I started finding not so nice ones, so I called to ensure I had a room as advertised on the internet and it would have a view of some sorts.

Our room was great, it had obviously been refurbished, bed was very comfortable, it had a lounge area (still in the same room  not a separate room), dining table and  kitchenette.

The location was excellent, as a first timer to New York, that was initially concerning, however we could walk everywhere, Times Square, Columbus Circle, Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, Carnegie Hall, etc etc. The tour buses were just down the road, fabulous resturants in close proximity.  The team at the club were always plesant.

If anything, what I didn't like was they did not change our sheets during the 2 weeks, and the electrical sockets probably should be looked at.  The bathrooms must have been designed by a male, because the lighting was terrible!

We thoughly enjoyed our time at the hotel and I would recommend and I would stay again.

title: An OK Stay
text: The Manhattan Club is an adequate hotel with a perfect location (assuming you're visiting in the general midtown area) at a reasonable price.  The front desk was pleasant and the bellhop service enthusiastic.  Rooms are small for a "suite" but if you're just looking for a room it's satisfactory.  Decor is a little tired maybe but we found everything clean and tidy.  The concierge was no help regarding a simple request for a nice bar within walking distance so I wouldn't use them for assistance making plans.  However, for independent travelers who are looking for good location and value, the Manhattan Club is perfectly adequate. If you want more though, there are better choices (and increasing prices).

title: Mixed reviews but my experience excellent
text:
We booked at the very last minute (25th Dec for the 26th) and I was a little worried based on some reviews.  Our experience was very positive especially the price via Expedia!

We stayed on the 15th floor.  There were four of us and the room had a tucked away bedroom and a sitting area with kitchenette.  The sitting area had a full size double sofa bed which our teenagers were very happy with.

The kitchenette had a fridge, microwave, basic coffee machine, dishwasher and dishes and cutlery for four.

The bathroom was large and we did not have hot water issues!

The rooms were not new but certainly not badly dated.  

The lift can be slow at busy periods for the 15th floor probably because the owners lounge (yes it is a timeshare and hotel) is on the 26th floor serving breakfast etc....

The valet parking has to be the bargain of New York.  $35 per day!!!  $70 + elsewhere close by.

The staff were very friendly and accommodating.

In terms of location it is perfect.  5 minutes walk to Central Park and 10 minutes to Times Square.  So it is not busy in the surrounding immediate area.

My suggestion and if you can, go for the more expensive room options.  I thought we were booked for the 2nd floor and that does appear to be where the complaints come from.

Oh...if you want a good early morning coffee that is not Starsucks....walk out the front turn right and right again on 7th.  There is a Starsucks on the next corner and just before that is Tisserie.  The coffee and baked goods are GREAT.

We will be staying at the Manhattan Club again.  We are not timeshare owners.

title: Very small rooms
text:
If you've ever been on a cruise, consider the metro suite like an outside cabin on a cruise.  You might have enough space to turn around and sit down, but that's about it.  Was not enjoyable space to unwind after sightseeing all day.  Rooms are old and in need of renovation.  There was a window unit (actually in the window) with that plastic piece covering the rest of the window around it.  We could not look out the window because we couldn't see over the AC unit.  And that plastic piece allowed every sound on the street into the room as if we were on the street ourselves.  Not restful at all!!
A positive note---the bellmen were very nice!!

title: “TERRIBLE! DESPITE THE LOCATION-DO NOT STAY HERE!”
text:
You may as well check yourself in to a nursing home- the Manhattan Club is old both in feel and appearance. Other reviewers have also commented on this and I fully support this claim. Rooms are old and dirty, interior is worn down, everything is dated, and what is worse-the staff are unkind and not hospitable.  This is advertised as a four star hotel-it's maybe a two stars at best. Such a waste of money and I will NEVER stay here again- 

Although you may not spend a lot of time in a hotel room while in New York- everyone appreciates hospitality, cleanliness, some level of flexibility, and most expect warmth and kindness from the hospitality industry-you will get NONE of this from Manhattan Club. Based on our experience which is similar to that of some other reviewers, the front desk staff is rude and completely unaccommodating. They had no flexibility with our request for a one hour late checkout time (we kindly requested 12 noon checkout opposed to 11am). We were refused a slightly later check-out even though they didn't have the housekeeping staff or other resources to turn rooms this quickly-and odd given check-in is 4pm! The front desk was very unorganized, couldn't initially find our reservation and were frankly unpleasant. The management also leaves a lot to be desired. Even though the bellmen were terrific-experienced, pleasant, helpful and willing to offer assistance, this did not make up for the other shenanigans and despicable appearance and quality of this place. Manhattan Club is awful and there are many other beautiful hotels in the Midtown and Central Park South areas that are leaps and bounds above this dump. Advice from a former and longtime resident of New York City- don't waste your $$$$.

To the management of The Manhattan Club- not only do you need a major face-lift to renovate your property, your staff would significantly benefit from hospitality training inclusive of you- the management. I am embarrassed for you- and this property is a terrible reflection of New York and it's hospitality industry. Shame

title: Manhatten Club
text: Our room was quite small though there was a tiny sitting area. Service was just okay. Location great. The room was quite dated, furniture, walls and bathroom. Very serviceable for the price. I'd come back if on a budget.

title: Times Square visit
text: I'm in this disgusting hotel can't wait to leave. Rooms are old peeling wallpaper room furniture should be thrown out. Never again will I stay here. Room is so hot, had to run a fan all night and it's winter!

title: Good standby, great location
text: Manhattan Club sells memberships, but we just contacted them for a two-day stay, and luckily, go in.  Stayed in smallish rooms (no surprise... its NYC after all) but the rooms are clean and decently appointed.  The 15th floor (where we were) is just OK, showing it's age (carpets, wall coverings, furniture), though 26th floor (member's lounge) is updated and very much more attractive.  The front desk staff is courteous and the concierge is super helpful... all in all, terrific people.  Well recommended.

title: Perfect for what it should be expected to be...
text:
I hope the Title doesn't sound trite, but the Manhattan Club is primarily a Time Share hotel, and it's ambiance and clientele reflect that.  I was lucky enough to stay on a friend's reservation when he had to check out earlier than planned.

PROS:  It's in a perfect location, convenient to all midtown and major transportation hubs.  The beds are amazingly comfortable.  The staff is lovely and accommodating.  

CONS? (if you could call them that... barely.  Rooms were older.  But clean and large and well appointed.  The clientele skews very touristy and Midwest and "older."  Not that that's a bad thing but something to consider if you're a local just looking for a fun night on the town.  

Also note the lounge upstairs is great but does not take cash.

title: Outstanding
text: Stayed for the first time and will never stay anywhere else when in New York City. Location ,Service, Convenience, and Accessibility to dining, plays and shopping excellent. Parking available. Rooms are large and provide facilities for eating in room. Rooms are clean and bed is more than comfortable. Pull out couch provides sleeping for two. Suite can accommodate 4 people. 2 baths.

title: Home away from home
text: We had 10 nights here and it was very easy, great location, subway station on the corner.  Great suite style hotel.  Rooms are a bit bigger then usual.  Microwave and bar fridge a bonus.  DONT stay on the 2nd floor - must book higher than a Metropolitan Suite - the noise of the air conditioning units is TERRIBLE.  Huge thanks to Jerry at reception, who moved us to the 23rd floor. Staff didnt go over and above, but was clean and very comfortable.  We got a great price, so highly recommend it.

title: Great Location
text:
Had three night stop over here - superb location, close enough to get into Central Park for a morning run (managed it twice)
Rooms spotless and decent enough view of Broadway.
Close enough to walk to Times Square and Broadway and tube stops very close.
Staff wonderful!

title: Wonderful place to stay
text: This is a fabulous place to stay when visiting NYC. It is a short walk to all the theaters and Times Square and only about a ten minute walk to Rockefeller Center. It is similarly only a few minute walk from Central Park. The rooms are very nice and spacious and the service is excellent.

title: Great location loud room
text: This location is hard to beat within easy walking distance to Central Park, Times Square,broadway, and Hells Kitchen. The lounge and gym were nice and our room was spacious. We unfortunately were in an interior room on the 2nd floor with a view of multiple air handlers than ran all night long. So the curtains were down the entire time with pillows jammed against them to dampen the noise. So the room was very dark and uninvting throughout the stay.

title: Nice room, great location and wonderful staff
text:
My wife and I have stayed at the Manhattan club several times. The staff is wonderful.  
The rooms are older but very Nicely renovated. All have flat screen televisions in the living room and bedroom. Not all of  the rooms have views. In fact, we were on the 23rd floor and looked out at a 4-5 foot wall. Beyond that you could see some of the highrise buildings of New York City.

The concierge, Carmie and Xiomara,  are very informative, take all the time necessary to  make the arrangements you so desire.

There is a lounge on the 26th floor. I believe they can make up whatever drink you would like. It is pricey in that my wife and I had 2 drinks which came to $36.

Location is almost central to all of what we like to do. Walking distance to Central Park, Time Square, several restaurants & shopping.

The Manhattan Club and it's Staff meets ALL OF OUR NEEDS. We want for nothing.

title: Location, location, location
text: Great experience.  We had a excecutive suite which was clean, comfortable and well appointed. The staff was excellent starting with the porter, to reception, bell hop and cleaning staff. Location could not have been better with easy walking distance to 5th Avenue, Times Square, Broadway and all the theatres.

title: Hotel sympa et tranquille à deux rues de central park...
text: Un hôtel agréable et bien situé aux chambres confortables. Le petit déjeuner  coute quand même 20 dollars par personne et est en supplément. A partir de l’Hôtel, on peut accéder rapidement accéder à pied à plusieurs lieux touristiques. Plusieurs endroits pour se restaurer sont disponibles à proximité.

title: would definitely stay here again!
text: Great room, Close to everything. very clean and comfortable.  Bed was comfortable, even the pull out couch was the best mattress we have seen on a sofa. excellent trip. I accidentally  left a few items there but they mailed them back to me.  Our view was not good but we were not in the room but just to sleep.  Loved it!

title: Volvería sin dudarlo!!!
text:
El hotel está ubicado a dos cuadras del Central Park, entre la 7th Av. y la Broadway.
Está muy bien conectado con los subtes, que es de suma importancia en NY, contando con una estación de la línea naranja a la vuelta. También hay otras estaciones a menos de 2 cuadras en la redonda, además pasan muchos buses alredor. Por lo cual, su ubicación es excelente para moverse.
A dos cuadras o quizás menos, hay dos supermercados abiertos las 24 hrs.
El hotel es muy cómodo y el personal es de excelencia. Las habitaciones contaban con todo lo necesario y eran muy lindas!
También en el piso 26 hay un salón de descanso, al cual podés acudir para tomar un refresco o comer unas galletitas en forma gratuita, si tenés que hacer tiempo o te dan ganas.
También tiene gimnasio y un centro de computación y copiado, al que acudí varias veces. 
La conexión de wifi es excelente en todo el hotel y la limpieza es otra virtud a destacar.
Realmente repetiría la estadía por todo lo mencionado y además porque todos los empleados fueron sumamente amables y atentos. 
Tuvimos que reacomodar planes por imprevistos personaes y supierion recomendar otras actividades para hacer. Totalmente satisfecha!

title: Will stay again
text: The hotel is always perfect, well-maintained, perfect location. We don't even bother to shop around. The rooms are large with comfortable beds and a good layout. Staff is always courteous, professional, and helpful. You can't go wrong staying here.

title: Great experience at the Manhatten Club
text: Staff was welcoming, we arrived early and they checked our bags to a holding area so that we could do a little site seeing. The room was specious and welcoming. everything that we needed for our overnight stay was there in the room. We were within walking distance to restaurants, shops. I would definitely stay there again

title: Perfect Location
text:
Very good situated, near to everything. Not cheap, but cheap in this area is hard to find.
Two room facility with small kitchen to heat up things and breakfast. Walking distance to Tine Square and Central Park

title: Great Location, Wonderful Staff
text:
This might be a bit long so many good things about The Manhattan Club. Upon our arrival we were greeted warmly and we were quickly in our room.  The room, by New York standards, was spacious.  A sitting area with a microwave, refrigerator, sink, coffee maker and plates. The bathroom was nicely appointed, marble tile and a big glassed in shower.  The drawback to our room, 227, was the view, there is NONE.  You overlook the courtyard of a roof, very little natural light enters the room. With that said, you are in New York City how much time do you spend in your room? 

I need to speak about the staff.  Every single person that we encountered was wonderful.  There are a couple that I can call out specifically.  Joel on the Bellman staff, he took our luggage on the last day secured it so we could enjoy our final day in NYC.  Not only did he take our luggage but went further to make sure we were set with first class transportation to the airport at a price less then we paid for a Yellow cab from the airport.

Next is Carmi, the Concierge. His recommendations for tours and local places to eat were spot on for us.  He LOVES to talk and make suggestions. He spends time with you to make sure you are getting the service you want.  Be patient as he does this for each guest that was in line.  Everything that he suggested we did and enjoyed them all from the Woody Allen sandwich at the Carnegie Deli to the quiet dinner at Nocello, we truly appreciated. As for the tour, we did some research before we arrived and it was nice to see that they had the Greyline tour available at his desk. Just remember that this tour is time sensitive and starts at the time you purchase the ticket. 

Now the ONLY issue we ran into at The Manhattan Club was the number of towels we received each morning. The first morning we did the Green Thing, but the towels were replaced, so we gave up on that idea.  The next day they gave us fresh towels, but no washcloths.  

We did take in the Owners Club on the 26th floor.  Not really worth the visit.  The Grab and Go breakfast is cold cereal, bagel and fruit for $10.00.  We went to Fresh & Co on 57th for a nice selection of hot breakfast items. 

We will be back!!  We are already planning our next visit and it will include The Manhattan Club!!

title: Espectacular!!
text: Hotel bien ubicado, a tres cuadras del Central Park y dos de la quinta avenida, con buen acceso a diferentes líneas de subterráneo. La gente del hotel muy amable y responde a las dudas, como contra sólo encontré una persona que apenas entendía castellano. Las habitaciones muy lindas y amplias. Hotel para recomendar!

title: Fantastic six night stay
text: My fiancé and I just returned from a six night stay at the Manhattan Club.  We absolutely loved it, and wouldn't hesitate in recommending.  Fabulous location just 2 min walk from the nearest subway station, and very easy walking distance to Central Park, Times Square and shopping on 5th and the surrounding area.  We had a beautiful, very comfortable and spacious city lights suite on the second floor - it had more than average space for a city hotel and it was really useful to have the kitchenette facilities. We heard the road a little ... but hey, what do you expect in the middle of Manhattan?! Staff were very friendly and helpful.  I'd be back in a heartbeat.  Thankyou to The Manhattan Club for a fantastic stay.

title: Bra - när vi fick byta rum
text:
Checkade in och fick först ett otroligt illaluktande och slitet rum. Bäddsoffan var trasig, men hade ändå inte gått att sova på ens om den varit hel. Otroligt dåligt, äckligt och ofräscht. Jag ringde och klagade i receptionen och fick då byta till ett renoverat och jättefint rum. I det nya rummet var sängen skön, bäddsoffan riktigt bra och badrummet fräscht. Smidigt med en liten köksdel och diskmaskin. Det var dock väldigt varmt på rummet och ventilationen var högljudd. Vi valde att sova med öppet fönster istället eftersom vi hade ett rum mot innergården. 

Hotellet har bra läge nära central park. Några i personalen hade trist attityd och var inte hjälpsamma, medans andra (särskilt städerskan) var otroligt trevliga och välkomnande. Tveksamt om jag kommer att bo här igen. I så fall vill jag vara helt säker på att få ett renoverat rum.

title: Very pleasantly surprised
text: I had read mixed reviews prior to booking but wanted to give it a shot. I did ask for a renovated room which was excellent. It was very clean and spacious for two. The TVs were great, the bed very comfortable. Although we were on the 2nd floor, it was extremely quiet. The bathroom was well appointed with a strong shower. The location is perfect a couple of blocks from the park with great places to eat nearby. Definitely plan to stay there often.

title: ottimo hotel
text:
tutto perfetto! Camera spaziosa molto pulita! Personale gentile e posizione ottimale.
lo consiglio vivamente anche a chi e' allergico alla moquette in quanto (almeno nella mia camera) non era presente sul pavimento. un ottima scelta anche per rapporto qualita prezzo ! Consigliatissimo!!

title: Average rating for average hotel
text:
Elevators were slow and always full; we regularly walked down 15 flights of stairs. No doorman helped us on arrival in the evening, in the rain. 
MOLD in the bathtub/ shower and room not vacuumed daily- not sure what Housekeeping did other than replace towels. 
No A/C in winter and no Heat in summer- weird. 
Ice machines only on a few random floors. 
Upon leaving Doorman got us a great car at affordable flat rate to JFK!

title: Stay away
text: I travel to NY frequently for business and pleasure. For this last trip I wound up booking a last minute hotel through LMT undercover hotels and this was supposed to be atleast a 4 star hotel. Definitely this is far from a four star hotel and not worth the >$400 a night I was charged. The rooms are not only old and outdated, but the furniture is falling apart, the carpet was extremely dirty with stains everywhere and to make matters worse, the linen on the bed was stained with unknown yellow substance. It is a shame that they do not atleast make even minimal upgrades such as ensuring that you have a clean decent room. After the first night of staying in a very old and dirty room, having to change out my own sheets in the middle of the night as I was getting to bed, I was given a second room for the following evening. Although this one was a little more decent (decent furniture, not falling apart), I found that the sheets in the bedroom were also stained and dirty. I don't know if the hotel is having trouble with their laundry service, but it is definitely a huge turn off to get to bed after a long day, only to be grossed out by the lack of cleanliness. I will not be staying here again and will not be booking anymore "undercover" hotels. Not worth the money!

title: Comfortable although a little tired
text: Location was very good easy walk to Times Square and Central Park. The one bedroom suite that we stayed in on 12 floor was spacious, although a little tired was very well equipped and comfortable. We had a 17 & 18 year olds sharing the sofa bed which they found comfortable and although it was left made up for the 5 days we stayed here we had plenty of room to sit around the table and use the kitchenette with no problems at all. It was especially nice to have 2 bathrooms that were both of very good size a large walkin shower in one and bath with shower in the other. The main bed was massive and extremely comfortable we slept like logs every night! The hotel was quiet never once did we hear anyone in the corridors. A large hanging wardrobe and plenty of drawers in both rooms too. We found it convenient to have breakfast in our room as there was a fridge, plates, bowls, mugs etc which we left dirty in dishwasher and returned every day to clean made up room and the cleaner even put dishwasher on for us. There was a good supply of filter coffee provided and even popcorn to cook in the microwave! Very nice touches, we recommend this hotel.

title: Good space for the price
text:
Nice clean hotel & lobby service was great! 
But when I asked for extra blanket , it took a long long long time .. then the heater was not on the whole night , finally they send someone to tell me , they could bring extra heater because the whole building's heat is not one. 
I booked a queen bed with sofa bed because two of us want to have our own bed. The sofa bed was a lot of stuff spring , but once I find my position , it was fine. 
Overall the big refrigerator, microwave, sink are great even we did not cook inside ..

title: Great location in New York
text: First of all I think that the best reason to stay in this hotel is the location.  For New York location is pretty key.  Also having two bathrooms is ideal.  The staff  was very helpful.  The downside was the sofa bed.  It was awful.  incredibly lumpy mattress.  The sofa was also very worn and dated.  But the room itself was very comfortable and quiet.  As long as you don't need someone to sleep on the pull out sofa you should be fine.

title: Very comfortable rooms and great location
text:
We stayed 5 nights and were thrilled to be so central. Easily walkable to Broadway theatres, Lincoln Centre, MoMA. Easy access to Subway to downtown.  Close to huge range of restaurants.
Room was way larger than typical in Manhattan. Well equipped, comfortable and clean. Good WiFi and air con. You can open the windows if you wish. Fridge, microwave, coffee maker etc. Enough to allow you to breakfast in the room.
Service was very good / helpful.
Not sure how old this place is. It seems a bit dated but seems to be generally working fine.  
Not cheap but actually very good value for central Manhattan.

title: Gute Lage für Musicalbesuch und Midtown-Unternehmungen
text:
Die Bilder im Internet zeigen andere Zimmer als das, in dem wir schließlich 3 Nächte verbrachten. Auf Nachfrage an der Rezeption wurde uns mitgeteilt, dass die Bilder offenbar die renovierten Zimmer zeigen, die man uns - wenn wir darauf bestünden - zum Mehrpreis von 75 USD pro Nacht anbieten könnte. Nachdem der erste Ärger verflogen war und die dritte Nacht überstanden ist, lässt sich zusammenfassend zum Hotel folgendes sagen:
Lage - exzellent für Unternehmungen in Midtown, direkt gegenüber Carnegie-Hall, Empire State Building und Rockefeller Center innerhalb 15 min zu Fuß erreichbar, Central Park ebenfalls, Subway-Station innerhalb 2 Minuten
Zimmer - 1 Queensize Bett in der Executive Junior Suite, Küchenzeile mit ausreichender Ausstattung inklusive großem Kühlschrank, Bügelbrett und Bügeleisen vorhanden, tadellos sauber, Pflegeartikel im Bad spartanisch, Zustand der Möbel ordentlich, etwas laut (Straßenlärm), Mineralwasser nicht kostenlos bereitgestellt, Verkauf von Softdrinks und und Süßigkeiten am Automat im 26. Stock zu passable Preisen
Frühstück - für 20 USD wird wenig geboten (keine Eier, keine Wurst, kein Käse), Tipp: einen Kaffee to go an der Bar holen (2,75 USD und refill kostenlos bis 16 h) und aus der Bäckerei um die Ecke den Rest
Personal - von der Rezeption im EG bis zur Bar im 26. Stock sehr freundlich
Gesamteindruck - gut bis befriedigend

title: Lindo hotel
text: El hotel muy lindo al igual que la habitación , súper amplia y cómoda. Todo siempre impecable. El único inconveniente que tuve fue el último día , que no respetaron el precio que me habían pasado por el taxi y nunca llegó el botones a retirar el equipaje para el check out , el cual lo tuve que bajar por mi cuenta siendo asesorada por un empleado del hotel.

title: TIME SHARE ARE YOU KIDDING ME!! ITS THE BEST EVER
text: I can't believe that I was lucky enough to get an international timeshare exchange with this property.  It is the best ever!!  Fantastic location, super hotel suite, a kitchen of sorts - enough to heat up your take aways from Morton Williams which is just down the road, and definitely great for your own breakfast every morning. Marble bathrooms - yes plural, and look out the window - its 7th Avenue.  OMG its a dream.  Go again - in a minute..... there was only one problem, patchy WIFI in the room.  I had to go upstairs to the lounge to do the emailing etc but it was a minor in comparison to the stay that we had.

title: Pleasantly pleased!!!
text: We LOVED our three night stay this week. The desk staff was great and so were the doormen. Didn't have a chance to meet the concierge but I'm guessing they were great too. Our room was 1906 and it was lovely and very well appointed.  The location couldn't be better. Quick walk of just a few blocks to Times Square, Central Park, Carnegie Hall, and the most popular theaters and restaurants. Only one block from the 57th street subway and it'll take you straight to Battery Park for the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. The Manhattan Club will be our go-to hotel from now on!

title: Great location
text: This was the third time we stayed at the Manhattan Club.   The location is great and the staff is friendly and helpful.  Kudos especially to concierge Mara who got us great tickets to two shows.  The decor is a bit dated and furniture was worn (shabby?).  So if that sort of thing matters to you this may not be the place for you.  But the suites are clean and spacious.  Our junior suite had a sink and MW and small refrigerator.    Definitely recommend.

title: Recomendable
text: Muy buen hotel ubicado a dos cuadras del lado sur del Central Park. Acceso a una cuadra a las lineas amarillas del Metro; también muy cercano a otras lineas, por lo que su ubicación y accesibilidad es privilegiada y céntrica, sin que esté en el medio de la locura de Times Square. La verdad que Nueva York es una ciudad que no te da respiro, así que no tuvimos mucho tiempo para estar en el hotel, pero el poco tiempo que pasamos ha cumplido con nuestra expectativas. Las tarifas de los hoteles en la ciudad son extremadamente elevadas. Cierto es que hay muchas opciones. Pero en el caso de Manhattan Club -en comparación con otras ofertas- la relación precio calidad nos resultó sumamente buena. La habitación se nos vendió sin desayuno y tomarlo en el hotel nos pareció algo caro (US$ 20 por persona). Las instalaciones lucen nuevas. Además la ubicación, se destaca la limpieza y el buen trato del personal.

title: Depende de la tarifa que consigas
text:
Bien situado, las suites son  cómodas con dos baños y buen espacio. Tener claro que es un 3 estrellas, no hay servicio de restaurante y se debe esperar lo típico de un 3 estrellas en cuanto a cuidado del mobiliario, el cual se encuentra un poco desgastado. La limpieza de cuartos estuvo bien pero en l de los corredores se nota poco cuidado. Al precio apropiado es una buena opción, especialmente si se viaja con familia pues las suites tienen 2 espacios separados, también tener en cuenta que el sofá cama donde duermen los otros dos huéspedes es imposible para que adultos puedan dormir, en mi caso funcionó porque tengo dos niñas pequeñas que pesan menos de 30 kilos, pero para un adulto el resortado del sofá se haría sentir mucho y el dormir muy incomodo. 

No lo recomendaría si la tarifa obtenida es mayor a usd 350 ya que a ese precio hay mejores opciones por la misma zona.

title: Razoavel
text: A localização é boa. O atendimento da recepção poderá ser mais simpático. Os quartos só são liberados às 16h. O quarto é bom e tem uma mini cozinha, o que ajuda bastante quando se está c/ crianças, no entanto, as cobertas e roupas de cama para quem está no sofá cama poderiam ser melhores. Reservei o quarto pra 4 pessoas e quando cheguei na tinha toalha nem travesseiros pra todos. As amenidades do banheiro são básicas: shampoo, sabonete, hidratante e touca, nada mais que isso. O melhor é que eles recebem suas encomendas sem cobrar nada por isso.

title: Great location in midtown
text: The hotel is nicely located in midtown close to Central Park and many other attractions it's a little bit dated but very spacious and clean. Great service from the staff that help to get a cab or even give directions I loved my stay here

title: Best
text: I just loved this hotel. Spacious rooms, well maintained, famous location, and a very courteous staff. Can't wait to my next visit there. Wi-Fi is free of charge, in opposed to most Manhattan hotels...

title: Excellent location for a New York getaway
text: My husband and I had only 4 days to see what we could in New York City.  The Manhattan Club was located in the perfect place to be close to all attractions.  Time Square, Central Park, The Empire State Bldg, etc.  The Hotel is a small hotel with excellent staff, and a great atmosphere.  Everyone was helpful.  The rooms were confortable and clean.  Would recommend this hotel, and have, to friends and family.

title: Nice Stay!
text: Great location, close to everything.  Older property, but well kept.  Staff was professional, but not overly friendly.  The suite was comfortable and offered enough space for 4 adults, including two full baths. We saw advertisement for continental breakfast on site, but found better value and offerings at the many restaurants nearby.  Stay was part of my birthday celebration with friends.  We would stay again.

title: Muy bueno por donde se lo mire
text:
MUY buen hotel excelente ubicación. La atención de todos es muy buena 
La habitación grande muy buena baño WiFi gratis. Lo único es que tiene dos ascensores y a veces se complica para moverse en horas de alto movimiento

title: Excellent location - great staff
text:
My husband and I were very happy with our accommodations here.  The staff is very helpful, pleasant and friendly - willing to answer questions and help whenever necessary.

the suite was very clean and nicely appointed.  We like to have the option to eat in if we want to, so the kitchenette was a nice way to do that.  The "Club" is centrally located and we were able to walk to a few of the places we wanted to visit, including a show.  Doormen make it easy to collect a cab if you would like one.   Lots of interesting restaurants for dining nearby.  

Overall a centrally located accommodation in Manhattan with pleasant staff to attend to your needs (or wants).

title: Premium Location in Mid Town
text: Stayed at the Manhattan Club for 3 Nights with my wife.   Loved the location, a block from the Carnegie Deli, 5 minute walk to Tiffany's and right in the heart of everything.   Nice rooms, easy check in.   The bellman arranged a $50 Stretch Limo back to LaGuardia on our out bound day.    Loved it here.

title: מלון טוב במנהטן
text:
מלון כייפי באווירה ביתית. מיקום טוב שתי דקות הליכה מ-הסנטרל, עשר דקות הליכה מטיימס סקואר. 
המון מסעדות ממש מתחת למלון. יחס חם ואדיב.
יש במלון חדרים ישנים וחדרים משופצים. החליפו לנו חדר בלי לעשות עניין.
הרגשנו בבית במנהטן.

title: Great Location, Excellent Staff
text: My wife and I like to travel to New York City every two to three years to visit the 9/11 Memorial and to see two or three Broadway Shows, this year was no different except it was our first time staying at the Manhattan Club.  From the time we arrived and were greeted by the doorman who helped unpack the car and made arrangements for it to be stored while we were in NYC, things could not have been nicer.  From his friendly greeting to the staff at the front desk, could not have been more helpful once they learned it was our first visit to the Manhattan Club.  That excellent care extended to the bellmen and the hotel household staff throughout our four days and three nights.  The room was outstanding, clean, and bright and offered everything we needed for our stay.  Whether you were leaving or returning to the hotel, the staff was there to greet you as if you were returning home.  First time at the Manhattan Club but not our last.  Great location, near Central Park, Broadway and of course 7th ave, adds the excellent staff and yes we will be returning time and time again.

title: One of the finest accomadations in NYC
text: Want to be greeted by a sea of smiling faces with a can-do attitude?  Want to be pampered by a very caring staff?  Then the Manhattan Club is for you.  The front desk is staffed around the clock by a great group of young people.  One in particular - James - was a plethora of great suuggestions.  We were disappointed by the female concierge.  When asked a question, she abruptly hands you a piece of paper showing how to get to various attractions and then dismisses you.  But, the male concierge is superb.  The doormen are outstanding, but again one - Jason - stood out.  Jason went out of his way to answer our questions and give us detailed directions.  Overall, a highly recommended place to stay.  And, the loçation cannot be beat.

title: location,pleasant surprise.
text:
I had tried to do a timeshare exchange in previous years with no success. I was able to get a last minute exchange in September this year.
Hotel was in a great location, room was great and service was wonderful. We plan to come back again.

title: Great room and helpful staff
text: Quick check in, massive room, clean, we had a suite with a kitchenette and sofa. Good wifi. Much more space than we expected. The staff were always on hand to answer any questions and looked after our bags on the last day. We had a great stay.

title: It IS location, location, location !!
text: but also a well maintained and attentive to detail facility close to food, entertainment, the theatre district, Central Park--therefore an excellent time share with an adjoining hotel (Park Central) for non time share folks.  We were guests of owners with a fold out sofa bed that was amazingly comfortable for us, the large, king size bed for them with separate bath rooms.  The room had a coffee maker, microwave and refrigerator, but no hot surfaces such as a stove.  Note that the lounge on 26 does not take cash, only credit cards and room billings--the wine is $14 a glass with a gratuity automatically charged.  Keep track of your billings there as it seems just a little confused at time.

title: Location, location!
text: My husband and I stayed in an Executive Suite (a large hotel room really, with a queen bed, sofa bed and mini kitchenette). We are Bluegreen Vacation Club members, and were able to secure a good room rate. The location is outstanding, near a variety of shops and restaurants, very walkable to subways and the theatre district. It was nice to have a bit of room to stretch out in. The bed was super comfortable. Also, compared to other Manhattan hotels we've stayed in, this one is very quiet; city noises don't overwhelm you all night. From the front desk agents to the housekeepers to the concierge, everyone who works here is pleasant and helpful. We look forward to another stay!

title: Bad stinky room
text: We paid a lot for our suit, but it was stinky and old, with wall to wall carpet. Will never stay there again. We were very disappointed. The size of the room was good, but our clothes,everything we had in the room still smells awful.

title: Close to the action!!
text: I got to experience this place through a friend's time share.  We had such a blast!!  It's clean, upscale, and close to Central Park, great bars and eateries, and is walking distance to mid-town venues such as the theater. There is a kitchen (no one cooked) but a great place to chill wine, and prepare snacks when in the room!  We stayed in a one bedroom suite with two full baths, three of us on a "girls week-end" had plenty of room and we were very comfortable.  The staff is helpful with suggestions on where to eat.  We loved Sarafino's!!

title: It's GREAT!!
text: The hotel has an absolute GREAT location. The building is shared with another hotel so some floors are for The Manhattan Club, it was interesting and not disturbing for my party. Tea or coffee with cookies at the top floor until 4pm was great to sit and plan our next move when we arrived. The room was fantastic, the layout was comfortable. The room had two bathrooms, one of them completely prepared for a handicapped person. That deserves an outstanding review! Cleaning was impecable. Staff was great (Joel, Ismael, Ciara). The microwave  broke down and Jorge (staff) was up to and changing it for a brand new one!! Oh and the popcorn every day was enjoyed and looked upon to end every evening!! A must return to for next time at the city!!

title: アクセスは最高
text:
地下鉄にアクセスは最高にいいです^_^
エグゼクティブスイートに泊まりましたがNYにしたら広く 3人で泊まれる広さでした。内装は豪華さはないですがバスルームもベッドのクッションも良かったです。通常のホテルと違い、オーバーナイトで荷物を預けることが出来なかったのでそれが残念でした。その点が問題無ければまた利用したいです。

title: Comfortable New York Experience
text: Stayed here for a weekend away.  We are vacation club owners and stayed in a one bedroom suite (King bed in master bedroom and sofa bed in living area with two bathrooms/PERFECT).  VERY small refrigerator (dorm size); dishes enough for 4, coffee maker, microwave and dishwasher. The room was comfortable for us a group of 5 adults and close to everything (Central Park, Time Square, good local dining and subway).  Microwave and fridge were worked well since no cooking was done, who comes to New York on vacation to cook?

title: 立地抜群！
text:
地下鉄NQR線まで１分ぐらい、部屋もニューヨークにしてはとても広く３８平米有ります値段もリーズナブルで同じビルのパークセントラルより1、5倍の広さで同じ値段です。
チェックインが４時アウトが１１時ですが日本からの飛行機でしたらさほど問題ないと思います。部屋もきれいで大型冷蔵庫もからにしてくれていますし電子レンジやコーヒーメーカーも備え付けです！

title: As New York as a cinnamon & cream cheese bagle
text:
I stayed here for 7 days with a friend who has timeshare. The location was perfect for all the inner city attractions and subway access was excpetional. 

If you're a Seinfeld fan...its walking distance to the Soup Man...former "Soup Nazi" on the show.

The studio room with king bed and sofa bed was extremely comfortable and well serviced. Modern and well maintained amenities and decor. Polite and friendly staff . Only negative was the the lifts sometimes took a while to reach the 22nd floor!   

I would stay here again.

title: Excepcional ubicación. Habitaciones bonitas y personal muy agradable
text: Bonito hotel con amplias habitaciones. Cama extra King muy ocmoda, sofá cama perfecta si vas con niños. Pequeña cocinita que te permite tomar un cafelito y estupendo baño. La ubicación te permite moverte a pie para muchas de las actividades sobre todo para asistir a los espectáculos en Time Square. A dos calles de central park, dos calles de la 5 avenida, a 4 de Times Square. tienes fantásticos restaurantes para cenar si no tienes ganas de desplazarte  a otras zonas. Los precios también se notan en la ubicación ya que para desayunar estas rodeada de sitios donde el precio medio desayuno por persona son 15 -20 euros. Lo peor, LOS ASCENSORES, solamente dos para la gran afluencia de gente que tiene el hotel. El personal muy atento y educado. al hacer check in te toman deposito de 300 dólares, que te los devuelven en un plazo medio de 10 días

title: A good newyorker experience
text: For those who stayed with the memory shaped by films shot in the city, located between the 7th and 8th avenues,   I think it's hard to get a better location. Two blocks from Central Park and three of Times Square, across the Carnegie Hall and near Lincoln Center, where you can enjoy a good jazz show and make the necessary purchases in wholefoods to give a good use to the kitchenette suite.

title: Spacious, lovely and comfortable rooms in a great location
text: The Manhattan Club has been a great find!  It is within easy walking distance of Times Square and Central Park.  The hotel staff are friendly and knowledgeable - lots of helpful suggestions for theatre and sightseeing.  Our room was a wonderful surprise - really spacious with comfortable couch, great bed, lots of closet space, small counter top kitchenette with everything you need to enjoy a bite in your room if you want - and a really nice bath.

title: Buena ubicación / Buen Precio
text:
En la 7ma y 56 st.
Excelente ubicación. Es un condominio de departamentos, regenteado como hotel. Com muchos de los edificios de departamentos en Manhattan, es viejo, pero bien cuidado. si bien la mayoria de los departamentos son iguales en cuanto a distribución, cada uno tiene su toque ya que funciona como un tiempo compartido y cada unidad tiene un dueño que lo usa y decora o simplemente lo deja para que lo administre el servicio de hoteleria.
La relacion precio/calidad es muy buena teniendo en cuenta la ubicación.

title: Excelente ubicacion
text:
El hotel está ubicado en un lugar espectacular y muy seguro, a unas 5 cuadras del Time Square y a 3 cuadras de la estación de subte de la cual podes partir a cualquier punto de nyc!

Los conserjes y personal del hotel son muy amables. Y siempre atentos a ayudar y responder consultas. Siempre hay uno q habla español!!

Las camas son cómodas, lastim que si pedís habitación para TRES te dan una cama grande y un sofá cama el cual NO es del todo cómodo sobretodo el colchón q es muy finito, x lo demás bien.

Es mi segunda visita (estuve x primera vez en mayo de 2012) al hotel y note el DETERIORO, especialmente en los baños, canillas, duchas, se notan corroídas. Por lo demás esta igual.

Tener en cuenta al volver a la noche llevar la tarjeta de la habitación consigo xq la piden al entrar como medida de seguridad

title: Gradevole e accessibile...
text:
Sono stato in questo Hotel con un gruppo di amici per una settimana di lavoro.
Posto tranquillo e ben servito. Sconsiglio le camere con affaccio sulla via principale. 
Nel complesso un buon posto dai costi accessibili. Dotato di area fitness.
